name: Rennen auf dem Hockenheimring
description:
Once the game board has been puzzled together (500 pieces), the players compete with their racing car in a dice race. 5 laps are driven, for each driven lap points are awarded depending on the placement. On the way lurk positive and negative event fields that affect the position of the race car. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Shelter
description:
Is a COOP survival game.
You have 30 days to build a shelter with a help cooperation and building materials.
There is going to be dangers ahead, polution, natural disasters and not a lot of smalltalk.
mechanics: Alliances, Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zero: Aim Low, Score High
description:
If you have wondered what it feels like to be a complete Zero, then this game is for YOU!

Zero is a new and exciting family game that asks players to search their minds for the "least popular" aspects of pop culture.

We surveyed more than 450 people in the US, UK, Australia & Mexico and tabulated their answers to hundreds of questions. Now you and your friends can match wits with them to see who comes up with the "least" likely answer.

Each card lists all of the correct answers to each question and points are awarded based on the popularity of the answer. The winner is the player who scores closest to zero when the game ends.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Track Movement

name: UNO: Jean-Michel Basquiat
description:
Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number, or word to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit.

UNO Artiste series - jean-michel basquiat is the first deck in the UNO series inspired by great artists.
Basquiat made his debut as a writer in the late 1970s and many of his creations are reproduced in these cards.
Contains four extra two-sided "artist" cards, which combine to recreate one of his masterpieces.
This is a premium and collectible deck.

name: Shipwreck Island
description:
Your crew has crashed on the shores of Shipwreck Island, a rocky island that shows on no sea charts and is only known to Pirates. Pirates raid the Island for slaves to sell in the slave markets. The other islanders have tasked you to protect their cities from Pirate attacks by building walled fortifications around their small Island cities. As a reward for the protection your fortifications provide, the first crewmember to fortify cities worth 100 points will be named King or Queen of Shipwreck Island.

Players draw Wall Segment Cards which allow them to place Wall Segment pieces on Wall Plans around their cities. They trade with other players for the wall Segment types they need, or draw from the Supply Station. Wall Plans are color coded so they must get the right type of Wall Segment to build on the needed segments for their cities. Players are dealt 3 City Defense plans at the beginning of the game and choose one as their starting city. They can build on their starting city or any city connected by one road to it.

They try to finish all the wall plans around a city to protect it from Pirate attacks. At the end of their turn, they roll to see if the Pirates attack their cities or what other actions may happen. If they are attacked, any any part of the city's Wall Plans are unfinished, wall segments are destroyed and must be rebuilt on the next turn.

Other rolls allow for moving the "Island Army" marker to protect a city from attacks, drawing extra cards, stealing a card from another player, or placing a wall segment piece.

Players may also purchase Reinforcement Cards which allow for extra building actions or protection from attacks.

Players score points after completing a city's defense plan. They move their scoring marker around the scoring track. The final round begins when one player passes 100 points. Each player gets one more turn to score points. The player with the most points after the final round wins and is declared King or Queen of Shipwreck Island.
categories: Adventure, City Building, Fantasy, Negotiation, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: 18ZOO: New Powers
description:
A new set of powers for 18ZOO:
- a new way to play powers (PINK powers)
- optional way to use the new and original powers together
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation

name: Tiger and egg
description: A cooperative game for 2-4 players. In this game, players act as tigers attempting to harvest eggs for an omelet. However, the eggs will soon go bad if the tigers do not harvest them in time. Tigers must race to collect 20 good eggs before too many eggs rot. Each of the four tigers has special abilities that give the players a helping hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: gam-gam
description:
The players roll a color combination (black-black, black-red or red-red) with 2 wooden pieces. Then they are to draw 2 sticks with matching color ends from a cup. Depending on whether there is a match or not, the player distributes the drawn sticks to the other players or receives sticks already collected from the other players. A player who succeeds in drawing the stick with 2 red rings (gam-gam) after a "red-red" requirement may distribute all the collected sticks to the other players and does not have to pick up any more sticks for the rest of the game. The gam-gam stick is put back into the cup. Sticks count as minus points at the end of the game.

—user summary

name: Head Hunters Bingo
description:
The game consists of two types of cards:
24 cards with whole faces (complete cards)
54 cards with partial faces (partial cards)

A dealer is chosen who takes the partial cards and shuffles them.

Each player including the dealer takes 3 complete cards and place them face up in front of him on the table.

The dealer begins by turning the partial cards one by one and placing them face up on the table. For the first few games it is suggested to turn the cards over slowly; later the speed can be increased to create a greater challenge according to the age level of the players.

When one of the players spots 3 partial cards on the table that together match one of his whole faces, he calls BINGO! and the game stops.

The Player that called BINGO! gathers the 3 partial cards from the table, adds his matching complete card and places them in a stack at the side. The player takes a new complete card from the pile and the game resumes.

If the player that called BINGO! was in error and the partial cards did not match his complete card, the player loses 1 point.

The game is over when there are no more partial face cards or when no more matches can be made.

Each match is worth 1 point. The points are tallied, remembering to subtract 1 point for each error. The winner is the player with the greatest number of points.

—user summary

name: Monarch: Brawl
description:
Monarch: Brawl is a game of insectoid strategy for two players. Take control of an army of crawling, flying, stinging bugs and outwit your opponent. But don’t leave yourself open to attack! Win the game by getting your insects through your opponent’s defenses.

Combining elements of chance from classic card games like War with the grid and movement of chess, this game is meant for all ages. It can be learned quickly, but provides deeper levels of play, with no two games being the same.

—description from the designer

name: Sapsucker
description: This is a fast-paced two player games which also offer surprising depth. It combines mechanisms of tug of war with dual winning condition. While collecting sap to lure the sapsuckers, player also has to consider the dice he will leave to his opponent. It is important because besides the final scoring at the end, player can also win by successfully attracting one of the sapsucker to his side.

name: Fencing: The card game
description:
Use your wits and skill to manipulate the odds and outsmart your opponent.
Each card has a speed that is decided by rolling a die, make sure your attacks are faster than your opponents defense by keeping momentum and utilizing the strengths (and weaknesses) of your specific fencing style.

With optional Special, and Character cards (and different Character cards coming soon) there is plenty of variety to keep it interesting time and time again.

—description from the publisher

name: Unter rauchender Schloten
description:
Industry themed game (under smoking chimneys perhaps, smoking because of the furnaces etc. after the war. Educational, very much so for children because that is the world they will be living in.

A simple game in that you roll and move and follow the instructions where you end your move. There are 60 different spaces and the first to get to '60' wins.

—user summary

name: Edit Name 	Until Daylight: Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
4 extra cards Kickstarter exclusive for Until Daylight

1 Brute clown
1 Errant Bear
1 Errant Dog
1 Weapon Hedge Trimer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Real-time, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Champions of the Galaxy: Tournament of Champions Starter Set
description:
The much anticipated Best of Champions of the Galaxy: Tournament of Champions starter set. This commemorative starter set will celebrate the 50 game editions of the main Champions of the Galaxy story. This set will feature 19 game cards and a handbook with not only descriptions of each charterer but also information on the history of wrestling’s greatest game! The starter set includes instructions, charts, and dice. It's a great way to get started with Champions of the Galaxy or just celebrate the legacy of this great game series.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Shiho Hiroto the Black Eagle
description:
The Black Eagle Has Landed!

In his fallen father’s battle armour, Shiho Hiroto strides the Isles of Jwar hellbent on revenge!

Shiho Hiroto has snuck back into the Isles of Jwar at the head of a group of deadly mercenaries from far-off lands, alongside a devout retinue of veteran warriors that rallied to his cause during his time abroad in the bowels of the Empire of the Golden Sun. His goals are simple: to claim this far-flung Prefecture for himself, then exact his vengeance upon the Takashi for what they did to his father and his clan. The Black Eagle is a mighty Samurai in his own right, becoming even deadlier at the head of a rejuvenated Shiho strikeforce. He will not rest until the Dragon Clan’s soldiers lie dying in the mud of his homeland. Jwar will be his!

Shiho Hiroto is a powerful model that epitomises the Shiho’s ambush and hit-and-run tactics, making them excel at striking their opponents where they least expect it. Hiroto has access to the IMPROVISE Ki Feat, a feat that provides his Warband with unprecedented options. It also gives him the ability to fight any model with confidence and cunning.

Blister contains one miniature supplied with a 30mm base and full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ich spiele Briefträger
description:
Each child receives envelopes with the numbers 1 to 10, turns the spinner that shows one of these numbers and hands in the matching envelope. The first to get rid of their envelopes wins the game.

—user summary

name: Test of Honour: The Samurai Miniatures Game – Samurai Warband
description:
A young, impetuous samurai sets out to defeat the enemies of his clan and bring honour to his family.

Samurai Hero
Samurai Warrior
Ashigaru Sergeant (Kogashira)
3 Ashigaru spearmen
Ashigaru with bow
Ashigaru with musket
9 Skill Cards
2 Trait Cards
1 Honour card
1 Dishonour card
5 Quest Cards
MDF bases

The warriors in this box form an ideal starter force for the game, combining perfectly with the Recruitment cards from the core set.

18 new cards cards provide a range of extra Skills, Quests and Traits, plus brand new Honour and Dishonour cards, making this a great expansion for existing players too.

The cards emphasise the unique character of the samurai, with Skills such as Salute Your Enemy, Death Poem, Spirit of the Ancestors and Heavy Armour, and Quests including Blood Feud and Head-Taker. The new Honour and Dishonour cards allow your samurai to impress or bring shame to their clan - gaining or losing a Skill card.

Box contains 18 gaming cards for Test of Honour and 8 metal miniatures plus bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tier Karussell
description:
The children receive food chips for 7 different animals. The animal carousel is spun and if the player has the right food for the animal stopping at the feeding trough, he may hand over the food chip. The first player to hand in all the food chips wins the game.

—user summary

name: Qixit
description: The object of the game is to form as many vertical and horizontal words as possible within 6 minutes... or whatever time the players wish to set. -From the back of the box.

name: Danskernes Egen Historie
description: A trivia game in the vein of Trivial Pursuit, featuring photos from 20th century Danish history.
publishers: Danskernes Egen Historie A/S, Substanz as

name: Make Your Case
description:
Make Your Case is an easy-to-learn, intuitive game that people can learn just after one round. One person (the judge) picks up a prompt card and the other players (lawyers) finish off the sentence with one of their cards and must explain why their card fits the prompt the best. Each lawyer has 30 seconds to make their case uninterrupted. Then they have another 15 seconds to either strengthen their case or attack the other lawyers' points.

At the end of the round, the judge decides which argument is the best and awards the point to that lawyer. The judgeship passes to the next person and the next round begins.

The person with the most points at the end of the game, wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Judge, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Chat Chains
description:
Goal:
Players earn points for building Chat Chains using Response Cards, working together to get the highest possible team score by having a focused conversation.

2-player: The first player (Chat Starter) selects a question from a Topic card to begin the chain, places this card in the center of the play area, and answers it for one point, or asks the next player to answer but earns no point. The next player continues the chain by answering, and placing a Response card next to the Topic card; if they need help in answering, they can get a suggestion from a Prompt card, but will not earn points for its placement in the chain. With 3+ players, Response cards can be kept in front of each player to track individual scoring.

Play continues with each player placing 1-2 Response cards. A conversation can include a combination of any types of questions, answers, or comments.

Round End:
A round ends when the Chat Chain is broken. This happens when:
-A player decides to finish the topic;
-A player goes off topic; or
-A player takes too long to respond.

3+ players:
More players introduce the optional gameplay role of Judge, a neutral observer who does not place cards.

Ending the Game:
The game can end after:
-10 rounds;
-30 minutes of gameplay; or
-A total team score of 200 is reached
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: URGNCY V72
description:
In this beat-the-clock cooperative space game! All of earth’s resources have been depleted! As a result, you & your team are on the last manned space mission to reach Planet V72, a planet that can sustain life & save the human race!

On your journey to saving all mankind, everything that can go wrong does go wrong! As a team, fix each situation that arises with your problem-prone ship as fast as you can before time expires in each of the games four timed rounds, in order to advance to the next round! If time runs out in any of the four rounds your team will perish & all mankind will cease to exist!

Get through all four rounds & make it to Planet V72 & into the history books as the team who saved the human race!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Race, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Kirakós
description:
The year is early 2005 in Northern-Europe. A series of murders have been committed in three countries in parallel, and all signs point to a connection with something that happened twenty years before. Will you (and your co-players) be able to figure out the riddles you find along the way or will you need help from the game characters? And most importantly: will you find out the motive before the story ends?
Kirakós is a crime novel combined with a game – a detective story where you are the hero. It is up to you to solve the riddles in time and make the correct deductions about the crime, before the inbuilt characters beat you to it.
•••
A Kirakós nem szokványos krimi. A méltán népszerű skandináv bűnügyi regények műfaját ötvözi az otthon játszható szabadulószoba-könyvek feltörekvő trendjével.
Tökéletesen élvezhető a „hagyományos” módon, az olvasó sorról sorra halad, közben találgat és gondolkozik a történetet illetően, amely végül teljes egészében kibontakozik előtte.
Lehetőség nyílik azonban időről időre a nyomozók bőrébe bújni, a könyvben tíz egyértelműen jelzett feladvány található, amelyek megoldásához semmi más nem szükséges, mint az eltérő betűtípussal szedett szöveg és az Ön leleményessége. Ezeknél a pontoknál kicsit megáll az idő, és mindenki kedvére kutakodhat a könyvön kívüli világban, később pedig ellenőrizheti, helyes megoldásra jutott-e.
—Hungarian part is description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Whitetail Wilderness: Woodland Pursuit – Hunter Skills Expansion
description:
This 18-card expansion for Whitetail Wilderness: Woodland Pursuit adds more options for players to include when constructing their player deck at the beginning of the game.

The cards in this expansion bring new skills and card abilities to the hunter's repertoire. They include Resilience (reclaim a card from the discard pile), Regroup (draw three cards), Scout (flip locations when adjacent), and Stalk (move and then Hunt).

There are also new variations of Hunt and Wild cards to provide even more variety and further options when building your deck.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Froggy Bazaar
description:
Froggy merchants expand the floating market in this variable worker placement game. Catch flies, claim lily-pads, build hat stands, hat shops, and haberdasheries, and trade goods at the driftwood market.

In Froggy Bazaar players play the part of a froggy merchant. They take turns moving around the floating market. They claim lily-pads and construct various shops. As the market expands, player options increase.

The game board consists a central driftwood market tile, surrounded by 8 lily-pad tiles. In each turn players 1) move their frog, 2) take either one or both actions on the tile that they moved onto. This can be a range of actions from building a shop on a lily-pad tile, to collecting resources from shops, or upgrading shops.

Throughout the game players collect river rocks which they place in a felt bag. As players achieve objectives (build or upgrade shops, collect hats, visit every tile) they achieve objectives (and collect more river rocks). The game ends when a player achieves their fourth objective. The player with the most river rocks wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Market, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Zeichen und Wunder
description:
The game combines several tasks known from other games and places them in a religious-Christian context. The players solve tasks such as "draw or pantomime a term", "explain a term without taboo words", "fill in a blank", "name Christian terms with given initial letters". Whoever solves the task correctly moves his figure towards the goal. The players who correctly guess the terms are also rewarded. The winner is the one who reaches the goal first.

—user summary

name: 99 Gemeinheiten
description:
The playing cards show different aggressive (mostly also punishable) actions with which one can annoy his fellow men (in the enterprise the bosses and colleagues). Two of these actions match each other and these cards are to be laid out by the players as a pair. The player who got rid of his hand cards ends the game. The winner is the player who has collected the most pairs.

There are four different theme sets, each with the same game principle:

In marriage
In traffic
In business
Among friends


—user summary

name: Fußball-WM Würfelspiel
description:
Each player has a goalkeeper and 10 field players with whom he can move across the field. The ball itself is also represented as a game piece. The dice are rolled for the ball and the players. The player with the ball first moves the ball (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) to an unoccupied field, and then 3 of his field players, also horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The opposing player also moves 3 field players with the same number of dice. If a field player of the player previously in possession of the ball is standing by the ball after the movement, he remains in possession of the ball. If only one field player of the opponent is standing by the ball, the opponent gains possession of the ball. There are additional rules for the goalkeeper, fouls, offsides, offsides and penalty kicks. The player who has scored the most goals after an agreed period of time wins the game.

—user summary

name: Das Kreuzwortspiel
description:
The players try to score as many points as possible by laying out letters in a colored crossword grid. They are free to choose which of the available letters they want to use. It should be noted that only valid German words (lexicon) can be formed, and valuable letters should be placed on own color fields if possible (plus points). Letters on opposing fields cause minus points. As soon as the target field has been reached, the game ends and the player with the most accumulated points wins.

—user summary

name: Panic Prey
description:
Panic Prey is a 1-4 player strategic board game inspired by the classic eighties film horror saga: ALIEN.

Players assume the role of different crewmembers trapped aboard a spaceship with a deadly visitor: the panic predator (a.k.a., the Alien). Escape the ship, or finish off the creature!

The game can be played either competitively or collaboratively, and has a sandbox nature where players have a wide range of challenges and options to modify the game’s rules and adjust the difficulty, objective and overall experience as they wish. The board is procedurally generated, so whatever ship layout you will end up with will be unique to that game and will require you to adapt and improvise, allowing for many different possibilities and strategies.
Players will have their crewmembers move across the ship avoiding the alien and must make the most out of the different tools and resources available to achieve their goal, locking doors and vents as needed, or using weapons when they have to.

Keep a close eye on your enemies, but an even closer one on your friends, because no one wants to be the Panic Prey!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Traitor Game

name: Totalandrin
description:
Totalandrin offers you a selection of the shortest and most impactful holorimes through a card game that will give you a smile on any occasion.

Better than an Alexandrian, each pair of cards makes it possible to reconstitute a rich rhyme which is pronounced identically over the entire length of the 2 lines.

Rules:

Reconstitute the pairs by memorizing their position, face down.
Each player turns over 2 cards, in turn, and covers them again if they do not constitute a pair. If you flip a pair in the order of the sentence, you can replay.
The mystery card, containing a QR code, embellishes the part of a digital and interactive interlude. You just have to scan the map with a phone to be guided in the actions to be taken.


Winning:
When there is nothing left to return, whoever has collected the most cards wins!

The game can be played, with or without a phone, from 3 years old to 123 years old!
For the youngest, the association of images is enough to reconstitute the pairs.
For candidates for the French Academy, repeating the same sounds, giving a different meaning, is an excellent mnemonic means to discover associations of words while having fun.

—description from the designer'
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Memory

name: A Call to Arms: Star Fleet – Reinforcements One
description:
Captain, reinforcements have just shown up on our sensors!

Need more ships for your preferred fleet?
Want to add different fleets?
Or are you looking for new foes?
Then A Call to Arms: Star Fleet, Reinforcements One is for you!
There are more ships for empires you enjoyed in earlier volumes: Federation, Klingons, Romulans, Kzintis, Gorns, Orion Pirates, Tholians, and Seltorians.
The WYNs that were previewed in Book 2 now have a full-scale fleet you can use.
We introduce the Frax, a simulator empire designed by the Klingons to provide an opponent for their officers going through their version of Star Fleet Academy.
Remember the Juggernaut from Book Two?
There is a whole fleet from the Juggernaut Empire!
This unknown enemy from a faraway galaxy periodically sends ships marauding across the Alpha Octant.
There is a new monster for your fleets to defeat: the deadly space tarantula.
There are more civilian ships to protect and a fleet repair dock to fix those damaged ships.

New types of ships include advanced technology X-ships that add more power to your fleets. War dreadnoughts add depth to a squadron.
The Juggernauts add a Shriek Missile.
X-ships can carry new versions of plasma torpedoes.
The new trait X-Ship gives those ships powerful advantages. Of course, there are rules for X-ships.
There are seven new scenarios.
One scenario is based on a story that appeared in a Captain’s Log; we added it to this book.
Finally, there is a consolidated index to all three books.

Reinforcements One has all the rules and information you need to play the game when combined with Book 1.2 and Book Two.
Please note that you must have Book 1.2 to play this game.
Some of the material assumes you have the expansion Book Two.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Mongoose Publishing

name: The Miniature Adventures of Dunsterforce 1918: 16 scenarios for Setting The East Ablaze!
description:
The Miniature Adventures of Dunsterforce 1918: a Scenario Book for World War One in Northern Persia and the Caucasus for the Setting the East Ablaze! rules, and easily adaptable for other rules sets.

In 1918, the last year of World War One (WWI), the British dispatched a military mission into Northern Persia.
The mission’s overall aim was to protect British interests in the region and prevent Turkish or German expansion to the Caspian Sea, part of a larger operation to prevent a threat to India from Persia or Afghanistan.
Its leader was the charismatic Major-General Lionel Charles Dunsterville.
Its members were selected for their specialties from all over the British Empire, drawn from fronts in Egypt, Mesopotamia, and Western Europe.
This mission became known as Dunsterforce.

Are you looking for …

Tabletop wargaming scenarios in an overlooked WWI theater in the Back of Beyond?
Involving a myriad of units drawn from the Mesopotamian and Western Fronts?
Units accompanied by armored cars and airplanes?
Battles that may be more exciting than the attritional warfare of Flanders or Gallipoli?
Battles more akin to the mobile actions fought in Mesopotamia or East Africa?
Battles fought out in some of the most desolate and difficult terrain of the whole war?


Then this book is for you.
It includes:
• A brief history of Dunsterforce
• 16 scenarios for miniature tabletop battles, from small-unit skirmishes to large-scale actions
• Complete with historical background, game notes, objectives, and army lists
• Maps and notes for ease of set-up of the tabletop terrain required
• Appendices covering Dunsterforce, Ottoman Caucasus-Islam forces, special rules, figures required,
and more

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Reich des Sandes: Promo Karten
description:
2 cards released for the German version of the game in 2020.

Der Kristallgarten (the crystal garden)
Die mystische Schmiede (the mystical forge)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Honeybee Brain Hexadoug Chess
description:
A Chess game on a hexagon grid with altered movement rules for the pieces. The grid consists of hexes in 3 different colors, evenly distributed. The hoppers (6 of them for each player) are bound to the field color. There are no bishops used in the game.
As in chess the object of the game is to mate the enemy king.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Movement, Static Capture

name: Spi-Trap
description:
You must guess the secret word before the opponents push you to the center of the board.

From the back of the box:

THIS MOST THRILLING GAME IS MOST FUN
FOR PLAYERS OF MOST AGES!

In the game you score points by discovering
letters in a "secret" word.

The points are then used to drive the opponents
further and further into the spider's web
towards the waiting spider in the centre.

CONTENTS: Board
4 markers, 20 markers in 4 colours
1 special dice (1, 2, 3 x 2)
rules

name: Galilean Moons: Expanded
description:
This is a small expansion containing four different parts.


Components to play with five players.
8 New Technology cards promos
New achievement goals addon.
Gameplay varients rulebook.


—user summary

name: Explorers of the Lost World
description:
In Explorers of the Lost World, you lead a team of two explorers (choose from Cowboy, Movie Director, Geologist, Biologist, Archeologist, Doctor, Journalist through the island, trying to survive dinosaur and giant creature attacks (Almost everything that moves is gigantic and yes there are giant gorillas).

Based on the Source of the Nile mechanics, you will map terrain and discover great and terrible things in almost every hex you visit. Gain Victory points with every time you defend against a creature. Snakes grow to unbelievable lengths and provide additional VP opportunities for their discovery. You will always be tracking at least one specific creature and gain VPs upon its discovery, then move on to another creature type. Rivers, ravines, jungle, mountains, veldt, are some of the terrain features you will face and each provides a local threat upon entering. Additionally there is a great lake that can be crossed for adventure and certain peril as well as a great mysterious mountain with caves to explore for additional treasures and VPs and certain peril.

The explorer with the most victory points at the end, wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Wardens of Wulvengrad
description:
A cooperative monster hunting boss battler for 1-4 players against AI controlled monsters set in the low fantasy kingdom of Wulvengrad.
Each hunter has a unique deck of actions and abilities, with every card being split in 2 - an action which can be played during the hunter's turn, or a reaction which can be played at any time! Will you attack with everything, or hold some back to defend against a counterattack? - the choice is yours. Your cards are also your stamina, so burning through your deck too quickly means you'll have to rest to recover them.
Monsters are controlled with a 3 tier AI deck, with attacks increasing in severity. The monster's health is made up of a token draw bag containing wounds, armour and counterattacks - no 2 fights will be the same! Only through teamwork and planning can you control the flow and defeat the monster before it kills you!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: In The End: Faith in Humanity
description:
In The End: Faith in Humanity is a post apocalyptic survival game. It is story driven not combat driven. The Characters you have to choose from are varied with their own stories.
In The End is a 1-6 player, 3 board game. It has ten unique bosses to fight and many events to overcome.
The play mechanics are simple roll a d6, move up to that number. If you land in a square with Character, Event, or Item you pull that card and resolve the card. On each board the player must complete 3 Character Cards to reveal the boss. Once the boss is revealed you must move to that square and fight the boss.
This is done over all three boards. In solo play you undertake this great journey alone. When playing in a party you all must fight the boss together. In Versus mode you are in a race to beat the three bosses.
After defeating the third boss you find and are granted access to Sanctuary, a city where civilization is being rebuilt. You lose by dying or in Versus by not making it to Sanctuary first.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Mature / Adult, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: We're Doomed!: Property Tax Promo Card
description:
An Event Card.

Public - Read Aloud

The owner of this game may immediately take 6 tokens from the other players or the Project.

Or, if the owner has been eliminated, they may return to play.

Originally available at Gen Con 2019 as a gift with purchase of the base game.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Guts ‘N Glory: WWII Combat System for N scale Miniatures
description:
Guts ‘N Glory is a World War II skirmish rules system for N-scale Miniatures.

This innovative system allows for faster game resolution taking into account troop quality, leadership, and moral.
The game was designed to be a pleasing combination of playability and realism.

The heart of the game system is a fairly innovative concept (at least to historical gaming) that uses different dice rather than die modifiers. In most games, one type of dice is used and the "success" number for hitting a target, spotting a target or passing morale is determined by adding or subtracting a number from a base number. This forces the player to go through some mathematical calculations each time and the "success" number always changes. In Guts 'N Glory, the "success" number never changes. Instead, the dice you roll changes.
For example, a successful morale check is made on a roll of a 4 or less. Veteran troops usually roll a 6-sided die to check morale (66% chance), but green troops roll a 10-sided die (40% chance). Of course, things happen to make troops more or less likely to pass that morale check. In Guts 'N Glory, these factors are taken into account by the use of "die higher penalties" or "die lower bonuses." When checking morale, you put your finger on the "dice hierarchy" chart and move it to the right for each penalty and to the left for each bonus. No need to add/subtract modifiers….No need to remember a different "success" number for every roll you make.
For example, let's say a veteran fire team needs to take a morale check. There are enemy tanks visible to the fire team, they were under fire last turn and they are in cover. The enemy tanks and being under fire are both "die higher penalties." The fact that the team is in cover is a "die lower bonus. This yields a net result of one "die higher" penalty. The veteran fire team checks for morale by rolling an 8-sided die instead of the usual 6-sided die. The "success" number for a morale check is always a four or less. The use of this concept really speeds up play.

Guts 'N Glory only considers factors that are necessary to create a realistic simulation. We didn't deal with details that added complexity/realism at the expense of playability. For example, in Guts 'N Glory tank armor is classified as light, medium, heavy or very heavy.
There are bonuses/penalties on the charts for sloped armor, side armor, rear armor and top armor. Also, if a tank is hit, you then check to see whether or not it was immobilized or put "out of action." This is all any platoon commander needs to know anyway. Therefore a Tiger tank is still a tougher target than a Stuart tank, but we didn't create an overly complicated system to model this. No need to find out exactly where the round hit, exactly what systems were taken out, or which crewmember was killed.

Don't think that Guts 'N Glory is a beer and pretzels game though.
It plays fast, but it rewards good tactics. It also punishes the player who makes tactical mistakes.
The results are very realistic when compared with historical instances.
Another concept that speeds play is the use of "fire teams." Infantry are grouped in teams of 2-5 men. Three fire teams make up a squad. The troops are individually based on metal stands. The fire team stands are magnetic. This allows you to tailor your fire teams to the situation at hand. You can decide which weapons go with which team and your squad leader can be attached to any team you wish. The rules allow you to detach tank hunters as well. Squads generally were divided up into teams to execute real battle tactics. It speeds up the game considerably to allow you to move your men in similar teams. All members of a fire team direct their fire at the same target (with the exception of tank hunters…They need to be free to engage armored targets.) when they fire. This speeds up play and is very reasonable when compared with accounts of actual combat.

Guts 'N Glory uses an initiative system and special fire modes or orders that allow both players to exercise control over their troops at the same time.
It is not an "I go, you go" system.
This adds realism to the simulation. I must admit that it is the hardest part of the system to grasp, but the most rewarding.
For example, veteran troops are easier to control than green troops. They have a better chance of gaining the initiative and have more special orders to give. This makes them more flexible to the changing battlefield environment. We believe that this is how it should be!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Guts ‘N Glory: Blood and Iron – Blitzkrieg Expansion for WWII N Scale Miniatures
description:
Blood and Iron is an expansion for the fast-playing Guts ‘N Glory World War II skirmish rules and covers the darkest time for the Allied cause at the outbreak of WWII.
All nationalities that fought in Europe during this time period are represented.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Guts ‘N Glory: Bayonets & Bushido – Pacific Expansion for WWII N Scale Miniatures
description:
Bayonets ‘N Bushido is an expansion for the fast playing Guts ‘N Glory World War II skirmish rules and covers all of the fighting in the Pacific, China and Southeast Asia during World War II.
It also includes two bonus Korean War scenarios.
Virtually all of the nationalities that fought in the Far East are represented.

Contains:

Vehicle and ordnance charts for Japanese, Americans, Chinese, Dutch and the Commonwealth nations
14 scenarios
New rules and weapons to simulate combat in the Far East during WWII


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Guts 'N Glory: Hearts and Minds – Vietnam / Modern Expansion
description:
Hearts and Minds is an expansion for the fast playing Guts ‘N Glory World War II skirmish rules and covers the fighting in Vietnam as well as Modern Warfare, scenarios and weapons for Iraq and Afghanistan.
It also includes new rules for helicopters and other post-WW2 weapons.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Jailbait
description:
An Educational Criminal Law Game

Jailbait is an exciting simulation of the real world of crime. It is both entertaining and designed to teach the lay person about the criminal justice system. The player will be taken through the court process, starting with bail hearings and lawyer's fees through to the trial and sentencing. Players will enjoy playing the roles of police officers, lawyers and Judges (sic). The winner of the game is the player with the most amount of money, but, he must also have the least number of criminal convictions.

Jailbait equipment consists of a board with crime squares, tokens for the various players, one die, Judge's dice, Jailbait money, small chips which are the players' conviction chips and 3 sets of cards—crime cards (which correspond to the various crime squares on the board), lawyer's fee/bail cards and pre-trial cards.

The winner of the game is the person with the most amount of money after he purchases back all his conviction chips. The game may conclude at any time, simply purchase back the conviction chips and count your money. Alternatively, the game concludes when only two players are left playing.

This game was designed to follow the actual process of the Canadian Criminal Justice system as closely as possible within the framework of a game. There are many aspects and possibilities that arise within the court system which were impossible to include: however, the pertinent section of the Criminal Code of Canada has been noted in the glossary when appropriate to enable the player to obtain further information if he or she so desires by referring to that document. The United States glossary version will follow.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Take That

name: Fuga Alucinante
description:
In Hallucinating Escape, players are divided between the survivors and a monster. The monster must build the board with the cards face down, using its best strategy to place the traps and well hide the keys and exit gate from the players. Once the survivors fall into the traps, the monster can capture them. The survivors must unite to be able to find the keys while escaping the monster's capture.

One player is chosen to be the Monster. The others will be player on the run against the Monster The monster assembles the board with all 49 cards face up, except for the Wall, Nails and Dungeon. The board must be set up in a 7 x 7 card square. Keys must be at least two spaces apart. The Monster places players in the most extreme positions on the board.

Each fleeing player can walk 02 spaces (cards) vertically and horizontally and cannot be diagonally. When stopping in space, the card is turned face up and cad´s effect is applied. The Monster moves 03 spaces.

Effects cards:

Ramp: walk two more spaces
Nails: in the next round walk only one space
Quicksand: gets stuck in one round
Hole: you will have to wait for a friend to come to your aid
Dungeon: when the monster captures one of the players it can freely move into one of the dungeons and trap the player. Each dungeon can only be occupied by one player.
Key: when going through one of the keys, it must be face up and considered that all players on the run have the key.
Gate by getting the three keys players can reach the gate space, open it and escape.


The game ends in two cases:
1. The Monster captures all fleeing players
2. Did any of the players get through the gate

Who wins?
1. The Monster if it captures the fleeing players or else
2. Any of the fleeing players who passed through the gate

------------------------------------------------------------------Em Fuga Alucinante, os jogadores são divididos entre os sobreviventes e um monstro. O monstro deve construir o tabuleiro com as cartas viradas para baixo, usando sua melhor estratégia para colocar as armadilhas e esconder bem as chaves e portão de saída dos jogadores. Uma vez que os sobreviventes caem nas armadilhas, o monstro pode capturá-los. Os sobreviventes devem unir-se para conseguir encontrar as chaves fugindo da captura do monstro.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Guerra Mitológica
description:
Mythological War is a board game that improves the development of logical thinking and strategy, while having fun. Fight the war and use your best strategy to win the game. Make allies and conquer magical portals to be the big winner.

The turn is played in 03 phases:
1. Portal Phase. It does not occur in the first round. Open a Portal card and apply the effect described on it.
2. Planning Phase. At the same time, all players place an order token for each territory in which they have an army. Tokens are placed face down
3. Action Phase.
3.1 Order tokens are flipped face up. Summoning tokens are resolved. It starts with the player with the Initiative Token and goes clockwise. You can enlist new troops respecting the supply limit (the supplies are marked on the map board)
3.2 The fights are carried out as described in the rules. It starts with an invasion and is resolved by comparison of combat power of the troops and the strength of your card. The combat power consists of: Soldiers force 01, Knights Force 02 and Cannons Force 03 (only for attack and 0 for defense).
Order tokens have modifiers of -1, 0 and +1 that must be applied. Neighboring territories can support battle.

The game ends when one of the players has control 06 portal areas.

A limit of 10 turns can be established, in which whoever has the highest number of portals is the winner.

Similar to Game of Thrones (2003) with changes in participating parties (instead of race families), on the board (no naval mobility), in game sequels with the introduction of a portal phase to replace the Westeros phase, in combat modifier cards and conditions of victory.


Guerra mitológica é um jogo de tabuleiro que aprimora o desenvolvimento de raciocínio lógico e estratégia, enquanto diverte. enfrente a guerra e use sua melhor estratégia para ganhar o jogo. faça aliados e conquiste portais mágicos para ser o grande vencedor.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management

name: Jornada do Herói
description:
With 6 board combinations this game will never be the same, face the villains to become a true hero.

The game consists of:
1. 06 modular maps representing a mythological site: a) Olympus of the Gods, b) Forests of Hera, c) Parthenon of Hera, d) Workshop of Hephaestus, e) Depths of Poseidon and f) Kingdom of Hades. Each map has a door and a space in which the deity is imprisoned.
2. Deck of cards with 20 mythological figures (Cerberus, Hydra of Lerna, Minotaur, etc) with combat power defined by numbers from 1 to 6 (result to win or be defeated) and attack effect.
3. 04 hero figures
4. 01 Dice D6

Each turn the player rolls the die and moves as many spaces as the die result across the grid towards the space in which the deity is imprisoned. Upon reaching the prison space, a card of a mythological figure is revealed where a battle takes place. In battle, you roll a die and compare it to the powers of the mythological figure. Being the winner the player receives a special effect from each deity (Athena, Hephaestus etc) and chooses a new map to be connected. Being defeated suffers the effect of the card.

When all the deities are freed and all the modular maps are posted, a final battle takes place on the Olympus of the Gods.
The battle is against Cronos who is imprisoning Zeus. To beat him, roll a D6 die and have the result 6.

The player who beats Cronos is the winner of the game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Prehistoric Settlement: Compendium of Beasts
description:
80 pages of a vast menagerie of Prehistoric beasts both still in existence and extinct. Familiar species such as Woolly Rhinos and Woolly Mammoths are included but also less known animals such as the Wonambi and Megalania.
The species included in the book have all the scores and information vital to making them playable in the Prehistoric Settlement game.
The book contains numerous beautifully drawn animals by Carmen Cerra. Carmen has painted them in a cave painting style as our Prehistoric ancestors would have thought of them.
The compendium also contains new animal appearance tables as alternatives for all the geographical regions available in the game. The book is full colour throughout and has a gloss card cover.

This book is designed to be used as a supplement for our Prehistoric Settlement game, but it does also make a complete reference guide to prehistoric species present at the time of major human expansion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Wargame

name: Jogo da Colheita
description:
A card game that lets you cultivate a perfect harvest in the comfort of your home! Get your friends together, and start planting! To add excitement to the game, you can also use the situation cards, natural disaster cards, and even put pests on neighboring crops! A little luck and strategy, and you'll be the first to have a winning harvest!

Components
04 game cards
20 chips
100 cards (01 Champion Harvest, 05 natural disaster, 15 pests, 19 Special Situation, 60 carrot, tomato and potato plantations)

In each round, the player can do only one of the actions:

Play a plantation card in one of your plantations. If you have managed to complete 03 of the same cards of a culture, you must declare yourself "Harvest"
Play plague card on another player's crop preventing him from completing a harvest
Play natural disaster card against a player preventing him from playing a turn
Play situation card and perform the action described on the card
Discard a card face down if you cannot do any of the above actions


After playing cards, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

The game ends when the player completes a crop of each type (Carrot, Tomato and Potato) plus one of any type.

The first player to complete a crop of each type (Carrot, Tomato and Potato) plus one of any type


Um jogo de cartas que permite cultivar uma colheita perfeita no aconchego do seu lar!
Junte seus amigos, e comecem a plantar!
Para dar emoção ao jogo, vocês também podem utilizar as cartas de situação, de desastre natural, e até colocar pragas nas plantações vizinhas!
Um pouco de sorte e estratégia, e você vai ser o primeiro a ter uma colheita campeã!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Zak Storm e a Aventura dos 7 Mares
description:
Help Zak Storm and his companions in another adventure across the seven seas. travel across the seas looking for the 7 mighty gems and help them defeat the fearsome Skullivar.

The board is divided into 7 seas with a path to be followed with 12 spaces. In these spaces there are:
1) 09 Spaces clear
2) a space with a villain,
3) a space with special effects and
4) a space with a jewel at the end,

Each player rolls the dice and moves according to the dice rolled in each of the 7 seas. It can reach:
1) Spaces clear that can go ahead
2) The space with the villain who will have to fight a battle where he declares 03 numbers. He rolls the dice if he gets it right he wins the battle and moves on and if he misses he goes back to Ship Chaos
3) The Space with Gem Trap House with Special Effects
4) The space with jewel where it declares even or odd. He rolls the die and if he hits he gets the treasure. If you make a mistake, go to the next player

The game ends when all 07 Gems are conquered and when everyone must return to the Ship Chaos for the final battle against the Skullivar monster. To beat him, you must roll a D6 die and get a result of 6 or more, with each jewel conquered by the players being added to the result of the die.

Whoever defeats the villain first wins the match.

Ajude Zak Storm e seus companheiros em mais essa aventura pelos sete mares. percorra todos os mares buscando as 7 poderosas joias e ajude-os a derrotar o temível Skullivar.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Prehistoric Settlement: The Savage Seas – Expansion Set 1
description:
Prehistoric Settlement savage seas supplement book, an additional supplement to the Prehistoric Settlement rule book, adding to a great game of prehistory with cavemen, mammoths and sabretooth cats using Steve Barber Models miniatures, a fun game for the family.

This expansion goes with version 1 of Prehistoric Settlement and covers maritime subjects (boats, battles at sea, terrain, and extra rules).

—description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Wargame

name: Vila dos Mistérios
description:
Everything happens while players have their eyes closed! In this card game, players are given a card that represents their character, and once the game begins, with all players' eyes closed, the announcer starts calling each one to a task. By the end of the game, your character may have changed! And everyone gets into a big argument to find out who the monster is. Get ready to investigate the monsters hiding in the village!

The mechanics are the same as Wolf Game
https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/151433/wolf-game

Wolf The Game is a social party game around deception, deduction and perception. Based on the traditional games of Mafia and Werewolf, Wolf offers a balanced and multifaceted approach to this beloved category.

Players take on the roles of villagers, trying to cope with an influx of murderous werewolves. Some players will be villagers and must try and work out which other players are secretly werewolves before the wolves kill everyone!

With 11 different roles available in the base game, Wolf offers small to large groups a great way to get to know each other and having some quality lynching time together.

Party game ends after voting.

Village Victory: At least one Monster dies. even if another player is not the Monster and dies, everyone will win
Monster Victory: If No One Monster Dies.


Tudo acontece enquanto os jogadores estão de olhos fechados! Nesse jogo de cartas, os jogadores recebem uma carta que representa seu personagem, e assim que começa o jogo, com todos os jogadores de olhos fechados, o locutor começa a chamar cada um para uma tarefa. No fim do jogo, seu personagem pode ter mudado! E todos entram numa grande discussão para descobrir quem é o monstro. Preparem-se para investigar os monstros que se escondem na vila!
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Netflix: Stranger Things – o Jogo
description:
Will Bayers is missing and all his friends will join forces to save him. Keep Will safe as Eleven, Dustin and their friends face this battle. Combat-themed game from the TV series Stranger Things.

The player can move one of his pieces forward, backward or sideways. Special spaces (Castle Byer and Hawkins Lab) and some of its pieces cannot be occupied. When occupying a space with a piece of the opposing team, a combat occurs. In combat, the pieces are revealed and the combat powers or special conditions compared. The piece with the highest combat power removes the piece with the lowest combat power from the game. In case of a tie, both leave the game.

The game ends when Will is rescued.

The first team to rescue the Will that is with the opposing team wins the battle and the game.

This boardgame is a thematic change from the famous and traditional Stratego.

Will Bayers está desaparecido e todos seus amigos vão unir forças para salvá-lo. Deixe Will protegido enquanto Eleven, Dustin e seus amigos enfrentam esta batalha. Jogo similar ao combate com temática da série televisiva Stranger Things.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Jogo da Fama
description:
In the Jogo da Fama, accumulate points for good attitudes and lose points if your attitudes hinder you to build your fame! at the end of the game, become a big star or a world star and rock!

Roll the 02 D6 and move exactly the number of spaces in the result, applying the conditions of the coloured spaces or special space. Apply what is described in space

All players must go through the Evaluation Show Day space and decide if they want to be a Superstar or Biggest Star. The player trying to Biggest Star will bet on a number and roll the two D6. If the result of two D6 is correct, the player is the winner. If you make a mistake, you will lose everything and be out of the game. By choosing Superstar he will compete when all players lose their fans or the last one becomes Superstar.

The first player to become Biggest Star will win.
Otherwise, the Superstar with the largest number of fans.
mechanics: Action/Event, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Decisões A Vida É Um Jogo
description:
In this amazing board game, you will choose the best DECISIONS to walk your life! Players must choose goals and reach their goals, following paths full of possibilities. A real life simulation in a playful and fun way.

Who here is already dying to play the Game Decisions, Life is a Game?

The player can move horizontally, vertically and diagonally only 01 space
When entering an instance, the player must draw a card (from the location) and read its contents. He will gain or lose attribute tokens as described on the card. If the card requires him to lose an attribute he doesn't have, he discards the card.
Each turn the player must move to a different location.
Only one player can occupy the same site.

The game ends when a player gets 08 tokens in two attributes of his choice.

The first player got her 08 tokens in two different attributes of her choice.

Similar to The Game of Life: Fame Edition with some changes in victory conditions.

name: Bataille de purée à la cantine
description:
Everyone sends the food they have in their deck in order to get rid of all their cards, but be careful not to be caught in the hand… in the mash!

Using a match mechanic similar to UNO, players match colors or numbers to meet one of 3 win conditions. The goal is to discard all your cards, get a particular set of cards, or have the highest number of points.



Chacun envoie les aliments qu’il a dans son jeu afin de se débarrasser de toutes ses cartes, mais gare à ne pas être pris la main… dans la purée !

name: Vikings: Ascent
description:
King Ragnar Lothbrok is dead! He is survived by his sons, each with competing claims to the throne. In Vikings: Ascent the enemy in front of you is less of a threat than the friend at your back.

On a player's turn they move through the following three phases:
1) Draw: draw up to 8 cards.
2) Recruit: recruit freemen (including: warriors, farmsteaders, and skalds) to their house.
3) Fate: take actions by exerting their freemen and/or playing cards from their hand to increase their bid for the throne.
The game ends when a player attains 100 Fate points (victory points)

A player increases (or decreases) fate points during the fate phases of each players' turn. The first to ascend the Wheel of Fate and attains 100 fate points wins the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting

name: Triomatt
description: On a 10x8 playing field, 2 players start from the baseline with their 15 number tiles ranging in value from 1 to 16 (13 is missing). The goal is to reach the opponent's baseline with 3 stones, or to hit so many of the opponent's stones that he becomes unable to move. The number stones may be moved one square at a time. The special feature of the game is to arrange your number stones on the board in such a way that valid arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) are created. Example: with the number tiles 2, 14, 16 in a row, the arithmetic operation 2+14=16 can be represented. The first number piece of the calculation may skip the result of the calculation. If the reached field is occupied by a foreign number piece, this is beaten.

name: El Tesoro
description:
Sixteen island tiles are laid out as a circle. The players roll a color and number die and move the corresponding ship by the corresponding number of islands, look at the treasure on the back of the island tile and may reveal another island. If this shows the same treasure, they may take one of the 25 gold talers. The player who has collected the most gold coins wins the game.

—user summary

name: Prehistoric Settlement: Out of the Wilderness – Expansion Set 2
description:
Prehistoric Settlement Out of the Wilderness supplement book, an additional supplement to the Prehistoric Settlement rule book. It adds new characters (Shaman...), new animals and magic.

This expansion goes with version 1 of Prehistoric Settlement
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Wargame

name: Prehistoric Settlement
description:
Set about 50,000 years B.C. in an age of hunter gathers, and the last of the strange large mammals, such as Woolly Mammoths, Sabre-tooth Tigers and Giant Birds, the game is a mixture of board games and wargames Using a mixture of Metal Miniatures, Resin Buildings, Cards and Counters.

At the beginning of the game, all the players start with the same amount of pieces and the basic idea of the game is to grow your settlement faster than the other players, buying Figures and Buildings with game tokens as you go along, hopefully avoiding Natural Disasters and other unforeseen incidents.

The game can be played by 2 or 4 players and is for Ages 14 and up and is fun for families as well as boardgamers & wargamers.
A great deal of time and effort was put into the design of the game pieces, which are very detailed. The same figures are used for each different tribe, which are just painted differently. Spears & Shields are cast separately, but come with the figures that they are intended for.

The rules are well printed complete with a color cover, and are packed with black & white illustrations.
The game tokens are printed in color, on white card.

—description from the publisher

name: Männer: Das Spiel.
description:
Party game for up to 5 men (or brave women), where you collect certificates in 5 categories to win.

The 5 categories are:

Guess correct number of teammates for whom a given fact is true.
Quiz question
Solve riddle
Assessment by fellow players to a personal question (yes / rather yes / rather no / no)
Good Luck (guess the value of the next card drawn)


For each solved task you get a status card, 3 of them can be exchanged for a certificate of the same category.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Komm mit!
description:
On the game board of a fictitious city, each player has a clubhouse to which he should bring 3 guests (opponents cars). Each player owns 3 cars with which he can drive around the city and capture the other cars (form a tower). With various rules to change the direction of travel and take over a tower the game is completed.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ein Loch ist im Eimer
description:
In Ein Loch ist im Eimer ("There is a hole in the bucket"), players are filling a bucket with marbles (representing water drops). The bucket is hanging from a water tap, and it has a hole in the bottom, which is initially blocked by a ping-pong ball. However, the marbles will displace the ball, which will make it possible for the marbles to "leak" out of the bucket.

Each player must predict how many of their balls they will put in without them falling out. Whoever gets the predicted amount of balls into the bucket is the winner.

—user summary

name: PEZ Click & Play: Jurassic World
description:
Roaring into your collection the Jurassic World Click and Play Gift Tin!

Each Gift Tin includes four interactive Click and Play dispensers (Blue the Raptor, T-Rex, Triceratops, and Mosasaurus). Twist the top of the dispenser off and it becomes an interactive game piece. Game board, spinner and directions included!

The game is chutes and ladders with PEZ and a pasted dinosaur theme.

The player spins a dial on their turn which results in a colored space to move to or a special candy space to jump to or a dinosaur space to go backwards to.

Game ends when a player reaches the finish line and escapes the island.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sira Box: La Biographie du Prophète Muhammad
description:
Prophet Muhammad holds a unique place in the consciousness and life of Muslims.
He is the one who received and transmitted the Koran, the revealed Text which recalls the eminent place of the Messenger of God, at the same time Prophet, model and guide.

The SIRA Box game is an exciting game to introduce children and adults to the life of the Prophet
Muhammad, from his birth in Mecca until his death in Medina. Educational, this game calls on memory, encourages players to read the Sira and holds many surprises.
Over 400 questions and answers will test your knowledge, and not necessarily the most learned will win.

The winner is the first player (or team) to reach the finishing box on one of the 2 boards for 2 modes of play . The game also offers 2 levels of knowledge, for the kids and the experts.
Each card contains 2 questions with 4 answers each. You move on the ladder based on the number of correct answers given (0-2)

– Translated description from the publisher + user info

name: Les Prophètes: Le jeu
description:
Have fun with short and varied games! Which player will be the first to reach the Ka'ba?
To win, answer the questions correctly and complete the challenges.
Which Prophets was thrown into the fire by his people?
Can you mimic the forbidden tree?
Can you make your opponents or team members guess the year of the elephant?
The answer to these questions and many others can be found in the game "The Prophets", this game developed with the help of teachers, allows children from 7 years old to approach in a fun way the stories of the Prophets.

Goal:
Be the first to cross the finish line.

–description from the publisher (translated)

name: Ikra: The Islamic Game
description:
Ikra has been designed to be a fun way of introducing or reinforcing Islam in any group of any size. The primary objective in introducing this product is that it should be both entertaining and educational - for every kind of Muslim.

As Muslims come from every geographical area, and from every different culture, we hope that Ikra gives all Muslims an appreciation for their different brothers and sisters, and helps each type address some of the problems specific to themselves as individuals. A few questions have been included in Ikra to show a contrast with Islam. This can initiate interesting discussion and can help us understand the place of Muslims in the world view at least a little more, insha-Allah. As such, there is something in Ikra for everybody!
-In game summary

Ikra is a game where the goal is the reach the center of the board by answering 1 of 3 questions on a given card and moving a player token counter-clockwise. Questions are largely focused on Islamic teachings, culture, and history, with the addition of general science and geography questions included. Once the player does a full lap and ends on their "ladder," they can answer a corresponding question to achieve that pillar of Islam and go up one rung. Game ends when a player is able to reach the Ka'aba in the center.

name: Weißt du noch...?: Die 70er
description:
The theme of the game is to put events from the 1970s in the correct chronological order and bring memories to life with narration.

Text and picture cards (movie posters) are shuffled separately and stacked. Each player gets one movie poster card and three text cards and places them in front of them. The cards must now be put in the correct order, for this you may look at the date on the back of the movie poster. Once everyone has laid out an order, the players take turns presenting the events; memories and stories come into play. You get one point for each correct card, in case of doubt the year counts. Whoever has the most points after an agreed number of rounds wins.

—user summmary

name: Meeplevania
description:
Meeplevania is a game of vampires and meeples. Taking place in the land of Meeplevania, several vampire hunters have joined forces in an attempt to track down Count Meepula, the infamous meeple vampire! Played over a series of rounds, where each player takes a turn at being Count Meepula.

Each player who is not Count Meepula must take two of these actions, if possible. An action can only be performed once per turn by a player.

They can move to an adjacent territory.
They can Investigate the territory they are currently in.
They can ask Count Meepula if they are adjacent to a territory.


Count Meepula can take one of two actions on their turn.

They can switch out the face down territory card with any adjacent territory card in their hand, in effect moving to that new territory.
Count Meepula can push any investigator meeple either in the territory they occupy or adjacent to the territory they occupy to any other adjacent territory. (i.e. move one space).


The player who reaches the winning number of cubes (different per player count) at the end of a round ends the game and wins!

A player wins a round either by guessing the location of Count Meepula or by having less cards than the other players if you are Count Meepula (you have to give up cards when the location is guessed incorrect).
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Horror, Print & Play

name: F-Life: Urbanization & Gangs
description:
Urbanization & Gangs is the first expansion to the dark humor party card game F-Life: A Card Game About Adulthood.

This expansion includes 100 all-new cards, including the new Drug deck and a new game mechanic.

Be the disappointment your parents always thought you were and become a drug dealer! Become a kingpin with one of the new backstory cards. Get a new profession such as a sign spinner, taxi driver, tattoo artist, and more!

Urbanization & Gangs is a great addition for any fans of F-Life!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Quest for Jannah
description:
In a playful way reconnect your family while learning more about Islam in an interactive fun way!

Do you want to test your knowledge about Islam and find a way to teach your children more about Islam?
Players will learn that being helpful and kind to their family and others, defines a good Muslim.

Gameplay:
Move around the board acquiring as many city sites as you can. The more you own, the more donations you can collect from the other players. Once you acquire all the city sites in a country set then you are entitled to build one Mosque per site which is given by the Angel. This Mosque must be placed on the corresponding city site. The donations you receive usually, increase with the Mosque.

The player that has the most deeds, is the winner.

This game can be played in three different ways:

Beginner: Ask the Questions with multiple-choice options.
Professional: Ask the questions without the multiple-choice options.
Master: Ask questions without multiple-choice options. The player must answer with an explanation and the references on the question card.


–description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mati per Barkolana
description: Mati per Barkolana is a deck of 32 cards depicting 17 funny crew members for your Barkolana team. "El petesson", "El sparagin", "El gambuser" and others will help you win the greatest sailing race of all the world.

name: Flames of War: Hungarian Steel – Mid-War Hungarian Forces 1942-43
description:
The Hungarians joined the war against the Soviet Union in June 1941, first contributing a mobile corps of light tanks, motorised infantry and cavalry. By 1942 they had committed an entire field army of 220,000 men made up of ten divisions in three corps. The freshly raised force was made up of young Hungarian recruits with little combat experience, but they were soon proving themselves in hard fighting on the Don River. They were backed up by the 1st Armoured Field Division who had many veterans of the fighting in 1941.

You will find

Background on the 2nd Hungarian Army on the Eastern front 1942 to 1943.
Instructions on how to build:
A T-38 Tank Company
A Panzer IV Tank Company
An Autocannon Company
A Motorised Rifle Company
A Huszár Squadron formation of cavalry
A Rifle Company
A selection of support including Marder Tank-hunters, Csaba armoured cars, 75mm anti-tank guns, Assault Pioneers, anti-aircraft, artillery and air support.

Also includes a painting guide and handy basing guide to help get you troops on the table.
The booklet comes bundled with Unit Cards (36) and Command Cards (27).


–description from the publisher (extract)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: IS: Intelligence Service
description:
A new terrorist organisation has appeared and is threatening the world peace. You are at the head of one of the most powerful secret service agency. By using your spy satellites you will be able to locate your enemies. Send your best spies to annihilate their plans but be quick, other agencies are on it and they want all the credit for themselves !

How to play ?


Every turn you must move at least one of your three satellites on a different row.
The card your satellites is pointing will determine your actions.


The card on the operation field could either be an objectives, terrorists, pieces of equipment or other nation spy.

Objectives and enemy spies can only be defeated if your total attack points exceed their defenses.

Your attack is determined by your special powers, your equipement and by rolling dices.

- your turn ends when you have make use of your three satellites.

Once every player have played their turn, the operation field operate a rotation.

By capturing objectives, sentinels or even enemies spies, you win victory points.

Set up wisely your satellites to outplay your ennemies !

With special equipment and a unique power to each and every agency, a lot of combos can be done which will most certainly please the most advanced players.

The game end when players have captured the number of objectives they agreed on before hand.
The player with the most victory points win.

Thanks to it's unique spotting mechanism and earth rotation, every session of IS: intelligence Service is like any other!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Voting

name: Lorica & Thorax: Regolamento
description:
Classic Ancient miniature wargame rules.
Dice, tape measure and counters (disorder, route, charge) are needed to play.

This book also contains 10 army lists

name: Imperi e Feudi
description:
Imperi e Feudi, Empires and Feuds is a simple ruleset that aims to reproduce and play great medieval battles, involving two or more players, within a reasonable time.

The philosophy of the game is to make players use the various types troops according to their actual use on the battlefield, without overloading the game with a myriad of different factors for weapons and armor.

It includes 14 Army Lists and 2 Historical Scenarios

—Translated description from the publisher
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Imperi e Feudi: Prima espansione geografica – Italia, Spagna e Portogallo
description:
This first expansion for Imperi e Feudi allows you to play with the armies that fought in Italy, Spain and Portugal
in the great medieval battles.

In this volume you will find:

26 new Army Lists, clarifications for their use,
rules for introducing "Historical Commanders" in your games,
playable cards of the "Historical Commanders" with their characteristics
personal, movement rulers, and rangers for shooting weapons.


—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Imperi e Feudi: Seconda espansione geografica – Isole Britanniche
description:
This second expansion of Imperi e Feudi allows you to play with that armies they fought in the British Isles in the great medieval battles.
In this volume you will find:

23 new Army Lists, clarifications for theirs use,
rules for introducing "Historical Commanders" into your games,
cards of "Historical Commanders" with their personal characteristics, clarifications,
optional rules (facing a flank charge, cavalry break-off, mock cavalry charge and landings),
landing markers and rotation rulers.


This volume does not contain the rules, in order to play, the Imperi e Feudiruleset is necessary.

–Translated description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Rewe: The Mapuche Sacred Places
description:
REWE is an abstract majority game for 2 players inspired by the Mapuche culture, an indigenous people of South America. You will impersonate a Machi, spiritual guide and you will employ her/his knowledge in obtaining the right combinations of curative herbs - the Lawen - to heal the polluted territories.

There are 3 types of cards:


Lawen cards: these are the resources of the Machi
Luku cards: the effects of these cards last for the whole duration of a round.
Küme cards: represent an help for the Machi


How to play:


Each turn starts moving the Rehue turn counter of one step forward along the external circle of the Kultrun board.
Therefore the first Machi launches the Wenu dice: the outcome will determine the position of the Wenu token on its scale numbered from da 1 to 8.
