Then the Machi's round starts. He draws from the Lawen deck the number of the cards indicated by the Wenu and adds them to his Yapaq (bag) and takes a step or two, otherwise stays still.
The player must move his Machi token trying to get in touch with the Ngen (Cosmic spirit), that is being in correspondence of the dashed line at the end of which the Ngen token is positioned, in order to trigger the colour of the Rewe for his turn.
Once moved, each Machi chooses the number of Lawen cards indicated by the Wenu scale and play them.
A specific combination of Lawen corresponds to each Rewe or sacred place.
In order to get the Lif (purifying agent), a sufficient number of Lawen is requested.
The Machi checks if the combination occurred which generates the Lif.
He chooses to store it in the Ruka space of his board or places it on a polluted territory.
At the end of the game, the Machi who gets more Final Points (bonus, lif cubes, and regenerated Rewe) wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Collectible Components, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Grid Movement, Resource to Move, Set Collection

name: hoch3
description:
The game board shows 9 fields on which the game pieces are placed and moved. In the 2-person game, the game is played on the five central squares of the game board. Each player receives 6 discs in his color and tries to form a tower of three in his own color as quickly as possible.
The active player places a piece on a square. The players take turns until all the pieces are on the board. Pieces in a field are stacked to form towers. Each tower can consist of a maximum of three pieces.
When all pieces are in play, the active player may always take one of his own free pieces and place it on another square. However, pieces blocked by other pieces are taboo. If none of a player's pieces is free, that player must sit out a round.
End of game: As soon as a player succeeds in forming a tower of three of his own pieces, he has won the game.

—user summary

name: 流浪地球：求生之路 (The Wandering Earth: Road to Survival)
description:
In Wandering Earth: Road to Survival, as a team leader, you need to be vigilant at all times, check detector data, deploy your team, find ways to protect your team members, and bring them to the nearest bunker entrance as soon as possible.

The great changes in civilization brought about by the disaster have caused tremendous changes in the thinking of the leaders. Everyone has a secret mission of their own in their hearts, which will affect every judgment they make during the evacuation process.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Voting

name: Quran Challenge Game: The world of the Quran in one box
description:
The Quran Challenge Game for children is a unique game based on the Holy Quran.

The idea behind this game is to provide the children with both fun and education.
All questions are taken from the Quran.
They have been creatively worked into this game and children will enjoy answering them.
This game can be played at school or at home with all the family members.
Begin your journey and find out what fun it is to learn from the Quran.

The player to reach the Finnish space first is the winner.

–description from the publisher

name: Corpo D'Armata
description:
Corpo D'Armata, Army Corps is a miniature rulebook coming from Napoleonic battles wargame experiences that have matured over many years.

These rules try to reproduce a battle or a campaign respecting the historical conditions as much as possible, such as the number and quality of troops, resources and means available to the various European armies. Trying to achieve the set objectives and reproducing the strategic and tactical choices of the commanders of the time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Imperi e Feudi: Terza espansione geografica – Bisanzio, il Medio Oriente e le Crociate
description:
Imperi e Feudi: Terza espansione geografica – Bisanzio, il Medio Oriente e le Crociate, Empires and Feuds - Third geographical expansion: Byzantium, the Middle East and the Crusades

This third expansion of Imperi e Feudi allows you to play with the armies that fought in the near east in the great medieval battles.
In this volume you will find:

25 new Army Lists,
rules to introduce "Historical Commanders", playable cards of the "Historical Commanders" with their personal characteristics,
optional rules,
motion rulers and range devices for shooting weapons.


This volume does not contain the rules, in order to play it is necessary possess the basic rules Imperi e Feudi.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: MYTH Trading Card Game
description:
A fantasy-style trading card game in which the players (dubbed MYTH Commanders) deploy Creatures, cast Sorcery, equip weapons, and change field conditions in order to attack the other Commander's Fortress. A Fortress consists of three Towers, each with 200 hit points, or Wall Points. The first player to bring their opponent's Towers to 0 Wall Points each has breached the Fortress and won the game.

Commanders deploy Creatures as their main attack force, each with a set of Attack Points, Guard Points, and Health Points. Creatures attack each other by comparing Attack Points to Guard Points, and the difference is dealt as damage to the weaker Creature's Health Points. Creatures are placed on a Battlefield, a 3-by-2 grid that allows or restricts attacks depending on placement. A Creature that has not been deployed the same turn, occupies a certain space on the Battlefield, and has no opposing Creatures directly in front of it, has a chance to directly attack the opposing Towers.

Commanders change the flow of the game with Sorcery cards, each with its own category and level that dictates their effectiveness. Commanders equip weaponry in the form of Armory cards to their Creatures, modifying their effectiveness in the game. And Commanders change field conditions with Field cards, granting advantages and disadvantages to Creatures depending on a variety of stats and classifications.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Income, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Crush the Kaiser: Where the Poppies Grow – Fast play wargames rules for the Western Front 1916 to 1918
description:
Where the Poppies Grow covers the Western Front from 1916 to 1918.
Includes rules for using tanks and aircraft, as well as varied artillery barrages and counter-battery fire, gas, mines and stormtroopers.


Fast play battalion and brigade level rules designed by wargamers, for wargamers
Fully researched and historically accurate for the period
Detailed organisations for all the armies on the Western Front 14-18
Rules are scenario based not points driven
Suitable for all figure scales, no need to re-base your figures
Company or squadron are smallest units for infantry and cavalry, with a company typically having 14 figures
Rules are written in order of play, so no need to flip back and forth through a book, with examples running through the rules
Minimum number of dice rolls for casualties
Four different experience levels for troops from Raw to Veteran, which determines how they shoot and react.
Simple and effective mechanisms for morale at company level, with more detailed battalion level morale only needed if losses are high


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Crush the Kaiser: Tools of victory
description:
Expansion for for Crush the Kaiser, Tools of Victory has detailed battalion and brigade organisations for infantry, cavalry and artillery for the armies that fought on the Western Front from 1916 onwards.

These include British and Empire, French and German and also US, Belgian, Portuguese, Austro-Hungarians and the Russian Expeditionary Corps.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Crush the Kaiser: Over by Christmas
description:
Over by Christmas covers the early part of the Great War on the Western Front from August 1914 to early 1916, and includes detailed organizations for the British, French, Belgian and German armies.

Allows you to fight fast moving open warfare with cavalry charges and horse artillery as well as the beginnings of the trench war.

Lots of period flavour including improvised grenades and mortars, trench catapults, rapid fire by British Regulars and attaque à outrance by French infantry.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Crush the Kaiser: Achtung Gringo
description:
Achtung Gringo Fast play rules for wargaming the Mexican revolution from 1910 to 1920 plus some interesting What if options!

Fast & easy to Play, Battalion or regimental levels, organisations for Federals and revolutionaries, Pershing expedition, Villa and Zapata, plus organisation for the German led invasion of the southern USA!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Ganga: River Rescue
description:
A thrilling chain building game exploring river water conservation, history & geography affecting India's divine river, Ganga.

You are in a race to save the Ganga ecosystem from extinction and loss. The crops, trees, birds and animals depend on you to rescue them from pollution, pandemics and over population. It is a race to save the cities in the Indo-Gangetic Plains Ecosystem through which the mighty river Ganga flows. She is not an ordinary river, but a Goddess of the Land.

Life is simple. Build your Living Unit chains, preserve your River cards, collect Goals and keep an eye on the competition. You probably have that secret smile knowing you are making a difference to our ecosystem. Knowledge will lead to action and nothing like a game to help you forge forward. Laugh a lot, compete fiercely and resolve to make a difference.

The Game ends when 4 Events have occurred or all the cards run out. Player wins by collecting Goals achieved of a collection of Living Units.

—description from the publisher

name: Jetzt mal ehrlich!
description:
With the help of an enclosed lie detector, yes/no answers of the players to juicy questions are checked. The player who tells the truth and exposes the other players' lies wins points. The player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Strasse frei!
description:
9 game pieces in 4 colors (3* 2 and 1* 3) are placed as a square. In turn, each player rolls the color die once and removes a piece of the color rolled. If this figure no longer exists, or if he rolls black or white, nothing happens. The player who succeeds in clearing a row of 3 figures vertically, horizontally or diagonally wins the game.

—user summary

name: Versos Desencontrados: Alfonsina Storni
description:
A poetic game to continue giving voice to Alfonsina Storni's work. You just have to mix and match to re-read and create.

Three forms of play: "disengaged verses", "creation of antisonetos" and "interleaved verses". The proposal invites you to play with the verses, read them, combine them and be encouraged to write.
categories: Book, Card Game, Educational, Novel-based, Word Game

name: Splinter
description:
Splinter is an abstract strategy game for two players. The object of the game is to knock out your opponent’s king, rooks, bishops and pawns while protecting your own pieces from enemy attack.

Each player starts the game with 4 types of pieces – 1 king (star), 2 rooks (squares), 3 bishops (crosses) and 9 pawns (circles). Play begins with the pieces arranged in a checkerboard pattern at the center of the board.

Choose a player to go first, then continue playing, alternating turns with your opponent.

On your turn, you may slide any one of your pieces one square in any direction (horizontally, vertically or diagonally). Any pieces that lie in the way (regardless of number, color or type) get pushed along, including off the board. If a piece is pushed off the board, it is eliminated and is out of play for the remainder of the game.

To avoid an infinite loop, you may not move any piece to a square that it vacated on your opponent’s last turn.

A splinter occurs when one or more pieces become disconnected from the original group so that there are empty squares between those pieces and the original group.

Following a splinter, the largest group remains on the board and all other groups are removed. If the groups are of equal size, the player who caused the splinter decides which group is removed. If a piece is removed as a result of a splinter, it is eliminated and is out of play for the remainder of the game.

Each time a player runs out of any type of piece (king, rook, bishop or pawn), the other player scores a knockout. The first player to reach two knockouts wins the game.

Click here for official rules and diagrams: https://splinterboardgame.blogspot.com/2021/06/splinter-is-t...

—description from the designer

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – Thirteenth Doctor & TARDIS
description: This expansion adds the Thirteenth Doctor and her TARDIS to Doctor Who: Exterminate! The expansion includes two miniatures to expand the Doctor Who: Exterminate! universe.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Portal Stone
description:
A duel between two willing participants, both aiming for the ultimate prize. The winner of this devilish game gets one wish granted, the loser, sacrificing their soul to pay for that wish.

GAMEPLAY
The aim of the game is to get 5 Portal Cards. Each player takes 1 of the two following actions on their turn, pass and repeat until a player has 5 Portal Cards:

1. CHARGE
Take one of your tokens and slide it onto the board from any one of the four sides.t the Portal Cards off to the side in a face down pile.

A) Tokens are played into a single square, pushing all other tokens in the same row up by a single

B) If you would cause an opponents token to slide off of the board then that player may place it back onto the board at the end of the turn, however this token cannot be used to push another token off of the board. That player would then take their turn as usual once the player whose current turn it is ends. If you can not place this token back onto the board without pushing another piece off of the board then this action is skipped. If you cause one of your own pieces to slide off of the board then this piece is forfeited.

C) If 5 tokens of a single colour are in a row, they are removed and the player that owns that colour takes one victory point.

2. CHANNEL*
Play a channel card from your hand if the conditions are met.

A) Show any cards from your hand and point out the requirements.

B) Remove the tokens on all matching squares of that cards requirements.

C) Gain points equal to the Portal Symbols on the bottom of the card.


Some cards have arrows on them, this means that you my play this card in your turn before or after your CHARGE action.

name: Dodge Dess
description:
Dodge Dess is a simple strategy print and play board game inspired by a combination between dodgeball and chess, then dice are added to add random elements to it. that's why this game is called “Dodge Dess” (dodgeball, dice, and chess). in short, the theme of this game is sports.

The game is played in a way where players can move their pawns vertically, horizontally, and diagonally with the distance of the squares determined by the number of dice that have been rolled. almost the same as moving, attacking (removing the opponent's pawn from the game), can be done vertically and diagonally with a predetermined distance from the rolled dice. because the player's pawn cannot cross the center line, then after attacking the opponent's pawn the player's pawn must immediately return to the previous box.

The goal of the game is to get rid of all opponent pawns from the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Little More Grape Captain Bragg! Wargame Rules for the Mexican-American War 1846-1848
description: Miniatures wargame rules for the Mexican-American War.

name: TAIJI Supreme Ultimate Playing Cards
description:
TAIJI Supreme Ultimate Playing Cards is a Non-Standard Universal Deck based on the principles of yin and yang. This deck can be used to play over 15 games.

TAIJI Supreme Ultimate Playing Cards are an improved version of the standard deck. The power behind this deck is in its versatility to be interpreted in multiple ways creating different core game mechanics.

There are four main game styles:
1)TAIJI - Uses + & - Card Values. Winning hands are closest to zero. (Use absolute value to determine winner)
2)WUJI - Uses + & - Card Values. Winning hands are farthest from zero. (Use direct correlation to determine winner)
3)CLASSIC - All Card Values are positive. Interpret cards like a standard deck with predetermined Card Hierarchy.
4)INTERPRETIVE - Rules unique for individual games.

The numerous game styles allow for a wide variety of card games to be played, with the manufacturer currently publishing rules for 15 unique games on their website.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Matching, Memory, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Forward Operations
description:
In Forward Operations, two to four players control border nations rushing to build and man forward operating bases so they can take and hold critical objectives in a neighboring country that is becoming unstable. Win the game by holding those objectives for victory points or by destroying the Command Center of your opponents' bases.

Players start with an established forward operating base, which consists of a Command Center, Barracks and a Power Plant. During the game, you'll play Command Cards to generate resources, which can be used to expand your base, develop new technologies, train or manufacture military units, and wage war on your opponents in bloody, fast-paced combat.

Forward Operations is a turn-based wargame sandbox filled with interesting player decisions and building options. Choose between 14 different buildings to expand your base and 25 different military units to build a personalized army that suits your strategy and playing style. Time and resources are limited, so choose wisely.

See you on the battlefield.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Zig Zag
description: Players take turns placing black or white pieces on a 8x14 grid to connect both sides of the board. Only bicolored pieces can be placed on the black squares, and these can be turned over into the opponent's color when surrounded by the opponent's pieces.

name: Poesía a la Carta: Laura Devetach
description:
A poetic game to connect with the poetry of Laura Devetach.

Three forms of play: "poetry on demand", "poetic oracle" and "cauldron of questions". Think of a question and poetry will answer you. Include 10 hexagrams from the I-Ching to complete the answer.

name: Heißes Brezel-Rennen
description:
7 baked goods that have not yet been baked (rolls, baguettes, etc.) are on their way to the ovens. At the beginning, each player makes a prediction as to which goods will end up in which oven. In turn, any 3 of the color dice are rolled (each die represents a baked good) and the corresponding goods are moved towards the ovens, provided they are not blocked by other goods. As soon as a good reaches the oven area, it is pushed into the first free oven. As soon as all ovens are filled with goods, the checkout takes place. For each correct prediction, points are awarded according to the oven (between 1 for the first and 4 for the last one). The player with the most points wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Track Movement

name: Flohmarkt
description:
In a round trip, the dice are rolled sometimes clockwise, sometimes counterclockwise. You can move with all the game pieces. If you arrive at a stand where the flea market item cards with the values 1-15 are displayed, you roll all three color dice to determine the price of the item. The price is written down on a piece of paper. The first player to sell items for Fr. 80 or more is the winner.

—user summary

name: Spionage
description:
Each player has 15 agents, 4 bases and 1 robot. The game is played on a playing field with a network of paths over which you move your pieces and on which you can set up bases. The player whose turn it is rolls 2 dice and can convert the points rolled into: Movement of the individual agents (1 dice point each), deployment of the robot (9 dice points), establishment of a base (6 dice points), air strike (10 dice points), air landing (12 dice points). In addition, it is possible to waive the dice roll and save additional dice points for an action in the next round. For this, however, the action of the next round must be announced and also executed. The player who first manages to occupy 3 squares in the opponent's headquarters by eliminating foreign agents wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Track Movement

name: StoryWorld: NSFW Expansion Pack
description:
A perfect choice for a party game, where the stories can become a little more intense. This will add even more fun to the game, just dont be afraid to tell your must hidden secrets!

44 new cards!

—description from the publisher

name: StoryWorld: Horror Expansion Pack
description: Tell the most terrifying stories and create moments of true horror with your friends. Solve the mystery of a haunted house or face a wave of zombies, everything depends on you and your imagination! 44 new cards!

name: StoryWorld: Fantasy Expansion Pack
description: Enter a world full of magical and powerful creatures, where everything is different from reality. Be ready to travel through magical portals and discover new worlds! 44 new cards!

name: L'Italia s'è desta!
description:
L'Italia s'è desta!, Italy has woken up!:
these Wargame rules are created to simulate the Italian wars of independence, without being too complicated.

To play you need a playing field.
The terrain scale varies per scenario, the reference is 1:5.500.

Turn Sequence:

Impulse of Player A:
Bombardment phase
Shooting phase
Maneuvering phase and charges
Melee Combat Phase

Impulse of Player B:
Repeat the above

name: Su Le Teste ! Le guerre napoleoniche: Nuova Edizione
description:
Su le Teste! ("Up the heads") is a historical miniature wargame for Napoleonic battles and campaigns from 1805 to 1815.

The rules brings all the charm of Napoleonic military exploits on the tabletop,.

A playful work dedicated to the men of those times and aimed at players with a taste for simulation with miniature historical wargames.
A laborious work animated by a passion for history and forged by decades of experience.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval
description:
Hordes & Heroes Medieval is designed as a fast play tabletop historical wargame, which uses hexagon marked terrain as a precise and effective method for moving troops. The rule system is simple and easy to learn, yet sophisticated enough to allow “realistic“ battles to be fought between a diverse range of medieval armies. It is easy to play, but more difficult to master.

One A4 Quick Reference Sheet is sufficient to contain all the information necessary to play. The Combat Results Tables can be printed or photocopied, cut and pasted together as required. The main rules need only be consulted when players are learning the rules, and occasionally thereafter, to clarify situations as they arise.

The precision of the movement system and the speed and efficiency of the combat system ensure that the game flows quickly and even a closely fought contest between two armies of 150 points can be concluded within 1½ hours to 2 hours.

The game is designed to be played on modular hex terrain which can accommodate a range of different terrain features, e.g. open ground, hills and slopes, rivers, woods, impenetrable terrain etc. Larger terrain features can extend over a number of adjacent hexes. The terrain is an extremely important aspect of the rules, in that, it is of great strategical and tactical significance because of the way it influences movement, Command and Control, and combat.

—description from the publisher

name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval – Siege & Assault Supplement
description:
Hordes & Heroes Medieval Siege & Assault Rules - Wargaming sieges and assaults have always proved challenging to wargamers.

Sieges were by their very nature often long drawn out affairs often lasting many weeks, months or even years.
Once the preparations for the assault were complete and the attack was launched the fighting would be fast, furious and intense as attackers and defenders fought for supremacy.
The Siege & Assault rules enable the Hordes & Heroes system to be used to conduct sieges and assaults against defended castles, towns and strongholds. They enable the use of a wide range of medieval siege equipment to be employed in breaching an array of different defences from simple earthworks to the massive stone walls of a major city.
In conjunction with the core medieval rules they enable campaign scenarios to be constructed which enable gamers to explore the strategic as well as the tactical aspects of medieval warfare.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Scrappet Kaiser Princess
description:
Mindy has just turned 10 and her parents have finally allowed her to play the collectable card game she’s been obsessing over: Scrappet Kaiser. But with the annual tournament starting next week, her journey to become the best has hit warp speed! With her close circle of friends and a few bucks, can she build a collection good enough to compete with the champ?

In this solitaire worker-placement board game, you play as Mindy as she plans out how her friends run various errands throughout the week. However, plans will fall apart as unexpected Events ruin your day and reveal that your friends just aren’t that into Scrappet Kaiser! As your collection grows, don’t forget to keep that Ego in check, because your friends will also get tired of getting bossed around. After seven days, total up your final score and check your ranking in the rulebook. Help Mindy become the champ by getting an S Rank!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval – Army Lists
description:
The HHM army lists are designed to enable any medieval historical army to be represented on the table top, in a miniature game, up to an agreed point value.

We have endeavoured to make the lists as flexible as the historical sources which were consulted would permit.

Hordes & Heroes Medieval Army Lists currently contain 28 different armies which can be easily modified and adapted to your own specific preferences or requirements, for use in a particular game, or to form part of an historical campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Wo war's?
description:
16 large animal cards are laid out in a square, the small animal chips with the same images are also placed face up in the center, each tile must be exposed. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice and moves the figure on the large cards accordingly, the animal on the card shows which small tile must be turned over. If the figure lands on an animal that is no longer visible, the player must try to find the matching small tile. If he succeeds, he gets a chip, whoever has 4 chips first wins the game.

—user summary

name: Blumen-WO
description:
A memory of 4 cards. The playing cards each contain 4 identical pictures. The cards are laid out face down and 4 cards are turned over by one player at a time. If two, three or four identical cards are revealed, you get to keep them.

—user summary

name: Throwing Star
description:
A two-card throwing game.

Players stand back to back, each with a throwing star in hand. They take three steps and at the count of three, they turn around and throw their star at their opponent.

The first player to land a hit wins. Wear eye protection. Hits to the head = Disqualification.

As someone who has some experience in throwing cards, the speed element of this can make things pretty wild. If you try to throw it too fast, it will NOT hit your target. If you wait too long, you will get hit.


This game was a stretch goal add-on for the Ninja: Silent But Deadly Kickstarter.

Delivered in the February 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
mechanics: Flicking, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Single Loser Game, Take That

name: Ping Pong Literario 2
description:
A creative game to talk about books, literature and much more.
Ideal to play it at all times in homes, schools, libraries and desktops.

Three ways to play. The conversation is the protagonist and these cards know it. It is not a trivia game. We all have an answer for these letters.


Game modes

Ping Pong: A game to generate and share conversations about your reading journey.

InversaMente: Score points by guessing the other players' answers.

Tell me what you answer is... and I'll tell you what you read: To win you must discover the questions with the clues they give you.

True or false: The same question can have different answers, depending on whether the truth is told or not. Try to find out if the other players are lying and score a lot of points!

The Winner is the one who reach the total points agreed upon at the start of the game or is winning after the session is over.

name: Casino: The Game of Gambling Strategy
description:
Similar to Monopoly, players roll dice and move around the board, perform actions as listed on the squares they land on. Some squares require the players to roll dice, play cards, or use a roulette wheel to gain or lose gambling chips.

Lose all your chips and you're out of the game. The first player to collect a set or more of color-coded casinos and to 'cut and run' with their chips, wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Rondel, Set Collection

name: Meine Burg Deine Burg
description:
The players take turns placing wall stones in a square grid. The player who closes a castle with the last wall stone marks it with his own flag and must place another wall stone. Once all the wall stones have been placed, the player with the most castles wins.

—user summary

name: Der Frosch sitzt schwitzend im Schaukelstuhl
description:
Each player receives 5 cards with sentence parts (parts 1 to 4). Whoever's turn it is draws a new card from the deck and is allowed to lay out a complete set of parts 1 to 4. Funny sentences should be created by mixing the sentence parts. Whoever cannot lay out a sentence must pass. The winner is the player who was able to lay out all the cards in his hand first.

—user summary

name: Diercke Entdecker Spiel
description:
The game can be played on either a Germany, Europe or World map. Depending on the chosen map, the corresponding question/action cards are used. Each player receives an itinerary that specifies the areas in which master questions must be answered in order to be allowed to acquire them. In order to move with the game figure, questions must be answered, drawings made or pantomime performances guessed. acquired areas can also be lost again. With the use of coins, in addition to acquiring territories, it is also possible to travel by plane or ship, or to bring a second game figure into play. The first player to completely fulfil his travel plan wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval Fantasy
description:
Hordes & Heroes Medieval Fantasy rule system is based on H&H Medieval with the addition of magic and special rules to reflect the particular fighting characteristics associated with particular fantasy armies.

It is designed as a fast play tabletop wargame, which uses hexagon marked terrain as a precise and effective method for moving troops.
The rule system is simple and easy to learn, yet sophisticated enough to allow “realistic“ battles to be fought between a diverse range of fantasy armies.
It is easy to play, but more difficult to master.

One A4 Quick Reference Sheet is sufficient to contain all the information necessary to play. The Combat Results Tables can be printed or photocopied, cut and pasted together as required. There is a Quick Reference Sheet Generator on the website to enable players to quickly create and print the play sheet for a game between any fantasy armies contained in the army lists. The main rules need only be consulted when players are learning the rules, and occasionally thereafter, to clarify situations as they arise.

The precision of the movement system and the speed and efficiency of the combat system ensure that the game flows quickly and even a closely fought contest between two armies of 150 points can be concluded within 1½ hours to 2 hours. This makes the system ideally suited for competitive and tournament play.

The game is designed to be played on modular hex terrain which can accommodate a range of different terrain features, e.g. open ground, hills and slopes, rivers, woods, impenetrable terrain etc.

—description from the publisher

name: Hordes & Heroes: Medieval Fantasy – Army Lists
description:
The HHM Fantasy Army Lists are designed to enable any medieval fantasy army to be represented on the table top, in a miniature game, up to an agreed point value.

We have endeavored to make the lists as flexible as possible to enable historical armies to be used with the addition of fantasy elements, such as flying units and magicians.

Hordes & Heroes Medieval Fantasy Army Lists currently contain 24 different armies which can be easily modified and adapted to your own specific preferences or requirements, for use in a particular game, or to form part of a fantasy campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Devenez Chef: Apéro en folie
description:
Devenez Chef: Apéro en folie
Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: asparagus, coppa, avocado
Other ingredients: Greek and Bulgarian yogurt, goat cheese, sundried tomatoes, breadsticks, Espelette pepper, lemon, shrimp, basil and cucumber

Gameplay

Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors
Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players
Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list
Gather your material with the supplied material list
Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Record Deal
description:
User Review

The object is to impress the other players with your singing performance when given a random set of lyrics and a random genre of music.

Each player is given two song cards, each with a set of lyrics, and spins the spinner for a random genre. (A player may spin for another genre by using one’s only Fire the Band Token.) After given some time to prepare, the player performs the chosen song in the assigned genre. (The publisher provides a web site where the assigned background music can be used.) After everyone has performed, each player has two votes to cast for the best performance(s). The player with the most votes get a Record Deal. Scoring two Record Deals wins the game.

name: Helionox: Sunward Struggle
description:
Fan made - cards-only remix of ideas in the Helionox universe. Designed to be a travel, and condensed, version that is both familiar and stand on its own.

Travel from planet to planet in this solo deckbuilder overcoming Events, ferrying cargo to fulfill Requests, and trying to score higher than the always lurking Shadow Syndicate.

This is a fan-made standalone game created with the copyright holder's permission. Players play and buy cards, move their ship, and overcome events on their turn.

Game ends after 9 rounds when the event deck runs out.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Death of the Goblin King: A solo dungeon crawl
description:
Death of the Goblin King: A solo dungeon crawl is a solitaire dungeon crawl where you explore a dungeon with monsters, traps, doors and secret passages. Travers the 5 levels of the dungeon, find the keys to unlock each level door, and destroy any monsters in your way until you reach the final Big Boss – The Goblin King and destroy him. You only need two decks of regular poker sized cards. No dice, pen or paper is needs, just 2 decks of cards and this rulebook.

Death of the Goblin King: A solo dungeon crawl is played in turns with you as the adventurer exploring the darkest depths of a sinister dungeon. Each turn you'll be exploring the dungeon by moving your character card “Ace of Clubs” from card to card. As you turn over each unexplored card you may encounter monsters, a trap, treasures, a key, a door, a secret passage or helpful items. As you unlock the door to the next level you must defeat the boss of that level until you reach the final 5th level and the ultimate boss The Goblin King. Defeat him and you win the game. You can only explore chambers “cards” that are either vertical or horizontal to your character card. To explore the chamber, you place your character card underneath the chamber card and flip over the card to see what awaits you.

VICTORY CONDITIONS
On each level you must defeat the boss of that level until you reach the final 5th level and the ultimate boss The Goblin King. Defeat The Goblin King and you win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Das große Bielefeld-Spiel
description:
Players move their figure over a map of Bielefeld by rolling the dice and must visit 5 randomly drawn landmarks. On the way lurk event fields (sit out once, move forward, jump to a certain place). Once you have visited your 5 destinations, you still have to reach the final destination. The winner is the one who manages to do this first.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Random Battle
description:
Choose to play as one of six characters: Bear, Wizard, Vampire, Ninja, Robot, Pterodactyl.
Take turns to either build up your hand, or attack opponents using the cards you already hold.
Six types of Attack Card correspond to six attack zones on the body. Combo Cards add to the Attack Score, Counter Cards add to the Defence Score.
Roll dice to determine if an attack is successful or not.
Win by surviving the final round with the least amount of damage.
Nerve, cunning, and a large slice of luck are required to be a Random Battle champion.
Two six-sided dice are required (NOT included).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Wer's weiß gewinnt!
description:
A quiz game with 600 questions, 5 each on 120 cards. The questions are numbered. Who knows the answer gets the number of the question credited as points, if you do not know the value is deducted. The first to reach an agreed amount of points wins.

—user summary

name: Mit Winnetou im Wilden Westen
description:
A quiz game about the Wild West with 600 questions. The questions are divided into 3 levels of difficulty. The player whose turn it is chooses a difficulty level (1/2/3) and is asked a corresponding question. If you answer correctly you get 1/2/3 points, otherwise they are deducted from the previous score. The first to reach an agreed number of points wins the game.

—user summary
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: ZERO
description:
Young and old are there at ZERO. They all put a card face down on the table. Which card values are hidden? Add up quickly: three, five, seven. Minus one equals six. Who guessed the correct amount?

—description from the back cover
publishers: AG Müller (AGMüller), ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Rhino Games

name: STAR MARS
description:
STAR MARS is a trick-taking game that was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) 2020 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット vol. 6 (Trick Taking Set vol. 6).

It is lightly themed as a familiar epic space opera, with one suit as the "rebels" and another as the "Mars" army; there are also 4 cards depicting a neutral ship, a Mars Kaiser card, a Princess Liza card, and a card roughly translated as Loose Landrunner.

The score board includes places for both the scores of the individual players, as well as a track for if the rebels or Mars has won more tricks.

Players earn points through "theme cards" that are chosen at the start of a hand. These represent predictions the players are making, as to if Princess Liza will be won by the Mars side, or if the Mars Kaiser will defeat Loose Landrunner.

The first player to 13 points is the winner.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Deen Challenge
description:
Deen Challenge is an atmosphere game for fun games with families or friends !

500 questions and challenges will put your knowledge and talent to the test:

Quiz
Mime
Drawing
Words to guess


The games are linked without respite, for a super friendly atmosphere!

Win: The first player (or team) to collect 10 tokens wins the game!

–Translated description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Fist Fight: The Card Game
description:
Fist Fight: The Card Game is a fast-paced, 1-on-1 card game based off of the action of old-school arcade fighting cabinets.

Two players simultaneously lay down cards from their hands and try to reduce their opponents hit points to 0. First person to do so wins the round, first to win 2 rounds wins the game. Rounds should last around 60 seconds.

There are attack, block, throw, and counter cards, all of which need to be played strategically to maximize the damage a player can do to their opponent, without taking too much damage of their own.

Predicting what your opponent might play and making a decision on what to do within seconds adds an arcade feel to the game; there isn't always time to think things over, sometimes you just have to throw down a card and hope it works, we call that our version of button mashing.

Whether played with a single opponent, or against a group of people rotating in and out, Fist Fight will provide hours of the high-energy entertainment.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fighting, Real-time
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Alebrijes
description:
Three types of characters: lizards, insects and fish will give life to a multitude of fantastic animals. The mission is to find a way to create three different trios with the cards that are available.

Cleverly choosing, combining, stealing and trading will be the strategy necessary to win. Also be attentive to the game of the other participants, to make the best decisions. In addition, the "action cards" will dictate certain moves that must be used wisely.

Trios are built by combining TAIL + BODY + HEAD of the same type. The types are lizards, fish, and insects, each on a different background color to facilitate association.

The deck is mixed very well with the 70 cards (the image cards and the action cards). The mixed deck is placed in the center of the table upside down. Each player starts with 4 cards.

Each one will make the possible trios and will leave the remaining cards in their sector of the table to continue playing with them. All cards in play are placed face up, showing the built trios and the remaining cards.

In turn, each player will pick up a card from the deck: If an image card comes out, the following two movements are made:
1- The card is used to make a trio or laid in the player's sector of the table to use it later and Exchange is made (mandatory). For this, an image card of one of the playmates is chosen and it is exchanged for an own image card (the one that has just been lifted or another). You cannot break a trio already built by another player. If an action card is drawn, only the action specified on it is done and the exchange is not made.
Whenever one of these cards appears, it is played immediately.

The game ends when a player manages to assemble three different trios, that is, a trio of each type.

name: I love El Paso
description: A real estate trading game. This is essentially like Monopoly with El Paso companies and locations. The proceeeds to benefit eliminating racism, empowering women and YWCA El Paso Del Norte Region. The six tokens are sombrero, tsco, chili pepper, trolley, UTEP logo, and cowboy boot.

name: Sitz Krieg ohne Hass: Orders of Battle – Operation Barbarossa 1941
description:
Orders of Battle for German, Russian, Hungarian, Italian and Romanian forces during the Barbarossa campaign in 1941 to accompany the SKOH rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: 栄！(Sakae!)
description:
The economic game 栄!, roughly translated as "Prosperity", puts the players in the world of Shibusawa Eiichi, a Japanese entrepreneur known as the father of Japanese capitalism, who established more than 500 companies.

Through three stages, the players take turns choosing certain actions, such as establishing an enterprise; training talent; borrowing; or market development. After each player has taken a turn, a settlement phase will typically reward those players who've started the most valuable companies, but market conditions could alter the situation.

Once a player has reached a certain number of points the end of the game is triggered, and the player with the most points wins.

name: Holgi's Ventil-Spiel
description:
Self-published game by Galerie Club N. 68 in Kiel (a famous pub).

Two players move their six valves, which serve as game pieces, by dice roll over a 6x10 square playing area. The goal is to move his valves to the starting squares of the opponent.

At the start of the game, event cards are placed face down on 12 center squares, which take effect when entered. Opposing pieces can be captured and sent back to their starting squares.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Die ganze Welt der Ritter: Ritterturnier
description:
The game Ritterturnier ("Knights Tournament") is part of the box Die ganze Welt der Ritter ("The whole world of knights"), which also contains other game elements (puzzle, craft sheet, etc.).

In the knight tournament will take part 4 knight figures. In one session a player is assigned 2 figures face down, at least one of which should survive the tournament. The knights move on a 6x6 playing field. Each player can move any knight. If 2 knights are on adjacent squares, they duel by dice roll. Only one knight survives the duel. A total of as many sessions are played as there are players participating, so that each player receives the assigned pieces once.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hidden Roles

name: Luzi Luftig
description:
Four airports are placed in the room, with the numbers 1 to 4 and a base. Parcels are placed on the airports, which are collected by the children and flown to the base with the plastic airplane "Luzi". The dice in the plane indicates the destination and when landed, the number of parcels to be loaded. The player who has brought the most parcels to the base after 2 rounds wins the game.
By the way: the airplane is powered by a battery, which makes the airplane wriggling and rattling.

—user summary

name: Das Klosterspiel
description:
The players want to recover the monastery treasure hidden in a crypt. There up to four monks who want to save the treasure compete with up to four commissioners who want to seize the treasure. Each player receives a piece, which he moves through the monastery by rolling the dice along predefined paths. To get into the crypt, 2 keys must first be obtained from the abbot or from opposing players. If you meet an opponent, you can get him drunk with a jug of wine and steal a key from him. There are other events (playing fields and temptation cards) that influence the course of the game. Whoever reaches the treasure field in the crypt first is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Quran Explorer Game
description:
The Quran Explorer Game is a game based on the Quran.
It is suitable for 2 to 6 players’ aged eight and above.
It is a highly entertaining knowledge game to play with family and friends.

In this simple and fast-paced game of question and answer you have to give the correct answers, face the challenges, move forward, collect the Quran Cards, and land on the final intersection square that leads up to the Blessed Road and then reach to the finish before your friends reach there.
Along the way, as you earn points, you also learn a lot about the Quran and its teachings.
This game is truly a journey into the world of fun, wisdom and education for the entire family.

– Description from the publisher

name: The Iron Cross I: Kharkov '42
description:
The Iron Cross Part I: Kharkov '42 covers the time between the start of the Soviet offensive and the beginning of the German Stalingrad campaign in 1942. In early May, several Soviet formations stand poised to take Kharkov and seize the Dnepr River crossings, destroying all the German armies in the south Ukraine. The Germans themselves are preparing themself their summer offensive. Victory hangs in the balance and the entire course of the summer’s campaign will depend upon who can strike first.
The game system is a very innovative impulse system. There are no ZOCs.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 5 miles / 8.5 Km
Units: Battalion to Division

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 3-12 hours

—description from the designer

name: Patty-Pillar
description:
In this colorful preschool game, players use a bouncy wormy die roller to feed leaf tokens to bizarrely unique caterpillars in an effort to turn them all into fantastical butterflies. There are three levels of play, starting with cooperative shape and color identification all the way to competitive, memory-based play.

The goal of the game is to transform all of your caterpillar cards into beautiful butterflies by feeding them leaf tokens. In general, players will take turns pushing down the wormy roller to spin the die inside its body. Depending on the level of play, that information will tell you which leaf tokens to find from the leaf pile. You must then find which caterpillar wants to eat that leaf, feed it to them, and then flip them over to their butterfly side and "fly" the butterfly away. When all the caterpillars have been transformed, you win!

—description from the designer

name: Safari Sprint
description:
It's time for the annual hedgehog race! All the animals of the Greater Rift Valley, big and small, have gathered to watch the hedgehogs take the field. But hedgehogs are very slow creatures. And the other animals are growing impatient! So one by one, the animals begin to push the hedgehogs along the forest floor, hoping to finish the race before tea time.

In this preschool game, each player picks their favorite hedgehog and lines it up at the beginning of the jungle track track. A shuffled deck of animal cards, as well as the big and small animal disks, wait off to the side, cheering on the racers. On your turn, flip over the top animal card and find the matching animal disk. Then use that animal to push the hedgehogs further along the track, but only as far as the canopy! As more and more animals crowd in behind the little hedgehogs, they'll get shoved, pushed, and jostled further and further down the field until one unlikely hedgehog pops out the other end of the racetrack and is declared the winner. If it's your hedgehog, you win!

Safari Sprint features all real world plants and animals that can be found in the Greater Rift Valley of Africa. The language free cards display each animal's range, size, and diet. Additional facts about the animals can be found inside the game's instruction sheet.

—description from the designer

name: Fart and Go Seek
description:
Fart and Go Seek takes the classic playground game and adds electronic farting beans. One player is the Seeker and the others are Hiders. As a Hider you are randomly dealt a bean. It might be a silent bean, but it also might be one of the farting kind. Everyone starts at a predetermined base, then presses the button on their bean and runs off to hide while the Seeker closes their eyes and counts.

While you try to hide, your bean may be unable to control itself and continuously let out little farts and giggles. Or you may have a silent bean. Either way, try to get back to base without being tagged by the Seeker. If the Seeker tags you before you get back to base, they'll collect your bean. If you make it back safely, you can exchange your bean for its matching score card.

Once all players have been tagged or returned to base, the round ends and each player earns points based on how well they did that round. The Seeker earns points for any beans they collected (silent beans are worth more than loud ones). Seekers earn points for any card they collected (loud bean cards are worth more than silent ones). Continue playing until each player has had a turn as the Seeker, adding up the points you earn each round, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer

name: Deus lo volt: Regole di wargame – Le crociate
description:
The Crusades.
Christian and Muslim armies.
Battles and military campaigns.

Deus lo volt are rules for wargame, with tables, cards, scenarios and everything you need to simulate history.
You will also find war tactics, military history, guides, manuals on how to build armies and scenery.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Marlborough: Regole di Wargame – 1700-1750
description:
These wargame rules are created to simulate the great battles of the 1700 - 1750 period, without necessarily using complicated rules.

To play, you need: a battlefield, approximately 120 / 160cm by 90 / 120cm, and a six-sided die.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Rasenna: Regole di Wargame Antico
description:
Etruscans, Gauls, Samnites, Romans Tulliani and Camillo, Latins, Veneti, Equi, Liguri, Campani, Bruzii, Apuli, Lucani, etc.
Military campaigns.
Historical battle scenarios.
Rules for tabletop wargaming. With tables, cards, scenarios and everything you need to simulate history, where you will find war tactics, military history, guides, manuals on how to build armies to scenic elements.

For those unfamiliar with historical wargames, this will be a good opportunity to approach a hobby, which has infinite charm and many fans.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: 5 Pillars: Seerah Edition
description:
With 5 Pillars: Seerah Edition – Learn lessons of the prophet, Increase your knowledge of the life and lessons of the Prophet (SAW), while having loads of fun with your family and friends. Learn and share important details from the Makkan Era, Madinan Era, his Sunnah, the Sahabah, his Family and the Caliphs. Discover the inspiring legacy of Muhammad (SAW) and master five difficulty levels before the other team to win! References from the Quran and Hadith are given so you learn more about Islam with every flip of the card.

Play for a couple of minutes or all night long!
5 Pillars is the Ultimate Islamic Board Game Experience cherished and loved by families around the world.

How do I play?
You'll get into two teams, select your level of difficulty for each topic, and answer questions to fill up the pillars.
Conquer all pillars across five difficulty levels before the other team to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Petit Pèlerin
description:
The object of the Petit Pèlerin, Little Pilgrim, cooperative game on Islam, is for all players to arrive in Mecca, only then the game is over.

Also, by means of easy or more difficult questions allowing to discover Islam and its values, and slowed down or helped by the direction cards, the players are brought to help each other throughout a journey which will lead them to Mecca.
The winner is the first player to arrive in Mecca.

User-friendly and practical, the game finds its place on a table, in the park on the grass or to accompany a trip.

This game is suitable for everyone, Muslims or non-Muslims, especially believers or atheists but all curious to know more about Islam. Share a pleasant moment with family or friends by playing the Petit Pèlerin game!

This game is suitable for both children and adults (questions of different levels). It will liven up your evening with family or friends.

—description from the publisher

name: Ehrenmann: Toter Mann
description: First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Geister erben nicht
description: First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Sein letzter Fall
description: First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Puppeteer
description:
Puppeteer is a negotiation tabletop game, based on the universe of the strategic prequel Electioneer. This time players play as party leaders to vote and make agreements among themselves to allocate the districts of Hong Kong. Players may win by being the Puppet or the Puppeteer.

The game plays over a total of 6 rounds.
In convention phases of each round, candidates may freely negotiate with one another and make agreements to trade your voting decision and influence cubes in that round. Once an agreement is dealt, it is normally enforced for that round. Then all candidates cast their votes. The candidate with the most votes wins the election in this round and he can allocate Zone cards to all candidates. If there is a tie, the leading candidates with most votes will enter Black Box phase to battle each other by bidding influence cubes.
Two types of winners
At the end of the game, VPs will be scored to the candidates who have majorities in each of the 5 regions.
Puppet: Candidate with the highest VPs wins the game.
Puppeteer: Candidate who holds the most Puppet’s influence cubes also win the game together.

—description from the designer

name: Liber Militum: Encamisada
description:
Liber Militum: Encamisada ventures as the first miniature skirmish wargame in the Liber Militum series, set in the days of the pike and the musket.

Although Liber Militum: Encamisada has as its inspiration from the characteristic skirmishes that arise in the West of Europe, it is perfectly valid for other scenarios of the time. Besides being possible to recreate the endless struggle of Protestants against Catholics in Flanders, we will be able to transport ourselves to the Christian border with the Ottoman Empire, to the Russian steppes or even to the early conquest of America.

As with Tercios, there is a complete version of the game Liber Militum (forthcoming) and a lighter one, Brevis Editio. The Brevis Editio is fully functional and fully compatible with the other, the rules are the same. Only additional content is added in the Liber Militum: Encamisada

Factions: In the Liber Militum version it will be possible to choose a Faction for our company. In doing so, the rules of each one will be applied to us, with restrictions and benefits. There are a significant number of Factions, giving us great freedom of customization.

Campaign: Probably the most attractive addition is the possibility of playing in campaign. Different alternative methods are added to manage it with sample maps.

Progression: We have a system of evolution by experience for campaigns, with which we can improve our Captain and the Company.

Scenarios: In the full version we have several extra scenarios: shooting cannons, ambushes or assaults in which civilians participate are some of them.

Multiplayer: Rules are provided for more than two players, including special scenarios.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Het Huis Anubis: Het Rijk Der Schimmen
description:
In the House of Anubis, not everyone is telling the truth. What do residents have to hide and what do they want to do? Try to find out by asking the right questions and listening carefully, but be careful not to give too much information yourself. Create your own secret code and consider carefully which code cards have already been used and which have not yet. Choose your strategy and interrogate your opponents, wait for the right moment and if you are the last one standing, you are the winner.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Mango Empire
description:
A tribal themed card game where players fight each other for the last Mangoes on the Island of Terakoti. Once enough Huts are built, a player becomes a Mango Empire and claims the role of Chief of Terakoti.

In each round, players are dealt 5 cards, 3 of which they place face down in front of them. Everyone turns over their cards at the same time and the winner (highest points from the cards) gains a resource which can be used to buy huts or destroy other players huts. Rounds repeat until a player has gathered enough huts to win.
mechanics: Market, Race, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Memo Friends
description:
The owl, the fox and the bear like to meet in the forest at the tree trunk next to the toadstool. But sometimes the toadstool sits inside the tree trunk and the fox on top of the stump. Or the owl is in the tree and the bear next to it. Remembering who was here and where exactly they were, is the big challenge for small children. You can play alone as a logic and memory puzzle, competitively as a test of memory and speed or co-operatively with lots of communication.

There are 20 different challenges to take on but as soon as you’ve finished them all, you’ll want to start again from the beginning.

Kinderspiel des Jahres 2021 recommended.

name: Treasures of Buddhism
description:
Treasures of Buddhism is a rule-based cultural treasure hunt, a meaningful, fun, and informative board game that develops memory and concentration in a playful way.
Treasure in the game has an intellectual and spiritual meaning.
During the course of the game the treasures to be discovered are the Tibetan Buddhist Symbols, which are placed on the real exploratory archaeological map of Zangla - an old Tibetan village in the inner Himalayas.

The goal of the game is to find as many treasures as possible on the track, memorise the location of the treasures, and then - in the Royal Palace - share the location and meaning of the treasure with other players.
The player who collects the most treasures wins the game.

Besides enjoyment, the intention of the game is to turn attention from collecting material goods and competing for possession of them, to intellectual freedom, spiritual values, and a meaningful life.
Its aim is to assist the mediation between different cultures, to educate tolerance and - last but not least - to build community.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Ankou
description:
You play as an Ankou, a chaperone of death. Seeking salvation, you lead souls of the dead safely to the afterlife. Three souls in exchange for your own.

Souls however must come willingly, and aren't so easy to come by. Often fractured by a violent passing, soul fragments are scattered throughout the land.

Once found, it would be wise to persuade the souls with coin so that they might experience riches in the beyond, but be wary - There may be others with a better offer.

On a players turn they have 3 options:
- Draw a card from the field
- Take income (1 coin)
- Pay for an action (steal a card from a player, or draw randomly from the discard)

The game ends when a player has collected 3 souls (3 sets of matching soul-fragments). The player who collected the souls first wins.

name: Fluch der Katzen-Göttin
description:
First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them additional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Schlag den Raab: KIDS
description:
One team represents „Team Stefan“ and confronts „Team Candidates, always one player in each game, and scores points for his team with each game that is won. Players split into two teams of even size, if possible, and alternate to provide the host for each game; a player being host must act completely impartial. By its position the round marker indicates the category of the game that will be played, the individual game will be determined by the spinner. Possible categories are Action & Risk, Chance and Dexterity and Bet & Think. Some examples for possible games: Catch a ball, Flea Circus, Bowling House numbers, Spelling mistakes, Hum a Song, Tongue Twisters, Mirror Writing, Card puffing, Pancake turning or Joke Questions and there are also games like The Bottle or Balloon Ball, for which you must find the material in your household.

When the game has been determined, both teams choose the candidate for this game and the team that currently is behind as regards to points decides who will start. The host reads out the rules or explains them. At the start of the game you choose the length of the game by choosing the number of individual games. When a team has collected the number of points necessary tow in the selected length - 8 points for Ratzfatz with up to 5 games, 28 points for Medium with up to 10 games and 61 points for Showtime with up to 15 games - the game ends instantly and this team is declared the winner.

In analogy to the “grown-ups” game Schlag den Raab Kids, too, is a felicitous mix of new and familiar games offering a good mix of action, movement, knowledge and thinking.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Roadrunner
description:
The game device (calculator) consists of rotateable reels, which are activated by a roll of 2 dice. The reels are the racing track and show traffic signs (= events) as well as the position of the cars. The first player to reach the target accurately over all the reels wins.

Note: In contrast to the box picture, there is no Formula 1 race, but a normal street race.

—user summary

name: Apocalypse Zombie: Core Set
description:
Apocalypse Zombie Core Set is a miniature skirmish game set in the zombie apocalypse. The outbreak has spread throughout the world while many people thought it was a hoax. Before the world realized that it was indeed happening it was too late.

In Apocalypse Zombie you have two ways to play. First is quick battles that allow you to choose a character, select a mission, set up, and play. It is a fast, fun, and bloody intro into the game. The second is the campaign. In campaign mode, you are tasked with performing missions to gather supplies, rescue survivors, upgrade home base and kill boss zombies. Campaigns can last as long as you want. With 14 Missions each with variable set up and more coming the carnage can be long lasting or short and sweet. You can “win” just by killing the Butcher Zombie and saying you have settled the area enough to prosper. Or you can trudge the blood to new bosses, new buildings, and increase the scope of the world. You may use either pre- made characters for fast entry into the unforgiving world. Or you can create your own character to level and guide through the world.

Apocalypse Zombie is played with a player turn followed by the zombie turn. Zombies are pretty much automated - reacting to sight or sound. This allows for all players to be on the same side and fight and die together. Apocalypse Zombie does have options for those more combative players that bring player vs player into the game. Zombie Abilities can hinder or severely damage your attempts to survive. Players have the choice of being sneaky or going in guns blazing. It really depends on your play style.

Combat is done with rolling attack dice to see if you hit. Defense works the same way. Hit Points are tracked with Heart Tokens.

Searching is done the same way. Each building has its own search deck in Zombie Apocalypse. So searching the Clinic will give you different results then searching the Cabin.

So how about those Zombies? Well the first boss, the one that comes in the core set, is the Butcher. He is big ugly and hard to kill. You must face him in the Butcher Shop. Players should not attempt this until they are truly prepared. Along with the Butcher you get 18 Shamblers. Slow, pesky zombies that can put your survivors in a bind. Next you get 6 Brute Zombies. These big boys will ruin your day real quick.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Fallen World: A Fantasy Skirmish Game
description:
A war destroyed the worlds civilisations and made the control of magic impossible, you command a small force of survivors looking for revenge on those they see as responsible for the destruction or just trying to live for a few more days.

Ideal for 28mm figures but any scale will do as long as they are individually based each player will normally command about 10 figures though this could be changed if required.

Turn Sequence:

Randomly determine which side moves first and stick with this sequence for the whole game.
The players alternately move figures when a figure is activated it conducts any movement, shooting or melee before moving on to the next figure.
Once all figures have been activated roll on the random events table before starting the next turn.


—description from the publisher

name: Rolf: NSFW Expansion
description:
This is a 25-card expansion pack for the party game Rolf. It contains bad words, so it's not safe for work, and it's not appropriate for children.

If you're not offended easily, just shuffle the cards in this box with the Rolf cards from your base game, and you're ready to play.

Just be sure you remove them when you're done playing so they don't fall into the wrong hands.

name: Rolf: Kickstarter Expansion
description:
This is a 25-card expansion pack for the party game Rolf. It was created by our Kickstarter backers, whom we love deeply.

Just shuffle the cards in this box with the Rolf cards from your base game, and you're ready to play!

name: Rolf: Beer & Board Games Expansion
description:
This is a 25-card expansion pack for the party game Rolf. It was created by Matt Sloan, Aaron Yonda, and the fans of their show, Beer & Board Games.

Although everyone should be a fan of the show, it's not required to enjoy this expansion. Just shuffle the cards in this box with the Rolf cards from your base game, and you're ready to play!

name: Interrogation
description:
Interrogation is a hilariously tense trivia game where players must answer questions while under a slowly descending string of dripping goo.

Players divide into two teams. One player from each team acts as the Interrogator and another player acts as the Subject. The Subjects from each team lie on the floor, side-by-side, looking up at the slime crane - a device made up of a rotating arm holding a syringe filled with green slime. The slime slowly begins to ooze from the syringe. Taking turns, the Interrogators quickly draw a card and read the question aloud to their teammate. If they answer correctly, the Interrogator gets to move the crane into position over the other team's Subject. Play continues in this manner until one player ends up with a face full of slime.

—description from the publisher

name: Astounding Adventures!: Magazine Issue #1
description:
Astounding Adventures #1, crammed chock-full of thrills and danger!

In this issue, face The White Slavers of the Red Empire! Travel to danger with Gimbals Gillespie and the Bloody Night of the Screaming Cannibals. Fight the Screaming Corpses of the desert in Zombie Crime! Brave the dangers of The Phantom Jungle! Join Night Raven and the Secret Masters of the White Temple! Explore The Vaults of the Visigoths!

Astounding Adventures are scenarios designed for Astounding Tales, Pulp Action Library’s miniatures game of Derring-Do and bold Adventures. Six action-packed scenarios take you from the fog-shrouded streets of London to the savannahs of Africa.

Included is a guide to playing Astounding Adventures with To Be Continued…by GASLIGHT, Rugged Adventures, and .45 Adventures.

–Description from the publisher

name: Astounding Adventures!: Magazine Issue #2
description:
Astounding Adventures #2 – a potpourri of thrills, chills and excitement!

In this issue you will combat the Claws of the Cat Goddess, join Gimbals Gillespie on the Island of Terror, investigate the Bride of the Mummy’s Curse, and endure a Féte Worse than Death!

Astounding Adventures are scenarios designed for Astounding Tales, Pulp Action Library’s miniatures game of Derring-Do and bold Adventures. In four action-packed scenarios you'll face Were-cats, Mummies, Nazis and the inhabitants of Little Piddlecomb.

Included is a guide to playing Astounding Adventures with To Be Continued…by GASLIGHT, Rugged Adventures, and .45 Adventures.

name: Astounding Adventures!: Magazine Issue #3
description:
Astounding Adventures #3, The Colossal Ape issue!

There’s only one adventure in this issue, but boy, is it a Doozie!

Travel to Skull Island and encounter Natives!, Villains!, Monsters!, Chinese gangsters! Vaudevillians! Pirates! Ninjas!

And Kang, King of the Apes! Kang, the 8th Wonder of the World! Kang, the 30 foot Wonder!

Also included are rules for large-scale combat in the worlds of Astounding Tales. Bring on the tanks, planes and big guns!

—description from the publisher

name: Schnapper-la-papp!
description:
All players play simultaneously. Each of the 36 tiles has symbols on both the front and the back. There is never a duplicate symbol on either side. One player rolls the dice, which tells the players which of the symbols is being searched for in this round. Now all players may quickly grab two tiles with each hand for one! Then it is checked who has grabbed the right tiles. The players take these as points. With two game variants, the game can also be played with older children to make the game a little more interesting.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Mini Mind
description:
A dog, a cat, a mouse, a fish, a parrot and a penguin sit on a bench next to each other, the players have to find out in which order the animals sat down. Each player places one set of animals on their stand and places the second set of animals face up in any order.

Whoever's turn it is asks his teammate for the place of an animal, you may only name two animals and ask for left or right, the teammate must answer yes or no correctly, the player rearranges his openly lying tiles accordingly. For a "yes" you may ask a second question. The player who thinks he knows the correct order says it. If it is correct, he has won. If you say the wrong sequence for the third time, you lose the game.

—user summary

name: NumNum: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Mau Mau variant with numbers - everyone starts with 7 cards, the cards carry numbers and symbols, same symbols means same suit. The player whose turn it is tries to discard as many cards as possible, same symbol on same symbol or a prohibition sign, thus blocking a 1x1 row or discarding a card that has a 1x1 row in common with the top card of the discard pile, i.e. has a common divisor. 1s are jokers, wish cards ditto, with them you can determine the symbol for the next player. If the number and symbol match, the player may discard another matching card, as long as he has double matching cards. If you can't discard, you draw a card, if you have no cards left, you win. Remaining cards can be counted as minus points in several games.

—user summary

name: Moskitojagd
description:
Place the eight plastic mosquitoes in the center of the table, with their spikes facing up. The first player picks up a fly spatula. Then he is blindfolded. Zack! Blindfolded, he now strikes only once and tries to catch as many mosquitoes as possible. The mosquitoes caught are counted and credited and the next player takes his turn. The player who has managed to catch the most mosquitoes after a set number of rounds is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game

name: The Queen & The Corrupter
description:
When King Arthur traveled beyond the waters of Britain to fight the Emperor of Rome, Queen Guinevere was left alone.

Arthur’s nephew Mordred, had plans of his own, not only for the crown of Brittany, but to kill poor Guinevere, by law or by by force. Little did he know that Guinevere was concocting her own devious scheme, to stop the Corrupter’s game before he took his chance to sit on the throne.
