As Arthur battled against the legions of Rome, the corrupt and bitter feud back home to him was unknown. Until one fateful day he heard. The death of a family member, but it had seemed so absurd.

Had Mordred the Corrupter triumphed, or had Queen Guinevere managed to defend the throne?

The Queen & The Corrupter is a 2 player social deduction and memory card game, which sees you playing as either Queen Guinevere or The Corrupter Mordred in a battle of wits for the throne of Brittany.

Each round, both players draw their subjects, and then choose which subject cards from their hand to play to the council, taking turns to reveal them, claiming influence from the council and enacting their subject's orders as they do.

The trick is in remembering which subject you have played to which advisor, and in correctly timing your moves in order to vanquish the other player by revealing the Assassin or the Executioner with the correct influence, in turn winning the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Medieval, Memory
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Variable Player Powers

name: Allikroko
description:
The little crocodiles need fish and want to be fed. So mama croc swims in the river and catches fish. The fish are placed in three corners of the water surface, the crocodile in the fourth - then the player on the turn carefully moves the box with the water surface. If Allikroko slips into the hole in the middle, the so-called whirlpool, then he catches fish under his mouth - and by the number of fish caught, the crocodile stone on the score card may be moved forward. For the next player the game is prepared again. The first player to reach the top square of the score card wins.

—user summary

name: Wer nicht bauen kann, muß...
description:
The players have the task of building a house of cards without letting it collapse. The player whose turn it is draws 2 cards, 1 neutral and 1 penalty card. If he can fit both cards into the house of cards without an accident, it is the next player's turn. However, if the house of cards collapses, he must carry out the penalty of the penalty card just drawn, e.g. refill each player's drink, or sing a song etc. The execution of the punishment is judged by the other players and the punished person receives 1 to 3 minus points. Alternatively, you can buy your way out of the penalty with cash, but you will receive 5 minus points. Once a player has accumulated 10 minus points, the player with the fewest minus points wins.

—user summary

name: Würfelbilder
description:
36 playing cards are laid out in 6 stacks sorted by numbers. Each player may roll the dice up to 2 times in his turn and tries to get one of the numbered cards with the result (for a rolled 1 and 6, the card 16 or 61 can be taken). If he succeeds, he receives chips corresponding to the card. If it fails, he loses a chip. If the last card is rolled, the player with the most chips wins.

—user summary

name: Komplett verrückt!
description:
Each player receives a 5x5 board, on which 24 square tiles in six colors are somehow colorfully distributed, as well as a so-called "pattern mixer". This hides behind a plexiglass housing nine small cubes, which must be shaken neatly. In this way, each player receives a task: 3x3 colors arranged in a very specific way.

The task now is to achieve exactly this arrangement at the middle 3x3 squares by moving the tiles on your own game board. The outer ring, which still comprises 20 squares, plays no role and is easily hidden by the slightly milky cover anyway. Of course, the winner is the one who could solve his task first.

—user summary

name: WeyKick Piccolo
description: A fast paced soccer game for 2 players. Each player takes control of 1 footballer by moving magnets below the wooden playing table. The footballers themselves are magnetic and move in response. The players try to kick a small marble ball into their opponent's goal. The first player to score ten goals wins.

name: Raffinesse
description:
Advertising game for the company "Miele". In this cooking-themed game, the players have to gather the ingredients for one of three recipes as quickly as possible, making sure that no superfluous part is included. The game piece is moved with dice, the event fields are completed accordingly.

Note: This game contains a recipe book whose recipes were developed directly in the Miele test kitchen.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Star-Reporter
description:
Players try to bring the best stories and collect money for them. After several rounds, the first player to earn 40,000 wins.
There are reporters, reports and documents cards, as well as play money cards. Everyone gets starting capital and 8 cards. Series of 3 cards must be formed, always with the same suit and within one category. The player on the turn takes a card and offers a card for auction, whoever buys it pays and gets the card, or the card is rejected by all. Actually, you may only buy a card to complete a series, but you can bluff, whoever is caught pays penalty and the purchase price. Whoever is the first to present 3 combinations with 3 cards, with documents with consecutive numbers, wins a round and receives bonuses paid by his fellow players. The possession of each player is noted and a new round begins with new starting capital and 8 cards.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Escape the Hyperion
description:
Play as the last remaining survivors attempting to escape a deadly alien infestation on the Hyperion, a futuristic advanced modular colony built on Planet X. You must navigate through the colony to find and modify the coordinates of the Teleport Pad to escape. All of the remaining survivors must escape before the teleport pads are removed from the game.

The game is divided into 3 simple phases. The first phase is the action phase. During this phase, you must do two of the following:

1- Reveal: this is when you reveal tiles based on the number of doors your current room contains.
2- Move: Move your survivor to an orthogonally adjacent tile.
3- Unlock: unlock any temporarily locked tiles.
4- Rest: discard 1 tile to rest. You will not have the chance to do a second action.

The second phase is the enemy movement phase. Move the stalkers 1 space (orthogonally) towards the nearest player.

The third phase is the lockdown phase. Discard any temporarily locked tiles from the game board.

The game ends when:
A- All the survivors escape together
B- You discard all of the Console tiles without modifying all of the coordinates
C- You discard all of the Teleport Pad tiles.
D- You run out of tiles to place.
mechanics: Action Points, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Map Reduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: All the Beer, No Idea
description:
All the Beer, No Idea is a beer-based brand logo quiz that features 80 iconic beers of the world. We’ve simplified the branding on bottles, cans and glasses and given you the task of identifying each beer. And if you can’t? Well, that’s why we’ve got some clues lined up; to give you a helping hand. But don’t call last orders just yet…

We’ve got 6 additional gameplays beyond the standard picture quiz. You’ll be tested on your knowledge of the origins of beer brands, their style, alcohol content and more.

These will certainly separate the ale-ficionados from the stout-right idiots. But, either way, there’s always a cool, refreshing forfeit waiting for you if you get it wrong!

All the Beer, No Idea is a cocktail of adult party game and brand logo quiz where the winners will either realise they have a photographic memory, or a serious drinking problem. Cheers!

name: Old Oak Hotel
description:
Old Oak Hotel is a solitaire light-hearted fantasy strategy game with colored rooms, in the shape of Tetris, that the player must try to play on the board. The only caveat to placing a room is that it is filled with different races of creatures and each has its own "affinities", this greatly influences the amount of prestige you will achieve.

The goal: Fill all three floors of the Hotel with Guests, taking into account their Affinities to obtain prestige stars and turn the Old Oak into a five star hotel!.

Gameplay: Each turn you will receive a Guest who will want to stay in a room with a certain shape. To determine this roll 2d6 and use one result to define the kind of guest and another for the shape of the room, and then place it anywhere on the board that is empty.

The game ends when all three floors are full or have no more empty space to draw Guest rooms.

Released as part of the 8th BGG Roll & Write Game Design Contest.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: スピマテカードゲームSt-BCG (Spiria Material Card Game)
description:
Build and win with 5 cards from the witch's library of memories! Using a witchcraft tag called Spiria Material, build and fight with 5 or more of the 18 cards.

On their turn, players can draw a card and put only one monster card on the field.

A successful attack with a monster card can destroy an opponent's hand. You win the game if your attack succeeds while your opponent has no cards in his or her hand.

name: Im Wintersportparadies
description:
The players move their figure by rolling the dice along a path in a winter sports area and take part in up to 4 competitions with it. Money is paid out for winning competitions, but you can also lose money on the way due to events on special fields. Who has no more money is eliminated during the game. The winner is the last player left, or the richest player if more than one reaches the finish line.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Pippi Langstrumpf: Polizisten austricksen
description: Funny game Pippi Longstocking police trickery from Oetinger. Everyone knows the popular classic game Pachisi, but this game is a little bit different. Here, two additional policemen (Kling and Klang) chase Pippi and her friends and make a mess of everything! Only together can the friends outsmart the policemen and get to safety. The game contains 18 game pieces. The winner is the first who has brought all four figures on the target fields to safety.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: That Monkey Game
description:
That Monkey Game is a hilarious Social Tabletop Card Game with a hint of Strategy.

There are 300 cards and you'll begin by shuffling and handing out 7 cards to each player. The Objective of the game is to collect 1 of each 4 unique Monkey Cards.

Players will play their cards for others and the group through Challenge Cards, Social Trivia Cards, Let's Get Personal Cards, and Strategy Cards. Depending on which card you play and for whom, you'll acquire cards more quickly or none at all. Once you've collected 4 unique Monkey Cards, you may claim victory!

The game is designed to get your group talking, prompt wacky impressions, and generate tons of laughs and life long memories!

—description from the designer

name: Fun
description:
A fast game with 12 cards and 21 chips. For each player 3 equal cards are taken into play. These are shuffled and each player receives 3 cards. At the same time, each player chooses a card and pushes it to his left competitor on command. Whoever has a combination of 3 equal cards, lays them out and grabs one of the provided chips. All other players may now also reach for the remaining chips, but there is one less than players participating. The player who has collected the most chips after several rounds and distribution of all chips wins.

—user summary

name: Theo Teichhüpfer
description:
Frogs are jumping into the pond and dive for fishes, pond snails and mussels; when they are tired, they take a rest on the water lily leaves.

Each player has his own mini pond and wants to fill it with booty that he got from the big pond with his frog.

The board, with openings representing two big ponds, is placed on the open game box; the two ponds are filled with approximately equal amounts of the pond tiles. Each player selects a frog and places the frog joker of the same color into his mini pond.

In turn, players try to let their frog jump into the pond with the help of the seesaw. Before you let your frog jump, you may adjust the position of the game box at your discretion. You can also decide to play a trial round and to agree on the number of jumps that a player can take on his turn to succeed. If you manage to make your frog jump into the pond, you may either draw a booty tile or select one from the pond to put into your own pond. A tile that does not fit or for which there is no room, is put back. Once in the game you can use your Theo joker and swap it for a tile that you need, albeit not for one of the last two missing tiles. If you are first to fill your pond completely, you win.

Theo Teichhüpfer is part of the Ene Mene Muh series, designed as first games for toddlers, and is a very nice dexterity game; the tiles in the pond are double-sided and easily distinguished by shape and image - fishes are oval, mussels are circular and water lilies rectangular; so, for selecting a suitable tile in the Selection variant is very easy. The seesaw works well, and the pond holes are big enough.

—user summary

name: Dream Heart Karaoke
description:
Dream Heart Karaoke is a card game to one or more players.

In this game, players are singers at legendary Dream Heart Karaoke. They must sing songs to win the friendship or love of characters watching their performances.

Each character has words that represent their feelings, stories, desires and personalities. These words (represented by "word cards") must be used in songs to win their hearts. Also, the song must match the "melody cards" revealed each round.

The free print-and-play version has eight characters.

The game is scalable and can be played solo or with a group. Each player can choose four character decks to use.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shogun Tactics
description:
Shogun Tactics is a strategy game that includes ninjas. The core goal for each player is to eliminate the pawns of the other player or grab the treasure. Each ninja has different abilities and should play strategically to win the game.The game can be played by two or four players.

The armies are placed on the tableau opposing each other.
Behind each army their own treasure is protected.
Each unit has its own way of movement and attack.
Units unlike Chess do not occupy the space of the fallen enemy, but stay in the space that they attacked. All but one unit, move horizontally and vertically only. ​

Each army is consisted by 7 different units:

7x Ashigaru - The most basic unit which moves 1 space horizontally or vertically. It can attack in one direction.
2x Double Edge - This unit can move 3 spaces and attack simultaneously on its front, left and right.
2x Monkey - This unit can move 3 spaces in any direction they like and then attack an enemy in left, right, front or back direction.
1x Cannon - This unit can move 1 space in any direction. This unit attacks the 3 spaces in a line. On attack this unit fires a cannon ball that hits all the targets, friendly or not.
1x Rope - This is the only unit that can move diagonally. It moves as many spaces it likes and attacks only diagonally one adjacent space.
1x King - This unit is the most liked. It can move 1 space in any direction but it can shoot its valistra and assassinate any enemy unit occupying a space up to 3 spaces in front of the King.
2x Wall - This unit is indestructible. It can move 1 space in any direction and also blocks all cannonballs and valistra arrows.


Once again, to win, a player should eliminate all enemy units or put a unit on the space occupied by the enemy treasure.

—description from the designer

name: Shipwreck Island: 5-6 Player Expansion Set
description:
This expansion will allow two more players to added your existing Shipwreck Island game board allowing up to 6 players at once. Expansion includes 2 Pawns, 60 Wall Segment Pieces, 4 Fire markers, 10 Reinforcement Cards, and 2 Game Play Instruction cards.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Fortifications of Moroni: 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
This expansion will allow up to 6 players to play with your original 2-4 player copy of Fortifications of Moroni. Expansion includes 2 Pawns, 60 Wall Segment Pieces, 4 Fire markers, 10 Reinforcement Cards, and 2 Game Play Instruction cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Religious
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Move Through Deck

name: Choke On MORE Notes
description:
The first expansion pack to Choke On These Notes. Includes 60 new cards.

Play is the same. Try to guess the song title from the lyrics provided. Each card has the Year, Genre, and 3 Clues/Segments of Lyrics. The fewer the clues you use the more points you score! Yay!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Lion of the North: Fastplay Rules for Combat during the Thirty Years War
description:
Lion of the North try to reflect the tactical combat of the Thirty years war, but can easily be expanded to cover other conflicts around the mid-17th century.

The rules aim to give a quick game with simple mechanics, that can be easily memorised.
They have evolved during some time, and use some crucial ideas borrowed from other rule sets, among others the ubiquitous DBA.

Game Sequence:
Play Sequence is determined by drawing Cards from the Gameplay Deck.
At the start of each game turn, the gameplay deck is shuffled, when all cards have been drawn, the deck is reshuffled, and another turn starts.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Haiduk and Rajtar: A Supplement for Lion of the North
description:
Haiduk and Rajtar is designed to supplement the fastplay rules Lion of the North.

In these a number of new unit types and special rules are introduced, giving the players a chance to refight battles that took place in the Eastern parts of Europe during the 17th Century.

—description from the rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Army Lists for Lion of the North & Haiduk and Rajtar
description:
These army lists are supposed to be an aid for the gamer to build an army that in a reasonable way will resemble it´s historical counterpart.

Contains:

Army lists for the Thirty Years War 1618-1648
Swedish Army
Imperial Army
Bavarian Army
French Army

Army lists for the Northern War 1648-1660
Swedish Army
Polish Army
Cossack Army of Khmelnytsky



—description from the rulebook
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Tally On
description: Take turns counting on as you add boxes to delivery trucks. The amount of boxes you need to fill the truck depends on the level you choose to play. The player who adds the final card that fills the truck wins all the cards in the play pile. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!

name: Kitten Caboodle
description:
Adopt the most cats and win!

Each player gets a Cat card which shows the items they need to collect to adopt their cat.

Players draw from the stack or go fish from another player's hand to collect the cards that match your kitty's needs from their Cat card. Collect everything you need and adopt the cat - adopt the most cats and you win!

name: Master Deen 2
description:
Master Deen 2 is a game of strategy and knowledge of Islam.

The winner is the first player to get rid of all their cards.

Game play: Cover the card played previously with a card of the same color or with the same number.
And also ask questions with Master Deen cards.

It contains 110 cards including 120 questions, on the Koran, the Prophets, the pillars of Islam as well as general questions on Islam and also contains the rules of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Regatta
description:
The Players start at space 1. The first to reach space 70 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. If a player gets on a space in front of an obstacle (e. g. waves) he only gets past it if he rolls the number of his track.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Recovery
description:
Is it true that time heals all wounds? In Recovery it’s true! Players simulate people wanting to recover; with little energy at the start and unfortunately a lot of complaints.

Recovery is a worker placement game where the workers represent the time to spend on various actions during the day, hopefully giving a full relief of complaints and enough insight to live a happy and healthy life onwards.

Players will spend their time in order to play intervention cards, develop on the insight track and lose complaints. Also they will be able to visit health care professionals for advice about specific combinations of intervention cards, scoring them more points in the end.

The game will end after 10 days, but perhaps you have already collected enough points and you want to stop the game earlier by quickly losing all your complaints? One way or another, you decide!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Auction, Worker Placement

name: Fred im Beet
description:
The bed must be planted with flowers before Mole Fred digs up the bed. Cooperatively, everyone plays against Fred and rolls the dice in turn: color means putting a flower in a slot of the same color; rolling the dice Fred moves one space towards the goal and Ladybug plants any flower. Fred wins if he reaches the goal before all the flowers are planted, otherwise the players win together. In the competitive variant, everyone plays with a number of flowers of any color and wins if they have planted all the flowers before Fred reaches the finish line.

—user summary

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Die Eimerparade
description:
Benjamin Blümchen he has come up with a particularly nice game: Baron von Zwiebelschreck has dammed up the river, and so the zoo is sitting on dry land, no more water for baby hippo Nino and the other animals. But if everyone helps and looks for the buckets, then water can be brought to the zoo,

One player sacrifices himself and plays Baron Zwiebelschreck, he first hides the buckets in the room, then he makes sure that everything works and even gives tips on searching, but he is not allowed to search and roll the dice himself.

Whoever's turn it is, rolls the dice and draws Benjamin. According to the field, on which Benjamin landed, is then searched for buckets or something happens to the cottages or buckets. During the search the baron builds a tower with the 30 wooden blocks, when he is done the search is over. The next player takes his turn and brings the tower down. The game is over as soon as all hidden buckets have been found

—user summary

name: Deutschland und seine Nachbarn
description:
A map with Germany's countries and neighboring states is divided into 40 puzzle pieces of various sizes. Each player receives the same number of pieces (the remaining pieces form the draw pile) and tries to place them on the pieces already on the table. If you don't have a matching piece, you have to draw one or pass if the draw pile is empty. The first player to place all the pieces wins.

—user summary

name: Focused Firepower
description:
Focused Firepower is a scenario-driven World War II tabletop wargame designed to be played with 1/72 scale miniatures, although the system works just as well with 28mm (1/56) models. We have endeavoured to offer an in-depth game system with the focus on realism, but the system we have developed is easy to learn and games flow well.

As a 1:1 system the models you have on the tabletop represent the exact troops and vehicles. The majority of other game systems use a more abstract method where one unit actually represents several, or where entire units are modelled on a single base and dealt with as a whole. We found that our method provides a more accurate and realistic impression of real warfare.

By focusing our game on realism we have found that real-world tactics work just as well on the tabletop and we highly recommend reading the fantastic range of WWII tactics books published by Osprey.

Turn Sequence:

Check Universal Morale
Resolve Battlefield Effects
Movement Phase
Firing Phase
Close Assault Phase
Re-organisation Phase


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Bad Ad: You Laugh, You Lose
description:
Bad Ad: You Laugh, You Lose is an improv party game where you have to create the narration of an ad based on prompt cards.

For 2-8 players, ages 13+, the game takes about 15 - 30 minutes.

Taking on the role of inexperienced advertisers, players have to create an ad within 1 minute. Once the timer runs out, players share their ad and if someone laughs, they have to buy your product and give you money. The player with the most cash after 5 rounds is promoted, everyone else is fired.

The game is all about trying to keep a straight face, while listening to ridiculous ads. Plus, with 150 different ad cards, there's tons of replayability.

name: Diamond Heist
description:
Diamond Heist is a compact 2-4 player strategic dice-rolling game about stealing diamonds, with a cast of unique characters, each with interesting abilities. Diamond Heist features fun art, a relaxing theme, and elegant gameplay all packaged together for decades of family fun.

The game starts by selecting one of the many unique characters. Each turn, players roll dice, and must decide whether they want to lock in their arsenal of guns, knives, bulletproof vests, pickpocket action, or take a chance and re-roll. Vests block guns, and helmets block knives. Each unblocked attack allows the player to steal a diamond from the opposing player. To add additional strategy, players must balance doing direct damage, and building up cash reserves. Cash can be spent on each player's character ability, which ranges from stealing mass amounts of diamonds, to blocking certain damage types, to swapping 2 players' dice.

Players can save up if they roll Bonus Cash, to spend on their character speciality. Players must balance short term and long term rewards for building up cash. Then, players battle it out with their selected arsenal, stealing as many diamonds and as much cash as they can.

Diamond Heist relies on easy to learn, but hard to master strategies with a cast of interesting characters to keep gameplay fresh. Manage your strategy with 4 competing players, to be able to steal diamonds when they are vulnerable.

Diamond Heist keeps things new, fun and challenging by including a selection of 18 different characters. Combinations of these creates numerous matchup possibilities, each with their own strategy to consider.

In this game, there are a lot of things to pay attention to. You must make decisions whether you will keep a guaranteed dice roll, or risk it to try to get something better. Players will need to weigh whether they want to steal cash to use their special abilities, or steal diamonds to add to their Offshore Accounts. Another tough decision will be whether to spend your cash for short term gains, or save up for a larger impact special ability. In 3 and 4 player games, you may need to team up and form alliances with other players, while making sure you have enough defenses such that you don’t get backstabbed yourself!

name: Epic Heroes: Skirmish Gaming in the Realms of Fantasy – A supplement to Brink of Battle
description:
There are new game mechanics for Flyers, Exotic Cavalry, Beasts of War, and Magic!

This has the most robust Magic rules and Spell lists of any skirmish game with over 60 Spell effects and dynamic Magic rules to bring your games to life!

New Traits – Over 275 new Traits to allow Players to create any Fantasy troop or monster type they can imagine!
New Trait categories include Champion, Inborn, Power, Prestige, Profile, Vocation, War Beast, Exotic Cavalry, and Gear Traits.
New Game Effects – Players can choose from over 130 different effects from Augmentations & Esoteric Traditions.


These rules cover Alchemy, Constructs, Magic Spells, Clerical & Druidic Rites, Paladin Virtues, Fellguard Sanctions, Witch Hunter Edicts, and Kung Fu Disciplines!

New Gear & Magic Items – Over 100 different pieces of new Gear & Magic Items!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Halt die Luft an, kleiner Frosch
description:
The little frogs dive in the water lily pond for the treasures, first on the water lily blossoms the frogs are inserted, who is turn rolls the dice and moves forward with points accordingly many fields. On the blossom you may lift frog and blossom to look at the treasure. If you want to mark it, you place one of your bubble chips in the blossom; later markings must equal or exceed the bubble value. Only the frog whose chip is on top at the end of the game gets the treasure token. The frog can be used to jump 3 water lilies further or to exchange open bubble chips for face-down ones. At the end of the game, everyone counts the treasure tokens in their water lilies, whoever has the most wins.

—user summary

name: Dr. Finn's Express Games Series #1
description:
Dr. Finn's Express Games are a collection of card game adaptations of other Dr Finn's Games. Series #1 includes express game versions of Alpjuarras, The Feds, The Little Flower Shop, and Fisheries of Gloucester.

Each express game is anywhere from 20-40 playing cards. The rules are printed on cards as well. They are all for 2 players only and play in 5-15 minutes.

The games are not available as separate items, but are part of the set.

—description from the publisher

name: Judge Dredd: Mega-City Robots
description:
Most Mega-City citizens are generally too lazy to get off their backsides and do the menial work performed by these semi-sentient robots.

Robots have 'AZI-MOV protocols' forbidding them from harming a human. Yet, some break their programming. Mega-City One has been hit with two major robot-related conflicts. The first was initiated by the rogue 'Call-me-Kenneth' unit. A bloody campaign of extermination against the 'Fleshy Ones' ensued. The second was precipitated by the arch-criminal Nero Narcos, who unleashed hordes of Assassinator Droids in his bid to seize control of Mega-City One.

Despite these incidents, robots continue to be an indispensable part of Mega-City life. With Mega-City One's population decimated by recent events the presence of robots as a tireless workforce has become ever more important.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Judge Dredd: The Wally Squad
description:
Me? I’m nobody. A ghost. A hole in the crowd… a big, fat zero.

There are some criminal investigations that require intelligence gathering, where the presence of a uniformed Judge brandishing a Lawgiver is not appropriate. For these activities the Justice Department has formed an undercover division known informally in the Department as the ‘Wally Squad’. These Judges adopt civilian garb and move amongst the street life of Mega‐City One always on the lookout for leads on criminal activity. If required, they will infiltrate gangs and criminal organisations on highly dangerous undercover missions. Activities like these are abhorrent to most Street Judges who tend to view their Wally Squad colleagues as necessary ‘oddballs’.

Whilst some undercover operations can be concluded in a short time, dedicated squad members have been known to spend years on a case, all the time maintaining a false identity. There is a danger in such deep cover that some Wally Squad members, such as the infamous Lenny Zero, have had their outlook and life values completely changed. Their beliefs have been sequestered by the roles they are playing, and many have ‘gone rogue’ working out of sight, but not out of mind, of the Justice Department. A Judge gone rogue can become the most dangerous of criminals.

Here we present three of the most infamous members of the Wally Squad.


Dirty Frank: Originally a respected Street Judge, Frank now appears to be a deeply unhygienic lunatic living in ‘Low Life’, the Mega-City One’s most crime-ridden area.
Jack Point: A deep cover Wally Squad Judge, Jack is a follower of the Church of Simpology. Despite this, Jack is an effective and dangerous operative.
Aimee Nixon: An ‘A’ grade cadet, Nixon joined the Wally Squad and was mentored by Dirty Frank.


—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Judge Dredd: Klegg-Hai!
description:
Klegg-Hai!, Klegg-Hai!, Klegg-hai! This chilling alien battle cry has echoed across a universe of battlefields, heralding the arrival of the nightmarish Klegg. Mercenary warriors over ten feet tall and resembling an enormous bipedal Crocodile. The Klegg are utterly ruthless in the art of war; surrender is futile as prisoners are not taken – they are eaten!

The Klegg first roamed the streets of the ‘Big Meg’ during the corrupt reign of Judge Cal. So feared were these vicious extra-terrestrial carnivores that Dredd’s victorious Judges attempted to exterminate every last Klegg in the city.

Despite this, the Klegg are born survivors and small groups can still be found deep in the ruins and slum blocks, ready to fight just for the pleasure of killing or selling their skills to any underworld maniac prepared to pay them in fresh meat!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
publishers: 2000 AD Comic, Rebellion Developments (Rebellion), Warlord Games

name: Kopflos
description:
Laying cards with head and body cards: The 24 cards showing headless bodies of various shapes are matched by 12 head cards with 2 heads each. 4 head cards (= 8 heads) are laid out. The two players try to complete figures from their 2 hand cards each. Whoever can put on the 2nd matching body receives the 3 cards. The winner is the player who has collected the most cards.

—user summary

name: Die Katze im Sack
description:
Puzzle game in which cards are drawn from a bag: The task is to puzzle together cat motifs on grid-structured picture tableaus. The game contains 4 picture boards with 3x4 fields and pre-drawn cat motifs as well as 4x12 square cardboard cards for the 4 cat motifs.
The winner is the first to complete his picture.

—user summary

name: HerbaLexikon
description: HerbaLexikon is a deck of illustrated flash cards with the properties and effects of 40 herbs. It includes the rules for 8 games - 3 for young children who have not yet learned to read, and 5 for older children who can. It's aim is to teach the knowledge of herbs that once came from grandmothers to today's children.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Memory, Set Collection, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Fisheries of Gloucester: Fisherman's Feud Pack
description:
This promotional pack was provided to Kickstarter backers of Fisheries of Gloucester, though it is separately available directly from Dr Finn's Games.

The pack has 6 double-sided game cards and 2 rule cards. At the game start, each player drafts 3 cards and places them "star-side" face up. Each round a player may use one card's special ability. If it's on its star side (with more powerful ability), the player turns it to the other side and then gives it to the other player, who may use the card on a later day. If the card is already on its non-star side, it is discarded after use.

—description from the publisher

name: 5150: Gaea Prime First Defense
description:
We Take the War to the Enemy.

Gaea Prime considers her proper place to be in the center of the First Ring, the center of the 5150 universe.

But that is now.

In the beginning there was only Gaea Prime, floating in space in a dream of isolation, waiting to be awakened.

Then the Hishen Came.

Attacked by a Race of Slave Traders with superior technology and weapons Gaea Prime must fight for it's survival.

Inside you'll find:

A man to man combat system that plays quickly with realistic results.
Rules for tabletop play with minis you may already have or on a Battle Board with terrain and color counters we've provided.
Complete rules designed for solo, cooperative and head to head play .
Complete Campaign rules that link your games into a viable Story - your Story.


The Hishen has landed and it's time for...
GAEA PRIME - FIRST DEFENSE

Can You Answer Her Call?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 5150: Star Army – Citizen Soldier
description:
Rules for Infantry, Vehicles and Mechs for Tabletop play.
5150 Star Army - Citizen Soldier
Played with minis and terrain on the tabletop.

In 5150: Star Army – Citizen Soldier you start as a Private and have ten years to rise in the Ranks and become a Gaea Prime Citizen with all the benefits.

Inside you’ll find:

A man to man combat system that plays quickly yet yields realistic, some say unforgiving, results.
Rules for Mechs and Vehicles.
Over a dozen different units you can join not to mention the three Alien Races you’ll meet. Can you say Bugs? You know what we’re talking about.
An easy to use bookkeeping system that tracks your successes and failures as you move up or down the Ranks.
Multiple Missions that allow for a quick and easy Campaign where the results of one Mission affects the next.
A game system designed for solo and co-op play – designed for; not a lame “can be played solo” game.
Play with any figures you already have or the color counters we’ve included - Infantry, Mechs, Vehicles and Bugs,.
All this and much more…


So do you want to be a Citizen?

Welcome to the world of...
5150: Star Army - Citizen Soldier!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 5150: Star Army – Cestus V
description:
5150: Star Army – Cestus V is a Campaign book that includes the basic Star Army rules.

Cestus V is a small planet in the 4th Ring claimed by Gaea Prime but not in Gaea Prime space. It’s seen its share of hard times as it’s always been a lawless place and then got invaded by Bugs. Well the Bugs finally got pushed out, it got “re-populated” and things began to settle down.

Except now the Hishen have landed and that’s not good. Having the threat of the Hishen Empire on the fringe of Gaea Prime space is unacceptable.

So now you’ve been sent back to Cestus V to kick them out.

Cestus V is totally compatible with 5150 Star Army Citizen Soldier but is a stand alone game as well.
Can be played with any figures you already have and includes color counters as well.

Gaea Prime Star Army,
We take the war to the enemy; one Planet at a time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Kung Fu Panda Stack Poetry: Duel Edition
description:
The Kung Fu Panda Stack Poetry - Duel Edition integrates 112 poems and their corresponding titles, dynasties and authors into the game. Let the children explore ways to recite poems in the game and improve their memory of the poems during play the game. In the game, the children can only win the game if they can recite these poems successfully.
We hope that children can be happy, learn knowledge, and improve the necessary abilities during the gameplay.
We provide teaching video for this game, hoping to help children enjoy the game as soon as they start to play it.
Win the cool stacking poetry game with your memory and speed!

Game preparation:

Shuffle the poem cards
Both players will get 1 set of pagodas (each set contains 5 pagodas of red, yellow, blue , green and white)
Place the bell on the center of the table


Start the game:

Flip a card with the colored text face up. Both players need to arrange the text on the card in the order they appear in the poem, and arrange in the correct order of 5 pagodas from the bottom to the top. Two characters with same color use a same pagoda.
The first player finishes stacking the pagoda rings the bell on the table.
The player rings the bell checks the result. If it's correct, the player can put the poem card in front of him/her; If it's incorrect, remove the poem card from the pile. Of course, if you want to enhance your impression and understanding of this poem, you might as well read the content on the poem card before remove it out from the pile.


(Please note: To be fair, when flipping the poem card, you should hold the card away from your side to flip the card, to ensure that this player is the last one to see the content of the card)

The end of the game:

The game ends immediately when there is a player gets 8 poem cards
This player wins


—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Novel-based, Real-time

name: Journey's Edge
description:
It was a bad wreck, yet somehow, you survived. You don't remember what happened, or how, but something went terribly wrong aboard that cursed vessel. Now you must begin the incredible journey that lies ahead, mustering every ounce of strength and willpower you have left, with one goal in mind ... staying alive.

Players travel a modular tile map to reveal uncharted areas, acquire resources, and build necessary items needed to outlast nature's harshest elements. Over the course of eight rounds, an event-driven scenario containing mission-critical objectives force players to wisely manage their precious inventories and prized possessions. These objectives must be completed by the end of the eighth round in order for players to be victorious.

Journey's Edge features strictly strategic gameplay, with hardly any luck (or dice). At each player's disposal is a deck of action cards that are used to move their character across the board to gather food, wood, stone, and fur, which can then be spent to create items like clothing and shelter. They must manage these limited resources carefully and work together as a team to determine the best course of action. To succeed, no one can be left behind.

Discover enchanted locations. Gather valuable resources. Craft useful tools and weapons. Encounter deadly creatures and monsters, and uncover magical artifacts that will assist you in your quest at Journey's Edge. Odds are against you, but perhaps your fate is not sealed. As part of a team of seasoned expeditionists, you know what must be done. The question is, will it be enough to ensure your survival?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Traders of Cardonia
description:
Traders of Cardonia is a medieval trading-themed package with its own unique setting. It contains a set of 3 different games.

Trading Cards: A worker placement game where the cards you play as workers with special abilities are played to a grid with unique worker placement markets on the backs. Because you choose which workers and markets to use within each game, the strategies in each game will change. And because the workers in your opponents' hands are also markets that are not available to you, the game is ever-changing from beginning to end.

Tricks of the Trade: A trick-taking card game based on the Dyad system (Dyad) in which the resources are scarce, and you must obligate other players to buy your trade goods to sell them. Assemble a team of workers that allow you to access unique special abilities.

Medley: A unique blended game experience that combines the worker placement in Trading Cards with the trick-taking aspects of Tricks of the Trade. As you play a worker placement phase, you will also draft from the available cards which can be played to tricks in the trick-taking phase.

Trading Cards and Medley also feature AI opponents for a solitaire game.

—description from the designer

name: Replicants!: United Sol Colonies
description:
The Replicants are starting to adjust to a solar system devoid of organic life. It was chaos at first, but, for the most part, the mega hives a have started to create some stability. The United Sol Colonies, or U.S.C. for short (who this expansion is focused on), are doing their part to bring structure (or structures =P) to the system. They are currently building a network of space stations that all Replicants may have access to, provided they follow a few simple rules:


No fighting on the space stations.
Use the rooms you need to and move on, so others may use them too.
Help build additions to the stations you visit.
Everyone must spend their own resources to activate functions they wish to use.
Stay out of other hives’ lockers.


In the U.S.C. Expansion you will pick your favorite hive and join the effort to make the system a better place for all Replicants.

Game play, for the most part, is similar to the core game (which is required to play the expansion.)

Like in the core game, you will deal out a resource grid each round, and place your drones to collect resources. But between those two phases, you now have a Station phase. During the Station phase, you will get to move your two personnel around the station to access the functions of the different rooms. Room functions consist of things like: build new rooms, resource discounts when leveling up new replicants, buying points, and more.

After the Drone phase, you still spend the resources you produced or gained to level up your Replicants. However, instead of discarding any unused resources from your hand at the end of the round, you now send them off to your locker on the space station. Once resources are in your locker, you may not use them for leveling up your replicants, but they can be used for activating any functions on the station.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Richtig oder falsch?: Quiz
description:
Quiz game with tricky questions and answers. E.g. "Are there more camels in China than in Egypt? The guessing person has to decide if it is right or wrong and then you read out the interesting answer. The person who gets the most 'right' wins.

—user summary

name: Rekorde Raten
description:
A trivia game with 80 questions about curious records. A game leader reads out the questions and the other players answer simultaneously. Whoever is correct receives one of the 30 score cards. After 30 point cards have been distributed, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

name: ArtMasters: The Game
description:
Immerse yourself in ArtMASTERS-The Game: A fun, challenging competition between 2 to 4 Players ages 14+ to create famous paintings by famous artists one tile at a time! You don't have to be an artist, or even need to know a lot about art. Your game board Canvas is your guide. With each tile drawn, every Player can be an accomplished artist as a Masterpiece is revealed! It's all in the Tube.

How ArtMASTERS is Played

The Object of the Game is to be the first to complete a Masterwork painting in tiles on your game board, call Frame It! and score. 2 to 4 can play.

You don't have to be an artist, or need to know a lot about art. Your game board Canvas is your guide.

Draw Game tiles from the Tube.
Decide which of three paintings to re-create on your game board Canvas.
Tile-by-tile create a famous artist's Masterpiece.
Be the first to complete a 3x4 inch painting in 12 tiles and call Frame It! to score.
Only the Player who calls Frame It! for a completed painting scores for that round.

The Game ends when a Player reaches 500 points.

—description from the publisher

name: Spy Sabotage
description:
In Spy Sabotage, you enter a secret underground auction where the goal is simple: Outbid your opponents in order to collect the three items you need to complete your mission. However, there will be other spies surrounding you, willing to do whatever it takes to obtain the items needed for their own missions. Place your bids strategically and sabotage your opponents when the moment is right!

Spy Sabotage is a fast-paced strategy game for 2-6 players. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a Mission card that shows them the 3 items they need to collect to win the game. Each player also receives the limited funds they will use to collect those items. Each round of the game, players will silently bid on the items available with the goal of collecting their three items, while preventing their opponents from collecting the items they need. Each player also has one Sabotage they can use each game, which destroys an item as well as any bids placed on the item. The first player to collect all three of their items wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Devenez Chef: Recettes de Grand-mère
description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: a complete menu (starter, main course, dessert)

Difficulty level: 3 out of 3 – Grand chef level
Main ingredients: spinach, veal, apple
Other ingredients: mushrooms, rice, carrots, celery, old-fashioned mustard, crème fraiche, bay leaf and leek

Gameplay

Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors
Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players
Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list
Gather your material with the supplied material list
Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Devenez Chef: Végétal' gourmand
description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: a 100% vegan menu (starter, main course, dessert)

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: fennel, button mushrooms, apple
Other ingredients: passion fruit, lemon, oranges, vegetable milk, ground hazelnuts, chestnuts, mint, vegetable soy cream, cinnamon and flat-leaf parsley

Gameplay

Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors
Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players
Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list
Gather your material with the supplied material list
Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Devenez Chef: Escapade en Italie
description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: an Italian menu (starter, main course, dessert)

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: gnocchi, Parma ham, chocolate
Other ingredients: veal cutlets, mozzarella di bufala, parmesan, almonds, lemon, tomatoes, button mushrooms and basil.

Gameplay

Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors
Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players
Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list
Gather your material with the supplied material list
Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Devenez Chef: Apéro gourmand
description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, enjoy your dinner aperitif with 5 appetizer bites.

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: Gruyere, hazelnut, chervil
Other ingredients: old-fashioned mustard, olives, mozzarella di bufala, mascarpone, parmesan, lemon, cherry tomatoes, crab, cumin seeds and smoked trout.

Gameplay

Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors
Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players
Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list
Gather your material with the supplied material list
Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Devenez Chef: Douceurs de la mer
description:
Cook with family or friends a mystery menu to discover throughout the game. At the end of the game, taste your chef's achievement: a complete menu (starter, main course, dessert).

Difficulty level: 2 out of 3 – Daily chef level
Main ingredients: crab, salmon, raspberries
Other ingredients: Speculoos, pineapple, Philadelphia fresh cheese, kiwis, pink or yellow grapefruit, lemon, sucrine, avocados, pink radishes and shrimps.

Gameplay

Choose your mystery menu according to your favorite themes or flavors
Build up your brigade of 2 to 6 players
Prepare your ingredients with the supplied shopping list
Gather your material with the supplied material list
Cook step by step and enjoy your chef's menu:


While cooking, spice up your game and try to earn stars by taking up challenges, by answering quizzes or riddles slipped into your game.

Once all the missions have been completed, have a good time while tasting your menu together.

Winning conditions:
The winner is the player or team who scored the most "stars"

Each box contains numbered "Mission" cards, 1 shopping list, 1 equipment list, the rules of the game and its scoreboard.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Loopy Llamas
description: Players take turns moving around the swimming pool playing board collecting one of each of the coloured rings to stack on their 3D llama. Then race to be the first to get your llama to dive into the swimming pool to win the fame!

name: Barbie: Il Giro del Mondo
description:
In this game you are Barbie. A well-known travel company offers you the opportunity to go around the world to collect documentation on the cities visited. A prize is awarded to you for each documentation. You will win if you reach $ 100,000 first, as long as you have at least one ticket for each of the 6 continents.

The players draw 10 letters from a bag with which they must be able to compose the name of a city they want to reach. If they succeed, they move their marker to the city and are rewarded with $ (depending on the city), otherwise they draw another letter and pass the turn to the next player.

name: Emperor!: Byzantium 1070
description:
A game of strategy and intrigue set in 11th Century Byzantium. As a powerful noble you build up your political faction in Constantinople, capital of the ailing Empire. Then, with the Emperor on his deathbed and the Turks harassing the frontier, you must launch your bid for the throne and defeat your rivals on the battlefield to become EMPEROR.

Emperor! has a unique two-phase feature. In phase one players move around a map of the city collecting money, military units and characters to build up their faction. Then, in phase two, the board flips over to the battle phase. Players cash in their cards and sets to build their armies. These are deployed face-down on the battle map. Players then select tactical cards (outflank, charge! etc) for their army and combat is resolved.

Emperor! is card-based with no dice.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Auction/Bidding, Automatic Resource Growth, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Force Commitment, Hidden Movement, Multiple Maps, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Reporterspiel
description:
The "Reporterspiel" contains 10 different crossword games with whistle for bright minds.
It starts with an educational reading game for ABC marksmen, goes through a crossword game to a reporter game and an interplay of changing letters.
Since every game is completely different, there is also a different objective in every game. For example, in the crossword game, points are awarded for the color of the field under the letter. In the game of changing letters, for example, a basic word is formed, which can now be formed by replacing, omitting or rearranging letters to form other words. Each letter of these words then counts as one point.

name: Lodestone
description:
Use your lodestone to attract or repel pieces on an ever-shrinking board. Capture your opponent’s pieces by pulling your pieces over them, pushing them off the board, or dropping them off the edge by shrinking the board itself!

Pull your pieces closer to the middle to keep them safe from the crumbling edges. Win by removing all your opponent's pieces.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: ゴールドラッシュ (Gold Rush)
description:
The trick-taking game ゴールドラッシュ (Gold Rush) was released as part of the publisher ruri ruri games' (るりるりゲームズ) Spring 2019 box of trick-taking games, titled トリテセット4 (Trick Taking Set 4).

It is a 2-v-2 team game, where players try to collect the most points in gold mine trolley cards. The game uses a mono-suit deck of 36 cards, and the player who plays the highest card each round will win the first trolley card. (Though a bid malfunction may occur, with the trolley being discarded instead.) The team that does not win the trick gets to influence the placement of the next trolley card.

After one hand, the team with the most points wins.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: Wim Thoelke's Pfiffi Quiz
description:
A trivia card game with questions about sports. The 100 question/answer cards are additionally provided with plus and minus points. Whoever answers a question correctly receives the card (1 plus point) and the points indicated on the card. Players who already know the game can thus avoid answering questions with minus points.
The winner is the player who scores the most points in total.

—user summary

name: Das lustige Apfelpflücken
description:
Each player is assigned a tree that bears 4 ripe apples. The first player to harvest his tree wins the game. Whoever's turn it is rolls a color die and moves an apple. You may only move if you roll the color of your corner, one square ahead. If there are four players, everyone moves to their left neighbor. In the tree itself the apples are not moved. If the player rolls brown, he may move an apple from his tree to his left neighbor's tree, if he rolls black, he takes an apple completely out of the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Gordon Greenfee Golfgame
description:
Players roll their piece (tee) across a golf course and complete the 18 holes. For this, 3 different dice are used (Normal: values 1, 2, 3; Putting: Values 1 and 2; Handicap: Values 1, 2, 3 and 3 events). In addition, there are event fields on which event cards must be drawn. The player who has needed the fewest strokes after completing all holes wins the game.

—user summary

name: Lese-Domino
description:
4 different reading dominoes in different difficulty levels to learn to read.


20 cards where you have to pay attention to certain initial letters.
20 cards with riddles.
20 cards with search words.
20 cards with additional sentences.


Here not only the mechanical reading is trained, but above all the sense-comprehending reading.
Only those who read correctly will find the right card!

The cards of a game are shuffled and distributed to the players. Now the cards have to be placed in such a way that the words or texts match the pictures of the previous card or vice versa... The first to lay down his domino cards wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Deutschland Rummy
description:
The popular tile-laying game RUMMY, now in a German version! As in the famous classic, each player tries to get rid of his tiles as quickly as possible, but in this version, each tile shows a connection between two cities from the German rail network.
From Rostock to Berlin it is 227 km and then on to Potsdam, or rather to Wolfsburg? The player whose turn it is tries to use his tiles to lay routes and to rebuild already played routes in order to get rid of tiles from his own supply.
This creates city connections throughout the entire rail network. Only the first player to get rid of his tiles can win the game!

—user summary

name: Lustige Quatschrätsel
description:
A trivia card game with humorous answers. The questions are read aloud. Whoever knows the answer gets the question card. Whoever has collected 5 question cards wins. The peculiarity of the game is that the answers require creative word creations. For example, the correct answer to the question "What swims in the sea and can calculate?" is "Octo-plus". As a support, the question cards are illustrated and shown to the guessers.

—user summary

name: Die Reise durch den Schwarzwald
description: The players start at space 1 (Karlsruhe). The first to reach space 62 (Stuttgart) wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pinocchio
description:
The board features an outline of six characters from the story of Pinocchio (pre-Disney). Players spin the spinner and try to collect the 6 pieces they need to cover the character outline on the boards. The spinner has a combination of colors and character icons. If the arrow points to a character icon, you can add a piece to your character's outline on the board. If the arrow lands on a color, then you receive a joker tile of that color. If that color is spun again on a future turn, the person holding that color joker tile gets to add a piece to their character's outline on the board. The joker tile is returned to the pool.

The first person to complete their character, wins.

name: Bee Good
description:
Everyone knows them, the bees that fly from flower to flower in summer. They have very important duties. Through pollination, they make a significant contribution to the preservation of biodiversity. But bees are at risk. The death of bees could have far-reaching consequences for all of us. In the game you will learn about the importance of bees for our ecosystem and receive specific tips and information on how we can contribute to the preservation of bees.

Tiles are shuffled, distributed on the honeycombs on the board and turned over one by one. Each player tries to get to the beehive via a path made of green tiles and avoiding the red tiles that can hurt or kill them. Players roll a die to move around the tiles of the board to find flowers and nectar to strengthen and survive on their long journey back to the beehive in the center of the board.

Bee Good is a co-op board game. Only together can the team ensure that all bees find a way to their beehive. If a player's bee has already arrived in the beehive, he can continue playing and throw the dice for the other players and win jokers. The players win if all bees make it back to the hive.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Der verflixte Turm
description:
Players receive 20 tiles each in four different sizes and point values. Together they build a tower out of these until it collapses. Whoever causes the collapse receives no points, the other player, the point values from his built tiles. After several rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Formino
description:
With 4 of their own pieces each, the 2 opponents try to recreate the winning constellations of their card "hand" - which they have on their tray (integrated in the game board) - on the 3x3 game board, whereby only one piece may be moved per turn.

—user summary

name: Companion Quest
description:
This game presents 5 clues to the identity of a Companion.

With over 500 jewels covering the lives of over 100 Companions, encapsulated in a thrilling clues game, Companion Quest is one of a kind. As a dual game, designed to be played between two people or teams, clues are read out revealing the identity of a Companion.

The faster you guess, the more points you gain.
The set also contains a bonus Highlights and Villains set which completes the package beautifully.

—description from the publisher

name: Companion Clues
description:
This game poses a question and gives kids four possible answers to choose from.

This children's game uses logical deduction and multiple choice questions to learn about the Companions.

It's a fantastic learning tool to get to know about the Sahaba in a thought-provoking way.

Companion Clues covers 60 Sahaba and is also designed to be played as a duel game between two or more people or teams.

Score more points by answering the harder questions.

—description from the publisher

name: Fizzog
description:
Match tiles with half faces to create complete faces and score points for matching features. Sparse line drawn artwork and simple game play makes this game very suitable for small children

It is a kind of domino game consisting of box with 25 domino-like cards where you have to try and make a complete face in the right mood and colour. If you can't match a tile, you pick another one to add to your stack. The first player to play all their tiles, wins.

name: Миссионерские путешествия апостола Павла
description:
In Миссионерские путешествия апостола Павла, ("Missionary travels of the Apostle Paul"), the players will embark on a fascinating adventure in the footsteps of the missionary journey of the apostle.

It will begin in Jerusalem, from where Saul went to Damascus to begin massacring the Christians of this city. And it will continue in the cities of Asia Minor and Europe.
Many adventures await them: ferocious lions, robbers and even a shipwreck.
The winner is the player who overcomes all obstacles and gets to Rome first.

During the game, they will be able to get acquainted with the letters of the Apostle Paul, addressed to different churches, which he founded during his missionary travels.

So, imagine that you are the apostle Paul, and off you go! You will face many difficulties, but fulfill your mission - to bring the good news of Jesus Christ to the peoples of the Balkan Peninsula and Asia Minor.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Charges: Antiques et médiévales
description:
Miniature wargame rules to simulate battles from Antiquity to the Middle Ages.

Using figures 15 to 28 mm.

It offers a budget system to build balanced battles that allows for competition games.

name: For the Homeworld
description:
For the Homeworld is designed around the simple concepts of “Full Thrust” and “Babylon 5: A Call to Arms” that got people back into playing Starship Combat games. We also need enough depth to make the games play out like your favorite Science Fiction Shows. We had a lot of success from 2004-2010 between the Babylon 5, Noble Armada and Starfleet license that Mongoose Publishing had. So like me, you might have a closet full of Starship Miniatures that you would like to interact with each other.

Included in the game are rules and weapons to make it "multi-verse" for your own IP, but also includes ready to go Generic Ships and Lists if you want to play in our Universe. In addition to the Data Cards you can photo copy out of the rulebook, we also have Generic Starship Cards you can download here and on our website. Sized to conveniently be the size of a playing card so you can slip them into a conventional card sleeve with a backing card.

Some of the basics are a basic distance movement value, to keep it simple. But to add some tactical flare, there are both Arcs of fire on weapons - as well as - Arcs where the Hull value on a ship differs (the sides or the rear usually).

As a gamer I have really enjoyed the break from reality that Starship Combat games offer. Working on the "Wolf 359 Combat Simulator" for Last Unicorn Games in the early 2000's, and later with Mongoose in their playtesting and development of the (3) "A Call to Arms" games. It is my hope that through modern production technology, I can bring these rules to life and you can join me in enjoying this sort of Non Electronic Tabletop Wargame.

This will be our 3rd self-published release, and I hope you will join us in playing it.

—description from the designer

name: NFT: The Card Game
description:
NFT: The Card Game is a satirical push-your-luck game for 2-5 players.

Outbid the other players to purchase NFTs. Be the first to collect 11 or more joy to win. Avoid sending 3 species of the same rarity score extinct.

—description from the publisher

name: Rund um die Erde
description:
The players start at space 1 in Hamburg. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. Movement is determined by a spinner in the center of the game board. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

This game was published about 1903.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Auteur
description:
Auteur is a highly thematic Economic-Strategy board game, about managing a movie-production studio, with Worker Placement with different workers elements and a unique Bumping mechanism.

In the game, players are the Film-makers (Auteur) of an inchoate movie Studio that, during the 5 rounds the game lasts, try to make their studio the most successful there is!

To achieve this, players hire Stars (Actors, Directors, Writers) and try to raise their fame. They gather crew, special guests and extras, upgrade their studio facilities, try to fund through sponsors and bank, promo their movies, and do everything they can, in order to produce their Films.
To have their films premiered, they shall get through the five movie-production stages, during which they get evaluated (earn Prestige/Victory points). Meanwhile they try to follow the hype, fulfill their agendas, and generally do whatever they can to be in the Spotlight.

Sometimes they manage to even win awards, but that's a hard thing to do....By the end, the one who managed to get the most out of their studio, is the winner!

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Turn Order: Pass Order, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Home Builder
description:
You and an opponent are engaged in a friendly competition for the title “Greatest Home Builder” in the Tri-Valley area. To win, you’ll have to successfully assemble all the components needed to build the best houses: Lots, Financing, an Architect and Materials. You’ll also need to add some custom features that buyers want, such as a swimming pool or sun deck.

During the game, you’ll compete for the above components and features by playing hands of 3-card poker. However, since this is a friendly competition, the “pots” are not winner-take-all. Instead, the winner of a round will gain two components, while his/her opponent will gain one – and it’s the winner’s decision. Close attention to your needs and your opponent’s needs is required. Your goal is, ideally, to build each house with the same level of components: fair, good, better, best; this is not always easy. Additionally, land in the Tri-Valley is a bit scarce, so you’re limited to five housing starts. Also, card management in the form of “what to play now and what to save for later” is an important factor in winning the game.

This is the second game in a series using the 3CP Game Engine, which employs custom cards and a deck of standard playing cards.


Print & Play cards available in Files section.
Professionally produced card deck available at thegamecrafter.com SOON.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Բժշկությունն ԱՅԼ ԿԵՐՊ ( Another way Medical)
description:
Բժշկությունն ԱՅԼ ԿԵՐՊ ("Another way Medical") is a team-based game where players have to guess words.
It is a thematic application of Այլ կերպ (Another way) game, designed for those who understand medicine, biology, human anatomy and healthcare.

Gameplay:
One player draws a card, explains to his teammates the 7 words written on the card one at a time, without using identical words nor the translation of that word into other languages.
Each guessed word is worth 1 point.
Only 1 minute is allowed.

The team with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Medical, Party Game, Word Game

name: Pocket Quiz: Kopfnüsse
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions. Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

This edition contains 150 questions, tasks, and puzzles about various topics.

The title translates to "Headbutts".

name: Pocket Quiz: Verrückte Natur
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

This edition contains 150 questions about the craziest
curiosities and records from nature. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

The title translates to "Crazy Nature".

name: That's the yellow from the egg
description: "That's the yellow from the egg" is a card game about common phrases. If you translate German idioms into the English language you don't get the correct English equivalent, but rather a funny English sentence. Then it's not English, it's Denglish ("D" for Deutsch = German). So one by one the players draw a card and have to translate the Denglish sentences into German and then also have to find the correct English phrase. Only if a player can translate the Denglish phrase into German and then correctly into English they can keep the card. The more cards the players collect, the more points they earn. Whoever earns most points wins.

name: Lauschangriff
description:
Players are asked to solve listening tasks based on any text read aloud. These tasks can be, for example:
Name a word heard in which a given letter occurs at the end of the word or identify the place where a grammatical case occurs. Whoever presses the buzzer first gets to name the answer. Correct answers earn plus points, wrong answers lose points. Whoever has the most points after the text has been read out wins.

—user summary

name: Davoser-Spiel
description: A Monopoly-like game with companies settled in Davos, Switzerland. There are some rule deviations, basically: no houses and hotels, start of sale of expensive land only after sale of all inexpensive land. Nevertheless, the game character of Monopoly is preserved.
mechanics: Income, Loans, Ownership, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Das Riesen Bauernhofspiel
description:
First, the game board is assembled from 35 puzzle pieces. Then each player chooses a plush animal. The player whose turn it is rolls the color die and may move to the next square of the same color. However, with red you have to move backwards and with white you have to sit out. The first player to reach the blue target field wins.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Farming, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Lasst uns wandern
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The worst space is the one on which you realize, you've forgotten your cooking pot and are depending on the mercy of the other players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Concept: Demo Mini Game
description: A small demo version of the game Concept (2013).

name: Dragons of Dunsmuir
description:
Dragons of Dunsmuir is a competitive two-player card game in which players battle by using three types of dragons -- Fire, Ice, and Water. In rock-paper-scissors format, each dragon has a type that they defeat and a type that they are defeated by.

The game is played in a series of rounds and each round consists of a series of battles. During a battle, players play out a facedown dragon and then the players reveal. The type and number of the dragon will determine the winner of that battle.

What separates this game from simple rock-paper-scissors randomness is the powers of each dragon. Fire dragon powers focus on scoring more points in certain scenarios, Ice dragon powers focus on revealing information and trading cards, and Water dragon powers focus on exchanging cards from hand with those in the draw pile. Throughout the game, you may find your strategies evolving as you learn your opponent's tendencies and patterns, and as they learn yours as well.
