The game ends when a player reaches a certain amount of points at the end of a round.

—description from the designer

name: Mixola
description:
Three snail dice are red, yellow and blue. The back side without color means white. You throw all three snail dice and look for the corresponding mixed color on the table. Now you can move to the next field of this color. If the field is occupied, you displace the player back to the field of his color. If all three snails show white, you stay standing. For all three colors in the roll, you choose a color. You reach the middle with rainbow colors or throwing your own color when it is no longer on the way, and you win if you are the first to do it.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Track Movement

name: Fussball-Kartenspiel
description:
Players are given cards with " moves" from a soccer game. Whoever's turn it is puts down a matching "move" card to the previously discarded card. The first player to discard his cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Beehive Surprise
description:
The guard bee (electrically charged) guards its 13 honeycombs. The children now quickly but carefully try to steal a honeycomb. Whoever is caught by the guard bee is eliminated. The last child who remains and was able to steal a honeycomb wins.

—user summary

name: Instant Drill
description:
In this game of intelligent questioning and word hunt set in a military camp, players take on different roles of trainees, lieutenants and observers in a timed drill.

With different roles having different objectives, trainees hunt for a the code word, captain answers all monosyllabic questions, lieutenants guide the trainees and Observers hunt for the lieutenants.

Win the game as a trainee by getting the code word, win as an observer by getting a hold of the lieutenant and win as a lieutenant by staying hidden from the observer.

name: Coal & Guns!: British ships 1885 – 1905
description:
This volume contains “ship cards” for the rule set Coal & Guns!. In order to play with them you need the basic rulebook.

Coal & Guns! is a three-dimensional tactical naval wargame for the era of the so-called "Pre-Dreadnought".

Above all, it wants to be a very simple and fast way to arrange on the table some models of those picturesque ships that marked the transition period between sailing ships and warships as we know them today.

It was a short period of only a few tens of years, between the end of the 19th century and the very first years of the 20th century (conventionally from 1880 to 1905), but which, from a technical point of view, was literally upset by new inventions or applications that followed one another at a frenzied pace.

The intensive use of steam energy, the construction of increasingly efficient breech-loading guns, the production of enhanced explosives, the invention of the electric motor and the radio, the use of torpedoes, the continuous development of steel armor and aiming devices are just incredible examples of applied technology that changed the way of waging war at sea in those few years.

The shipbuilding industry, of course, had to keep up and in less than half a century they passed from sailing ships to battleships, through a series of intermediate stages that made the obsolescence of the projects very rapid.

All this caused the flourishing of projects among the most imaginative and disparate that have ever been seen, with ships that were a synthesis, with different shades, between the pomp and romanticism of sailing ships and the solid reality of steel, the dirt of coal and the cold effectiveness of modern technologies.

Those vessels, especially in the bright pre-war colors, with white or black hulls, wooden decks, light or ocher superstructures, bright yellow chimneys, red or green keels, gold finishes, were a triumph of Art Nouveau style applied to instruments of death, often destined to be torn apart by the cannon fire of opponents who are perhaps less attentive to aesthetics but with the most advanced technology.

From a wargame point of view, playing with these ships is very interesting, because they are often very different from each other and because, despite being equipped with powerful guns, they did not fight at unimaginable distances on the gaming table.

The individual ships of the different nations, even within the same fleet and the same category, have great differences between them in terms of armament and armor, so the game can become quite varied and exciting.

Here, on a 180 x 120 cm table you can use models in 1: 2400 or 1: 1500 scale, in order to allow a good representation of the ships involved.

Coal & Guns! is very simple and intuitive and the heart of the system lies in the “status” cards of the ships.

Drawing free inspiration from the very nice Brigade Models steampunk rules Imperial Skies, we tried to create a very linear and pleasant game system, but with rational mechanisms that, even in a few rules, aim to give you the flavor of that way of fighting.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: くみこ と かつひさ (Kumiko and Katsuhisa)
description:
くみこ と かつひさ (Kumiko and Katsuhisa) is a trick-taking game for two players. One player takes on the role of Katsuhisa, a businessman who grew a large company, and his daughter, Kumiko, whom he left the management decisions to when he grew older. However, Kumiko thought her father's ideas were not for the modern times and changed many company policies, which made Katsuhisa furious. Through their roles and Chairman and President, the two set the stage for a proxy fight at the next shareholders' meeting.

The game takes place over several rounds as each player tries to woo the shareholder for the round, such as the institutional investors or the employee stock ownership plan, over to their side.

Each shareholder to be courted presents a number of shares (victory points) and some conditions for the current round, such as determining the trump suit. In addition to the cards for playing the tricks, each player has a hand of "Proposal Cards" which represent the policy proposal they are using to win the shareholder's votes, and these have game effects, such as reversing the ranks of cards or making certain suits worth negative points.

After a volley of proposals, the two players complete a series of tricks and evaluate who earned more points in the current round. The winner collects the shareholder and their votes, represented by their number of shares. The player with the most votes at the end of the game wins.
publishers: Yokkaichi Indoor Union (四日市インドア同盟)

name: Not Parent Approved: Video Games Expansion Pack
description: 30 NEW VIDEO GAME-THEMED CARDS! With 20 red answer cards and 10 blue question cards for the award-winning Not Parent Approved party game, this expansion pack will keep video game-lovers coming back for more family fun game nights.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Bitter Enders
description: ASL conversion of an expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in October 1942. Adds 8 scenarios. Comes in a ziploc bag.

name: Rally Point 10: The Best of Pete Shelling
description:
This scenario pack is a reprint pack of favorite scenarios previously featured in the Schwerpunkt magazine, with each one designed by Pete Shelling. The scenarios have been renumbered with the Rally Point numbering scheme.

Scenarios:
RPT91: The Tigers Whiskers
RPT92: To No Avail
RPT93: A Siege of Their Own
RPT94: Trigger Happy Joes
RPT95: Muhlenkamp's Miracle
RPT96: Brittany Speared
RPT97: Encircle This!
RPT98: Tatra Salad
RPT99: Rock the Csaba
RPT100: Chaos Crossing

name: Rally Point Volume 11: Heroes and Knights
description:
This scenario pack is based around actions where the medals Hero of the Soviet Union and Knight's Cross were awarded.

Most of the scenarios were designed by Evan Sherry but Mike Augustine provides two of the ten.

Scenarios:
RPT101: The Kibizov Kibosh
RPT102: Kleisoura Pass
RPT103: Nikolai's Star
RPT104: Das Ritterkreuz
RPT105: Flaming Star
RPT106: Balck by Example
RPT107: Meet Me at the Station
RPT108: Catching the Bear
RPT109: Krainov's Ambush
RPT110: Theirs Not to Reason Why

name: Disco Balls
description:
Put on your dancing shoes! It's time to put your moves to the test with this funky card game of hilarious missteps from Ridley's Games! When the 'DJ' shouts Disc-go!, each player simultaneously plays the top card from their hand, and when a matching pair is revealed, make sure you're the first to bust the right move! The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner (and dancing queen!).

Whether you're channeling your Travolta vibes, sinking to the floor doing the Swim, or getting on down with one of the other moves, this is a dance party that will keep you on your toes and that's fun for the whole family! All of the dance cards are dynamically illustrated with vibrant neon colors and come packaged in a groovy disco ball tin!

Perfect for families and groups of friends, Disco Balls is suitable for ages 8+, 3 to 6 players, and has an average of 15 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: List or Twist
description:
You'll need to think quickly in List or Twist, the category-guessing game from Ridley's Games where the answers are only as easy as the clues! In this fast-paced game, players split into two teams and take it in turns to try to guess what's listed on the card by the clues made up by a player on their team. They then switch things up and play off against each other, with things coming to a head during a bonus round! Each time a clue is offered, the team can either List by requesting another clue, or Twist by guessing the answer! But don't ask for too many clues or guess incorrectly, as each time you do you lose points!

With categories ranging from TV and places to technology and pop culture, there's something for everyone.

Perfect to play with family or a group of friends, the game is suitable for ages 8+, 4 to 10 players and has an average 30 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Playmobil: Brandweer
description:
This is a simpler version of Playmobil: Alarm! Alarm!, as players only try to play their own hand, not hindering other players in any way. Another difference is that players only play a single card, rather than three.

Included in Playmobil set 5495 (Adventskalender Brandweer met kaartspel).

name: Fire-Water-Wood
description:
This is a simple little card game combining Rock-Paper-Scissors and War that you can play anywhere. All of the game pieces are held in your hands so you can play Fire-Water-Wood while waiting in line, riding in the car, walking from place to place, and so on.

The object of the game is to collect all of the cards.

Players start with one of each card type shuffled and hidden. On each turn the top card is turned over and the action resolved. This continues until one player runs out of cards.

name: Im Flug durch die Welt
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 58 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dwarf Wars: Saga Ironfist – Battles of the First Invasion
description: An expansion for the Dwarf Wars base game.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Iconoclash: Cross-Dimension Zero
description:
Iconoclash: Cross-Dimension Zero features 2 new crossover fighters for the Iconoclash system from Zephyr Workshop and Solis Studio.


Diane: Lead a team of combining robots! When she combines them against her foes, she draws from a special deck of extra powerful A.E.G.I.S. class robot attacks. It is a one-two punch of pure mechanized power.
Mr. F: Rushdown opponents and use extra movement tokens to power up his attacks. Mr. F's roots will then take hold and lockdown his opponents, preventing their escape. With Mr. F on the field there is no chance of escape!


In Cross-Dimension Zero you’ll take the fight to the universe-bending Dimensional Forest.

name: Cremona: Echo of Violins
description:
The player takes on the role of the luthier boy and in the game he will have to go around the shops of the great Cremonese masters: Amati, Guarneri del Gesù, Ruggeri and Bergonzi. In these workshops he will have to collect the materials to build his own instruments: violins, violas and cellos, and learn the secrets of their workmanship. Going in this way by exclusion, he will have to understand the secret of Stradivari's workshop, which obviously changes with every game.

Objective of the game
The winner of the game is the one who, at the end of the game, has scored more points than is opponents. The point are obtained by making violins (each instrument has a number at the bottom right that represents its value), correctly revealing the secret of Stradivarius (3 points) and going to the Theater.
Each player must in their turn move his meeple to a tile adjacent to the one in which he is. Movement is mandatory. Once the player has entered the new tile, he must choose one of the following actions:

Benefit from one of the blocks that the tile offers
Build an instrument, but only if it belongs to the same family as the workshop in which it is located, and then look at the relative secret of the hidden family, without showing it to the other player
Reveal the secret of Stradivari (only if the player is in Stradivari’s workshop and only if he has built at least 3 instruments)


Once the chosen action is complete, the player ends the turn and it’s up to the next player.

The game continues in this way until a player builds six instruments, at which point the round of turns ends and the game ends whit the calculation of scores.

—user summary

name: mini-halma
description: Halma game with significantly reduced playing fields and therefore also only for 2 players.

name: One More Drink
description:
“Come on, just one drink…” we know that sentence well and how it can lead you to having the best night with adult drinking games or drinking card games : OMD will help you enjoy game night games for groups adult in the best possible way :)

One More Drink is an adult games for game night drinking that even the “cleverest” of your friends will be able to play: : pick a card, read it, and do what it says. Drink games at their easiest.

Our interesting mix of cards will quickly make you forget other drunk games with boring cards and forced laughter : with "One More Drink" the drink game, your evenings will be filled with voting, activities, shots to take (and give!), and most importantly, real laughter with every card!

Play for fun or give the "Action" cards to the winner of the round, the winner is the one with the most cards at the end of the game (if still standing).

name: Der Zeitlift der Götter
description:
In this dice game, the 3 players take on the characters of Pacifist, General and Manager. Their task is to collect as many symbols belonging to their character as possible on a circuit in a predetermined time. Through various events you gain symbols or can also lose them. If you are in the time lift, you may be forced to swap your character with that of a fellow player. The winner is the player who has collected the most matching symbols after the set time.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Jagt die Rohrteufel
description:
Players roll their game piece through a house, from the basement to the roof. On the way lurk event fields, where you collect chips, or can be thrown back. Whoever uses the right chip can prevent the throw back. The player to reach the finish line exactly, wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Radical Pursuit
description:
Questions that burn under the nails of each and every leftist: What did Marx mean by fetishism? Who was Rubinstein - Freud's pet name for his beloved, a pendulum often used in hypnotherapy, or rather a Soviet psychologist? Did the localists in the 19th century labor movement want their own independent party locality, was it about local autonomy or was it after all about a local united front?
With 62 question cards including answers, the time between demonstrations can be passed in no time and people will have fun doing it. Every shared flat will be able to collectively raise itself to a high level of knowledge. Suitable also for the beginning of studies and as a source of nasty questions for/to the professor or student.

—description from the publisher

In this game you are confronted with questions about leftist theory. Play Radical Pursuit cooperative and correctly solve the question as collective or do it in a competitive mode, collecting as much of your correctly answered questions that no one else could answer to win the game. In competitive mode you sure could also team up... it's up to you, what you make out of this game!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Shadowrun: The Trading Card Game – Underworld
description:
The first and only published expansion to Shadowrun: The Card Game is called Underworld and it's focus is on the Yakuza, Mafia, Lone Star and specific gangs like the Halloweeners, Ancients, and others. In addition, the set added more Spells, Spirits, Drones and other Gear to equip your Runners with.

The release date was January 1998. The cards from this set are identified by the letter "U" before the Copyright on the bottom of the cards.

name: ZipWarZ Quick Start Game
description:
A Free Intro to ZipWarZ.

Welcome to the ZipWarZ Quick Start Game, a great place to begin playing the 2-player, rules-lite war game system: ZipWarZ. In the game, each player brings customized armies to the battlefield in an attempt to vie for victory using tactical movements, devastating attacks, and special abilities. The player who gains the most Victory Points by the end of round 4 wins the game.

This game includes 2 pre-generated armies, a player board, and all the rules to play the game. Best of all... it's free.

—description from the publisher

name: Halma
description:
Halma version with reduced game board (45 squares) for 2 players. Each player receives 10 pieces. As in normal Halma, you have to move your pieces to the opponent's side first to win.

Note: the board is different to the board used in Mini-Halma.

—user summary

name: Olympia Spiel
description:
The players start at the "Sporthilfe" space. Movement is determined by a die. If a meeple gets on a sports space, he puts the corresponding athlete card on that space.

If a meeple gets on a space with an athlete card he has to compete for a bronze medal by playing condition cards. The winner places his athlete card and the bronze medal on the space. The next competition on this space is for the silver medal and the loser gets the bronze medal. The third competition on a sports space finally is for the gold medal.

If a meeple gets on a space with a medal, the owner gets points awarded.

On a space "Trainings-camp" the player gets to draw a new condition card.

When all gold medals are awarded, the player with the most medals wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hot Shot Football
description:
One rare edition of the famous "Hot Shot" series from Milton Bradley, is Hot Shot Football. It was released in 1995, only in travel edition. The game don't need any batteries to be played. In each turn you stand against the mechanical goalkeeper (he moves right and left) and you have to score as much goals as you can in 30 seconds. The winner is the player who scores the most penalties after a number of rounds, whose exact number is decided by the players before the game starts.

—user summary

name: Potions: Roll & Write
description:
- There is little left for the next full moon. When it shines high in the sky, the secret conclave of the potion-makers order of warlocks and withes will begin. Then, the oldest and wisest of the master witches and warlocks, will choose from among the aspirants, the new member of the order, to whom all kinds of secrets will be revealed. Only one will be chosen. -

As an aspirant, you will have to brew as many potions as possible to prove your skills and convince the council of elders. But don't worry, you have your magical helpers, who will make it easier for you to collect ingredients. In addition, you know the formula of the multipurpose potion that will be of great help to you.

Potions is a simple roll and write game, easy to explain and play, with some interaction between players, dice draft, push your luck and set collection.

On your turn you roll the 6 dice, which you can reroll up to 2 times. Then you will choose a value and you will take all the dice with that value that you will spend in the best way to complete the ingredients of the potions. Players will be able to make use of the abilities of their helpers to facilitate their task. Also the more complicated potions will provide bonuses.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Underground, Lost & Found: An Escape Room Style Game
description:
The Domestic Counter Terrorism Office (DCTO) is at a dead end. Five devices have been hidden around the London underground. One was found at Westminster Station and it was disguised as a cactus!

The DCTO needs your help in working out where the other devices are, what they are disguised as, and what their 6-digit disarm codes are.

This is a difficult escape room style deduction game that should keep you occupied for an evening. You might want to enlist some help. Perfect for a group, or try it solo for the expert detectives out there.

HQ will send you all the intel and leads they have on the case. It's up to you to sort through all of the evidence and solve the puzzle by entering the answers online.

name: Chromaville Cold Case: A Murder Mystery
description:
Dear Detective, You're obviously aware of the unsolved murder of David Cuthbertson.

As his prodigy and one of the top detectives in the country, I do hope you will be able to crack it. His body was discovered by a dog walker in Chromaville at 6am on Saturday 14th March 2020. I can send you all the information I have gathered surrounding the case.

David appears to have been conducting cases of his own and was found with an interesting array of paperwork on his person. I will also include this to help you with your investigation. Any help you can give me in solving this case would be greatly appreciated.

Try your hand at this tricky murder mystery ‘whodunnit’ and solve the case of David Cuthbertson. Expect 2-3 hours of mind boggling twists and turns as you unveil the truth behind this awful crime... great for a couple of budding detectives, or as a gift for the inspector in your life.

name: Magic Sword Tactics
description:
Magic Sword Tactics is a tower defense game for solo play.

Use the power of the magic sword to fight against the Demon King's army that is attacking the city.
The game is cleared when you defeat the Demon King before he destroys the city.

Roll the 10-sided die to inflict the damage set for each demon sword.

Build a better deck of swords to fight the Demon King's army!
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Atlanta Besieged: Regimental Wargame Scenarios For The Atlanta Campaign – July 1864
description:
The battles around Atlanta during the American Civil War were pivotal to the outcome of the conflict.
Confederate General John B. Hood threw his army against the forces of General William T. Sherman in an effort to save the city from capture.
The battles were hard fought and bloody, but ultimately ended in the capture of Atlanta.
Can you be a better general on the game table?

These scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental or brigade level set of rules.
Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand.
Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn.
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.

This book does not contain rules for playing miniature wargames.

Scenarios include:

Ruff’s Mill
The Battle of Peachtree Creek: Eastern Flank
Bald Hill
The Battle of Atlanta: Sixteenth Corps
The Battle of Atlanta: Seventeenth Corps
The Battle of Atlanta: Hardee’s Attack
The Battle of Atlanta: Fifteenth Corps
Ezra Church
Sunshine Church


—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Felix Mau-Mau
description:
Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number, or word to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Tom Piper Good Citizen Shopping Game
description:
Tom Piper Good Citizen Shopping Game is a simple roll and move board game promoting products from a company called Tom Piper Ltd.

The Australian company Tom Piper Ltd. manufactured canned meals, fruit juice, soup, cordial, jam, baked beans, spaghetti, tomato sauce and desserts from late 1948 till 1972.

This promotional game can be played with one or two dice and players follow a path of 90 squares leaving home, passing through a supermarket isle advertising Tom Piper products and then continuing until home is once again reached.

Along the way players can advance or be sent backwards based on good deeds or thoughtless acts. Landing on a square with the Tom Piper Logo also has a bonus move. First to reach home by exact count is the winner.

—user summary

name: Die wilden Hühner auf Klassenfahrt
description:
Where the wild chicken gang appears, it goes around: All players put a playing card on their head and off they go! The players try to place matching wild chickens cards in pairs. But watch out, if the card falls off the head, it's "chicken overboard". The winner is always the one who is the fastest. When you discard cards, you win all the cards that are on the pile with the cards that have already been revealed. When shouting "chicken overboard", you only win the card that has fallen down or that is not right.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Playmobil: Wirbel auf dem Bauernhof
description:
In this fun laying game, speed and close looking are required, because not all parts are the same size. The first to put all the matching parts in his frame wins the PLAYMOBIL figure.

—user summary

name: BrainBox: Das große Quiz
description:
You answer questions in the colors of the location fields of your figure, the side walls of the game box fold out to form the game board. You roll the dice and move in any direction, not diagonally and not twice across a field; if you answer the question of the category you have reached correctly, you get the card. You look at the card, memorize as many details as possible and then answer the question, it is read aloud by the other player and determined by the roll of the dice. The player who has a card of each category wins. Special fields change the rules of the game for the active player.

—user summary

name: 5 Pillars: Junior Edition
description:
Learn all about the basics of Islam while having loads of fun with your family and friends!

Discover, play and learn, with a journey through the pillars of Islam, pillars of Iman, Quran, Sunnah and Muslim Manners. Can you beat your friends, classmates or parents at all five difficulty levels?
References from the Quran and Hadith are given so you learn more about Islam with every flip of the card.

Play for minutes or hours, but for the best learning experience don’t stop until you have mastered and learnt the basics of Islam.

How do I play?
You'll get into two teams, select your level of difficulty for each topic, and answer questions to fill up the pillars.
Conquer all pillars across five difficulty levels before the other team to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Wo hat der Rauhaardackel sein h gelassen?
description:
In Germany there are many words where even Germans are not sure how to spell them. Especially characters like h, which are not spoken or double/triple characters in sequence make here problems.
This game has 50 of this classic German language traps, as quiz cards with the description of the rules and their origin for clarification.

—user summary
publishers: Brockhaus, moses. Verlag GmbH, Wahrig print

name: Just Like Mama Used to Say: Going to Church!
description:
Better than Sunday Donuts and Punch! 50 New Cards that are funnier than Paw Paw snoring during the sermon! 25 action cards & 25 phrase cards to add to your Just Like Mama Used to Say Original game.

The game is best played with 3 or more people. Players compete to build the most entertaining Southern phrase.

Mix and match action cards with phrase maker cards to create thousands of combinations.

name: Just Like Mama Used to Say: The Back to School Expansion Pack
description:
50 New Cards that are funnier than Mrs. Garvey throwing chalk at Billy! 25 action cards & 25 phrase cards to add to your Just Like Mama Used to Say Original game.

The game is best played with 3 or more people. Players compete to build the most entertaining Southern phrase.

Mix and match action cards with phrase maker cards to create thousands of combinations.

name: Spell Binders Grimoire
description:
A solo game where you must successfully harness the energy of the elements to casts spells.

This is a solo roll and write that takes up to 15 minutes to play. Using dice you get values that correspond to markings on a spell sheet that is set in a circle, you connect those points and attempt to trap the element within and make specific patterns with the connecting lines.

—description from the designer

name: Capt'n Sharky: Die Schatzkammer
description:
Capt'n Sharky has been on a great voyage and has found many beautiful things for his friends, which now have to be stowed away as well as possible in the treasure chamber.

Each player gets 21 treasures and 2 wooden planks. Each player first places two wooden planks horizontally or vertically in the opponent's half of the treasure chamber. Then the players each take turns placing one of their treasures in the treasure chamber and try to place as many as possible. The treasures may touch each other, but not lie on top of each other. When placing the treasures, remember that the treasure map and anchor each score two points, and the other treasures each score one point. If no player can place more treasures, the value of the treasures is added and the player with the more valuable collection wins.

—user summary

name: Chivalheart: Uprising
description:
Chivalheart: Uprising is a card-driven strategy wargame for two players to enjoy over approximately ninety minutes per session with high replayability. It is proudly an “Amerigame”, meaning that the narrative is at the core of the experience. In Chivalheart: Uprising, one player assumes the role of the imperialistic Seren while the other becomes the desperate Rebels with the latter’s homeland providing the battlefield(s). The two factions are highly asymmetrical and feature different strengths: the Rebels have superior numbers and means of maneuvering around the map, while the Seren start with control of all settlements and are fundamentally more dangerous combatants.

—description from the designer

name: Black Flags: Stories From The Eye Of The Sea
description:
"Ahoy me hearties, have I a story for ye! Years ago I was the high captain of a grand fleet of ships. The world was the helm of me ship, and I had her in the palm of me hand. Then, a warring storm came upon us before we knew it and in a flash me entire fleet was sleeping in the depths of Davy Jones' Locker. As luck would have it, myself and a hand full of me scallawags managed to stay afloat on a raft made from empty rum barrels. For days we were adrift, thirsty, hungry, and scorched by the sun. Of the original crew only myself and three others survived the trial. We were saddened by the loss of our brothers and sisters at sea, yet somehow smiles found us again as we finally stepped upon the shores of an uncharted desert island. The island was just rich enough with fresh water and resources to support the four of us. After years on the island, we missed our old life so much, that we came up with this game to remind us of who we once were. Other than our bones, it is all that remains of a life that once was."

Black Flags is a competitive table-top game which uses a unique rondel system, story telling, dice rolling, and narrative choice to transport players to a fantasy world of piracy, commerce, and nautical adventure.

Players take turns in clockwise fashion until a player takes the last gold coin from the bank. When this occurs, the game immediately ends. The player with the most gold wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Play the Pub Quiz Family Edition
description:
A game of two teams allowing players to compete in a pub quiz in the comfort of their own home. Categories consist of History, Sport, Music & Film.

—user summary

name: Dracula
description:
The game contains two different variants: one game for two people and one for 2 to 4 people.

In the 2-player game, each player alternately moves one of his figures. The "villager" may only move one space horizontally or vertically onto an unoccupied space. The "vampire" player is also only allowed to move one square, horizontally and vertically. But he may also hit by jumping, also diagonally. The winner is the player who met his or her victory condition.

The 2 - 4 person variant is a modified Halma with its familiar move and victory options.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Square Grid, Zone of Control

name: Maya: Indianische Spiele aus Altamerika
description:
Maya is a game collection of three Indian games based on ancient America for 2 to 4 people: Patolli, Quippu, Yucatan.

Patolli is a running game with a peculiar dice mechanism: two players each receive a knotted cord and hide any number of knots in their right hand and cover the rest with the left. Then it is revealed at the same time and the number of visible nodes must be The players "roll the dice" with the knotted cords and then move their figures (semi-precious stones). The player who passed the cross (game board) first wins the game.

Quippu is played with the knots and is a pure puzzle game.
Yucatan is only played in pairs and only with the semi-precious stones. It is a puzzle game in which one player puts together a combination of three stones from two semi-precious stones and the other player has to guess it.
mechanics: Deduction, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: ATS Bloody Buna
description:
New Guinea, 1942, and the American 126th and 128th Infantry Regiments, 32nd Infantry Division are up against it. Fighting alongside the Australian 18th Brigade they faced not only oppressive heat humidity and insects but also disease, as malaria and dengue swept through their ranks (accounting for twice as many casualties as were lost in battle). Let's not forget their reason for being in New Guinea... to wrestle control of the Pacific island from the heavily entrenched Japanese.
In this package:
18 map panels (17x11 inches each) depicting historical terrain
11 scenarios
A Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules
2 half-sheets of Japanese personnel, weapons and AFVs

Players will need to have at-hand their ATS rulebook and charts as well as US Army and Commonwealth Army personnel, weapons and vehicles (Bren Carriers and Stuart I tanks)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ATS Utah Beach: D-Day On The Cotentin Peninsula
description:
The Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) returns to Normandy for an entirely different experience than the earlier Omaha, Juno and King Red offerings. Here, there are no enemy positions stationed on high ground, this coastal area being relatively flat with a 4-to-8 foot cement wall along the beach. Make no mistake, however, the area was heavily defended by the German 919th Grenadiers and 709th Infantry Division. Getting ashore (yes, there is a monster, 48-turn invasion scenario) is only half the battle and tactical simulation fans will enjoy the unique maps depicting the Cotentin Peninsula and the flooded farmland inland from the beach itself.

What You'll Receive:
16 map panels, each 17x11 inches
11 scenarios, the last being the aforementioned 48-turn affair
A 14-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules and an extensive historical breakdown

What You'll Need:
Standard ATS rules and charts
ALL necessary counters including German and American personnel, weapons, AFVs, weapons nests and US Landing craft, either from the Normandy modules you already own or via the special counter set, available separately.

This version is for owners of the latest ATS OMAHA, ATS UTAH Counter Collection and the ATS Rulebook 2014 and later, plus small and large system markers. Includes Landing Craft Play Aid, 8 scenarios, BW Rules in color and color folio.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Kesselfüllen
description:
An enchanting story to play with for all those who love magic. With magic wand and 25 gems.

I am kili the witch and present you with the magical and funny game "Kesselfüllen".

Whoever gets kicked out wins!

You just have to get kicked out and you've won!
But it's not always that easy!

The somewhat different game for the whole family, kindergartens and primary schools.
An educationally valuable game.

name: Tridu
description:
A game with a glass board, black and white glass stones and three dice.

No further information about this game could be found online.

name: Das GROSSE Alfred J. Kwak Freundschaftsspiel
description:
Relive the adventures of the famous Alfred Jodocus Kwak and his friends with this exciting board game!

Alfred has disappeared. Kra tells us that Alfred fell down the well, but won't reveal where this well is. As Alfred's good friend, you naturally set out to help him and experience all kinds of exciting adventures.

To get Alfred out of the well, you must first have three friendship cards. Will you be the first to find the well and gather three of Alfred's friends around you? Or will Kra snatch a friendship card from you at the last moment...? By gathering friends around you and carrying out the orders well, you will - a deal is a deal - reach the goal the fastest!

—description from the back of the box (translated)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Sirocco
description:
The object of Sirocco is to move the 6 pawns to the diagonally opposite field which is marked by a bar in your own color. On the way, you must try to take as many pawns from your opponents as you can. Since captured pawns from opponents have more value than your own pawns which have been brought into the opposite goal, the pursuit of the opponent is the hallmark of sirocco.

Each player receives 6 pawns in one color, which he places on the starting space of the same color.
One throws in turn (clockwise) and advances one of his pawns the number of points thrown.
One's own pawns and those of opposing players may be jumped over. The grey dots form the neutral starting space. pawns of the opponent may not be knocked over in this space.

Important: You must first move all 6 pawns from the grey neutral space into the green playing field (= onto the green lines) before you can make a move or capture with a pawn that is already in the green space.

Once all pawns have been moved into play (i.e., no pawn may be on the starting spot, base, or on the gray dots), one may move into the playing field. On the playing fields, players move from point to point, provided they are connected by lines. It is not possible to move an opponent's pawn on red-bordered spots, because these spots are protected. One may move one's own pawn back, but one may not return to one's own neutral square.

The game ends when a player has lost all his pawns or has moved them into the base (= the large colored circle). Each player then counts the points he has scored.
The following points are scored: - captured pawn of an opponent

Captured pawn of an opponent: 3 points.
own pawn in the opposite corner: 2 points
A pawn of your own that is already in the neutral opposite field but not yet in the base: 1 point


Pawns which are still in the playing field at the end of the game have no value. The player who scores the most points wins the game.

name: Neko Tobashi
description: First you assemble the tower then catapult cats of various sizes counting points depending on where they land.

name: Wer kann rechnen?
description:
Similar to the classical children's game Lotto. The children have to solve math problems, sometimes with farm animals, sometimes with numbers, sometimes with abstract shapes.

—user summary

name: Die Biene Maja: Blumenfest
description:
In this game with 30 cards (motifs of Maya the Bee and her friends) are offered two variants. Duo is for two players, both have a face down deck of cards, the top one is revealed, the better card in terms of symbols wins both cards. Trio is played by three players, each has 10 cards of the same suit, again all reveal a card, the better card wins the other cards of the round, which card is the better, again the symbols decide. The winner is the one who could collect the cards of the opponents.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Wortpoker
description:
The game consists of 110 cards with 40 vowels and 70 consonants. The aim of the game is to continue as long a word as possible by placing letters, but not to finish. Each player gets 2 vowels and 5 consonants. The starting player uncovers a consonant card from the deck and places one of his letter cards to the right or left and adds a new card to his hand. If the next player believes that no valid word can be formed with the letters on display in the given order, he can challenge the display.
A penalty point is awarded to anyone who is justifiably doubted, to anyone who doubts incorrectly, and to anyone who finishes a word. The player with the fewest penalty points wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Sakura: Character promo card
description:
This is a unique promo card for Sakura published by A-games.
This card was included in the issue 100 of JEM magazine (i.e. Magazine of Players) in Hungary.

The card has 2 different sides:
- Side II: The player with the most points in the first round gets it. In round 2, when it's your turn, you can use a 6th character card, which you put under 5th, and you can hire that too for 5 money. At the end of your turn, if you haven't hired a character, you discard this. If you hired one, but not this, you have to push it further as card 6.
- Side III: At the end of the 2nd round, the player with the most points gets it. In round 3, when it's your turn, you can buy a character for 1 less money. Replacing characters is also one money cheaper. You get the character in the first place for free.

name: Schachtett
description:
Teach children the game of chess in a playful way with SchachTett, the first quartet to chess.

Each player gets 6 cards. With more than 8 players, each player should get 4 cards. Decide whether to play the easy or the more difficult variant (pawns / knights = easy, rook / queen = difficult).

The goal of the game is to "win" one card of each category by answering the questions and thus get a quartet.

Player A (the youngest, the smallest, ...) starts and chooses a card from player B, who then asks player A the question on the card. If player A answers the question correctly, he has "won" that card and can put it in front of him. If player A cannot answer the question correctly, then player B has "won" the card and can place it in front of him. The round continues clockwise according to the same system.

The winner is the first player to have a card of each color in front of him.

—user summary

name: Schnitzeljagd
description:
The traditional game similar to Chutes and Ladders. Players roll the dice and move along a path. One can also take shortcuts, but risks falling back again. The game ends when the player rolls the dice to move his piece to the target square or beyond.

—user summary

name: Don't Look Back: Sideshow Slaughter Expansion
description:
Northwood hasn't seen a carnival in over two decades. Something happened all those years ago that people in suburbs are still reluctant to talk about. Recently some younger locals have been talking about hearing the sounds and seeing the lights of a small carnival off of Route 72, just north of the Sealy Line crossing. Others say it's just a figment of their imagination.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 1 "Booger" The Banished Killer miniature, 4 resin balloon token miniatures, and 2 custom scenarios to the base game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight: Invasion Of The Saucer Kaiju Battlepack
description:
Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Invasion Of The Saucer Kaiju Battlepacks include 4 randomly selected Kaiju Battlecards (2 of which are new random 'Saucer Kaiju') , 3 random Zone cards (1 of which is a new Space Zone) , 2 Bonus Cards and rules!

This is a standalone pack and can also be integrated with any other Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Battlecards.

Based on the original kaiju characters of game designer and manga artist Alex Strang, Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight is an action-packed (yet simple to play) monster-fighting game using large ‘Battlecards’.

Each player uses a Battlecard to represent their giant monster. The large-size illustrated card has all of the monster's abilities and strategic moves arranged on the back, using a unique tactical grid system for battling and tracking results.

Kaiju Battles can end in many ways, from total defeat (monster explode!), concession, running away, draws, and more.

Also: Circular Zone Cards represent various planets and other galactic environments that affect gameplay, and Bonus Cards provide surprising extra moves and events that can alter battles.

The game can be played with 2 players, and becomes even wild with multiple players.
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Pattern Recognition, Simulation

name: Spy Kid
description:
At spy school, open your eyes and remember 5 drawings in 5 seconds !
Inspired by Kim’s game, Spy Kid is the perfect game for young spy training.

—description from the publisher

Quickly memorize the 5 drawings on the visible side of the card. Then, when the card is turned over, try to be the fastest one to identify the drawing that has changed. The game ends when a player reach 5 points.

name: Das große Bauernhofspiel
description:
Players collect rewards on a farm for correctly answered questions and help with the harvest. On his turn, the player rolls the dice and moves his piece to a harvest field or receives a question. The first to collect 8 rewards wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: À toute vitesse
description:
Slower or faster? You decide !

Have fun guessing and comparing the performances of 66 objects or living beings, from the turtle to the shooting star. Can a swallow outrun a motorcycle? Is a tennis ball faster than a helicopter? Does a parachutist go faster than a drakkar? You have a one in three chance of getting your card in the right place.

À Toute Vitesse is a game of deduction, comparison and knowledge on the theme of speed. Extend the experience by reading the documentary booklet that presents the 66 themes of the game.

The master of the game shows a card at random and hides the speed indication with his index finger.
The player who is asked to guess where he should place the card: is the object slower, faster or the same speed as one of the cards already on the table?  The player being questioned has 3 possibilities, but only one possible answer. With each turn, the game becomes more complicated, as the number of cards increases and the range of possibilities becomes wider and wider.

When a player make a mistake, he holds the card in front of him. When he have 5 cards (2 to 3 players) or 3 cards (4 players), he is eliminated from the game. The last player in play wins the game.

Adapted by Pierre Bellet from the children's book "À Toute Vitesse" by Cruschiform.

name: Das große Polizeispiel
description:
Players perform police missions in the city, and should work together to complete as many tasks as possible. The players start in the center of the plan; four events are revealed and these spaces on the plan are occupied with a deployment marker. In each round, four dice are rolled and each player gets one of them by agreement; he then moves his figure accordingly; for the die of his own color, twice as far. When a player reaches a deployment marker, it is removed; on color squares, only the player of the same color can remove it. If after such a round all events are used up and no deployment markers are on the map, everyone wins together.

—user summary

name: Swing State Steal
description:
Relax. It's just a board game.

This will go down as one of the strangest years in the country's history. And you get a chance to enjoy it again.
It's all here. The boat parades. The Pandemic. The Cancel Culture. The Riots. Left-wing Globalists. The Laptop!!
Such Fun!!

And let's not forget the cheating. Mail-in ballot cheating. Poll watcher cheating. Dead guys voting in droves!

Can the Incumbent president navigate public opinion, the Main-Stream-Media and win the swing votes he needs? Can he get them back after they've been stolen?

Swing State Steal is a premium quality product and the perfect consolation gift for the disheartened Republican.

Summary:
One player is the incumbent president, the other players represent swing states controlled by the opposite party. The president is playing against all other players in the quest to collect votes. Each state collects votes in their own color and the president is collecting votes in each of the opponent's colors. At the end of the game, the president compares his collected votes with each of the states and whoever has more wins that state. President needs to win a majority of the states to win the election.

The board is organized in four rounds: The Campaign Round represents the time from the beginning of the year until election day, the Election day round, After the Polls Close and finally the Challenge Round. First round is two laps, all other rounds are one lap. Players roll a die to advance.

First three rounds are about collecting and stealing votes from the incumbent. Any player can land on a Fake News space that has a story from the headlines (maybe) and an opportunity to take or give votes away. Swing states can land on a Cheat space where they draw a cheat card. The president can land on an Evidence space where he collects evidence cards for the final round.

States use Cheat cards to steal votes. They are color coded and organized by rounds. Green cheats (Campaign) are mail-in cheats, Blue (Election Day) are polling place cheats and Purple (After Polls Close) are big-time cheats.

The final round represents the weeks between Nov 3 and Jan 6 and is a card games. The president presents evidence cards he has collected and the State have to play cheat cards they've played that match and return some votes.

On Jan 6th, the end of the game, is when all of the votes are tallied and a winner declared.

name: Travel Light Travelers
description:
This is the perfect game for anyone who enjoys traveling or travel-themed card games. It's a fun and easy to learn game with beautiful hand-painted artwork.

There are four suits: Site, Transport, Food & Lodging, and Activity, each with thirteen unique travel characters. The game will take you on a journey where you will meet these Travelers who add to the luggage you're carrying. Some Travelers may also help you discard luggage, some may help you weigh down your opponent with luggage and some may prevent you from discarding.

Your aim is to discard as much baggage as possible while weighing down your opponent with luggage. The game ends once one of you reaches the limit of the bags you can carry. The one who has travelled with the least baggage wins the game.

name: The Catnip Kid
description:
An Old West Roll & Write for 1 - 4 Drifters

The Catnip Kid is out to collect the bounty on some no good thievin’ varmints. They been eatin’ cheese from here to the Rio Grande. Gonna take some plannin’ and a heap o’ luck to clean up these parts.

In this game, players earn points by rolling two 8-sided dice and writing the numbers in adjacent squares of their grids. Some spaces will give them resources that allow for special options. By filling a row or column with scoring sets, they earn points. Bonuses are available for the fastest draw, spinnin’ yarns and sheriff badges.

name: Whoa Nelly
description:
A wild western puzzle game for 2 - 4 players

Race to arrange your cards so they score the most points in this wild western, real-time puzzle game. The fastest cowpoke won’t always come out ahead, so aim for a balance of yer speed and wits.

There are no turns. The challenge is to play the cards so that scoring icons on the sides line up to earn the most points. Call STOP when all your cards are placed. Being quick on the draw and scorin’ high to boot will earn ya bonuses worth braggin’ about. Keep playing rounds until the target score is reached. At that time, the highest score wins!

There are two levels of play, for novice and experienced players.

name: Limbo: Saga of Noadin
description:
Fight alongside the powerful Noadin who come from the North in order to resist the demontide. In the expansion you will get a whole new set of Heroes including the Lord Yasa, who controls a giant ice golem. Follow along as you tell countless stories within the Saga of Noadin.

The Saga of Noadin is a brand new army that will bring with it a new board game map as well as new models, cards and rules for their boards to use in the Core Game. You need a core game to use this add-on.

name: Soap Opera Derby
description:
Players must acquire six awards by answering various questions about soap operas. The soap operas involved are General Hospital, One Life to Live, Guiding Light, Another World, As the World Turns, The Young & the Restless, All My Children, Days of Our Lives, Dallas, Dynasty, Falcon Crest, Loving, Capital, Knot’s Landing, Edge of Night, Ryan’s Hope and Search for Tomorrow.

Players must roll a six before they can begin moving on the board, but may get any number after that initial roll. Landing on a colored space requires them to answer a question (i.e. - landing on blue requires answering a question about General Hospital or Guiding Light). Correct answers allow them to roll again, while wrong answers move player to the next person.

If a player lands on an “Award Space”, a correct answer gets them the award represented by that color. There are also “Star Spaces” that act as wild spaces, but get the player an award for whatever color they chose if they give a correct answer. The first player to gather all six awards wins. The rules include a special note that all material included within the questions uses material from episodes up through the end of August, 1984.

name: Erster sein!: MEERE
description: Three hundred sea creatures cavort on the board of this game. Pull an animal tile out of the box and be the first to find the depicted sea creature on the hidden object board! In a triangular box and with a double-sided illustrated hexagonal board, there's no routine at all as the board reconfigures itself each time! This fun and challenging game idea is easy to understand, but beware - it's addictive for adults and children alike! The one who has found the most animals wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Real-time

name: Experior Existencial
description:
EXPERIOR is a line of games in a dark epic fantasy world.

EXISTENCIAL it is a game where chance and decisions make up the story. 4X - Strategy, Ameritrash, Cooperative, Deckbuilding, Wargame

Control multiple units in continuous combat. Simultaneous shifts in cooperative. There are NO time-outs, players can always participate if they manage their elements well. Decks of spells and abilities of each one. Player levels with skill and stat upgrades.

4 asymmetrical characters, with independent skill decks, with their own improvements plus the possibility of including cards from the board with their own characteristics.
1 random map that is built as the game progresses and according to what happens in the story. The initial goal may not be the final goal.
100 different ways to experience each story, according to chance, decisions and situations.

The games are independent, we have several characters to choose from and start the 4 stories. But each story has at least 5 endings each. Many of those endings continue chronologically in future installments.


EXPERIOR es una linea de juegos en un mundo de fantasía épica oscura. EXISTENCIAL es un juego donde el azar y decisiones conforman la historia. 4X- Estrategia, Ameritrash, Cooperativo, Deckbuilding , Wargame

Control de múltiples unidades en combate continuo. Turnos simultáneos en cooperativo. NO hay tiempos muertos, los jugadores siempre pueden participar si administran bien sus elementos. Mazos de hechizos y habilidades propias de cada uno. Niveles de jugador con mejoras de habilidades y estadísticas.

4 personajes asimétricos, con mazos de habilidades independientes, con mejoras propias mas la posibilidad de incluir cartas del tablero con características propias.
1 mapa aleatorio que se construye a medida avanza la partida y según lo que suceda en la historia. El objetivo inicial puede no ser el objetivo final.
100 Maneras distintas de experimentar cada historia, según azar, decisiones y situaciones.

Las partidas son independientes, tenemos varios personajes para elegir e iniciar las 4 historias. Pero cada historia tiene al menos 5 finales cada una. Muchos de esos finales continúan cronológicamente en futuras entregas.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Line of Sight, Market, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Order Counters, Passed Action Token, Pieces as Map, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Don't Look Back: Terror on the High Seas Expansion
description:
Take your games of gruesome horror onto the wide open ocean with the Terror on the High Seas expansion! Featuring full rules for ship-based games, this expansion expands on how you can craft your cinematic horror tales.

The USS Australis has a dark and lurid past. Technically, the ship is owned by Dr. Ethan De'Graw, but over the last decade it has been used by the research division from several of the corporations that Dr. Ethan has business dealings with. These partners have used it for anything from shipping to experimentation in international waters.

Whether the characters are waking up in surprise or spending the weekend on a school funded trip, they have found themselves on the research vessel the USS Australis. Now, they must try to survive whatever is lurking below decks or just under the surface of the water.

This supplement is designed to be used with the Black Site Studio 'USS Australis' kit but is easily replaced with a desert island or old run-down dock. The expansion includes a full re-hash of all the core DLB scenarios with a nautical twist!

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds an 18-page nautical expansion booklet, 1 Captain Erasmus Drake Hero miniature, 1 Deep One Killer miniature, 4 resin egg markers, 4 new items and weapons, and associated Character and Visage sheets to the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Nautical
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight: Wave 2 Battle Pack
description:
This standalone BattlePack is a complete game and can also be easily mixed with other Battlepacks from the Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight series.

Wave 2 includes an entirely new horde of giant monstrosities!

Based on the original kaiju characters of game designer and manga artist Alex Strang, Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight is an action-packed (yet simple to play) monster-fighting game using large ‘Battlecards’.

Each player uses a Battlecard to represent their giant monster. The large-size illustrated card has all of the monster's abilities and strategic moves arranged on the back, using a unique tactical grid system for battling and tracking results.

Kaiju Battles can end in many ways, from total defeat (monster explode!), concession, running away, draws, and more.

Also: Circular Zone Cards represent various planets and other galactic environments that affect gameplay, and Bonus Cards provide surprising extra moves and events that can alter battles.

The game can be played with 2 players, and becomes even wild with multiple players.

Wave 2 Battlepacks include 4 randomly selected Kaiju Battlecards, 3 random Zone cards, 2 random Bonus Cards and rules!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement

name: Quatre-Bras 1815
description:
Quatre-Bras 1815 is a game based on the Jours de Gloire series. It covers the battle which occurred on June 16th. It involves Ney and a single French corps attempting to secure a strategic crossroad defended by detachments under the Prince of Orange and Wellington.
Game scale : 1 counter = 1 regiment or equivalent, 1 turn = 1 hour
Designed in 2011. Free print and cut. Zun Tzu module available.

name: La Souffel 1815
description:
La Souffel 1815 is a stand alone game based on the Jours de Gloire series.
It covers the almost unknown battle which occurred on June 28th. It involves General Rapp and a small French army attempting to secure the area along the Rhine, against allied troops from Württemberg, Hesse-Darmstadt and Austria led by Prince Eugen.
Although the opposing forces are vastly superior, it is a brilliant French victory. Unfortunately, this victory has no effect on the events of 1815, after Napoleon's defeat at Wateloo

Game scale : 1 counter = 1 regiment or equivalent, 1 turn = 1 hour
Designed in 2013. Free print and cut. Zun Tzu module available.

name: Komikal Kricket
description:
Komikal Kricket is an early 20th century board game based loosely on the game of cricket.

The game is for two to four players and is a simple roll and move game where players advance along a board with 110 squares. The first to reach the end is the winner. Players can advance quicker by reaching the bottom of a bat and move to the top of the bat, likewise landing on a space at the top of cricket stumps sends you back, in this way it is similar to Snakes and Ladders.

It differs in that also a number of special squares are marked "caught Out" and sends the player back to the start. Other special squares are marked "Bye" and advances the player by 2. An exact roll of the dice is required to win.

—user summary

name: Royal Tour Game
description:
The Royal Tour game is a simple roll and move game based on Australia's first Royal tour by Queen Elizabeth the Second in 1954. The game appears to be a supplement in the Australian Women's Weekly which has been an iconic Australian women's magazine since 1933.

The game has players move counters along a trail to reach the Royal tour on square 80. Along the way certain squares represent a family going to the Royal tour and are faced with difficulties (i.e Jostled by the crowd) or good fortune (i.e meet a friendly policeman). First player to reach square 80 is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wander: The Cult of Barnacle Bay – Shovel Knight promo card
description: The Shovel Knight character card has stats along with a leveling track. The Starter Gear card for Shovel Knight's Shovel includes a weapon classification and icons related to combat, plus a ruling that it is Shovel Knight's Starting Weapon. The third card is just an Initiative tracker with a picture of Shovel Knight on it.

name: Teslas' Secret Weapon
description:
Besides the well-known patents and inventions Nikola Tesla brought to the world, he was working on numerous projects, which could not be finalized during his lifetime. After Tesla's death in 1943, numerous documents, referring to concepts and outlines, were yet to realized.

This game takes place in the 1950's cold-war-scenario, an era characterized by the constant threat of nuclear warfare and thus, the end of civilization. The opposing world powers are diligently seeking after the ultimate weapon, which would make them superior to the enemy.

The goal of the game is for a player to deliver three Patent cards of various categories to his/her base, after that agent waits for one round, while the Tesla’s weapon is constructed and in the next round start the delivery to installation location. The other possibility is to steal the weapon from another agent and to take it to its own installation location.

The player (agent) visits all required locations to which letter cards direct him and collects Patent cards which he delivers to his/her base. The player can either collect patent cards from the locations, or steal them from other players. Patent cards can be lost when they are stolen by another player.

The winner is the agent who first deliver Tesla’s secret weapon to installation place. The player (agent) visits all required locations to which letter cards direct him and collects Patent cards which he delivers to his/her base. The player can either collect patent cards from the locations, or steal them from other players. Patent cards can be lost when they are stolen by another player.

name: Arcana Resurgence
description:
Arcana Resurgence is a fantasy card game set in the modern world. Control various mages as they seek to learn from the magical world and, ultimately, control it.

What makes Arcana Resurgence unique is the usage of Mage permanents as a means of using spells and relics. Unlike traditional deckbuilding games, players are limited in the amount of cards they can directly use. In order to cast spells or create relics, a player needs not only the right resources, but a Mage available to use it.

Additionally, Mages provide their own resource outside of mana: Intelligence. In the process of opening their eyes to the world of magic, these individuals have also expanded their minds to both the schools of science and the arcane. Once per turn, each Mage may focus their knowledge towards creating a non-magical Relic or "Spell". However, some Mages are wiser than others, allowing them to create more complex and powerful Relics without spending mana.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Single Loser Game

name: 音楽隊はブレーメンを目指す。 (Ongakutai wa Bremen wo Mezasu)
description:
音楽隊はブレーメンを目指す loosely translates to “a band aiming to be like the Town Musicians of Bremen” (from the popular Brothers Grimm fairytale).

In this game, a wide variety of animals have set their hearts on becoming like the Bremen musicians via standing on each others’ backs.

Players must stack animals on top of each other in order of heaviness. If a heavier animal is placed upon a lighter animal, the stack is flattened.

In addition, players must make the sound of each animal as they place them onto the stack.

name: Fantasy Shindig
description:
A world inhabited by fantastical creatures like Dragons, Elves and Reverse Mermaids. A world ravaged by badly spelt names like Gruthar, Dannoth and Rythnethyiguius. A world where altercations determine who will claim victory in war, love and whose turn it is to cook dinner.
Welcome to Nworyathe. Welcome to the Fantasy Shindig!

Gather your heroes and begin a magical quest of hunting for epic items, finding hidden pathways, and beating the living daylights out of any other group of so-called heroes that might get in your way. Find potions, swords, scrolls and armour to help you on your mission; but watch out for monsters and cursed items that will no doubt try to ruin your day.

An extremely versatile game using a unique dual-dice rolling system where the bonuses or hindrances received during the game change the very dice you roll. Making use of all the Polyhedral dice (D4, D6, D8, D10, D12 & D20) your merry band of warriors, mages, clerics, druids, necromancers, rogues or a mix of them; can find themselves battling across open tabletops or crawling through the midst of a dungeon. All of the terrain you use can be searched for magical oddities, so who knows you might find a Sword of Slaying, a Potion of Healing or even the mythical Rolling Pin of destiny.

Add into the mix the ability to play against each other, co-operatively or even solo play. You might find yourselves rescuing villagers from pesky Goblins, cleansing a dungeon of undead or even attempting to slay a mighty dragon. – Let the Shindig Begin!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Card Rails Junction
description:
Card Rails Junction is a 3-5 player, 30-45 minute track-laying and auction game played on a deck of cards. Players invest in companies by auctioning off shares. Cards count as both money and track, so finding the balance between investing too much and investing too little can be a fine line to walk.

Throughout the game, players choose an available action from their action cards. After performing the action, players must flip over that card to a different action. Players can auction a share, build track, or call dividends.

While auctioning and calling dividends are pretty straightforward, building track can get tricky. Along with building track to increase the value of their company, players may also build junctions that pivot into other company's track lines.

At the end of the game, players get money equal to each company's most profitable line multiplied by the shares in that company they own. The most money wins.

Card Rails Junction is a standalone game in the Card Rails line.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Crazy Aaron's Ultimate Putty Challenge
description:
This game is a game consisting of different mini games that can be performed with "Thinking Putty" - a modern day version of an elastic putty (in similar vein as Silly Putty). Some games are more dexterity based - such as roll a putty ball into a supplied table top skee-ball like ramp to score points. Others are more on the creative side - such as trying to guess what someone else's sculpture is while holding it behind your back.

What does a player do on their turn - roll dice, pick a card?

The person (or team) whose turn it is picks one of the 25 cards randomly with the mini game, and that card dictates the terms of the that round and winning criteria for that round (tallest stack, most pins knocked down, one chosen by judge, etc). All of those mini games involve doing something with the putty. Depending on the card criteria also is whether players (teams) need to take turns or if it is simultaneous action. Once the winning criteria on the card is satisfied, that person (or team) wins that mini game and can move their scoring token on their score track.

A couple examples of these mini games - One has them use a sand timer and see who can make little cubes of putty and create the largest stack of cubes (without pressing them together to make them stick) in the sand timer length. Winner is one with largest stack of cubes.

The game ends, and player (or team) wins when one player (or team) wins 6 of of the mini games.

Gamebox includes
4 Tins Putty (all different colors)
Score track boards
Score track tokens
Sand timer
"coin" token
Cardboard obstacles for certain challenges

cardboard bowling pins
little cornhole boards (2)
golf green
Skeeball - like ramp

name: Numbers Game
description:
Product description:

The Numbers Game is a new game concept that resembles the memory game play but with some interesting differences, which makes the game more exciting and flexible. The Numbers Game consists of four sets of 20 cards. Each set has a set of numbers running from 1 to 20. The goal of the game is to collect one set of 20 cards. However, the cards may only be added to your collection in ascending order, if you first pick a number-1 card, or in descending order, if you first pick a number-20 card.
The player who first completes a full 1-20 row wins the game.

The numbers on the cards have been photographed on the streets of cities around the world, from house numbers to traffic signs and commercial signage. Paul Baarss sharp eye for graphic candor resulted in a collection of thousands of street graphics depicting numbers. For this game, he selected 80 striking numbers in surprising settings from his large collection.

name: The Heist of the Golden Pearl
description:
Sneak into the museum to capture the Golden Pearl... but WATCH OUT! The security measures are state-of-the-art!

Use Passcodes to rewire or disable alarms and robotic guard dogs! Navigate the maze of the pressure-plated floor! Avoid teleporters and fake exhibits!

And above all, evade the Chief of Security at all times!
mechanics: Finale Ending, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Recreando Funes
description:
Recreando Funes is a cooperative game designed to stimulate children, youth and adults to become familiar with the city of Funes, Argentina.

While having fun, players will be able to learn about the history, the institutions and their most relevant places.

With the cards they will be able to recreate the origin and development of the city up to the present time, understanding the importance of its most prominent characters. Do you join the challenge?


The objective of the game is to accomplish each game level (Events), being the highest level 16.

For this, players must together complete the current Event card (each one representing places and moments in time of the emergence and growth of the city of Funes).

Starting from the Initial Plan card, each turn players will be drawing Plan cards from 4 different decks, placing them from their hand, or exchanging cards between their hand and the plan, trying to solve each level.

The game ends when one player has no cards in hand, if the current level cannot be completed, or if the players successfully complete level 16.

There are 3 levels of difficulty, beginners (3 decks, until level 12), normal and expert (no exchange action).
categories: Card Game, City Building, Educational, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Hagen 1888
description:
Visit a bygone Hagen, Hagen in 1888, one year after it became an independent city in Germany. On this "dice walk" through the city, you can visit thirteen historical places, many of which are still in the same place today, while others have changed structure significantly and some have moved locations or disappeared.

In Hagen 1888, you want to visit a variety of locations, but ideally you can reach the right locations at the right time to score more points than others. On a turn, you roll the six-sided die, then either bank those movement points or roll again; if you roll again and get a result higher than your first roll, you bank the sum of the two rolls; if your second roll is equal to or lesser than the first roll, you bank no movement points this turn.

Next, you can move your figure on the game board, which depicts a network of walkways. Most spaces on the walkways are gray, but the board has twelve lettered building spaces in six colors as well as the Rathaus (town hall) in a seventh color. If you start on a building, you must move; otherwise movement is optional. One point of movement takes you to an adjacent space on a walkway.

If you end your movement on a lettered building (which must differ from where you started), you can place one of your eight tokens in the lowest open space on the "Hagen points" board for that letter.

If you end your movement at the Rathaus, you remove your figure from the game board and place it on a 4-point space in the Rathaus section of the "Hagen points" board. On each subsequent turn, you no longer move your figure, but instead you may spend 6 movement points to raise a previously placed token in a letter column to the first open space higher in that column; alternatively you can spend 12 points to move it up two spaces. Once you are in the Rathaus, to end your turn, place one of your eight tokens on a 1-point space in the Rathaus.

At the end of your turn, you must have fewer than 8 movement points banked. Once a player has placed all eight of their tokens on the Hagen points board, the game ends at the conclusion of the round. Players score the points listed next to their placed tokens, in addition to 1 point per 4 banked movement points and 3 points for each color of building in which they have a token, with a maximum color bonus of 21. Whoever has scored the most points wins.

name: The Wizard of Oz Emerald City-Opoly
description:
Make your way along the Yellow Brick Road on an Emerald City adventure! Collect your favorite characters along the way, including Scarecrow, Tin Man, Cowardly Lion, and many others. Avoid the castle of the Wicked Witch and her field of poppies, then get ready to meet the famous Wizard of Oz and discover "There's no place like home."

Contents: 19" x 19" gameboard, 6 collectible (pewter) tokens, 22 Movie Moment cards, 4 Wishes cards, 1 'Wash & Brush Up Co.' card, 1 'Ride in the Hot Air Balloon' card, 16 Magic Wand cards, 16 Crystal Ball cards, 1 pack of money, 32 Munchkin houses, 12 farmhouses, 2 dice, and rules.

- publisher's description from back of box
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: BelloLudi: American Civil War – Strategy Game
description:
These rules have been developed for people who have no previous experience in wargaming, yet like to play games.
