A ruleset of eleven pages, no more than the game of RISK. From page thirteen on, we included some extra rules. You will not be needing them at first, but we can imagine that you would like some variations as your experience grows. Start with that page when you have some battles under your belt.

The game is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players or even solo. The army structure that is presented in this writing, can be easily adapted to the number of miniatures that you have available. Albeit that a large army look suitably impressive. Hopefully, playing the game will encourage you to create your own armies.

This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 1861 to 1865, the American Civil War. Units were drawn up in line in order to maximise the effect of their weaponry. The musket, the type of gun that the troops were supplied with, was only accurate on short distances. During a volley all muskets were fired simultaneously at the same target. Off course, this required iron discipline of the men. Soldiers of that age were drilled to fight formed up into line formation and to march in columns. During the game, your troops will do likewise.

In an ideal scenario the enemy was pinned in place by fire of artillery, the threat of cavalry or the fire of infantry. Once the enemy was pinned, other units could deliver the coup de grâce. Tactics were therefore based on teamwork. Not only within a brigade, but also between brigades, or even armies. Every unit would have its own specific task and if they executed their tasks in unison, success was often achieved. The aim is not to annihilate the enemy unit to the last man, but to inflict so much damage, indicated by chits, that morale is brought down and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and removed from the table top. By a clever combination of movement and shooting, dashing cavalry manoeuvres and carefully positioned artillery pieces, this can be achieved. The tactics are based on teamwork. Not only within a brigade, but also between brigades and as such, the whole army.

Your role will be that of a brigadier in the Confederate or Union armies, commanding a brigade of troops. Should more players be available, one of you will play the part of Commander-in-Chief or general. Should any disagreement arise concerning the rules, we suggest you roll a dice. The one who rolls the highest number has it right, for now.

So onwards, to glory! And, off course: have fun!

This product contains one rulebook and two commander dice.

–Description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tier-Roulette
description:
All animals are evenly distributed among the players. All players bet an animal and the wheel is spon. The player who bet on the animal, indicated by the ball after the wheel has stopped, wins all animals in the betting pool. The player with the most animals after an agreed on playing time wins the game.

—user summary

name: Dwarf Gemhunt
description:
A fast-paced fantasy tabletop board game for 2-4 players age 10+. Collect gemstones (and Runes) fight monsters

"You live alone in an underground cave where you keep your precious stash of gemstones. The thing is, dwarves are quite greedy when it comes to gems so every day you go adventuring for more, and if you are lucky you might also find Rune Stones; Runes, it is said, give you magical abilities. Of course adventuring in dungeons can be dangerous. They say that there are zombies, skeletons"

The object of the game is to collect as many Gems (& Runes) as possible. The dwarf-players move around the board using two six-sided dice, and each square they land upon means that something happens e.g. take a Fight card, find a gem etc. Runes confer extra skills such as - Speed, Resistance to Curses and Luck etc. They also have a points value at the end of the game.

The winner of the games is the player who has the most gems and runes when all the gems have been given out.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Real-time
mechanics: Action/Event, Real-Time, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Delver: Heroes of Farenwald
description:
Delver: Heroes of Farenwald is a 4-7 Player competitive TableTop RPG Card game where players seek to be named the first Hero of the fictional city of Farenwald.

Players are dealt a class card who will be their Adventurer for the game. These Adventurers have stats indicating how good they are in specific areas (Attack, Defend, Heal, Discuss, Dexterity). Each Adventurer also has a unique class ability they may use once per game.

Players will then draw Tactic Cards that will help them tell their story as Hero, or help them impede the other players story.

At the beginning of the round, a Game Master will reveal a Battlefield card for that round of play. The Battlefield Card effects all players for that round and can help or hurt their efforts, but dynamically changes each round.

The players will then take turns deciding to delve into the Town or Dungeon Zones, handling specific fantasy scenarios. Such as, saving a farmhand from a cave troll or planting poison on a noblewoman. They will choose which of their skills they will utilize to handle these scenarios and roll the dice. The Game Master will determine their success and reward them with treasure.

You receive individual Victory Points for the Town and Dungeon Area. The first with two of each will be named the Hero of Farenwald.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling, Take That

name: Capture: A Book of Mormon Game
description:
Capture: A Book of Mormon Game is a fast-paced, card-changing, thrilling adventure that is fun for the entire family.

Be the first to collect Lehi and the brass plates or Samuel the Lamanite on the walls of Zarahemla. But don't blink! This game moves fast! Multiple action cards keep this game exciting as players struggle to create a memorable moment from the Book of Mormon -- the first one to accomplish the goal, wins.

Players draw 2 cards and plays 2 cards each turn. There are special effects for some of the cards. The game ends once a players played cards match the goal card.

—user summary

name: サクサク・ファーム (Saku Saku Farm)
description:
Place tiles to encircle your farmland with a white picket fence but beware of UFOs going after your cows.

The game starts with players receiving 4 tiles each. Shuffle the remaining tiles and split them evenly into individual draw piles for each player. Set unused tiles aside.

On each turn, a player draws one tile from their draw pile. From the five tiles in his or her hand, the player choses a tile to place down into their personal farm area. Only the farmland contained within the fence will count for scoring.

Farmland tiles contain different resources that can give you additional points…but some resources, such as a tree stump, can actually subtract from your score.

The player with the highest score wins.

name: Merchants of Midgard
description:
Merchants of Midgard is a 2-6 player resource management, deck-building game. The aim of the game is to gain the most points within 10 rounds.

As a human merchant of Midgard, you travel through the nine realms to sell on wares from one realm to another, managing your resources so you aren't left stranded!

You can gain additional route access to other realms, increasing your compensation, as well as hiring servants to help you navigate the treacherous paths!

You always gain resources when you arrive at a new realm, but if enough merchants have gotten their first, then you are going to have to settle for whatever is left.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Resource to Move

name: You're Fired: IT Guy
description:
IT Guy (inspired by Moss from The IT Crowd) promo card from Board Game of the Month Club.

Look at the top 2 cards from any player's deck and put them back in any order.


Released in the September 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Trolling for Trouble: Acuity Powder
description:
An additional item for Trolling for Trouble, Acuity Powder. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the May 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Hast du hunger, kleine Raupe?
description:
Are you hungry, little caterpillar?
A game of colors, memory and reactions:

"No, what a delicious, red strawberry and there a crisp green salad and smells like the yellow cheese. It's like in paradise", says the little caterpillar, who is always hungry and eats everything that gets in her way. It is only picky about color. Sometimes she wants to eat something red, sometimes something blue, then again she only likes green or yellow delicacies. And then she searches until she has found something in her favorite color. With every bite the caterpillar eats, it becomes longer and happier. It's the same in this game: in the beginning the little caterpillar is very tiny, actually it only consists of a head and a tail. But the more she eats, the bigger and longer she gets. A treat in a certain color must be found through the color die. The card then - turned around - results in another piece of belly. Who has the longest caterpillar in the end?

name: Quiek Quak Miau
description:
Players roll 2 dice - 1 with color dots and 1 with arrows. Players then match up the color and arrow direction to the rows and columns on the their player board and make the sound of the animal they find.

The first player to fill a row or column wins!.

name: Swing State Steal: Fake News Expansion Cards
description:
By Popular request, we've added another pack of 72 fake news cards. In all fairness, this stuff practically writes itself!

There's more fake news where THAT came from. Ready for more stories? How about news on why Math is racist. Or media bias. Or Climate Change. Or cancelled Looney Tunes. The fun never stops! The expansion pack come with a brand new set of 72 news cards to compliment the cards that come with the game.

Relax. It's just a board game.

name: Trolling for Trouble: Cleric/Thief
description:
An additional player character for Trolling for Trouble, the Cleric/Thief. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the June 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Trolling for Trouble: Umbral Cloak
description:
An additional item for Trolling for Trouble, the Copper Robot. Attributes are listed on card.


Released in the September 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Dakalio
description:
Dakalio is an abstract strategy game for 2 players set in space, the board acts as a planet gravity surface, so it works similar to a spherical board.

Players place Asteroids and move their spaceships around the planet creating paths in order to get crystals and take them out while trying to block each other.

There are 2 ways to trigger end game.

Features:
-High replayability
-Offensive & Defensive win conditions
-Circular linked board
-Path building and blocking
-Exhaustion of pieces
-Portals
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Pick-up and Deliver, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Cosmix
description: An Abstract strategy game for 2 players about spaceships building bases on planets. Theme is only to justify mechanics and visual aspect of the game.

name: Radiumtaistelu Marsissa (The Radium Battles on Mars)
description:
Designed by the creator of Star of Africa, players travel across Mars reach the island city of Horz to find out the whereabouts of the weapon's blueprint, carved on a wall of an ancient temple. From there the race continues to the desert city of Kalat where the blueprint itself is hidden.

The expeditions can proceed by three different routes: by radium canals, submarine routes, or gas tracks. The game is played without a die with cards corresponding to those routes (radium, sukellus, kaasu).

All three different passageways available - radium canals, submarine routes, and gas tracks - have corresponding cards (radium, sukellus, kaasu). Movement on the board is determined by the numbers and letters on each card. The first place to find the weapon, wins.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points, Race

name: Empires
description:
Empires, a medieval, head-to-head combat card game, puts you in command of a kingdom seeking to control the known world. With upgradable units, a vault of gold and an impressive variety of tactical decisions each turn, Empires is an immersive, strategic experience for all ages.

Empires includes several classes of units including infantry, cavalry, archers, and siege carefully balanced through a classic rock-paper-scissors mechanic. Research a plethora of technologies and construct powerful buildings for even more strategy! Construct a formidable deck from a huge collection of cards. Designed for head-to-head gameplay.

All actions taken during your turn cost gold. On your turn, draw cards from either your deck or discard pile, then deploy or construct units and buildings to the battlefield. Once your units and buildings have been strategically placed, engage in combat by attacking your enemy's units and buildings. Attacks are compared to armor and then deteriorate heath of which is tracked with damage counters. Be sure to protect your town center as when it falls you lose the game. To win, either destroy your enemy's town center or have them run out of gold.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: A Second Chance at Love
description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery

When the reality TV drama, “A Second Chance at Love,” announced that it would be filming its next season in Valley Falls, excitement was high. As filming started, Aaron Queens, this season’s new bachelor, was already a hit with the ladies. His looks and charm made many of the avid watchers wish they could be on the show as a contestant. But tragedy struck the show during the filming of Wreckage Night, an episode where some of the bachelor’s exes are invited to spend a week with the contestants. After some technical issues, the crew returned to start filming only to find Aaron Queens dead in his room. Will you be able to sift through all of the lies, spite, and romance to find the killer?

Difficulty Rating – 6/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Return to the Hideaway Motel
description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery.

Return to the sleepy town of Valley Falls and pull back the dingy curtain to take another look at its sordid underbelly. Head back to The Hideaway Motel and discover the secrets that a killer called The Magpie left behind. As you visit one of the most notorious spots in town, uncover one of Valley Falls' most well-kept secrets and do so while trying to avoid a local mafioso hitman who goes by the name of Vito the Smile.

Difficulty Rating – 7/10


This mystery was never a part of the DMS monthly subscription service. It is half the size of the normal DMS mysteries and takes about half the amount of time to complete.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cryptic Words
description:
Cryptic Words is a word guessing game for two players. Each player thinks of a secret word and hides it in plain sight for their opponent to guess using common clues.

The game is played in rounds until someone hits or exceeds 30 points.

In each round, players first grab six hexagonal letter tiles and secretly think of a 3- to 8-letter words and encode and it using a proprietary tracking form. They write down the codes for their word, shuffle their tiles and swap them with their opponent.

Using the game board, players arrange the tiles in any order front of them. The deduction phase starts.

Players take turns rolling two dice and either perform an action on doubles or strategically pose a question. The question will try to pinpoint letters in the opponent's word. Both players must answer the question. The answer may reveal a letter in an opponent's word.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: The Mara
description:
Welcome to The Mara, the national reserve of the Maasai people. Your job is to drive tourists across the savannah where they may take photos of animals.

The Mara consists of face down tiles where only the habitat color is known, not the animal symbol. The players take turns to either pick up/drop off tourist cards at lodges or to drive their jeeps and peek at adjacent tiles. The more tourists they have, the less drive actions can they take.

If both color and symbol matches a tourist on picked up card, the player takes a photo by placing a gem on the tourist.

Each tourist has a favourite animal and each animal has its favourite habitat. When all the tourists have been picked up or all the animals have been photographed, the game ends and the player with the most complete sets of animal photos wins.

The Mara combines child-friendly mechanics like deduction, memory and pick-up and delivery with a healthy dose of randomness to provide a fun experience for the entire family. Animal cards tell you where on the map the animals are likely to be found, memorizing the animals you pass help you find them for the next tourist, and skilful jeep driving let you deliver as many tourists to the animals as possible.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: On Shelf
description:
Systembolaget is a government-owned chain of stores in Sweden with an exclusive right of selling liquor. Its vision is a society where alcoholic beverages are enjoyed with consideration for the health so that nobody is injured. An important aspect of this is that all product selections and displays must be based on customer preferences, and every producer and distributor must be handled the same way.

The items of the store come in three different types of five different colors. The players play job cards to order items to the store, move them to the shelves, pick up customer cards and match them with items on the shelves.

Timely actions will let you work where the store needs it the most and skilful placement of items will bring ”your” customers’ items to the shelves first - both of which will earn you satisfied customers.

The better you execute the jobs, the higher the Customer Satisfaction Index increases. When the store closes, the player with the highest index wins.

The Shelf is a kind of semi-cooperative experience where an action of one player will open (or close) opportunities for the next player. The physical movements of items through the store provides both a tactical experience and a spatial challenge and the card management provide elements of both deck building and turn order manipulation. The result is a highly interactive and tactical game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Contracts, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Suecia
description:
Gustav Vasa has liberated the Swedes from the Danish oppression and risen to the throne. But the new King’s position is weak, as is his Kingdom. Sweden is indebted to the Hansaetic League, Denmark has not given up her claim to the Swedish crown and Europe suffers from religious turmoil.

But this is also an opportunity to start something new. By developing the economy, reforming the taxation and building a national army, Gustav Vasa sets out to consolidate his dynasty and his Kingdom. Take advantage of natural resources, encourage domestic manufacturing, establish overseas markets and engage in profitable wars to pursue the King's will. This is only the foundation of a strong and powerful nation!

Take turns to add estate cards to a card tableau. Each placed estate card lets you execute all the actions of the estate cards in that column.


Peasant: Place farms or sell resources to shops.
Burgher: Place shops or use buy basic resources from shops to turn them into advanced resources.
Clergy: Place churches to collect tax from farms or supply Royal missions with advanced resources.
Nobility: Add provinces to the Kingdom or supply Royal missions with advanced resources.


Resources enter and exit the city to and from different sides of the city grid. As more advanced resources enter the economy, they can be invested in advanced farms and shops that enable the production of advanced resources within the Kingdom. However, such actions also require a combination of two similar estate cards in the same column so plan your card tableau wisely.

The players who has supplied the most resources to the Royal Missions wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement, Trading

name: C64 Board
description:
C64 Board is a tribute to the old Commodore 64 games that pleased an entire generation back in the 80s. It's a game system using simple programmable "joystick cards" and generic boards to recreate old C64 games.

Among the games included in the base pack are Tanks (move tanks and fire bouncing shots at opponents), Monsters (move hero and monster with the same action), Maze (find your way through a maze with movable walls), Cars (use gears and turns to race and bump your opponents, Trains (move trains and lay tracks to connect to as many opponent rails as possible), and Snakes (move snakes and try to eat your opponents).

The board consists of 8x8 squares, possibly with additional components depending on the game. Each player has a card tableau of 3x3 joystick cards. The player starts with any 2 cards from any row or column as active joystick cards and play them one at the time to either move in a direction or press a button. The last played card determines the row or column to take up the next 2 cards from. The game proceeds in this manner until its victory condition has been fulfilled.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Game System, Maze, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Programmed Movement

name: Flatten the Curve
description:
Flatten The Curve is an entertaining board game for kids and adults alike, bringing virus safety-awareness through play.
A horrible illness is attacking your city! Will you forget your mask and get infected? Be smart, stay sharp, and move fast to get you and your family out of the pandemic - safe and healthy.

Players roll dice and move their families around a Monopoly-like board. Event cards add twists to the game. But be careful, some space can cause you to get sick and have to go into quarantine!

The first person to move all 5 of their family around the board, wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Diplomaten-Spiel
description:
For each number of players, there are starting positions given. The goal of the game is to block enemy pieces by jumping on top of them.

Movement is to any empty neighboring space which is connected to the starting space by a line. An enemy piece may be captured by jumping over it to an empty space behind it. The captured space is stacked under the attacking piece or stack. The piece on top moves the entire stack. When a stack is jumped over, only the piece on top is captured. Capturing may be perormed in a series of jumps.

To win the game one has to immobilize all enemy pieces by being on top all other pieces.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Stacking and Balancing

name: Chain Reaction: Cryptocurrency Trading
description:
Players are cryptocurrency enthusiasts trading tokens and riding the highs and lows of the volatile crypto markets.
Starting with $5m and some fiat cards, players will take turns trading with the market, each other, and buying or playing value cards to affect the price of tokens.
Every round various valuers, market forces, regulators and hackers will cause the values of everything to fluctuate. This can make or break fortunes!
Will you become a billionaire crypto trader or hit the deck as a failed bit-nobody?

name: Combo!
description:
Here comes Combo!, a game in the tradition of Uno, Mille terminals and other simple and fun card games. With original and wacky rules like those of Nunuches, young and old will have fun in the company of Léa Olivier as well as three characters with powerful powers: the nunuche Maude, best friend Marilou and boyfriend Alex.

ON YOUR MARKS, READY, PLAY!

—description from the publisher (translated)

The game is played in a "get rid of all your cards" fashion. The first player to do so wins.

—user summary

From the Publisher:
Voici Combo ! , un jeu dans la lignée des Uno, Mille bornes et autres jeux de cartes simples et amusants. Avec des règles originales et loufoques comme celles des Nunuches, jeunes et moins jeunes s’amuseront en compagnie de Léa Olivier ainsi que trois personnages aux pouvoirs puissants : la nunuche Maude, la meilleure amie Marilou et le chum Alex.

À VOS MARQUES, PRÊT, JOUEZ!

—description from the publisher (French)

name: Expedition: Scarred Lands
description:
Battle new Titanspawn enemies, earn new lore-filled loot, and play as new adventurers from Scarred Lands.

A 50-card booster that expands Expedition: The Roleplaying Card Game into Onyx Path's world of Scarn.

Includes:

21 new enemies, including gorgeous art by the amazing Chris Gebhart
13 new abilities
10 new loot cards
6 new adventurers
3 new official quests for epic adventuring
Unlimited playtime with community quests and GM Mode

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Paths to Aegis
description:
Paths to Aegis is an automa rogue-lite deck-building board game. The game allows for 1-4 player cooperation as each player takes their own character with a unique set of abilities and strengths as they discover new tiles on their way to defeat Cerberus by gaining more powerful cards and leveling up.

Each turn the player rolls the die to move across the board or rolls the die if they're in battle. Rolling a 1 or a 2 places them in battle. Once a player is in battle, life clips keep track of health for both the player and each enemy they fight in battle.

While in battle, a player will use as many action cards as levels they are and use those actions to either damage the enemy or heal their health. On the enemy's turn to attack, the player must roll the die. Each enemy has a standard attack and most have a special attack. If the die roll matches the enemy's special attack, then it usually damages the player more than a standard attack. Once the enemy has been defeated, players earn coins which they can use to either purchase more action cards at the market or level up.

As it is a rogue-lite game, you can expect to die. But don't worry! Upon death, you only lose half your coins and you keep any cards you purchased.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Market, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Hrou dobrým motoristou
description:
Czech board game about road traffic. The game was to teach children the rules of the road.

Each player has their own car on the game board - dice and tokens (money) are used to play, which are used to pay fines for violating the rules of the road.

Interesting fact:
The official rules of the game also provide a basic overview of road traffic signs.
The preface to the rules was written by the Ministry of Emergency Security

Basic course of the game:
It is played on a game board that shows the road (which has a clearly defined start and finish) and each player has his own figure (in the shape of a race car), which moves around the playing area. To move around the board, players roll the dice (three dice with numbers 1 to 6). At the beginning of the game, players roll the dice - the player with the highest total starts and then the others according to the sum on the dice.
Subsequently, the players take turns - everyone rolls the dice on their turn - and according to the sum on the dice, they move on the playing field towards the goal with the toy car.

The game board shows the roads, including traffic signs - for example:

Main road in front of the intersection - the player can continue without interruption
Side road in front of the intersection - you are on a side road and you have to pass all the vehicles on the main road - so deduct 2 points from your roll of the dice for the delay at the intersection.
Prohibition of overtaking - in corners or marked places, players may not overtake the vehicles of other players in front of them - they must follow them, even if they threw a larger number of points on the dice. It is possible to overtake only after the end of the overtaking ban.
Traffic light - the game contains a dice that has colors on the sides - red, yellow and green. When a player arrives at the intersection square with a traffic light, he must roll this dice and may not continue until he is green.
Speed ​​limit - a player who moves in this part of the road counts only half the value of his dice roll.
No stop sign - if a player ends his turn on this square, he must pay one coin fine.


The game also contains red wooden chips that represent money. At the beginning of the game, the players distribute them evenly. When playing, the places where fines are paid are defined - for example, No stop sign.

The winner is the player who reaches the finish line first and at the same time has at least one more money - so he did not spend everything on fines.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Mullewapp: Das große Wettrennen
description:
An animal race for 2-4 players from 4 years. Pig Waldemar, Franz von Hahn and Johnny Mauser with sheep Wolke against farm dog Bello. Who will reach the farm first? Each animal has its own lane. In the cooperative variant, dice are rolled - for the animal dice, one of the animals is drawn one step accordingly, then for the symbol dice, an animal tile of the back is revealed and the animal is drawn, everyone remembers the animal to be able to draw a desired animal later. If all animals are at the finish line before Bello, everyone wins together. For the competitive variant, each player is assigned one of the four friends, and the first animal at the finish line wins.

—user summary
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Bachspiel
description:
The Bachspiel is a fishing game with didactic information about the creatures in streams with high to low water quality. In the game, players use magnetic fishing hooks to fish for previously prepared animals or trash from cardboard boxes from behind a screen and receive points if they can match the animals to the correct water quality. No points are awarded for trash. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary
publishers: Institut für ökologische Forschung und Bildung e.V, Ökotopia

name: Wer versteckt sich hier... im Dschungel?
description: Players should find one of the 8 animals on an animal card on a jungle map with 11 animals. Whoever finds the animal gets to keep the animal card, and the next animal card and jungle card are revealed. Whoever collects the most animal cards wins the game. There are 3 other very similar game suggestions in the game rules.

name: Publicity
description: Rush through town and try to do the shopping as soon as possible. But be careful, there are other people out and about in the city and they try to slow you down. Use your cards cleverly and hinder your fellow players. Get to the finish line first.

name: Goetia: The Card Game
description:
Goetia the Card Game is a quick, easy to play game for 2-4 players where the aim of the game is to be victorious in pitting the Ars Goetia Demons against one another in a battle of wills as well as brawn.

Will you be able to strategically thrust your Demons into the fray at the most opportune moment when they're at their most powerful? Or risk summoning them early when they're weaker in case you lose control of them and are forced to use them? And will you have the Seals at hand to make sure your Demons are boosted, or enable you to banish your opponent's Demons that threaten your victory? Luck will certainly play a big part when largely uncontrollable entities are involved, but Demonic victory will depend on how well you play the hand you're dealt.

On a turn each player will play cards & also metal tokens (seals).
It's played over 3-6 rounds (depending on number of players).
The player with the highest points score at the end of the rounds wins.

name: 2 Nun 2 Run (fan expansion for Nuns on the Run)
description:
A revamp on the beloved classic from 2010, 2 Nun 2 Run adds a new map and extra goal cards to this hidden movement chase game.

Up to 6 novices must sneak through an all-new abbey, to find their heart's desire. The novices must remain watchful for the Abbess or Prioress, who are on patrol to ensure no mischief is wrought.

In 2020, Frederic Moyersoen uploaded files for the unpublished expansion to Nuns on the Run, canceled when Mayfair Games shut down in 2018. That prototype has now been developed into this print and play expansion.

You will also need from the original game from 2010:
Rule Book, Log Sheets, Novice Tokens, Guard figures, Noise and Vanished Tokens, Captured and Turn Markers, Line of Sight edge, Novice Status and Movement Cards and Guard Movement cards and Blessing Cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Print & Play, Religious

name: Space Pirate's Treasure
description:
Each player controls a pirate ship flying around an asteroid belt trying to find the loot of a long dead pirate captain.

Ideal for multiplayer club games or introducing new people to wargaming, simple to learn and hopefully fun to play.

Turn Sequence:

Randomly determine the order of play for the turn
Each player activates their ship in turn
Move dust clouds
Roll for random events
Roll for end of game


–Description from the publsiher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Temporal Odyssey 2
description:
A battle card game about dueling Time Travelers! This is a stand-alone sequel to the original Temporal Odyssey.

Draft cards from the Past, Present, and future decks and enlist epic characters to banish the other Traveler from the timeline! Each time period has its own theme and mechanics, and each class has specific uses and value depending on the situation and your Traveler's needs. Each card you draft provides elemental power. Collecting certain elements will level up your Traveler's spells, enabling power plays that can shift the pace of a fight dramatically. Each Traveler uses each element differently, and can greatly affect how you prioritize your drafting and banning.

Banishing enemy characters, securing artifacts, and defeating rival Travelers will destabilize your opponent's timeline, but also grant them more power. Once their stability is lost, defeat their Traveler one final time to win!

The game ends when you defeat the enemy Traveler after they have 3+ instability cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: GIRI game
description:
GIRI Game is a storytelling card game for children that develops communications skills, imagination and emotional intelligence. GIRI Game helps children improve their attention span. Some kids have shorter attention spans because of too much 'screen time'. Through playing GIRI card game and telling stories with set elements, children improve their focus, learn to express their thoughts and ideas fully, and improvise in the moment.

There are two roles in the game:
The Storyteller, team or player who tells the story.
The Teaser, team or player that distract the Storyteller by inserting their oen card into the course of the story.

Each Teaser team/Player draws one card from the Teaser Category. The drawn cards are not shown to the Storyteller.
Storyteller starts to tell a story, based on cards from categories: Characters, Objects, Theme, Place, Atmosphere.

As the Storyteller tells a story, the Teaser team tries to distract the Storyteller or change the way the story is told.
Each Teaser team shall do this once, whenever they want to during the story. The Storyteller has to stay focused on his story... And include Teaser cards in it.

The winner is the one who scores the most points in all rounds of the game. The maximum possible score in each round is 12. A maximum of 6 points is obtained for technical difficulty of the story and a maximum of 6 points for artistic impression.
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Interrupts, Open Drafting, Player Judge, Singing, Storytelling

name: TV Master
description: The players move their game pieces via a spiral into the center of media power by rolling the dice. Opposing figures can be hit and reset. On some fields, questions about Austrian TV shows have to be answered. Points are awarded for correctly answered questions, depending on how far you are from the goal. The game ends when a player has reached the goal or all question cards have been distributed. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Jamboree Game
description:
The Jamboree Game is a roll and move game that sees players move around a winding track with 130 spots.

The board shows a course where players are scouts that trek around the outdoors passing along the way wild animals, a ration dump and Indian camp. Players roll a dice and move the number of spaces indicated by the dice throw. Along the way certain numbered spaces require the player to follow directions written next to the spot. Some will help the player while other spots incur a penalty. First player to reach the last space (130) is declared the winner and ends the game.

name: Schmetterling
description:
The players roll a color die and place their stones on same-colored parts of 9 butterflies. Whoever has placed 3 stones on a butterfly takes possession of it. A foreign stone may be exchanged for one of your own stones if you are already represented on the butterfly. Butterflies on which three players are represented are removed from the game. The game ends when only one butterfly is left in the game. The winner is the player who has been able to take possession of the most butterflies.

—user summary

name: Sonne, Mond + Sterne
description: Players draw celestial bodies from a small bag and collect them in front of them. Whoever draws a green celestial body may exchange a celestial body with a fellow player. The green one goes back into the bag. The goal is to collect celestial bodies of the same color. The first player to collect 6 pieces wins the game.

name: Light Castle
description:
Three warriors must save 4 keepers of the castle of light who have turned into evil monsters, and they must try to maintain as many towers to get high scores in their mission.

The gameplay is simple, during 7 rounds any player rolls 5 dice, 2 of them will activate the effects of the managers that can be to destroy towers, bring fog to the towers, among others, then with the 3 remaining dice you can organize their values ​​in one or more rows of actions of the warriors, and thus obtain bonuses in diamonds also complete a row that will give you many points, but you must organize them as more consecutively as possible or if you cannot be blocked, these actions range from increasing your attack, increasing your movements through the castle towers, mushrooms to control luck, placing books on the towers and incredible powers among others.

At any time you can exchange diamonds with the ghost merchant for useful objects, if it is in solo mode the player must beat a certain score to win, or if there are several players, the player with the most points wins the game by: putting books together, delivering potions to those in charge, for towers that are not destroyed, but there must be a minimum of 2 fog figures, for completed rows among other scores.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Kayros: A Game of Thieves
description:
The god Kayros has summoned all the best thieves from every age to confront each other in a great tournament that will establish, once and for all, who is the greatest thief in each universe. To win, Robin Hood, Arsène Lupin and the other thieves will have to travel through time and space to steal the world's most precious treasures.

"Kayros: A Game of Thieves" is a board game for 2-6 players (1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all).

Each player leads a Thief with unique abilities and statistics.

The game is played in turns, and at the end of each turn, players draw 2 cards from the Main Deck consisting of Tool and Event cards and earn 1 coin.

Tool cards are used to provide additional abilities and increase the Thief's statistics, while Event cards have an immediate effect and also contain objectives that, if completed, provide Victory Points. With Coins, players can buy Silver and Gold Tools, cards that will greatly enhance your character!

The main goal of the game is to steal the Treasures placed in the center of the table, but it is not the only way to win the game. In fact, many different factors contribute to Victory Points.

The game comes to an end when a player fills their Loot or steals two sets of Treasures (a set consists of three treasures of the same type). The final "special" turn is executed, and Victory Points are counted!
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Income, Layering, Market, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Trading, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Das Quiz der Erde
description: In this quiz game, each player gets 7 question cards from 7 categories. The answers are contained in an enclosed book. The player whose turn it is reads out one of his questions and must answer it himself (according to the specification on the card) or address it to all the players. Correctly answered individual questions score 1 point, the general questions score 2 points. The player who scores the most points wins the game.

name: Rival Rogues
description:
As a talented and devious rogue you know that this high level job requires the best equipment. Gather the necessary materials, but be quick! Or someone else will beat you to the treasure!

Create your equipment by combining needed materials, but watch out for the monsters and trap cards hiding in the material deck! Be the first to craft 3 equipment cards and maintain the most points by the end of the round to win the game.

On the start of your turn you have three actions to complete: Draw 1 Card from any three decks ; Play 1 action card ; Play your subclass ; Complete an equipment card.

The last round of the game is started when a person plays their third equipment card, symbolizing their desire to complete the job. The game ends on the turn of the person who went last on the starting round.

To win the game and complete the job, be the first to complete 3 equipment cards and maintain the most points by the end of the round! Points are +1 for each complete equipment card and an additional +1 for every special equipment that matches your role.

If the player only completes two cards and ties in points with the person that ended the game, the person who ended the game wins. All other ties are settled by an added speed round. The top equipment card is flipped up and the tied players take turns as normal trying to complete that equipment card. Resolve Monsters, Traps, and other actions cards as normal, but remove the equipment and role deck.

name: The Big Six game box
description: Bundle of six family/party card games. Each deck has about a hundred cards. Included are "Battle of the Ages" (Kids v Grown-ups trivia, "The Big Quiz" (Basic trivia), "Charades", "Mimic the Music" (a capella humming Name That Tune), "Impossible Decisions" (Would you rather do/have this or that? - both suck), "Who Am I?" (Think Inglorious Basterds bar scene). Included are minute timer, headbands for "Who Am I?" and rule sheet for all six games.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Singing

name: Gods and Heroes
description:
A fast-paced Battle card game, with Drafting and in-game Deck-Building for 2 players (4 player rules can be added via stretch goals!).

Gods and Heroes is a battle of strength and prestige between warring Gods and their subjects. Build Temples of worship to bolster your armies and weaken your foes. Let loose your mightiest Heroes and crush your enemies in the name of your chosen Deity!

Each player represents a God, or Goddess fighting for dominion over the Lost Realm. Players draw and play cards to attack the other Temple Guardians. Once all a player's temple guardians are destroyed, a player loses the game.

Victory goes to the one who destroys all enemy Temple Guardians. Alternatively, whoever cannot discard three cards during a reshuffle, loses.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Battle Havoc!
description:
Battle Havoc! is easy to learn and play fantasy wargame where each player commands an army and lead it to the victory on the battlefields. Thanks to alternative activation, all players are involved continuously in action.

Each unit represents up to a few hundreds of men and the game doesn’t have any particular scale, as players can choose to play with either 28mm or 10mm miniatures.

Fight big battles with just a handful miniatures!

—description from the publisher

name: Krimispiel: Tod in Tillstetten
description:
Take on the investigative work in an exciting criminal case!
Follow the clues. Who has a motive? Are the alibis correct?
Excitement and fun with numerous hints.
For some of the research you need access to the internet.
You are forming a special commission to investigate a murder. The previous police investigations have not been successful.

The police headquarters finally needs progress, and therefore sent you the order to take over the investigation. With the order you will receive the investigation results found so far for the case in an envelope.

The group of potential perpetrators has already been narrowed down somewhat. Now your creativity and a sense of crime is required.

Work your way through the evidence and clues discovered so far, do research.

Do suspects have alibis and are out of the question for the crime? Who is the perpetrator?

Examine the various clues, discuss in the group what motives the suspects might have had to commit a murder. Who has something to hide?

It is best if your special commission consists of 2-7 players to determine together. The game can also be played solo.

You can be creative and use tools during the investigation. Research on the Internet may also be necessary to track down the perpetrator.

name: Unsere Wehrmacht im Manöver: Rot Gegen Blau
description:
Unsere Wehrmacht im Manover Rot Gegen Blau ("Our Army in Maneuver, Red vs. Blue") is a tiddlywinks type board game about the First World War.
On the box cover (artist Hans Friedmann, Munchen) - army cavalry men and horses are galloping from right rear to left front, while infantry marches at upper left below trees.
The trifold game board depicts a military scene with blue forces on the left fighting gray forces on the right. A footbridge is shown at center near the top. At center is a sturdy bridge with a tank on its way to cross it. Below that, troops are crossing the river in a raft. Near bottom, troops are building a wooden bridge across the river.

It is a competitive game involving to teams (players) in red and blue color. Player are fighting on the game board with different type of measures: horses, tanks, aircrafts, cannons etc. Players, who lose all measures lose the game.

—user summary

name: Manila 2076
description:
"Sneak, hack, attack"
Manila 2076 is a “push-your-luck” competitive card game for 2 to 4 players. Each play session can last from 15 to 20 minutes.

The game is simple. You are on a mission to steal data from the megacorp. Play the highest cards, get the most data. Easy. Well, corps don't like it when you steal their stuff. The more data you have, the riskier it is for you. So be careful and manage your aggression. Don't be like the last guy who got blasted by security.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Zero Impact
description:
Zero Impact teaches children about environmental awareness and how their actions impact the environment.

On their turn players draws a card with an environmental impact action on it (driving every day, buying local food, etc.) then move a number spaces either toward zero environmental impact or towards environmental damage. The first player to reach the Zero Impact zone wins.

From the game description:

Zero Impact is a board game on the theme of climate change. Our daily activities, large or small, affect the environment in big ways. This game is designed to allow individuals an opportunity to learn about daily activities that can help fight climate change as well as activities that can harm the Earth. While playing Zero Impact, you will be able to learn what you should and should not do to help save the planet! If you can create a net zero impact on the environment, you can be the hero and save the Earth.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: カエルの財宝 (Kaeru no Zaihou)
description:
カエルの財宝 (Kaeru no Zaihou) can be translated to “Frog Treasure”.

A band of frogs have been sent by the Frog King to retrieve treasure sleeping within a pond to the east of the Frog Kingdom. The frogs who bring back the greatest riches will receive high praise from the King.

In this game, players move pairs of frogs around a pond to collect treasure. Treasure of varying value is hidden beneath lily pad tiles. In order to collect the treasure, a player must sandwich the lily pad tile with two of his or her frogs or stack two frogs on top of the lily pad tile.

After collecting the treasure, players should decide whether they wish to display the treasure for game points or keep it in their hand for a power boost meaning greater mobility for their frogs and the ability to collect even more treasure.

Collecting certain combinations of treasure will also result in a higher number of points (for example: collecting gems of the same color).

There are a limited amount of times a player can take action so everyone must be careful to strategically plan their actions.
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: Hellfire Campaigns: The Universe at Your Feet
description:
This guide is written to help you fight wargames campaigns. The guide is written to help both the player with enthusiastic opponents but also to support the solo player as well.

Although written with Hellfire rules in mind, a lot of the campaign systems will work comfortably with any rule system you like. The rest will be be easily modifiable to cope with whatever rules or figure scale you want to use. The rules will cope with a wide variety of periods as well.

I confess that I've always regarded the wargames campaign to be wargaming at its finest. Done properly a campaign can provide far more interesting and unexpected games than just facing an equal points army across the table. This guide is written in an attempt to ensure that you manage to extract the maximum amount of fun whilst limiting the book-keeping. Whether you want to use massed heavy armour, or ride the fleeing enemy infantry down with your wild horsemen, this rule set will help you make sure it's all done in a suitably cost-efficient manner.

Combat accountancy has never been a particular love of mine and I'd hate to impose it on anybody else.

—description from the designer / publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Horizon 1
description:
Horizon 1 is a solitaire science fiction settlement-building game of strategy, resource management, and above all, growth and survival.

This game is an entry in the 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

Overview:

Priority 1: Establish and develop the Horizon 1 settlement on planet Cerberus.
Priority 2: Maximise settlement population.
Priority 3: Extract as many minerals as possible from the planet crust.

Your settlers make planetfall on Cerberus, 2.6 light years from Earth. As the Governor of the Horizon 1 settlement, your task is to ensure their safety, to build facilities in which they can live and work and, most importantly, to research and understand this strange new world.

Turn structure:

The game is played over a series of game turns. Each game turn consists of a number of phases, performed in the order below.

Resource collection phase. Collect food and ore resources.
Research phase. Check if scientific breakthroughs occur, and (optionally) change research focus or projects.
Movement phase. Move units, explore terrain, prospect, and move aliens.
Building phase (optional). Use Engineer (ENGINR) units to build / demolish modules.
Combat phase. Any aliens present engage colonial militia in combat.
Event phase. Draw and resolve an event card, and flip the Day / Night counter.
Status check phase. Update position of status counters on the status board. Do an approval check.


The game ends immediately when any of the following conditions occur:

The Life support module is destroyed.
Settler rebellion occurs.
There are no cards remaining in the draw pile of event cards.
Settlement population (POP) reaches zero.


When the game ends, your Victory Points (VPs) total = population + ore mined. Some event and technology cards also provide VPs.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Exploration, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Stanisław Moniuszko
description:
Players learn Stanisław Moniuszko's biography on the board while completing their own hidden goals pointed out on the goal cards. To complete these goals players should find a match between two opened biography cards. Everything happens simultaneosly so try to find match quicker than the opponents. The first player who'll "live" Moniuszko's life wins.

This game is inspired by the creators of "Snappy Dressers".

•••

Planszowa zabawa dla dzieci i dorosłych.

Życie i twórczość Stanisława Moniuszki to bogaty materiał na niejedną książkę czy film. A co dopiero przełożyć to na język gry. Autorowi tej, Karolowi Madajowi, udało się połączyć element edukacyjny ze swoistym napięciem, które towarzyszy każdemu grającemu – chęć wygranej. Frustracji nie przysparza nieznajomość faktów z życia kompozytora. Gdzie podróżował, co i kiedy komponował, rytmikę jakich tańców narodowych wprowadzał do swoich utworów, gdzie mieszkał w Warszawie – tę część, pomocną w czasie gry opracowała dr Hanna Winiszewska. Jeśli chcesz wygrać, to przeczytanie tych informacji z instrukcji jest elementem obowiązkowym.

Gra wydana została z okazji Roku Moniuszki.

name: Гаспадар цмокаў (Host of Dragons)
description:
Nowadays everybody seemed to forget that the first beast to be tamed by a man wasn't a dog or a cat, or even a horse — it was a dragon! It gave it's master assistance in finding food as well as protection. And the worthiest man was the one who owned five dragons. In order to tame them you have to be fast, attentive and fast-witted.

Complete the tasks on the cards, tame the naughty dragons, collect all the five dragons (aquatic, aerial, terrestrial, underground and ultimate) to win the game.

•••

Прыручайце гарэзлівых цмокаў, станавіцеся іх сябрамі, разам ахоўвайце свае землі ад шкоднікаў і не давайце адзін аднаго ў крыўду старэйшым. Мы верым, што вясёлыя і абаяльныя істоты з радасцю стануць часткай вашага сямейнага вечара або далучацца да шумнай сяброўскай кампаніі.

name: Iconoclash: LevelMAX
description:
Iconoclash: LevelMAX is a stand-alone expansion and features 4 new, cross-over fighters for the Iconoclash system from Level 99 Games:


Zsolt: This relentless hunter never ceases, releasing his flurry of attacks with his arsenal of weapons. There’s no escape!
Khadath: The master of the portal takes to the battlefield and assumes control. By summoning his Gate Trap he can attack from any range.
Deques: Is your deck ready and do you want to duel? After studying the meta game for years, Deques has readied his deck of trading cards for any situation. Summon all sorts of monsters to become the champion!
Esfir: Bring down the house with this hothead who controls gravity. She sends her opponents flying into the stratosphere, creates blackholes, and inverts gravity with a snap of her fingers.


In LevelMAX you'll take the fight to the world of Seventh Cross with Mansion of Darkness and the Gilded Foyer maps.

name: Escape from Danger Dungeon
description: Escape From Danger Dungeon, a co-operative board game based on the Tunnels and Trolls RPG system. Can your band overcome the foes and traps which block its way? Can your band discover an exit before being buried alive? Can your band avoid squabbling over the loot? you can find out!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Flickers
description:
Space Flickers is a competitive flicking game, where player compete in an intergalactic golf tournament, held on hostile aliens planets.
Player bid on how many strokes it will take them to compete a course and gain bonus points for meeting targets.
Players will have to contend with obstacles, weather events, player special powers and much more.
The course is made up of modular board pieces, which combine to form hundreds of possible courses. The game also comes with buildable 3D obstacles, player characters card, event card and custom flicking pieces.

name: Guardian & Thieves
description:
Work hard, build a career, save in order to ensure a prosperous life for your family - this is the path that you have been recommended to follow. But if you stole a treasure, wouldn't the result be the same with much less effort? During your journey, you hear of dungeons, filled with treasures, guarded by golems who tirelessly patrol their dark corridors. How to miss such an opportunity? All you need are companions to act as a diversion while you collect the treasures and you will be "set for life"!

Each player chooses a unique character and use of cunning to pass under the nose of the guardian, embodied by OLEM. Take turns using your moves and actions to explore the dungeon and implement your strategy. But beware! If the Guardian hears you or spots your torchlight, he will tirelessly pursue you to try to imprison you!

Guardian and Thieves integrates the robot and board and takes advantage of the connection to the smartphone. Connect your phone to your speakers to fully enjoy the background music and let OLEM transport you, which reacts to your actions.

On their turn, a player moves his thief from 0 to 5 tiles and can perform 1 of several actions. But beware, some of these actions can aler t the golem to your presence!

The players win if they succeed to bring at least one treasure to the dungeon entrance.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Lose a Turn, Memory, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Venari
description:
An abstract strategic battle to capture your opponent's soldiers!

In Venari, your goal is to capture two of your opponent’s soldiers.

The rules are very simple:


You have 4 soldiers on the board.
Each turn, you choose to move 1 to 4 spaces.
One of your soldiers moves, space to space, the chosen distance along the paths.
Try and trap your opponent’s soldier so they can’t move, and capture them.
Capture two soldiers to win the round.


However, there are some restrictions to consider:


You select how far to move on the Movement Track using your token, so there will only be 2 of the 4 options available at a time.
You must move exactly the number of spaces selected.
You cannot move through any occupied spaces, and you cannot backtrack and retrace your steps within a turn.


If at the end of a turn a soldier has no valid moves (because every adjacent space is occupied), they have been captured.

If you capture 2 soldiers, you win the round.

Win two rounds, and you are the victor!

—description from the publisher

name: Rolling Stock
description:
A railway roll-and-write for 2 to 8 players

The six cities are in need of rail service, and it’s up to you to build the connections!

Roll the dice to find out what to build and where, take on contracts to connect cities, and build the longest connection you can.

Try and complete all your contracts before one player connects all six of their cities,and ends the game!

In Rolling Stock, up to 8 players compete to build the best railway networks.

Each round, the two custom railway dice are rolled.


Choose a rail shape from one die, and draw it into a space of the terrain type from the other die.
Or, use the numbers on the dice to take a contract to connect two cities.
Add a station to connect multiple rail lines, or to fill in a tricky space.


Play continues until one player:


connects all their cities together, or
fails to make a move.


Then it’s one final round, and time for scoring!

—description from the publisher

name: Tiny Transit
description:
A pick-up-and-deliver microgame for 1 to 4 players

Manage a railcar on the transit network to move as many passengers to their destinations as you can.
More passengers are arriving all the time, and new stations open as well.
Don’t let a station get overcrowded, or it’s all over!

Tiny Transit is a pick up and deliver game squeezed into a small package.
Each turn you will pick up one or more passengers from your current station, move around the circle of stations to your next destination, and drop off any passengers heading there for points.
Drop off 3 or more passengers, and a new station is added to the network!
Then, new passengers arrive, and four more cubes are added into play.

Once someone has earned 30 or more points, or a station has no room for new cubes and becomes overcrowded, the game ends. Will you have the highest score and win the game?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Summoner Duel
description:
A battle of wits for 2 players

You are a wizard, battling for dominance in the Duel Arena using your summoned Beasts. However, the magical abilities of your rival are the equal of your own — you will need to outwit your opponent in order to win. Gain control of eight Flames, and claim victory!

In Summoner Duel, two players compete to control the board. Each turn, both players choose two magic stones, and the combined result determines the current player’s movement options. Move one of your two Beasts around the board, and try to claim a space or defeat an opponent’s Beast.

You will have twelve turns to claim eight Flames, or eliminate your opponent!

—description from the publisher

name: Creature Crèche
description:
Manage a daycare centre for mythological monsters in this card drafting game for 2 to 6 players.

Welcome to Creature Crèche, a daycare centre for mythological monsters.

Your job is to arrange a room full of creatures as they arrive, and keep them happy, which isn’t an easy task — not all monsters play nicely with others!

Creature Crèche is a card drafting game for 2 to 6 players.

Players simultaneously play a creature onto one end of their line of cards, making sure they don't scare away their neighbours, while trying to arrange them so that everyone is as happy as possible.

Some creatures have special effects that can help you in your task, or make life more difficult for you… or your opponents…

The game is super easy to get started — just shuffle the 52 card deck, deal everyone 8 cards, and you’re ready to go. And a round can be played in just 5 minutes, so it’s a great filler!

—description from the publisher

name: Slipstream Pocket
description:
A delivery race for 2 to 4 players
For the fastest deliveries in town, you can depend on the Witch Academy Courier Service!

As a junior witch, you are racing to complete your delivery route the fastest. You must fly to each town location in the correct order for your delivery route, The witch who completes their route and returns home first is the winner!

Slipstream Pocket is a card game that is played as a tabletop game.

Each player controls a witch, and is given a delivery route and five Flight cards to move them around the table. Six town locations are randomly placed in the centre, and you must place your Flight cards down in a pattern that moves your witch over each location in the correct order.

As you play your cards, your movement options become restricted, until you pick up cards from the tail of your slipstream. Plan your flight carefully!

If you can overlap your witch onto a slipstream in play, you can follow it for a speed boost and pick up your cards, gaining a big movement advantage!

Can you complete all your deliveries the fastest?

—description from the publisher

name: Slipstream
description:
A delivery race for 2 to 6 players
For the fastest deliveries in town, you can depend on the Witch Academy Courier Service!

As a junior witch, you are racing to complete your mail deliveries the fastest. You must fly to four town locations and deliver mail, then return to the Academy. The witch who completes their route and returns home first is the winner!

In Slipstream, each player controls a witch, and has nine transparent Flight tiles to move them around the board. The game board is a map of the town with the eight locations requiring deliveries. At the start of the game, draw two location cards; you must place your Flight tiles down in a pattern that moves your witch over your nominated locations. Each time you complete a delivery, draw another location card.

As you play your tiles, your movement options become restricted, until you pick up tiles from the tail of your slipstream. Plan your flight carefully!

If you can connect your witch’s slipstream to another slipstream in play, you can follow it for a speed boost and pick up your tiles, gaining a big movement advantage!

Can you complete all your deliveries the fastest?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Pattern Movement

name: Inventory Quest
description:
A flip-and-write game of inventory management for 1 to 8 players.

You have been summoned by the king for an important quest, but the road to the castle is long and dangerous — make sure you pack well!

In Inventory Quest, your task is to prepare a backpack full of supplies to help you on your journey to the castle.

Draw your chosen selection of items onto your dry erase player board, then draw 16 cards from the Journey deck to reveal the challenges you’ll face along the way. Erase your supplies as they are used up… will you survive to the end of the journey with the most gems to win?

There are six types of items you can add to your backpack:

Food, consumed as you travel
Rope, to cross various hazards
Potions, for healing
Swords and Bows, for fighting and hunting
Shields, to protect against damage


The most important rule to remember when packing, is that you can only access items from the top of your bag. Pack your supplies poorly, and you might not be able to use items when you need them! If you get stuck, you can discard the blocking items; and if you’re lucky you might find a shop to buy replacements.

Try not to run out of food… you don’t want to starve before you reach your destination!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Coalitions: Levée En Masse Expansion
description:
In the basic solo mode for Coalitions the player takes control of all European nations except France and tries to defeat Napoleon. With this new expansion, it’s the other way around!

La Patrie en Danger! introduces a new, alternate solo mode that allows you to take on the role of Napoleon himself and use the might of his French Empire to dominate Europe! The AI cards in this expansion dictate the moves of the five other nations. They will try to do everything in their power to curtail the Emperor’s ambitions...

—description from the publisher

name: No Such Thing as a Free Sandwich
description:
No Such Thing as a Free Sandwich is a mint tin party game for 2-8 players, ages 13+. Down to their last few slices of bread, players compete with one another in a variety of challenges to make the best (or worst) sandwiches according to a handful of different score categories such as "Taste", "Affordability", "Wow Factor", and more, using a hodgepodge of ingredients.

At the beginning of the game, each player draws 3 ingredient cards to add to their hand. Each ingredient card has different stat categories that affect how desirable an ingredient is for a given Challenge. At the beginning of each round, a Challenge card is drawn. The Challenge card outlines which stat categories each player’s sandwich should have. Players must play a minimum of 1 card for their sandwich. Cards must be played face-down. When all players are done creating their sandwich, the ingredients are revealed and the player with the sandwich best suited to the Challenge wins the round.

The player with the winning sandwich will keep the Challenge card for the round. Once all of the Challenge cards have been played, the player with the most Challenge cards collected wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Heirloom
description:
This is the story of Elouise Farmer. Elouise was a mother, a pillar of the Littleton farming community, and was known to all in the nine valleys, as Ma. Elouise made a small fortune selling her heirloom selections to the Littleton Market. For decades Elouise was known as a charismatic saleswoman, and an absolute wonder of a farmer. Elouise’s famous heirlooms were known near and far as the best in all of the nine valleys.
Over the years Elouise invested her fortune in the lands surrounding Littleton, and until her recent passing, she was the single greatest land holder in all of the nine valleys.

Elouise’s recent passing was mourned by all around, and her funeral was one for the record books. Every respectable farmer in the nine valleys attended the service, to bid one final farewell to a great matriarch, Elouise Farmer. Ma. Elouise’s recent passing has weighed even more heavily on you and your siblings, and for good reason. She was your Mother. Her passing, not only tears at the fibers of your being, but also places a tremendous burden upon your shoulders. As her heirs, you and your siblings are now at the forefront of the community’s attention. What will the children of the great Elouise Farmer do with their vast inheritance?

In the game, the players each take on the roll of Elouise Farmer’s grown children. Each beginning the game with a family of their own, and a recent inheritance.

Each play of Heirloom is a snapshot of life on the farm. The players compete by drafting farm hands & development cards, rolling weather dice, sowing seeds, reaping the fruits of their labor, and selling to the Littleton Market! Ultimately, the ‘Farmer’ with the most money at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Kaboom!
description:
Kaboom! is a card game for 2 to 6 players. The objective is to collect points after each round.

At each turn a player, after receiving his cards, discards one, there are some special cards that allow you to roll the dice and change the color of the cards. Points are collected when the Kaboom card is discarded. The first option is a Double Kaboom, in which you have two Kaboom cards in hand, which you have either drawn from the draw pile, drawn from an opponent using the Woosh card or received during the deal. The second option is to discard a Kaboom card as your last car

The game ends when a player manages to score 10 points.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Speed Matching

name: Emojo Dojo
description:
A great new spin on the classic card game, "War". Martial Art Emoji themed, multi-player all out war with special battle cards and situations. Ten different Emoji's from white belt to black belt battle it out along with the wise Sensei.

Up to five players battle it out to win the battle cards. The last person standing in the 'dojo' is the winner. There are three types of "FACE-OFF" cards; Standard, Roundhouse and Tag-team, each keeps the battles interesting. Several special circumstances such as:
Double Trouble: Separate battles take place at the same time.
Lucky Strike: All cards in consecutive order (4,5,6,7), lowest card wins.
Loco Mojo: All players advance to the next level battle.
Go!-Low: Two cards are the same rank but lower than the highest card (3,3,10), The high card has the option to surrender or join in the battle. These make each hand dynamic and exciting.

Emojo Dojo has three levels of play; Sly's Battle (Easy), Basic Play and Sensei Rules (complex).

The thing everyone hates about WAR is watching two people exchange cards for hours. Emojo Dojo has "Elimination Rules" that reveals a quick winner as the players get knocked out. This keeps games quick and everyone interested and engaged.
mechanics: Kill Steal, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Cheddar Blitz
description:
Fast-paced racing game! All players race at the same time to complete five unique Challenges. Players scramble to match their BLiTZ Row to their Challenge cards while preventing others to match theirs. Special "FLiP OUT" cards forces any player to swap out their current Challenge card and start over.

Each player starts with 5 challenge cards (top one face up), two round BLiTZ cards in their hand and four face up on the table. There are 2 draw piles and a discard area. Play begins when the dealer says "Blitz". The play action is DRAW, DISCARD, DOWN. Players (simultaneously, not taking turns) draw a round Blitz card, then discards (face up) a card that they don't need. This card becomes available for other players. Then places one down from their hand to fill in the row. When a player matches their BLiTZ row to their Challenge card, they yell "CHEDDAR" and all play pauses while they reset the board and turn over a new challenge card.
You can use any number of wild cards and can rearrange your row at any time. The winner is the one who completes all five Challenges and Shouts "CHEDDAR!"

Unique colorful round BLiTZ cards highlights the special Emoji on each card.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Race, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Champions!
description:
Let the Tournament begin! You and an opposing commander shall face off in a battle of wits for the prestigious title of Royal Commander!

In Champions!, two players will take turns upgrading and commanding legions of warriors to defeat their opponent in battle.

The game is played on an imagined 6 row by 3 column board, with either player picking one of the far back rows as their base row.

Each turn has two phases:
1. Movement: you will move your units around the board (rotate, move, fight). Cards move one space per turn.
2. Reinforce: you will summon a new scout or upgrade a scout to a champion (recruit, upgrade).

You win the battle, and the title of Royal General, if you move one of your units into your opponent’s base row.

name: Stacks
description:
Bluffing, to a science.
Stacks is a 15-card, 3-4 player bluffing game where the stakes are high and they keep raising.

Overview
Play cards each turn to increase the point value of your Stack. Make a bid that matches the value of all the cards in your Stack. Keep raising the Bid each turn to stay in the round. Get caught lying, and your opponent takes everything. Beware the dastardly -10 card, or use it yourself to catch your opponents by surprise.

Each round of Stacks is about a minute long, from dealing the cards to scoring the points. Play a few rounds at lunch or a few hundred.

name: Panama
description:
Our fleet’s halfway around the world. It’ll be smooth sailing once we’re through the famously crowded Panama Canal. But another famous Captain has accidentally been scheduled for the same day!

In Panama, you must use your fleet’s special abilities to push your ships through the Panama Canal before your opponent!

Each player controls a fleet of 9 ships. Each ship has a special power that makes it unique. On your turn, pick one of your ships and move it one space per your ship's special abilities.

To win, move six of your nine ships through the Panama canal, past all of your opponent’s ships, and off the opposite end of the board, past all of your opponent’s ships.

name: Kreuz-Mühle
description:
Each player has 12 playing pieces of one color. In the first stage of the game players take turns placing their pieces on the intersections of the board, attempting to make a connected line of three inside one of the five squares on the board. A line with pieces in more than one square doesn't count. Once all the pieces have been placed, the players may slide them. Whenever a player makes a line of three, he removes an opponent's piece of his choice, which is not part of a line of three. When one player has only three pieces left, he is allowed to move any piece from any point on the board to any other point. As soon as one player is left with only two pieces, his opponent wins the game.

—user summary

name: Color-Coded: The Violet Vendetta
description:
In Color-Coded's first ever expansion, players are given new 'Play' cards which adds interesting twists to the game because now, your decoded cards fall prey to The Violet Vendetta!

Color-Coded: The Violet Vendetta adds 20 more color cards and 20 more 'Play' cards to the Star Deck.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Color-Coded: The Orange Obstacle
description: In the second expansion to Color-Coded, players now face an entirely new challenge in the form of Obstacles which add on new tasks and hindrances when trying to decode their Code cards!

name: Color Coded: The Grey Guild
description: In the third expansion of Color-Coded, players now try to vie for the favor of the mysterious Grey Guild. To do so, players must now work as teams of two against another to see who is worthy to join their ranks by decoding six codes together, decoding new Wild Codes and scoring Grey Bonuses to help aid in their endeavors. Which team is worthy to join the Guild?

name: Das ÖVA-Spiel
