description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 65 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. At the beginning of the game and after the 4th turn the players have to pay an insurance fee.
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: AgroChemineer
description:
AgroChemineer is an industrial resource management game for 2 to 4 Players that features simultaneous gameplay and an innovative new economy mechanic.

Players buy, manage, then sell different resources until the end of the game year (when a player reaches 10 points)

The player with the most points wins.

With more mouths to feed around the globe, the business of getting the most out of crops, Agrochemistry, is a growing field. The materials market changes each season, so a player must wait until the time is right to purchase resources, research the perfect fertilizer blend, mix up the ingredients in reactors, and fill orders while the demand is at it's highest!
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Market, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Devil in the Wilderness: A Game of Witchcraft, Puritans, and New England Indians
description:
It is 1689 and King Philip's War, between the Northern English colonies and the Native peoples, is over. Atrocities have been committed by both sides. But the fighting isn't done -- five factions still vie for control of New England...

Devil in the Wilderness is a colonial gothic-horror skirmish game for 1-5 players. A typical game plays in 2 hours and needs a 4x4 game surface with village terrain and 10-15 miniatures per side.

The game can be played using the cards and the traditional rule-book, or with an online game app, available through Application of Force, which works on PCs, smart phones, or tablets. (Both games use the same rules, miniatures, terrain, and dice.)

—description from the publisher
categories: American Indian Wars, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Suspicious Brew
description:
Story:
Our reigning emperor is obsessed with two things: war and herbal tea. In times of war, we are largely free. Since our nation is at peace, we are all forced to spend every waking moment serving the Emperor tea. It's worse than death. It's monotonous. So, we've all decided: The Emperor must die.

So...ahem. We challenge you to a duel!

Experience:
Suspicious Brew is a bluffing game where you and your royal court are locked in a tea-time battle of wits, serving up a deserving death to the Emperor as you compete for the title of “tricksiest hero of all.” The game gets really intriguing and silly when you start choosing your secret agendas based on the evolving social dynamics of the court, knowing your friends know that you know they know you know how they play each role, and that they will use that against you, and you know it! When that happens, you feel determined to outwit them, or to just plain old lie your pants off to thwart their efforts!

Interesting elements:
Your Agendas are chosen, not dealt randomly. The role of Emperor has all the authority to make decisions, and the players they rely on have all the first hand information and are the only ones who can influence the outcome of each round. Each Secret Agenda has a vague alignment, but everyone is in it for themselves, so cooperation outside of your "faction" can be valuable. Everyone has the chance to play the Emperor once before the Emperor dies. The emotional stakes are lower than many other bluffing games, because the narrative being played out is absurd, and person who gets screwed over ultimately is not any of the players but the fictional Emperor.

This game is certified non-toxic to friendships.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Real-Time, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Goblin Civil War
description:
A bit like the Spanish civil war but with goblins!
characterful easy to paint miniatures, plus a easy to pick up unit-based system, filled with lots of hard choices.
plays out in 2-3 hours

Its a classic 28mm scale, platoon VS platoon wargame 30-50 models a side with a emphasis on infantry, you are fighting for control of objectives and victory points.

The setting is inspired by the Spanish civil war but we have played around with the factions slightly and added units for reasons of game balance and flavour that were not in the real SCW.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Turn Order: Role Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Taalhelden van het spelwoud
description:
The language heroes (Taalhelden) jump into action to defeat the monsters of the game forest with you. The game forest is full of dangerous creatures that feed on language and only the language heroes can defeat them. Choose your favorite language hero, create your own game forest and work together to defeat the monsters with your language skills!

The educational game can be played at different levels: level 1 from group 4 to level 3 for groups 7 and 8. The game can be played at school or at home and contains a booklet with no less than 60 texts to train your brain.

Players place cards on the table to form a path through the Game Forest. With personal language heroes, they walk the path to find treasure chests and defeat bosses. To defeat bosses, players answer questions related to texts they read. By answering a question correctly, the players earn stars, which are added together at the end of the game to form a high score.
Can you and your team get the best high score? Let the adventure begin!



Kidsweek Taalhelden van het spelwoud is a game about creating an adventure together and slaying monsters with your language skills. Each turn, players place cards to create a route towards boss monsters and treasures. They move on this created route with their heroes to reach treasures and to battle boss monsters. Battling monsters will cost players a live, so they need to collect those lives back by looking for treasures. By answering questions (fighting boss monsters) about the Dutch language, players score stars together. The game ends when the deck of cards runs out. Try to earn a lot of stars to increase your score and set you highscore.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Carnage
description:
A semi-cooperative board game of terror and violent survival. Inspired by the greatest works of horror, Carnage is a game driven by your choices and your ability to survive against deadly traps, madmen and even your friends. For 2 to 6 players from 14 years old. Filled with Easter eggs from popular horror movies, old and recent, this is a must for the lovers of the genre. There are tons of references to slashers, psychopaths and other villains as well as iconic locations and items.

Each player gets 4 actions to spend during a turn.

To win:
1. Complete your personal objective
2. Start the power in the Engine Room
3. Unlock the door to the Control Room
4. Get out

Highlights
1. Simple gameplay for an instant immersive experience, while complex in its variables for a great replayability.
2. Play certain cards at ANY time, including when you are not the active player.
3. Get through twisted and deadly traps that will certainly test your nerves.
4. Embrace your madness and take advantage of it if you would lose your sanity.
5. If you die, you now play as a Deranged to hunt and kill the other players.
mechanics: Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Dastardly
description: Players play "tactic" cards in order to complete tasks. Tasks grant rewards when completed and are assigned faster as the game progresses. If too many tasks build up, a player is eliminated. Players may chain copies of the card(s) a player plays on their turn. Game encourages players to copy, counter, and steal each others' cards and tasks.
mechanics: Action/Event, Chaining, Events, Interrupts, Move Through Deck, Player Elimination

name: Houdini-Opoly
description:
Houdini-Opoly is an exciting hero board game for 2-6 players built around the life of one of the most exciting personalities in history.

As you go around the board you will learn about the life of this great icon of the entertainment field, in a fun way. The real estate properties on the board are the actual key places in Houdini's life in chronological order. Each of the property deed cards has additional fun historic information about that particular time and place in Houdini's life. Each time you play you will get different deeds and land on different spots so both the both the enjoyment, and your knowledge about Houdini will increase.

Uses typical Monopoly rules and movement and has 14 tokens.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: ワラドの冒険 拡張＃1 (それぞれの物語) (Adventure of Warado Expansion #1 (Each Story))
description:
ワラドの冒険 拡張＃1 (それぞれの物語) Warado no bouken kakuchou #1 (Sorezore no Monogatari) - Adventure Of Warado Expansion #1 (Each Story) is a small expansion deck for the base game Adventure of Warado. The expansion is only for 4 or 5 players. It is not designed for 2 or 3 players.

The deck of 16 events cards is split into two types of 8 cards each, for the first and second part of the game respectively. Each set of 8 cards is shuffled and 4 are dealt face down in a row along the top of the normal adventure section.

As players advance their cubes through the adventures, past the normal first column, the event cards are then triggered. The events for adventures 2-5 need four cubes to be advance, the latter events for adventures 6-9 need only three cubes to be advanced.

Some of the events are immediate, and some will affect scoring at the end of the game. Usually, one player will benefit by an event whilst the rest suffer.
user summary

name: ワラドの冒険 拡張 ＃2 (魔法陣と東方の精霊)  (Adventure of Warado Expansion # 2 (Magicians and the Spirit of the East))
description:
ワラドの冒険 拡張 ＃2 (魔法陣と東方の精霊) Warado no bouken kakuchou # 2 (Mahou-jin to touhou no Seirei) - Adventure of Warado Expansion # 2 (Magicians and the Spirit of the East) is a free to print'n'play expansion to Adventure of Warado. The expansion is for 5 players only, and is printed on A4 sheets.

This expansion offers 7 new cards to add to the base game, 5 magicians to aid your quest, and 2 Spirits, special magical creatures.
user summary

name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Yudong, 1948
description:
As an expansions, it was listed together with the Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Huaihai, 1948-1949 . It tells the battle between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party in the east of Henan Province in June 1948 before the outbreak of the Huaihai Campaign.

With independent rule book and accessories, it can not only play independently, but also link with Jinan campaign and Huaihai Campaign.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Devil in the Wilderness: French Expansion Deck
description: This 18-card expansion pack adds Baron St. Castine and the French faction to games of Devil in the Wilderness.
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Wargame

name: Devil in the Wilderness: Wabanaki Expansion Deck
description: This 18-card expansion deck adds Madockawando and the Wabanaki Indians to games of Devil in the Wilderness.
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: La Guerre à Outrance: Grand-Tactical Franco-Prussian Warfare in Miniature
description:
La Guerre à Outrance is a traditional miniatures game for recreating the larger actions of the Franco-Prussian War in 1870. Players maneuver brigades -- whole armies can be fielded to re-play entire battles over the course of a normal gaming session. It is designed to be a fast-play alternative to other grand-tactical systems, and uses a common basing system for figures. Time, figure, and ground scales are higher, making for shorter, more decisive actions.

The emphasis is on army and corps-level command: the functions of lower-level generals and officers are handled by the system. This speeds play, and lets players focus on commanding armies instead of regiments or brigades. The game does not use dice, and allows one or more players to use a device to moderate play. The interface is simple and easy to use.

The system is built on a large body of research into the weapons, formations, and doctrine of the period, hiding this complexity to let players experience a more detailed level of simulation in a fast-play format. So go ahead and discover what it is like to fight war to the uttermost, in the most decisive European conflict of the later 19th century!

—description from the publisher

name: Tales of Vespershard
description:
Tales of Vespershard (ToV) is a miniatures skirmish game (32mm) with a fantasy aesthetic. It is based on the Uud universe, created by the Eldritch Foundry. The Vespersdhard represents the ability players have to shape their own universe.
We provide the story and a basic background. The players can use that to come up with any new adventure, story, and campaign, changing and adapting it totheir ideafor a fast and fun miniatures game.

You want an elven-forged empire which has subdued all other races? Or do you want dragons easily upholding the plains? Or maybe for nightmares to come true at night and hunt down the unwary? Well, you can make all this a reality in ToV.

Many things are customizable at the rules level (scenery, campaigns, enemies ...), but you can also customize the miniatures for your gang thanks to the powerful Eldritch Foundry app, an indispensable collaborator for our project.

Fight against your friends in dynamic battles between gangs, with a narrative touch and with heroes designed by you. Evolve your gang and link scenarios to create your own narrative campaign.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Race, Role Playing

name: Mahanadi
description:
You are working together to save a life-giving river and its ecosystem. For each one of us, It is not just flowing water, but a deep connection to our being. How will we all work together to save it from contamination?

The players are specialists in their own right taking unique roles with the knowledge and the power that they bring in to save the situation and find a solution. A separate deck of cards for the abilities and contamination levels and land and river tiles for the various zones make up the components of the game.

Players use cards and place tiles to move around the board. The game ends when the last contaminated zone tile has been removed.

Players must together plan their strategy to mesh with their expert's strengths in order to prevent contamination. For example, the Tribe head can identify and find cures for ecosystem contamination, and the bio-Scientist needs only four cards of particular contamination to cure it instead of the normal five—but the contamination is spreading rapidly and time is running out.

If contamination spreads beyond recovery or if too much time elapses, the players all lose. If they stop and regenerate the ecosystem, they all win!
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Arena Brutalis
description:
Arena Brutalis is a miniature wargame where players battle in a arena with futuristic war machines and weapons. Players can customize their team, select and swap unique weapons and equipment in game, pose their minis, and fight for glory! Miniatures are 3d printed at home and designed to have articulation with customization capability. This unique system was engineered and tested to create the most immersive and robust tabletop game in the world (big claim). It's fun, it's funny, it's ridiculous, it's Arena Brutalis!

First released in 2020, the 2nd edition features updated rules.

go to www.arenabrutalis.com to find out more!
categories: Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Turn Order: Random

name: Deutsches Volkstrachtenspiel
description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 60 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The Supplement edition was printed in a magazine - most likely "Onkel Antons Kinderkalender" - had the same board design and came with cut out meeples.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Verba Volant, Scripta Manent
description:
Liar's Dice with letter cards. The first player draws 5 cards and announces a word of 4 letters or less that they claim is in their hand. The next player either accepts or refuses.

- If they accept they get the whole hand of cards, discard a card and draw two cards, and claim a word in their hand longer than the previous one, and the next player must accept or refuse.

- If they refuse the hand is exposed. If the claimed word is in it, the person who claimed the word gets 1 point per letter in the word. If it isn't, the challenger gets those points. Either way, the hand is discarded and the next player starts the process again with a new 5-card hand.

- The first player to 25 points wins.

name: Devil in the Wilderness: "Afflicted" Expansion Deck
description: This 18-card expansion pack and PDF reference guide allow a player to become the "Afflicted" of Salem and accuse other players of witchcraft, unleashing angry mobs on the hunters.
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Army of the Rhine: Ombre de Turenne – The War of the Grand Alliance on the Rhine, 1688-1697
description:
Army of the Rhine is the fourteenth volume in Red Sash Games’ Lace Wars series. This game is the last in a set of four dealing with the War of the Grand Alliance (1688-1697). This war, sometimes called the War of the League of Augsburg or the Nine Years' War, was the second of the three great wars of Louis XIV.

As a young man he waged the Dutch War to expand France’s borders. That was a war of aggression. As an old man he fought the War of the Spanish Succession to put his grandson on the throne of Spain. Despite the King’s ultimate aim, that was a defensive war. The War of the Grand Alliance was Louis’ war of middle age – a war of grinding attrition involving nearly a million men. There was not even supposed to be a war, only a demonstration of France’s power. France was engaged in a long process of securing her eastern and northeastern frontiers. Louis felt his prestige was on the line when some of his German neighbours – specifically the Elector Palatine and the good burghers of Cologne – refused to give him what he wanted. A strong message needed to be sent. Also, by taking military action the French would put heart into the Turks, who were fighting a losing battle against the forces of the Holy League; keeping the Ottoman Empire in the game would ensure the Holy Roman Emperor could not support the minor powers who were the real object of King Louis’ wrath. But, things did not go as planned.

In Army of the Rhine, you will have a chance to change history – and perhaps you can win enough glory to write your name in the history books. As the Allied commander you lead a motley collection of troops. They are nearly all German, but that means very little. In the Empire, a prince only contributes greatly to the Cause if he expects to be greatly rewarded; otherwise, he will contribute as little as he thinks he can get away with. And, because the princes have the option to aid either Emperor Leopold or King William of England, they can play the one off against the other without being accused of letting the side down. Vienna may tell you to expect 30,000 men from Brandenburg, only to learn their Elector has chosen to fight in Brabant this year, because King William paid him in advance. And as for expecting help from the Emperor himself, forget it. French passivity in the face of your outstanding defense of the frontier last year has given him the excuse to siphon away yet more resources to his never-ending Hungarian war.
categories: Age of Reason, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Devil in the Wilderness: United Colonies Expansion Deck
description: This 18-card expansion pack allows a player to become Benjamin Church and his rangers. These men are skilled at hunting the supernatural.
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Devil in the Wilderness: Werewolves Expansion Deck
description: This 18-card expansion pack and PDF reference guide add NPC werewolves and a new scenario to games of Devil in the Wilderness.
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: ジュリアーノ王子の貢ぎ物 (Prince Juliano's Tribute)
description:
ジュリアーノ王子の貢ぎ物 (Prince Juliano's Tribute) is a board game from Japan. Prince Juliano wants to show his love for the princess. She asks for a necklace to be crafted, one part each month, before she will marry the prince.

Players are jewellers in the kingdom, tasked with keeping the princess happy by putting together the clusters of jewels she demands. The players work together, buying jewels, rolling the dice to find out she wants, and then assembling the necklace. If they do well, the princess gets happier, but if they fail then her mood falls. Over 12 rounds, can the players keep her sufficiently pleased to marry the prince?

The game comes with lots of jewels, gold coins and a long presentation box to assemble the pieces.

There is also a variant to make the game more competitive.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Trading

name: Roll Mon
description:
Roll Mon is a TCG (Trading Cube Game) for 2 players
Each player build a team (2 units) including 5 special cards that come with units you choose.

Players control units by flipping the cube to do a action After flip the cube. Face of cube that face up will take action. Each unit's cube have very own unique ability: some can draw card very fast some can attack very heavy some can use skill and more.

A player wins the game by reducing the opponent HP units to 0.
mechanics: Action Points, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination

name: Steve Jackson's Sorcery! The Boardgame
description:
Steve Jackson's SORCERY! The Boardgame is a fantasy co-op adventure of exploration, tactical combat, and decision-making for 1 to 4 players set in the wonderful world created by Steve Jackson.


The game takes a band of unusual heroes through the unique lands of the Shamutanti Hills, revisiting all the locations of the choose-your-own-adventure book classic, adding and expanding on the original universe with the addition of locations, characters, and quests.



Players pick hero characters from Dragon Knight to Charlatan, each with their own deck of action cards. These cards are then used to overcome obstacles by activating a range of keyword actions such as jumping, manipulation, spotting hidden elements, or stealth.



The same cards contain a wide range of combat maneuvers that can be played in battle to thrust, stab, cut, breathe fire or sidestep enemies, cast spells, or support other players. The game encourages and facilitates group play since heroes will have to support each other with action cards in order to gain the most from each other’s actions and abilities.



Every location the heroes visit is set up on the location board, allowing them to explore its secrets and interact with the many available location tiles and drawing from a range of possibilities in order to decide the best course of action for the group.



Every location in the game contains new challenges based on the core mechanics that are easy to understand and serve to create a variety of puzzles, dungeons, and other interesting places to explore.



While all the iconic locations and enemies are present, the world setting has been expanded in collaboration with Steve Jackson himself to create a unique, excitingly immersive game adventure set in the SORCERY! universe.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement

name: Old North
description:
Old North is an area majority game for 2-4 players. Players battle to have the most influence points over several rounds of gameplay by maintaining the strongest loyalties to the four warring Houses in the North.

In Old North, you have no armies of your own. Instead, you maintain a court (or open hand) of five nobles belonging to the four Houses to manipulate and use their armies for your benefit.

Gameplay revolves around a central board containing six important regions in the realm. Occupying these regions are the armies of the four Houses, vying for control of each one. Over the course of the game, players score points for each noble in their court based on it's House's presence and control of the six regions. Controlling nobles in your court that belong to the most dominant Houses on the board will score you the most points - but comes at a cost.

On your turn, you will play a noble from your hand and perform one of over 30 unique actions and events. Playing a noble improves its House’s numbers and advantage on the board, but in turn removes its presence from your court – eliminating its ability to score points. On one hand, maintaining a court of nobles belonging to the most powerful Houses is the key to victory – but that means keeping them tucked away in your court, away from danger and unable to add to their House's strength on the board.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Negotiation

name: Conquer The Forest Path
description:
Who will make it through the FOREST first?

Contents:
4 Player Pieces
1 Dice
52 Wooden game board pieces

Customizable game board means no two games will ever be the same. Hidden obstacles and adventures await you at every turn!

The object of the game is to travel through the FOREST along the path of woden pieces. The moves are made by rolling the dice to see how far you will move forward and by following the instructions on the wooden pieces with pictures of them.
mechanics: Events, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Set-up

name: Devil in the Wilderness: Additional Witch Expansion
description:
This 18-card Witch expansion pack makes it easier to play multiple witches in the core game. This pack will also give you the ability to add to your core deck, should you choose. By adding this pack to your core, you give yourself a chance to play the cards that work for you or the scenario you create in your game.

Most of the cards in this release are the same as the core Witch set; however, there are a couple of surprises.
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Wargame

name: Devil in the Wilderness: Additional Witch Hunter Expansion
description:
This 18-card Witch Hunter expansion pack makes it easier to play multiple witch hunters in the core game. This pack will also give you the ability to add to your core deck, should you choose. By adding this pack to your core, you give yourself a chance to play the cards that work for you or the scenario you create in your game.

Most of the cards in this release are the same as the core Witch Hunter set; however, there are a couple of surprises.

name: The Battle of Baltim: The Missiles turn on Egypt
description:
A ready to play scenario based on the battle of Baltim, a missile boat engagement in the Yom Kippur war between Israel and Egypt.

Designed for use with SHIPWRECK, Vandering Publications d10 based wargames rules system for naval warfare in the age of the guided missile. With a little modification could be used for other rules systems too.

Includes:

A description of the action, results and long-term consequences.
Ship detail sheets for all units involved.
Instructions to set up the scenario, starting positions, victory conditions, variation rules, and a solo play option.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: BirdSeed
description:
BirdSeed is a card game from Japan. The game title is actually published as Bird$eed on the box front, and also as 'bird seed' in the game rules.

Players are roosters, trying to get food to score points. Getting sets of the same food scores best. Each rooster has a pair of favourite foods, and getting up to five of these adds points.

The food comes in three types, wheat, corn and nuts, in 1,2 or 3, or one of each. Cards showing a left wing, right wing and roosters are laid out, and three food cards dealt face-up to each one. Players then use card hands to win these food cards. Any food not collected stays in place and more food is added.

The players have hand cards to match the positions, and cards numbered 0,1,2,3 in different amounts. Players play three cards face-down, a place and two numbers to show which food pile they are going for and what number they bid. The numbers are added together and the game follows a butting process like Hols der Geier. But before the cards are assessed, any special combos take effect. So a pair, such as 11, gets you a free food card off the draw deck. A 00 gets you a food card from the player with the most.

Then players with a unique choice (left, right, centre) get their food. Then players with the same choice compare values. The highest value wins, but matching high values means the next highest wins, and so on.

At the end of the game, most points scored wins.
user summary

name: Irmandinhos
description:
"In the middle of the s. XV in Galiza several power struggles took place in different regions. The warring factions acted in order to gain sufficient influence to gain control of these regions.

The Marshal will move through the different regions and determine in which territory the revolt will take place while the 3 factions position their followers to stand in front.

Irmandinhos is a board game of political and military intrigue that takes place during the final period of the Second Irmandiña Revolt (1469) in which three players will assume the role of different important characters and will have to make secret decisions for the three factions to make. Control each of the regions in play according to your character's goals.

After completing the six rounds, the player with the most goals accomplished will be the winner."

The players program actions in a hidden way through the intrigue cards, choosing the order in which they will be carried out to try to make a certain faction obtain a greater presence in the territory where the battle takes place. These territories will vary during the game. The player who manages to meet the requirements set by his character card before the 6 rounds will be the winner of the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Beetlejuice: Joke Cards Game
description:
Beetlejuice: Joke Cards Game is a simple card collection game using characters from the Emmy winning Sunday morning cartoon "BEETLEJUICE" from the early 90s.

Beetlejuice the great jokester, has a great variety of Nutty Knock-knocks, Spooky Riddles, Snappy Put-Downs, and Groaners in this wild and crazy game. Be the first player to travel along the spooky path to Lydia's house by collecting joke card combinations. In addition to collecting sets and runs of joke cards, answering the riddles will score players bonus points.

Each turn the current player draws the top card from either the draw pile or discard. Cards in hand are used to complete sets of three (any suit, same number), or a run of three (same suit, consecutively numbered) as in Rummy. Redeeming a set or run moves the player's score token one step closer to victory.

Every step of the score track denotes a joke card suit. When scoring, a bonus point maybe awarded if the player can correctly answer the riddle corresponding to the scoring space they just moved to.

First player to the final space wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Twen Politspiel: Werden Sie Kanzler
description:
Each player chooses a starting position (CDU, SPD, FDP, APO) from wich to reach the "Kanzler"-Space to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 6, the player may leave the starting space or, if this happens during play, he gets a free turn. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the player. Each player has to travel around the outer ring, before he may enter the inner ring, by getting on a T-space. If a player gets on a K-space he may choose to take the risky shortcut.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WW2: 3CP
description:
This is the fourth game in a series using the 3CP Game Engine, which employs custom cards and a deck of standard playing cards. It's more "warlike" than the others in that it uses a familiar "battle line" format, with players competing for five "theaters of war" by playing cards on either side of them.

During the game you’ll acquire Force cards representing Land, Air, Sea, and Production – by playing 3-card poker hands from a hand of seven cards. (Hence, “3CP” in the game’s title.) Card management in the form of “what poker hand to play now and what to save for later” is an important factor toward winning the game.

Close attention to your (and your opponent's) needs and how the game is evolving are required before placing your Force cards; the decision can be tough. Your goal is to triumph in three of the five theaters of war -- or outpoint your opponent -- and achieve victory.

FINAL CARDS AND RULES NOW AVAILABLE AT WWW.3CPGAMES.COM! (Update Required)
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Force Commitment, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Megagammon
description: Backgammon reimagined as a four player game or for two teams of two.

name: Logic Bomb
description:
A card game of logical matching and mental gymnastics for one to four players.

Win bytes by finding correct matches between symbols using the Boolean operations AND, OR, NOR and XOR – and their opposites.

There are three different ways to play: the Speed Game is about finding matches quickly, the Strategy Game requires thought and planning, and the Solo Game is an absorbing option for one player.

There’s a master of logic within you, and it’s time to let it out!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Triviavore
description:
The Ultimate Trivia Boardgame! Triviavore highlights the brilliant absurdity of mother nature. But it also employs Darwinian survival strategies. You don’t need to know a thing about aardvarks to become an apex hunter.

Unlike some trivia games, this one offers you closed choices (“A, B, or C?”). So if a question stumps the central organ in your nervous system, you can frequently survive on hunches, or guessing.

If you think trivia questions are about as friendly as rattlesnakes, then go light on the gnarly questions. Find “camouflage and dodge” or “ink and stink” cards to build your defenses. Or land on a human to damage someone else’s habitat (or repair your own).

Triviavore takes two or three minutes to set up and 15-20 minutes to play. It is printed entirely in the USA on sustainably harvested paper certified by the Forest Stewardship Council. It has no plastic parts, and is not even shrink-wrapped. The cards celebrate nature and are colorful and attractive.

—description from the publisher

name: Alfons Åberg Tågspel
description:
Follow Alfons Åberg and his friends as they drive trains and pick up various passengers along the way. The one who has first picked up his passengers must get to the station as quickly as possible and win the game.

The tokens at the beginning show which of Alfon's two friends you should pick up on your train. Then everyone drives around and picks up and releases. So you risk driving around looking for a friend who is already sitting in someone else's train.
Each turn, roll the dice. Get your two passangers to the train station first to win the game.

name: The Sandwich Game
description:
The Sandwich Game is a fun way for family and friends to gather around the game table and compete to see who can eat their way to victory!

Work as a group to build community sandwiches then bid as individuals to see who eats each sandwich. Be the champion by eating the most delicious sandwiches, or just have fun by making your opponent eat road kill and rotten tomatoes between two moldy croissants. But beware, because your opponent might completely change what’s happening by throwing down a special napkin card at the last moment!

The Sandwich game is a card game played in multiple phases. Play starts in the Building Sandwiches phase where players take turns drawing cards and building communal sandwiches.

Once a sandwich is completed play enters the Bidding phase where players take turns placing bid cards face down in front of any player (including themselves). Once all players have finished placing bids, the bid score for each player is calculated to determine who eats the sandwich. Eating the sandwich will reward that player with the point value of the sandwich (determined by the cards that make up the sandwich). Players can interrupt play and sour their opponent's plans by playing Napkin Cards. These cards have specific effects on game play and scoring.

The game end is determined by the number of players playing. For 2 player games, the first player to 25 points wins. In 3-4 player games the first player to 15 points is victorious. For a 5 player game the Ultimate Sandwich Champion is the player with the most points after 5 sandwiches have been eaten.

name: Dice Darts
description:
This is a quick and easy luck & push-your-luck game where you try to reach 0 as quickly as possible!

Both start with 121 points.

You take turns in rolling a single dice. Before making a roll you must choose whether to roll d4, d6, d8, d10 (ones), d12, d20, or, d10 (tens). After rolling you deduct your roll from your total points unless your new total would be negative.

You continue back and forth until one person hits exactly 0 points remaining.

With the multifunctional dUltimate dice designed for this game you will always see what "could have been".

—description from the designer

name: Esotera, the Awakening
description:
Esotera, the Awakening, is a new entry into the world of TCG that takes the complexities of most card games and reduces them to 10 game modifiers, 4 card values, and 1 card archetype value. The entire game involves a deck of 40 cards, hands of 5 matches consisting of 3 - 5 rounds with 5 turns for each player. With this seeming simplicity is a very low barrier to entry for new players, but a lot of complexity, strategy, and deck building for dedicated players to maximize the win: loss of the game mechanics!

Aside from the game aspect of Esotera, it is also a cultural doorway to many religions, societies, fantasy, science fiction, and even Alien Conspiracy theory that unites all of these things into an easy to digest medium that will push the imagination and interest of the player. Finally the post Kickstarter goals of the project will be to establish a non-profit debt forgiveness program that collects Student loan and medical debts and forgives them unconditionally as a way of giving back to the greater community during these unprecedented times!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Mythology, Religious, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Real-Time, Variable Set-up

name: Checkmate
description:
A puzzly game about keeping things in check, mate.

A small game about picking your side each turn to make sure you win, that's also all about setting up for future turns.

Cards represents Chess pieces, and have black and white on each side. They are setup in a 3x3 grid with Kings in opposing corners.

The goal is to end each turn by making a move that puts the opposing King in check. If you cannot do this, you lose the game.

Players will alternate turns, doing the following in order:

Choose a card and swap it with another card, according to standard Chess rules.
Flip over either of those cards.
Move your token on top of the card that is putting the opposing King in check. You cannot use a card covered with a token.


For check, you are not playing as Black or White. On the end of your turn, you are playing the most prominent color on your side of the grid, and you must have the opposing color King in check.

The game ends when a player cannot claim check. They lose.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Happy Planets
description:
Happy Planets is a space-themed 24 cards game where the planet's satisfaction will prove to be essential.

You are the new system manager of our company. It is time to prove yourself. Distribute your planets as best as you can in order to create a solid trade route among them, carrying out monthly objectives. The more needs are met, the happier they will be.
Remember: A planet that pays its toll is a happy planet!

You can play alone or with friends, all players work to (or help each other) build a new commercial empire from scratch. Using 24 cards, 1 core objective (Happiness) and a variable secondary objectives system (3 per game). Happy Planets changes every time you play it!

Each turn, players will take 1 card (when the game starts, they take 2) from the deck and play one of them in the galactic system. Every planet that is put on game increases the Happiness of the surrounding ones while increasing its own. This will depend on each planet's needs and production.

While in cooperative mode, players will have to communicate and plan without revealing their own cards in order to grow their planets' happiness in the most efficient way, but taking on account the secondary objectives. Planets with a happiness level below minimum will score negative points, so be careful.

In semi-cooperative mode, every player has their own personal objective, which everyone can see.

In competitive mode, secondary objectives are applied to all players, but every player has their own galactic system!

The game ends when all cards have been placed. Players will then see if they have reached the objective scores for the current game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Цар на Историята: Бонус тесте (King of History: Bonus Deck)
description:
Additional deck that adds 45 cards with events from Bulgarian history and 4 bonus cards, giving players that puts even more challenges on the way to the crown of the tsar.


Тестето съдържа 45 карти със събития от българската история, както и 4 бонус карти.

Закупувайки продукта, играчите си осигуряват по-вълнуваща игра, в която пътят към царската корона се изпълва с още предизвикателства.

name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series One
description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 1 includes 4 Time-Spaces:
- Eurasia 120M BC
- Egypt 3100 BC
- Athens 400 BC
- Luna 3400 AD

Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:
- Momochi Sandayu
- Fuma Kotaro
- Mochizuki Chiyome
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pot o' Gold
description:
Pot o' Gold is played with the provided board, two distinct dice, and a number of distinct tokens representing leprechauns: the rules recommend three for two players, four for three players, five for four or five players, and six for six players (or more, since there is no actual maximum player count).

Before each of three rounds players bet on one leprechaun to win and another as an alternate. Players then take turns rolling the dice, one of which always moves a leprechaun forwards and the other of which may move one backwards; the player rolling the dice decides which leprechaun(s) to move.

When a leprechaun reaches the end of the track it pays out: players who bet on it to win split a pot (100 times the round number) and players who bet on it as the alternate split a half-size pot. The player with the most points after three rounds wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Epic Dice Tower Defense: 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
This expansion adds 6 neoprene play mats and a set of red and green dice for up to 6 players.

This was unlocked during the KS campaign.

name: Endgame
description:
Endgame is a Chess variant which starts with the game already in progress, more or less.

Before the game starts players secretly purchase pieces using points. There is a maximum number of pieces of each type, but this is not always the same as in the standard game (e.g. a player can purchase two queens). The cost per piece goes up as more of the same type are purchased.

Once the players have their pieces they take turns placing them on the board, but all pieces except the kings (which are placed last) are placed on randomly-determined squares.

Once the pieces have been placed play proceeds according to the usual rules.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Hot Diggity Dog
description:
You are a hot dog vendor in a brand new baseball stadium looking to make a name for yourself as you get out there and sell juicy ballpark hot dogs to the hungry crowd of baseball fans. Your manager has told you to get out there and 'SELL, SELL SELL!' as you take to the Grandstands to move as many hot dogs as you can to keep the crowd happy and in their seats.
In the game Hot Diggity Dog, 2 to 5 players grab their trusty hot dog supply box and hit the Grandstands, looking to turn their carefully selected inventory into fistfuls of cash. Moving quickly but strategically around the sections, they look for opportunities to turn dogs into dollars and make the most of the seven innings before the concessions begin to close down.

In every inning of the game, each player has 5 action points to take any combination of the actions listed below to increase their sales.
With these points, they can:
- Fulfill a hot dog order (1 AP)
- Move to an adjacent (no diagonals) Grandstand section (1 AP)
- Hawk your hot dogs to the crowd, adding another order to the section you are in (1 AP)
- Play a 'Dog Eat Dog' card (1 AP)
- Return to the commissary and restock your supply box (2 AP)

An event is revealed from the Huge-0-Tron deck at the top of every inning, potentially altering the course of play for the next turn. Players must also be on their toes and watch for opportunities to capture extra points by fulfilling the combination showing on the top card of the Incentive deck. There is also an optional player interaction deck, the Dog Eat Dog deck, which allows you to get hands on in thwarting the efforts of your fellow vendors while you seize crazy opportunities to better your own position.

Carefully choose your route through the Grandstands, manage your delicious inventory, and seize the best opportunities to turn dogs into dollars to claim the spot as 'Top Dog' by the time the last 'Out' is called!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Rondel, Worker Placement

name: Black Stories Junior: Magic Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "black stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "black stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Magic Stories contains enchanting riddles full of glittering secrets all about cotton candy-farting unicorns, heroic dragon slayers, or mixed-up potions. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

name: 金色军号——军史主题文创桌游 (Golden Bugle)
description:
The game is a Chinese People's Liberation Army(PLA) history-themed board game that integrates educational and interesting features. The teaching aids are based on key events in the history of the Chinese PLA, and the design intention of “long history, tide of the times” is selected, and the content of military history education is scientifically combined with pedagogy and game science, so that participants can fully understand and deeply understand the Chinese people. The history and classic events of the People's Liberation Army. Relying on the past accumulation of military history knowledge and familiarity with game strategies, game participants can immersely feel the hardships and glory of the Chinese PLA’s journey. As the participants merge each tributary of events into the long river of military history, no one does nothing. I kind of reverence for the army from the heart.
《金色军号》是一款集教育性和趣味性为一体的中国人民解放军军史主题桌面游戏。教具以中国人民解放军历史关键事件为主线，选取“历史长流、时代大潮”的设计意向，将军史教育内容科学地与教育学、游戏学相结合，让参与者能够全面熟识并深度理解中国人民解放军的历史与经典事件。游戏参与者依托过往的军史知识积累、游戏策略熟识，能够沉浸式感受到中国人民解放军征程的艰辛与荣耀，在参与者将每一个事件支流汇入到军史长河的过程中，无人不从内心燃起对于军队的崇敬。

name: 墨色山河——新中国史主题文创桌游 (Ink Colored Mountains and Rivers)
description:
The game is a card board game designed based on the major events of China since 1949, with the image of "long history and tide of times". Even if you have a deep understanding of history, you need strategic arrangements. You need to make reasonable arrangements to bring the events connected by the year together, converge into the mainstream with tributaries, keep pace with the trend of the times, and learn the history of China subtly in the game.
This version sets advanced rules and competition rules, giving you more experience.
《墨色山河》是一款以中华人民共和国自1949年成立以来的部分大事记为主线，取“历史长流、时代大潮”之意象设计的一款卡牌桌游。就算对历史了解深入，也需要策略的安排。你需要通过合理的安排让年份相连的事件汇聚在一起，以支流汇集成主流，与时代大潮并进，在游戏中潜移默化学习新中国史。
此版本设置了进阶规则与竞技规则，给你更多样体验。

name: Stjæl et rim
description:
A Danish rhyming game with a stack of picture cards.

At the beginning of the game, a card is flipped.
Each player will spend their turn flipping a new card and seeing if two cards rhyme (like 'house' and 'mouse' - this rhyme also woks in English). Cards that are also in a trick can also be taken, stealing the trick. If there is a rhyme, the player takes the cards as a trick. If not, the newly flipped card is placed on the table next to the already flipped card(s). If the active player sees no rhyme, the other players may see if they can find a rhyme and take the trick.

Keep going until all cards have been flipped and potentially converted into tricks. The player with most cards wins.

name: Trial by Cipher
description:
The Infiniti Institutes is an institution like no other. They are dedicated to discovering truth wherever it may be hidden and preserving it for all to experience. Their methods are, however, far from stodgy academics one might imagine.

With field agents across the globe infiltrating every nook and cranny of the world, data is constantly incoming. Of course, it's largely encoded, so The Institutes department of cryptography is its largest and most-funded, seeking out the best and brightest every year to join its ranks.

Trial by Cipher is your entrance exam. Do you have what it takes to join The Institutes and assist with the Great Understanding?

name: Kingdoms: Ascendance
description:
A card game played with a standard 52-card deck (plus 2 Jokers). This is a hack of War which adds strategy without losing the spirit of the original game.

In Kingdoms: Ascendance, wage war in a duel on 3 fronts, protect your castles, and weaken the opposing forces. Your goal is to earn cards and win wars, but as you continue to play, exhaustion starts to set in--forcing you to make compromises to your castles and pray that a war doesn’t occur. You always feel about as close to winning as you are to losing.

The game is played in 3 phases: Draw Cards, Play Cards (initiate War), and Recruit.

If a player is unable to draw up to their hand size, unable to contribute to War, or have only 1 castle standing--that player immediately loses.

The game has no win condition, only 3 lose conditions. This reflects our own beliefs that war has no winners. Even when you have technically won the game, you may look down at your Kingdom and realize how much weaker it has become than when you started.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tug of War

name: Migratory Patterns
description:
The present becomes the past. Fact becomes legend. And artifacts become myth. Throughout the ages countless works of immeasurable beauty and history have been lost to the ravages of time, their memory turned into nothing more than whispers of something that probably never existed...

...or did it?

Now, an Institutes researcher has tracked down some of these artifacts, scattered around the world in dusty, forgotten corners just waiting to be discovered and shown to the world. But The Institutes aren't the only ones looking for these treasures, and the others' intentions aren't nearly so altruistic. So hurry and decipher the incoming data so field agents can be dispatched to retrieve the artifacts before it's too late!

name: Cryptic Cryptids
description:
How much do you know about the creatures that populate the earth right alongside us? Zoology is a rich field, filled with millions of species and sub-species. And that's to say nothing of its sister field: cryptozoology.

One of the smallest departments at The Institutes, the department of cryptozoology is made up of just four very dedicated people. Largely a theoretical field, little concrete data has ever existed over the years. But with your help, that is about to change

One department member has set out on a research trip to verify unsubstantiated claims of a number of cryptids. Their trip has gone from pleasant to dangerous in the blink of an eye, and all of it will be for naught if you can't decode and catalog the information they've sent back.

name: Veritas
description:
The combined library of human knowledge here on earth dwindles in comparison to the knowledge spread through the universe around us. Secrets that we can only scratch the surface of lurk just beyond our grasp.

Now, you have a chance to uncover some of the greatest secrets of the cosmos, knowledge that will alter the way you see the world and your place in it.

You may never be the same again after deciphering the messages you've received from an old Institutes alum, but you're going to do your best despite that. After all, this is what you signed up for.

name: Do You Have What It Takes?
description:
Test your investigative skills and join a top-secret unit with QuestAir! Designed by air force fighter pilots, your escape game in a box features 12 intricate puzzle cards that lead you and your teammates through thrilling challenges. Scribble, search, and calculate, typing your findings into our interactive website. Do you have what it takes? Find out with your escape room game!

Immerse yourself in a world of riddles, codes, and secrets with your interactive game! Though complex in design, your game is simple to follow and includes helpful hints if you get stumped. Log onto the corresponding website using your game’s code to type in answers, check their validity, and complete your tryout’s stages. Pore over your 12 puzzle cards, investigating answers like a super spy, scribbling notes, calculating problems, and searching for answers. After you’ve completed all 12 cards and entered your correct answers, you officially become part of our top-secret intelligence unit!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 5-Up!
description:
Add as many of your favourite fruit the the fruit salad as possible but, don't be too obvious! The Investigator is watching, trying to deduce what your favourite fruit is! If you can get the most of your favourite fruit in the salad without getting caught, then you'll get a load of points!

Each round you will be playing and taking Fruit Cards from the middle of the table, placing them in front of you. These cards in front of you count as points at the end of the round for whoever has the matching Favourite Fruit Card.

Throw the Investigator off your trail by adding different Fruit Cards but, every Fruit Card you add that isn't your favourite might be one for someone else!

—description from the designer

name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series Two
description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 2 includes 4 Time-Spaces:

Uruk 4100 BC
Paris 845 AD
California 1805 AD
London 1905 AD


Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:

Hattori Hanzo
Fujibayashi Nagato
Ishikawa Goemon


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Topsy Timbers
description:
A team tower building dexterity game with elements of chance and sabotage. Teams compete to build the tallest tower with dice rolls determining a) their share of the finite collective timber resource and b) their chance at sabotaging the opposing tower with rubber band artillery. Built around a dynamic game box which converts to a dice tower for game play. The boss went home early leaving you and the crew to manage the timberyard. Grab the keys to the crane, it's time to have some fun... Build a taller tower than your friends before the timberyard runs dry!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, King of the Hill, Stacking and Balancing, Team-Based Game

name: Plaka
description:
Plaka is a highly thematic Economic, about managing and expanding a Clothes Store in the old historical neighborhood of Athens, with Worker Placement and tile placement elements and a unique Flow mechanism.

In the game, players are the owners of a small clothes store and they try to operate it in a way that it will attract the most of the tourists passing by, serve them and get the most benefits from the trades. To achieve this, players hire workers and pitchmen, expand their stores trying to get the most of the small place they can use, advertise their business, and even sell some of their goods via their e-shop.

The game lasts 8 rounds.
Each turn is divided by 3 phases:
The Action Phase, that is a worker placement phase.
The Flow Phase where the micromanagement of the employees, customers and clothes happens.
The Upkeep phase, where players pay the rent and their employees, as well as they setup the game for next round.

By the end of the game, players score the customers they served, their reputation, as well as they lose some Victory Points for every customer left inside their store and the tiles on the board that were left unoccupied.

The player who managed to get the most out of their store, is the winner!

name: Escaping The Bolsheviks: A Solo Game
description:
The war is not going well...
Command a small group of White Russians trying to escape from the pursuing Bolsheviks.

An easy to learn and play solo game ideal for 28mm figures but any scale will work without much problem.

TURN SEQUENCE
1- Move your forces
2- Roll for Bolshevik reinforcements
3- Move Bolshevik forces
4- Roll for random events
categories: Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: S.O.S Donald!
description:
Donald has left the bath water running, and everyone jumps from piece of furniture to piece of furniture to arrive outside on dry feet. The furniture is laid out next to each other, the sofa in the middle. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice, with a color you jump with the matching figure from the left onto the next piece of furniture, with the white joker you can move your own figure, with the arrow you move any figure back one piece of furniture, whoever is the first to have both figures of his team dry wins.

—user summary

name: Toggolino: Sternenfänger
description:
Toggolino has lost his lucky star during a romp and it has shattered into many small pieces, which Toggolino and his friends now want to find.

The player whose turn it is rolls the dice: For a color he goes to the next matching field, if it is a star field, he may take a puzzle piece and put it on. As a reward, they get a colored star. If the star is rolled, the player takes a puzzle piece and gets a reward star. For the lucky star, the player moves to the next free mushroom and gets a reward star. When the star is finished, the player with the most points on his stars wins.

—user summary

name: Der Maulwurf ist immer dabei
description:
The game consists of 32 cards in 8 colors, with associated frame and a die. 4 cards of each color are placed in the frames in a certain order (predetermined by the bulges on the cards) into the frames. A set = color shows in each case the mole with his friends with different activities or events in attractive graphics. The variation of the game goes from finishing or getting to know a picture to a complicated exchange or dice game.

—user summary

name: The Backpacking Through Europe Card Game
description:
Europe is rich with history, culture, and wonderful people calling to you and your fellow backpackers to see as much as you can. In the Backpacking Through Europe Card Game the traveler who has the most memorable trips, wins!

The Backpacking Through Europe Card Game is a goal-driven hand management game that challenges players to craft carefully considered trips around Europe. On your turn you will decide whether to TRAVEL or PLAN the next stage of your trip.

To TRAVEL, play a single card from your hand matching exactly 1 transportation icon from your most recently played card.

To PLAN, take all cards of a single country from a public pool and add them to your hand.

Each destination a player visits provides them with victory points and bonus points can be earned by fulfilling the conditions of goal cards. Some goals include visiting the most destinations in a certain country, having trips of certain lengths, using specific kinds of transportation, and for making perfect round trip itineraries where your last destination provides transportation back to your first destination.

Goal cards change every game causing players to adapt to ever changing criteria for judging the value of a trip.

The backpacker who earns the most points, wins!

name: Alliance
description:
A 1-6 player game of diplomacy and warfare in the Napoleonic Era... with a Columbia Block System twist.

Play as Austria, Britain, France, Prussia, Russia, and Spain. These major powers cannot survive alone, however. They require the assistance and support of neighboring countries, the Minor States. The Columbia Block System adds a level of granularity to the traditional style of such games.

Even though Alliance is best with 3-6 players, the Minor States create added depth for the two-player game and solo rules are in the works for the growing demand for solitaire play.

Players start each turn by receiving six cards, and discarding one. Afterwards, they take turns playing a card, moving and building units, and conducting combat operations if necessary. Then a political phase occurs in which the major powers make diplomatic plays for the Minor States.

Players can forge alliances lasting a year or more, with various conditions in effect: gold tributes, border disputes, non-aggression pacts, etc. By default, the winner is the player with the most Victory Points in cities by the game's end. Other scenarios may have extra stipulations that also determine victory.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series Three
description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 3 includes 4 Time-Spaces:
Laurentia 530M BC
Sydney 1776 AD
Chicago 1930 AD
London 4100 AD

Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:
Kido Yazaemon
Kato Danzo
Jiraiya
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Protection of Turalia
description:
Turalia is a democratic land, where people vote for the government every few years. Now is time to vote for a new president but, in an unfortunate coincidence, a fire has started in the north of the land. Join other candidates to stop the fire. But do not lose sight of the people votes: there can be only one president.

The protection of Turalia is a familiar semi cooperative game for 2 to 4 players. Suggested age is from 10 years and game complexity is low. Each game will take about 30 to 45 minutes. Game materials are a main board, a secondary board, some cardboard tiles and the following components in five colors: wooden cubes, wooden discs and six sided dice.

The game main mechanic is action selection. Players will throw dices and group them by values. A player will select a dice from a group and, for each other dice on that group, the fire will advance. If a city has too much fire, the fire will be out of control in that city. If that happens in too many cities, players will lose the game.

Then, the player will perform some actions and deploy some new units in the south. At the end of the turn, if there are enough units in a city, that city will be fortified. But only one player can fortify the city. Also, fortifying cities will improve all players actions: more movement, more fire extinction, etc. And the player with more cities fortified will win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: ドワーフのネックレス工房 (Dowa-fu no Nekkuresu Koubou)
description:
ドワーフのネックレス工房 (Dowa-fu no Nekkuresu Koubou) can be translated to "The Dwarf Necklace Workshop".

There’s always a commotion at the Necklace Workshop where thirteen dwarves work as skilled craftsmen. Even though it’s critical that tasks be carried out in a timely manner, the sleepyhead dwarves never rush to get things done. As the proprietress of the workshop, you need to manage the dwarves’ various abilities in order to produce a beautiful necklace.

At the beginning of each round, the starting player (who holds the hearth card) selects one dwarf card from the two in their hand and places it so the card is visible to all other players. The remaining players then chose which card they will play from their hand. These cards should be revealed at the same time.

After the cards have been revealed, the player with the dwarf card of the lowest number gets to go first.

On their turn, players execute the abilities written on their dwarf card in order from top to bottom in order to build a necklace. After all abilities are executed, the player picks any card from the upper row of cards placed in the middle of the table and adds this card to his or her hand. If there are any jewels on this card, the player also receives them. Then, the player disposes their previously used card into the lower row.  

This ends the player’s turn and the next player now starts his or her turn until all players have carried out one turn each.

  At the end of the round, one jewel is drawn randomly from the jewel bag and placed onto any card remaining the the upper row in the middle of the table. Then, all cards in the lower round are moved into the upper row so that the row is replenished to a total of 5 cards.

Also at the end the round, the current starting player receives one jewel. 

When a player completes stringing 8+ jewels onto their necklace string (6+ in case of a 3 player game), the game proceeds to the final round. The player with the highest valued necklace at the end of the game is the victor.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Time Vs. Ninja: Series Four
description:
Time-Traveling Ninja jump through history, hunting for rare artifacts, meeting unusual companions, exploring hostile lands and engaging in Ninja Battle!

This science-fiction adventure game features an array of maps to explore, from Ancient Egypt to a futuristic Lunar Colony. Players choose from one of the Legendary Ninja characters (each with their own Legendary Ninja Ability, then embark on a time-traveling adventure!

Players roll dice to travel through treacherous zones, hop from zone to zone, or acquire item and companion cards. As they collect, their abilities and options grow!

Each character is linked in a row, so any damage one sustains dramatically impacts the other players. Being connected to your enemies can be a real challenge! If a Ninja 'falls off the row', the game ends and the one with those most collected items wins!

Series 4 includes 4 Time-Spaces:
Ethiopia 2M BC
Hong Kong 1500 AD
North Atlantic 1912 AD
Detriot 2050 AD

Also included are 3 Legendary Ninja:
Jinichi Kawakami
Ukifune Jinnai
Miracle Kazane
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: 1:0 für mich
description:
In this simple soccer game, you just move a ball by rolling the dice. The point on which the ball lies indicates which player/team is allowed to roll the dice. The dice indicates one of the 6 ways the ball is moved to the next point. If the ball gets into a scoring position, there is a 1:6 chance of scoring a goal. The game is won by the player who has scored the most goals after an agreed time.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Deutschland Tour
description:
On a round trip through Germany, the players start with their game piece in Berlin. The player whose turn it is rolls the dice and receives a question from the question booklet, depending on where he is. If the player gives the correct answer, he may advance the number of dice rolled, otherwise he must stop. The player who reaches Berlin first wins the game. There are two different question booklets, one for children and another for teenagers and adults.

—user summary

name: Spy Car
description:
You are a Secret Agent. You have the best gadgets, the best smile, the best lines, the most fashionable wardrobe. And the coolest thing you have is your awesome Spy Car. You have all the goodies at your disposal, Oil Slicks, Machine guns, Rockets, Tire slicers, Armor, Solid Rocket Boosters, ejection seats, MP3 player, GPS, and often a supermodel or famous love interest in the passenger seat. You’ll need all that and more if you wish to out maneuver and out gun all the goons, ninjas, and thugs trying to run you off the road. So make sure your clothes are impeccable, your hair in place, and buckle up for a ride!

In Spy Car, you have one goal. Eliminate enough of the Bad Guy's cars to force out the Boss Car. Kill the Boss Car and you win. If you lose all your Vehicle Damage or Health before then, you lose.

You start the game with 6 gadget cards, which give you special abilities above and beyond what you can normally do with your die rolls. You also place out a grid of enemy vehicles cards according to the diagram on the city you are in.

Each turn, you roll 8 standard dice, and 1-4 specialty dice, which are skewed to certain abilities. The specialty dice can give you certain results you are looking for easier, but there is also a Danger result not found in the regular dice, so you need to weigh that risk into your decision on how many to roll. You will use the die results for their basic abilities, or to power up gadgets or combos, which will help you eliminate the enemy's spy vehicles.

Your goal is to eliminate the Boss Car at the end of the wave. Once 10 vehicles are eliminated, the Boss Car comes out. You win the game if you eliminate the Boss. You lose the game if either your health or vehicle damage is reduced to zero.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Re-rolling and Locking, Relative Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Ninja Galaxy: The Ninja Masters
description:
The Ninja Masters expansion to Ninja Galaxy:
- Updates some of the base game rules to inject more strategic decision making.
- Improves the capabilities of the Ninja Pawns from the base game with special abilities.
- Adds one-time-use Ninja Master cards to each faction. These Ninja Masters "transfer" Wisdom, Experience, and Fighting ability into a Ninja Pawn for one action.

The new components include updated wooden Ninja Pawns, the Ninja Master cards, and Marking Cards to track hit-point loses.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Stworze: Odrodzenie – Pre-order promo cards
description:
Two additional Event cards, which were added only for the copies ordered via pre-order campaign on the publisher's website:

1. Silent night:
- flavour: Stworza remain in their lair and don't bother people with their daily life
- effect: Every Stworze increases a countdown on their Lair card by 1

2. New mores:
- flavour: people stop caring about Stworza and forget them
- effect: Every Stworze loses 1 Influence token
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Pizza Taxi
description:
Each player is the driver of a pizza delivery service and should be the first to deliver his three pizzas, in the order of the topping images, so the pizza with three toppings last. However, the other players can order new pizzas, put wine bottles in the way and thus hinder the other players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Howling Monkeys
description:
The game is designed to encourage people to improve their own communication. Each player receives a game piece with which he wants to reach the target field. The player whose turn it is receives a communication task corresponding to the color field on which he is located. If you solve the task in the given time, you receive a chip, roll a color die and move your piece to the next corresponding color field. If the task is not solved, you have to stand still. There are also fields on which you can lose chips (red) or win chips (green). The game has 2 winners, the player who reaches the finish line first and the player who has collected the most chips.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Skippy
description:
Card trick game, everyone tries to get no tricks or only a few tricks, whoever plays the lowest card gets the kangaroo and thus basically the next trick. The back of the card can help decide which card to play. Plastic kangaroo, partly outside the packaging!

—user summary

name: Kreuzverhör
description:
This deduction game contains 48 culprit cards with the following features: Place of residence, Current whereabouts, Facts of the crime, Special characteristics, Photo, Crime photo or mug shot.
In addition, there are score cards with an indication of whether the perpetrator is lying or telling the truth during questioning, which requires some rethinking when asking questions. In each case, the interrogators are provided with a total overview of all possible offenders. There are several variations of the game, in the simplest one a player receives a secret perpetrator card and answers yes or no to questions from the other players. For each no, a point card (14 to 1) is discarded and the interrogator changes. The sooner the perpetrator is identified, the more points are awarded to the interrogator. After that, a previous investigator is questioned about the perpetrator and in turn. Whoever has collected the most points after a complete round wins the game.

—user summary

name: Pocketable Golf
description:
Players select their own clubs and play against each other to attain the best scores over a 9 hole golf course that includes bunkers and ponds and players can hit their ball out of bounds or get a hole-in-one, just as actual golf play.

Players roll dice and convert their roll into yardage to place their ball down the fairway. The player who completes the game with the lowest score for the round wins.

name: Aikido Game
description:
A game based around animal caricatures of personalities you might find on the Aikido training mat, in every-day life. We meet the 'Strong', the 'Fitness Fanatic', the 'Sadist', and many others.

There are game variations on classic card games.

1) "Classical“ Quartet: players try to make pairs (e.g.cards 1A and 1B are a pair, 1C and 1D another), by asking one of the other players if they have the card they need.
