2) Piranhas: similar to 1, but the Piranhas card does not have a 'partner'. the player stuck with the Piranhas card at the end has to do a fine (e.g. 10 push-ups)

3) Quartet variation ‘Trumps’: Here the categories come into play. one player choses for example 'Pain Tolerance' and then all players have to say the value of their card. The highest (or lowest) value wins over the others.

4) As 3 but with a dice: after the active player has announced the category, anyone can throw the dice (he/she has to pay 1 card to do this though). depending on the number he/she can e.g. change the category, take a card from somebody else, the value is doubled, etc.

5)The 'Randori' Cards (5 different ones). These cards can be used at the end of a game round (played as in 3): As soon as it is clear who has actually won this round, another player can put down a Randori card to challenge the round winner. The first player to lay a Randori card is the challenger for this round. Each round can also end without a Randori card being played. Challenges are e.g. reaction (who grabs the dice first on a sign of a third player), Mushin: try to lure the round winner from the state of 'empty mind': with grimaces, jokes, and sounds trying to make him/her laugh.

name: Zeitgeist Card Game
description:
A strategic card game played on a board. You summon beings to attack your opponent's area of the map.

You can play 1v1, 2v2, free for all and even solo! Draft or Construct your decks.

Players draw and play cards to move, attack and defend. If your hit points drop to zero, you lose.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cold War 3! VDV & Airborne Forces: the VDV, Spetznatz & US 3rd Infantry Division
description:
This volume contains new rules for Airborne forces; including Air-Assault's (via helicopter); Air-Dropped (parachuting vehicles, equipment and personnel) and Air-Landing (touch-and-go dropping of personnel and equipment via transport aircraft).

Includes rules for Special Forces (The Soviet Spetznatz) and rules for airborne equipment such as the BMD-1 and BMD-2, Gaz-66 trucks and UAZ-469 jeeps.
Also included are rules for 120mm mortars, air droppadle ZSU-23-2 AA guns.
Included are a complete TO&E for the Soviet VDV as well as the US 3rd Infantry Division -rules covered are air-assaults using UH-60 helicopters; rules for armed Blackhawks (UH-60a) and Cobra and Apache gunships alongside M1 tanks and the M60a3.


To round the book off is a special linked scenario section involving the VDV/Spetnatz seizing (with the intent to blow up) a Nuclear Power Station in the lead up to the 8th Guards Army crossing the Inner German Border -with the 3rd (US) Infantry Division tasked with liberating the power station unaware that WWIII is just hours away.

Included are rules for transport aircraft such as the AN-12 and the iL-76; helicopters such as the Mi-2, Mi-4, Mi-8 and Mi-24 (Hind), UH-60a, UH-1D, OH-58 and attack helicopters AH-1F and AH-64!!!

Take the fight to the next level! Deploy the paratroops and wreck some havock!

–Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Federation Commander: Klingon Space
description:
Federation Commander has two base games: Klingon Border (which is the same as Federation Commander: Academy + Graduation) and Romulan Border. When placed together, you have ships for the United Federation of Planets and the four major empires that surround them.

If you already have Romulan Border and want to add the Klingon and Kzintis, instead of buying Klingon Border (or Academy + Graduation), you can buy this discounted package that includes the non-duplicated parts of Klingon Border, such as the counters, ship cards, reference cards, and a special ship/scenario book. This package does not include the hard-mounted maps, the box, marker, dice.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ledger Cell
description:
Play as the five senses (Touch, Taste, Smell, Hearing, Sight) of an alien attempting to escape a scientific complex. As you explore the map, unravel the story of the Ledger Cell and your place in it. As players enter rooms, they are asked questions depending on their sense to describe an item in the environment. Your level of successful communication determines your reward for completing a room. Guessing incorrectly lowers the being’s ‘Stability’.

Win by exploring all of the rooms of the complex; lose when your Stability is reduced to zero.
categories: Deduction, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Závod o kilometry
description:
Czech children's board game. This game was to teach children the geography of Czechoslovakia. The name is translated as "Race for kilometres"

This is a very simple game for 1-10 players (in theory, more players can play)

The game contains a game board that is not equal, but the top third is slightly increasing. In this upper third there is a map of Czechoslovakia with marked large cities. The lower two thirds of the game board slope and contain the same list of cities, but it is spread over the game board. Each city is represented by a hole in the game board.

Basic style of play:
The task is to collect as many kilometres as possible between the start and finish city.

Rules and course of the game:
At the beginning, the players draw for the order (the order has no effect on the course of the game).
The first player then takes a cricket (a wooden rotating figure) - then he chooses the starting city on the map (in the upper third of the game board) and in this city he spins the crickets with his fingers. Due to the curvature of the board, the spinning cricket gradually descends down the board - the task is to fit into a hole that represents the city as far away from the player's starting city as possible.
If the spinning cricket does not fit into any hole in the city, the player gets 0 points. When it fits into a hole representing a city, the player looks at the attached table of distances between cities and compares his selected start city and finish (where the spinning cricket reached) and the number of kilometres is his score.
Then another player plays.
The player who collects the most kilometres wins. The number of rounds and the number of players is not theoretically limited.

—user summary

name: Flooping
description:
With the help of a catapult, each player wants to hurl his bat tokens into the rooms of the castle. The player who could conquer more rooms at the end of the game wins the game. Bat tokens are 2 sided with different outlines of bats.

Flooping comes with 2 different game set ups and rules for 3 games. All games end when on side has run out of bats.

The player who has the most bats in each room wins the room. The player who wins the most rooms, wins the game.

—user summary

name: Capt'n Sharky: Kampf der Wikinger
description:
"Watch out, the Vikings are attacking!" shouts Capt'n Sharky. Try to knock over the pieces of the opposing team with the marble spit. Only when you have hit all the Vikings, you may dare to hit the Viking chief. But watch out! The opponent can get ahead of you by clever aiming.

Have fun with the tabletop variant of the successful Kubb game for young and old. This board game is made of high quality wood!

—user summary

name: Zauberberg
description:
Players have to fill 3 paths of color stones to reach the top of the magic mountain.

On their turn, players draw a stone from the game tube. They can place them on their way up, or they can use them to block other players on their way up. The stones can always be used on both sides, so that the player has a tactical choice of how to use the stone. The player who was able to place all stones on all 3 paths on his way up wins the game.

—user summary

name: Tiere im Wasser
description:
1. Memory with three parts of an animal
2. Card game. Each player receives 5 cards. After that, you can draw a card or swap with another player. when an animal motif is complete, it is laid out in front of the player.

Whoever has completed an animal in variant 1 and 2 turns the dial and notes down the points. Then you draw a new card.

3. In this variant, the animal motifs are collected with the help of the dial and by card diving. Options of the dial: sit out a round, swap cards, draw cards from the deck or teammate, discard card.

The first to reach 13 points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Il gioco del grillo.
description:
The deck consists of 136 cards, 8x sit out, 8x 'Grillo' (joker) and 120 cards with different motifs from eight categories: Homes, Trees, Animals, Food, Flowers, etc. Everyone gets six cards in hand and tries to 'answer' to the given card with the same category or draws a card after. who first has no cards left in hand, wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching

name: Myster cards: Vorhang auf zur Gruselstunde
description:
A guessing whodunit from the world of books "Knickerbocker Gang".
The whodunit is told on 49 cards. These cards are shuffled and you have to find the right order to solve the mystery.

In the box there are 49 mystery cards, each of which has a part of the exciting story printed on it. The player or players must now put the cards in the right order, which can be done by carefully reading and logically arranging each part of the story.

If the cards are in the right order, one can easily solve the puzzle from the information and answer the question found on the last card.

A hint on a special card can also help. And how do you know if you have guessed correctly? Quite simply, the cards are turned over carefully and one by one, without changing their position, and the letters on the back then give the correct answer.

Reading, logical combination, drawing conclusions, recognizing sequences, all these essential elements are trained in this game, and on top of that without the children noticing it.

—user summary

name: Myster cards: Das Geheimnios des Urwaldtempels
description:
A guessing whodunit from the world of books "Knickerbocker Gang".
The whodunit is told on 49 cards. These cards are shuffled and you have to find the right order to solve the mystery.

In the box there are 49 mystery cards, each of which has a part of the exciting story printed on it. The player or players must now put the cards in the right order, which can be done by carefully reading and logically arranging each part of the story.

If the cards are in the right order, one can easily solve the puzzle from the information and answer the question found on the last card.

A hint on a special card can also help. And how do you know if you have guessed correctly? Quite simply, the cards are turned over carefully and one by one, without changing their position, and the letters on the back then give the correct answer.

Reading, logical combination, drawing conclusions, recognizing sequences, all these essential elements are trained in this game, and on top of that without the children noticing it.

—user summary

name: Calaveras
description:
Calaveras is a poker-style party game based on a popular Mexican game called Viuda. Viuda (which means “Widow” in Spanish) has it roots in the older game of Whiskey Poker, which in turn took ideas from the much older game of Widow Whist; in Widow Whist, an extra hand is dealt to the center of the table (the widow), which players can then use in addition to their own hand. Calaveras takes the general game-play ideas from Viuda, but adds an extra suit and some special cards that make the game much more strategic and appealing to the sensibilities of modern gamers.

Each player receives 5 cards in their hand. 5 cards are also dealt to the center of the table. Before the round begins, in turn order, each player can swap their hand with the cards on the table, turning their cards face up. Once the center cards are revealed, each player in turn order can swap one card from their hand with a card on the table, swap their entire hand with all the cards on the table, or pass. This continues until a player knocks, indicating they want the round to end. After knocking, every other player (except the knocker) gets one last turn, then hands are revealed; the lowest hand then loses one of the three skulls they started the game with (the hands are ranked similar to poker, but with 5 suits rather than 4)

The goal of Calaveras is to be the last player in the game. Each player starts the game with three skull tokens. After each round of play, the player with the lowest hand loses one of his skulls; when a player loses his last skull, he is out of the game. The winner is the last player to still have skulls after everyone has lost theirs.

name: 盆暮れ正月両彼岸 (Bonkure Shōgatsu Ryō Higan)
description:
The title of this game, 盆暮れ正月両彼岸 (Bonkure Shōgatsu Ryō Higan), translates roughly as “Bongure New Year’s Equinoctial Week”, which refers to times of the year when in Buddhist traditions extra thoughts are paid to your ancestors. The game is themed around visiting the graves of your departed family members through a trick-taking mechanic.

The suits in the game correspond to your different family members (e.g. Grandpa, Aunt, "That Uncle"), and each is worth a different number of points. At the start of a hand, players choose one card from their hand to bid with.

During the game play, tricks can have 1 or 2 winners. The first winner of the trick is the person who played the highest card of the lead suit or the trump suit (monks). That player takes each of those cards, and sets them in a pile next to their bid card, with a specified card on top. If any players visited the grave adjacent to the lead suit, that suit can also have a winner, and that person makes a similar stack.

At the end of the game, a player has met their bid if in the piles they've created next to it from winning tricks, they are showing another card of the bid suit, and the points for the visible cards sum to exactly the rank of the bid card. The player who met their bid and scored the most points wins.

The game includes several "advanced" modules, such as special powers; a tie-break card; and a story-telling aspect where the winner of a trick is encouraged to share a memory of a family member of the lead suit.

name: Astray
description:
On December 10th of the year 2031, a commercial flight, with a manifest of more than 300 passengers, departed from Boston. The flight was in route to Puerto Rico. Then a bright flash of white light... Moments later, all of the passengers of Zephyr Air Flight 309 somehow found themselves alive and well on the beach of a strange island surrounded by smoldering debris of their once great aircraft. The survivors picked themselves off the sand and began to search about for sustenance. In a matter of days, the survivors divided into various camps. Four leaders emerged from the masses, each with their own ideas of how to move forward.

Astray is a competitive, turn based, worker placement game of exploration and risk taking. In the game, players compete for resources by placing workers on a modular hexagonal game board. Resources are used to increase player morale, build tools, fire, cisterns, huts, enclosures, two way radios, escape rafts.

There are three ways to win the game.

Build an escape raft, and successfully draw a winning raft card wins.
Craft a two way radio, and successfully draw a winning two way radio card.
Build four stone huts wins the game.

The game ends when one of the three game winning conditions have been met.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Piráti
description:
In Piráti, the Beagle Boys want to rob Scrooge McDuck of his gold. Scrooge McDuck (along with Huey, Dewey and Louie Duck) try to get the treasure from the island to the harbor. Players have ships that are trying to save this way.

Each player has one or more ships of their color (wooden figures in the shape of a ship) and starts on the island in the middle of the game board. Two Beagle Boys are placed on a field marked with a pirate symbol on the game board.

The players gradually roll the dice - each round moves both one of the players and one of the pirates. The pirates remain only on the main route, but the ducks can hide in several shortcuts, where they are not in danger from the pirates. But if the Beagle Boys catch up with one of the player ships, the ship is captured and imprisoned on a pirate island. There is a possibility to free it if one of the players gets his ship directly on one of several squares with a star symbol.

The player must get to the port by rolling the dice on exactly two green squares, and if he does not roll the necessary number on the dice to allow him to enter, he must wait or go around the next round so that the Beagle Boys do not catch up with him.

If all players manage with minimal losses, Scrooge McDuck is satisfied and the game is won. Against are the Beagle Boys, who are trying to capture ships loaded with gold.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Dino Toys s. r. o., Ravensburger

name: Rätselkönig
description:
A crossword puzzle that can be solved by six people - with this game it works. The puzzle is clamped, the figures are placed at the start. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice and moves in any direction, change of direction is possible only at the start or on the correspondingly marked field. On the reached field you answer the first question in the puzzle, for this you get two knowledge chips. If more than half of the letters are already there, you get only one chip for the solution. If all the questions have already been answered, you are out of luck. If you want to consult an encyclopedia, you pay one knowledge chip. Event cards can be used to get or lose chips, or to get opportunities to move. As soon as the puzzle is completely solved, the player with the most chips wins.

—user summary

name: Mark of the Muse
description:
Mark of the Muse is a new card game, designed with the idea of community in mind. This system allows for artists to submit their art for a team of game designers to turn their work into a playable card. It’s meant to be fun for collectors, and a recognition opportunity for artists. Cards are of course completely playable as a game, encouraging collectors to seek out and browse artists for new cards, and aid artists by both getting their names out there and being another source of income.

The cards are designed to maximize the original artwork while being easy to understand and see all the necessary stats and abilities. We decided to not use any borders on the edge in order to see as much of the art as possible.

On a turn, players draw a card then play cards to attack their opponent. When a player has defeated 10 cards the player wins.

Certain cards have a life point on them, with only a specific amount being playable each turn. If these cards' HP get reduced to zero that card goes to the Lifeline. Cards on the Lifeline may still be used as resources, fueling other cards' abilities when flipped. When the Lifeline contains 10 cards, that player is out and the remaining player wins the game.

name: Yarr!: Stranded Scoundrels
description:
You’re pirates, and you’re shipwrecked on a cursed island where you get hungrier each night. Your goal is to not starve, and escape the island with the most treasure, all the while creating uneasy alliances and backstabbing your fellow players.

Search for resources: treasure, food, wood (for building an escape raft) and weapons (for fighting other players). Negotiate and trade with other players to get the resources you want as the island’s limited supplies dry up.

On your turn draw a card from one of three decks that are weighted with particular resources, then pick from actions such as “pilfer a card from another player” or “attack another player”. You must build an escape raft in order to be eligible to win. The game ends when all players have either escaped or are dead. The winner is the player who escaped with the most treasure.

The game also features 30 special cards which can turn the tide of the game from their one use abilities.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Deduction, Hidden Victory Points, Interrupts, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Prisoner's Dilemma, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending, Take That, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Major's Golf
description:
This board game from South Africa uses custom dice to try to replicate the sport of golf. The contents include a scorepad, instructions sheet, 4 golf course boards with 4 or 5 holes on each one (18 total holes), one D6 die with letters A to F on it (representing which track your ball follows down a golf hole green), 17 different D6 dice representing various golf clubs and distances hit, and 8 player markers (2 each in 4 colors).

Each player rolls the letter die to determine which of the 6 tracks they will follow on the first hole. Then take turns choosing an appropriate golf club die (woods, drivers, etc), each with different possible distances on the six sides, to roll to proceed down the course. There are sand/water traps along the way that your ball can either fly over (if you roll a long enough distance) or land in, which requires you to switch to a different die such as a sand wedge with shorter potential distances on it. Once you reach the putting green near the end of a hole, you switch to a putter die that tells you how many putts it took you to get the ball in that hole. Add up the total of each player's strokes/putts on that hole, and record it on the scoresheet. Then continue on the next hole. Just like in real golf, the player with the lowest score after either 9 or all 18 holes is the winner; or if only 1 player is playing, compete against the provided par numbers.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das Umsteigespiel
description:
There are 2 variants of the game, one with cards to be placed face up, the other with cards to be placed face down. The aim is to be the first to get rid of his cards. The last card to be discarded must be matched (number +1 / -1 or color with exact number). Some special cards offer additional discard options. In the face-down version, cheating is allowed, but you must not get caught.

—user summary

name: Fire Game
description:
The players get two fire engines and put their figure on the success ladder. The first to put out six fires wins the game. The fire locations are marked on the game board in order. The players roll the dice and move their fire engines towards the fire scene. The first player to reach the exact location of the fire has extinguished the fire and may advance one space on the success ladder. On yellow playing fields, an action card can be drawn to trigger an advantage for one's own fire department or a disadvantage for another fire department.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Chippo-Chippo
description:
The players should place their pieces as quickly as possible on a 6x6 square. The player whose turn it is rolls a number die and a letter die and places his own piece on the diced square or removes another piece, if there is one. If there is already one of your own pieces on the diced field, nothing happens.

—user summary

name: Bild-A-Word for Tots
description:
A version of the game Bild-A-Word made for preschoolers and kindergarteners. Whereas the original game has letters on the cards, this one also has numbers, colors, and pictures.

From an advert for it:
"Make the Bobbys, The Bettys and the Johnnys of pre-school or Kindergarten age happy -- by giving them

BILD-A-WORD
for TOTS
"A Kindergarten Education in Itself"

Start them right with games that teach as they amuse. BILD-A-WORD for TOTS is based on the methods employed in the schools today. It is a game and a toy that teaches little minds colors, numerals, picture construction and spelling."
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Forgotten Treasure: Cursed Treasure Expansion
description:
A 54 card expansion pack for Forgotten Treasure. This expansion adds brings a bunch of new cards to the game and expands the game to 2-6 players (from 2-4).

This expansion also adds an alternate win condition: There are 6 Item cards with skulls on them; If you hold 4 of these cards in your hand at the end of your turn, you win the game!

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Saviors Cards Pack
description:
This pack contains the cards necessary to use the miniatures for Negan and his lieutenants from The Walking Dead: Here's Negan – The Board Game in games of The Walking Dead: All Out War and The Walking Dead: Call to Arms. This pack does not contain miniatures.

This pack includes the Character Cards for 6 Survivors (Negan, Dwight, Sherry, John, Laura, and Tara) and 3 Equipment Cards. These are the same cards that are included in The Walking Dead: All Out War – Saviors Faction Pack.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame, Zombies

name: Reise durch Afrika
description: The players start at space 1 (Rabat). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces, events (from the rules booklet or information cards) hinder or benefit the players and points get awarded or deducted. The game ends when the first player reaches space 78 (Addis-Abeba). The player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flucht aus London
description:
The Escape game for London fans.

In this gritty escape thriller, players must crack tricky puzzles and encrypted codes to escape from the English metropolis. The gripping escape story takes them to London's most popular landmarks such as Big Ben, London Eye and many more.

--publisher's description

name: Das Escape-Dinner: Ein kulinarisches Escape-Abenteuer in 3 Gängen
description:
After a nuclear catastrophe, the surface of the earth is devastated and most of the population destroyed. For decades, a handful of survivors have held out in the bunker - until the supplies run out and they decide to find an exit. But all ways out seem firmly closed.

Those who want to survive this apocalyptic Escape Dinner must not only prove their intuition and excellent powers of deduction, but also manage their supplies well: Only when a puzzle has been solved, the next course may be served. Teamwork, stamina and a cool head are required here.

Find your way out of the bunker – but share your supplies well Because if you want to survive this apocalyptic escape dinner, you need not only prove sense and combination skills, but also keep good households. Solve the puzzles together to get to your supplies and slowly find the way into freedom.

name: Arschloch Extreme: Mit Sonderkarten für noch mehr Nervenkitzel
description:
Normal "Asshole" (German game name: "Arschloch") was yesterday!

In this new variant, it's all about committing the nastiest deeds possible to gain an advantage and end up on the throne. Special cards give players superpowers that let them see through cards, give them magnetic hands, or let them slip cards to other players.

At the end of three rounds of play, the player who has played the meanest to his fellow players wins.

name: Deutschland-Wanderung
description:
The players start at the starting spaces, representing a hiking club corresponding of their choice with a capital of 100 points. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Often points are awarded or deducted. On the roll of a 3 or 6 the player gets to chose to move his piece or draw an event card. At the roll of a 1 the player gets another turn.

After an agreed on amount of time the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

The address of the publisher has a pre 1992 zip code and the game map shows only West Germany it places the game before 1990.
The use of a tube instead of a box indicates that the game was most likely published in the 1980's or late 70's.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Transcend
description:
A single-player card stacking game. A test of strategy, luck, and concentration based on the solitaire-style card game Calculation.

Players begin with four base piles (which can only be built on following a sequence going from atomic to galactic) and four empty stock piles (which can be built on in any order).
Shuffle the deck and draw one card at a time. These must either be placed on a base pile (if possible) or one of the stock piles. Cards can also be moved from stock piles to base piles.

The aim is to use up all cards to complete the sequence on the four base piles.
If you reach the end of the deck and still have cards in stock piles that can't be moved, you lose!

Work out the optimum strategy for success (it's all down to how you order your stock piles, and a bit of luck). A good player can complete the game 1 out of 4 times, but can you do better?
mechanics: Connections, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Septenarius
description:
Septenarius is a new take on the classic card collecting game Rummy and can be played Co-op. The game consists of 138 cards and is filled with various mythic creatures. The object of play is to form melds - combinations of three or more cards of the same rank - with or without the help of wild cards. The Pegasus and Faun are wild. . multiple rounds are played until a player or team reaches 6,000 points and wins the game.

2-3 player games are not played in teams. 4-8 players must pick partners. Partners sit opposite each other The dealer deals 10 cards face down to each player. The undealt remainder of the deck is placed face down in the center of the table, becoming the stock, and the top card is turned face up beside it.

Each player starts their turn by drawing one card and discarding one. players and teams collect cards and place melds down in front of them. Players add to these melds throughout the round to gain more points. If a player is able to get rid of all their cards on a turn, the round ends.

Everything that is on the table when a round ends counts as positive points. All cards left in players hands count as negative, even for the team that went out to end the round.
A player may meld as many cards as they please, of one rank or different ranks, forming new melds or adding cards to previous melds. All the melds of a partnership are placed in front of either partner.
—description from the designer

name: OOMANS: The card game
description:
Welcome to the world of Oomonia, where Oomans live a peaceful and simple life. That was until Omenns arrived! Omenns are chaotic shape shifting creatures that can look like any Ooman so that they can blend in and wreak havoc. Thankfully Shibby, an Ooman's best friend and his fellow Oomans are here to stop this once and for all by capturing Omenns using specially designed gadgets!

In this 2-5 player game, players will help Shibby capture these Omenns by matching capture gadgets of the same name. Use breakout cards to breakout Omenns from other players to have a chance to capture them yourself. Players will use the cards along with special action cards to boost their turn. Once the deck runs out of cards, the player with the most Omenns wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Finale Ending, Hand Management, Interrupts, Matching, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Gates of Medina (fan expansion for Medina)
description:
Unofficial variant, tested and approved by the author

The gates allow you to leave the city.
Each side of the city must have an opening which is indicated either by the free space separating the walls originating from either corner tower, or by a gate placed by a player which indicates the limit for placing walls.
During their turn, a player can choose to place a gate as one of their actions, respecting the following conditions:

The gate must be placed adjacent to a wall; it cannot be placed directly adjacent to a tower.
The gate must either be placed next to an empty space on the board, or next to one occupied by a merchant.
Only one gate can be placed on each side of the city.


Consequences of placing a gate

The gate stops the construction of the wall against which it is placed, so the wall originating from the same corner tower can’t be extended beyond the gate.
The wall coming from the opposite corner tower on the same side of the city can continue to be lengthened until it eventually reaches the gate.
A building or a stable can’t be built against a gate. However, a merchant can be placed next to a gate.


Complete rules in english and french are in the links

name: Golden Top Game
description:
The game combines questions with bets. On a circuit, the players move their game pieces by rolling the dice. Bets can be placed on the dice roll of a fellow player or on the correct answer to a question card. A fast rounding of the playing field brings additional money. The player who has collected the most money after an agreed time wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ticket to Fly (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Ticket to Fly is a French language expansion for Les Adventiers du rail. Set in the US, it allows for flight between major US cities, using custom cards and TtR mechanics.

Journeys are:

Los Angeles–Chicago

San Francisco–Atlanta

Portland–Nashville

Los Angeles–Miami

Vancouver–Montreal

Los Angeles–New York

Seattle–New York
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains

name: Melbourne (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Travel the Hoddle Grid or see the sites in St. Kilda. Your favorite train game now travels through Melbourne! by Peter McIntyre
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains

name: The Sound of Midnight
description:
Deck building card game. Solo to unlimited player. Lovecraft-like themed. Standard game allows for around 4+ players. Add another artifact pack to allow additional 4+ more players. Game can be played with players having their own packs. Players can join any active game at the start of any round. No need to wait for end of game to join.

This is a 2 pack game, both packs are needed for the full game.
Book of Artifacts
Book of incantations

Casting "Bewitched" Incantation cards will affect everyone including the caster. There are "Aura" Incantation cards that help protect from "Bewitched" cards.

Tournament style also available, in the rules.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ZU Tiles: Hime – Starter Set 2
description:
ZU Tiles: Hime is a strategic tile placement game based loosely on the creatures of the Chinese Zodiac. Players choose a creature (or creatures) to build customized decks around in order to out think and out play their opponent(s). Players earn points by creating patterns of “compatible squares” using creatures or by battling and capturing opposing creatures. The first player to 12 points wins! Think Collectable Card Game meets Dominoes...but with amazing anime inspired art and super fun tile interactions.

ZU Tiles: Hime is a quick and easy game for the whole family, focusing more on its unique compatibility mechanics than it does on combat. We're hoping you have more fun and more genuine enjoyment of playing vs. the sometimes cutthroat competition that other more competitive deck building games can become. Relax. Take your time. Smile more. Laugh a bit. Enjoy yourself.

Starter Set 1 consists of the Pig, Rabbit, Ram, Tiger, Horse, and Dog tiles.
Starter Set 2 consists of the Dragon, Snake, Rooster, Rat, Ox, and Monkey tiles.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Humor
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Interrupts, Matching, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Dino Quest
description:
Your dinosaur family has just moved into Prehistoric Park, a lovely marshy nook. Now, you must explore the park, gain resources and settle in. The first to collect all resources will make this their abode. The Quest is on!

Dino Quest is a resource collection and management game. In Dino Quest, you collect resources to help your dinosaur family settle in prehistoric park. You’re competing with other players to be the first to collect these resources and sometimes even grabbing some from them!

The game has 15 survival cards. Each card lists the resources players must collect during the game. When a player collects the exact quantities of each resource listed on the survival card, they immediately win the game.

There are 3 dice in the game, one number dice and two power dice. When you roll the number dice, you can collect any 1, 2 & 3 resource tokens. When collecting tokens you can either collect all of the same resource or different resources. There are 2 power dice, both have 3 symbols on them: spin, grab and double it. The action spinner lets you perform special actions. You can spin the spinner only if you roll two spins or a spin and a double it.

Your turn begins by rolling all 3 dice. Keep aside any one dice of your choice and resolve the other two. When collecting tokens from the resource bank, you must collect them one at a time without looking! If you collect the quantity mentioned of any 1 resource on the survival card, it does not mean that you ‘lock’ that particular resource. Opponents can still grab tokens off you and reduce your quantity. When grabbing resources from opponents you must always pick the top most token from any pile. Once you’ve performed all actions, your turn ends. If at the end of a turn you have the exact quantity of all resources listed on the survival card, you win the game. Otherwise the game continues.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Race

name: Monsters Arena
description:
Monsters Arena is a battle game for children. Each player take a deck (they are different for each monster) and in own turn plays a card. On the card there are values for attack and defense. Simply subtract values and damage enemy of correspondence result. At start of the game each monster has ten life. The monster who remains with life at the end will be the winner.
If you play more than two players you have also to choose which opponent attack.
Each monster has also some asymmetrical powers that can help during the battle.
In the end the Arena has special rules to be applied each turn.

—user summary

name: Glory&Galleons
description:
The game is set in a fantasy medieval realm where the battles take place in the air. Each player is a commander of a galleon fleet that floats in the air thanks to special crystals and balloons.

Every fleet has unique deck of cards. There are three location cards on the table. Each round players add their cards to these locations. At the end of a round, the scores are calculated and one of the player gets domination in the specific location. By covering special icons on the cards, players receive extra bonuses.

During battles players receive Victory Points. Whoever has the most VPs at the end of the game is the winner.

There is very clever variant for 1 player included.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings – Hundred Kingdoms Household Knights Regiment Set
description:
Following the sweeping reforms of Charles Armatellum at the onset of his conquests, the ceremony of dubbing can only be performed by an Imperial noble of at least the rank of Margrave or Count Palatine. The anointment, moreover, can only take place after a battle in which the prospective knight has blooded his blade. These mandates were established to ensure that only men of true prowess earned the rank of Knight. Even with the Empire dissolved, those mandates are well preserved traditions and those who ignore them meet ridicule. In fact, a recurring article presented in the Imperial Conclaves is the appointment of Counts Palatine, to replace those who may have fallen in battle or died or old age.

The massed charge of Household Knights is one of the most powerful weapons at the disposal of a Hundred Kingdoms commander. Hundreds of pounds of obdurate metal and muscle, forged through years of training and experience, they have shattered men, formations, and kingdoms throughout the ages.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Koruru: New Zealand
description:
Koruru, also known as Knuckle-Bones, is a game of dexterity, already played in ancient times with stones or animal bones. This is the Maori version.

Basically, you take all pieces in one hand, throw them into the air and try to catch as many as you can with the back of your hand. Then you throw the caught pieces up again and try to catch at least one of them with your palm. This is the „Taw“ stone; if you caught more than one piece, select one for Taw. The Taw is then used for several variants.

name: Kinderpulok
description: The players should lay out picture cards on their game board according to the chosen rule variant. At the beginning of the game, players are given a certain number of picture cards and lay them out on the given places on their board. During the game, players receive new picture cards and exchange more usable ones for the ones already on the board until the target pattern is met.

name: Samsara: Das Rad der Wiedergeburten
description:
The game teaches themes from Buddhism and rebirth.

Basically, it's a race in which you want to be the first to reach space 64 (single victory). Since the game is played in 2 groups, there is also a group victory when all members of the group reach space 64.

A player rolls the dice and may - depending on the current special rule - move on, take a black or white stone, jump to a certain square. take an event card, etc. White stones can be exchanged for a stupa, which provides an aid to rebirth (restart). White and black stones may not be taken to the target field and must be worked off by sitting out.

In addition to the game instructions, the game box also contains a manual with a detailed explanation of the individual fields and their meaning in Tibetan Buddhism.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Holzwurm-Wurfelspiel
description:
Players create a worm (in the first place you receive its head) by adding colorful body-pieces according with the throw of one dieby adding pieces that match the color of the die. The same colors can;t be side by side, so if a player rolls the same color twice, they lose their turn.

The game ends when the pieces are all distributed,. The player with the longest worm is the winner.

name: Golondrinas: Un Periplo con Alas
description:
The swallows must put all their skills to the test to achieve their migratory goal, flying from one nest to another on a long and tireless journey towards eternal summer.

Includes 3 game modes: Viaje con Alas, Golondrina Tramposa y Pares de Plumas


Viaje con Alas

Spread your wings to join the swallows' journey, in search of food and warmth. Get to know the different species of these birds to group them and build the journey that takes them to their nest of arrival.

There are 4 types of Swallows: the brown, the domestic, the black and the white eyebrow. Mix the cards well and distribute all of them among the players. Whoever has an empty nest will place it on the table.

On each player turn, a card must be played in the ascending progressive order of numbers of each type of swallow, an empty nest must be added to the side, or the player must pass.

The player who has played all their cards wins.


'Golondrina Tramposa'

The game plays the same as Viaje con Alas, but the progressions in the swallow columns can be downloaded without respecting the consecutive order of their values, it will be enough that they are of the same type of swallow.

The winner will be the one who manages to have the least amount of cards in hand once it is impossible to continue with the game because all the columns are "closed".

Each card is worth one point. The first player to reach 30 points exits the game. The winner will be the one with the least points.


Pares de Plumas

Look for a swallow of the same type and collect them on the trip. The bird that travels the most wins.

Five cards are dealt per player, and the remaining cards are turned face down on one side, turning the first one over and placing it on the side.

Each player on their turn can play a swallow of the same type. If you do not have that card, you must lift it from the deck until you find one and lower it.

The player who has played the highest value card between the two of the same type, may bring down another card with the type of swallow that he chooses.

The game ends when one of the players plays all of their cards.

name: La Cripta de Plagcrow
description:
A Story based on the fourteenth century in the midst of the Black Death that attacked Poor Europe, with touches of Fantasy from the Creator Himself.

When you are on your turn you roll the dice to advance through the board. You have the option of being able to play up to 2 cards but at the same time you can only draw one from the deck. The turns do not have a time limit so you have all the time to think about playing any card or simply advance and end your turn.

The game ends when someone reaches the end of the board or you are the last player alive, since each player has a certain amount of life that varies depending on the character you choose at the beginning, if they kill you you lose.


Una Historia basada en el Siglo XIV en medio de la Peste Negra que atacaba la Pobre Europa , con toques de Fantasía del Propio Creador. Este incluye:Un juego de Mesa que mezcla un Tablero, Cartas , Dados con funciones diferentes, Selección de Personajes , Vida y muchísimo mas incluyendo un sistema basado en el puro Azar y el Riesgo por la Recompensa lo que hace que la "Cripta de Plagcrow" sea un Juego en donde el Jugador deberá pensar su siguiente movimiento y adaptarse a los Cambios Rotundos que puede dar el mismo juego independientemente de los demás jugadores. Tienes la Libertad de elegir entre una forma de jugar mas segura y defensiva, así como todo lo contrario y ser un Rival que solo busca desatar el Caos! aunque le pueda costar la Victoria. Con 7 tipos de Cartas además de ser más de 500 diferentes entre si y extrañas formas de jugar lo hace un juego ideal si estas agobiado de los juegos convencionales en donde el factor sorpresa se apaga al jugar unas cuantas partidas ya sea con las mismas personas o cambiando de jugadores , La Cripta brinda que nunca 2 partidas se parezcan entre si así como esa seguridad de saber que nada asegura la Victoria ni la Derrota, Sera tu decisión de aguantar hasta el final o rendirte ante la situación.
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Map Deformation, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: My Hero card game: Izuku Midoriya and his classmates of Class 1-A.
description:
My Hero Card Game MH-01 features primary protagonist Izuku Midoriya and his classmates of Class 1-A. Will you be able to learn all the quirks of the heroes and mirror Izuku’s notebook collection?

Play a character card from the show to attack other characters and your opponents. Attack your opponent when their guardian stack is empty to win.

name: My Hero card game: All Might and All For One set
description:
My Hero Card Game MH-03 features All Might, the world’s greatest hero and All For One, the leader of the infamous League of Villains. Will you choose to be a hero or to embrace your villain side?

Play a character card from the show to attack other characters and your opponents. Attack your opponent when their guardian stack is empty to win.

name: Mekaröth
description:
Here you are in the middle of a Steampunk universe, playing the role of ambitious little rabbits ready to do anything to recover the magic crystals scattered throughout an enchanted forest that will defend itself. The aim of the game: the first rabbit to have returned to its burrow with enough Carrot Crystals wins the game.

60 tiles are laid on their "Nature" side. Some tiles will trigger effect when reached. All tiles are flipped to their "industrial" side after the rabbit has completed its movements. Flipping tiles will trigger different effects.
Effects can be: revealing a mine (with a Carrot Crystal), radar (allowing to flip 2 tiles anywhere on the board), Treant (losing 1 Carrot Crystal and flipping back surrounding tiles to their nature side). Some Relic Crystals will provide special powers such as free movement, immunity against Wolves, etc.

—user summary

Vous voici projetés en plein univers Steampunk, incarnant d’ambitieux petits lapins prêts à tout pour récupérer les cristaux magiques éparpillés à travers une forêt enchantée qui saura se défendre…
But du jeu : le premier lapin à avoir regagné son terrier avec suffisamment de Cristaux-Carottes remporte la partie.

—description from the publisher (French)

name: Villa María: Ciudad del Aprendizaje
description:
In this game developed in conjunction with the Municipality of Villa María, the player must tour the city, passing through various educational and cultural institutions, and various points of interest, in order to get learning points, which will crown him as the winner of the game.

It can be played from 2 to 4 participants representing a group of visitors. It consists of a three-day tour of different places that the city offers to know and learn. At the end of the journey, whoever makes the most enriching trip wins, but the idea is that “everyone has learned interesting things”.

"Learning Points" can be earned in various ways during the game. The die indicates the number of movement points on the board and the number of squares that must advance on the timer. Thus, it moves around the board that represents the map of the city.

This game has the particularity of being accompanied by an application for mobile devices with which the cards of the game are scanned to obtain more information about the places that are visited.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: GEG Geländespiel
description:
The players start with 3 pawns at the four big circles and have to reach the opposite one, which is also the starting space of another player. Movement is one space forward or sideways per turn, never backwards, on the branched path. Since the pawns may not jump over each other, they are able to block each other. If a player isn't able to move, he is out of the game.

The first player to get all 3 pawns to the destination circle wins the game.

This game was published between 1933 and 1945.

name: Atlantic Crossing
description:
A ship-racing game where 3-6 players secretly-bid matchsticks in order to move from the start (Plymouth) to the finish (The Statue of Liberty). Players who bid the same as one or more others will not move, those that bid uniquely will forge across the ocean and those who bid 'zero' can replenish their hand of matchsticks...all bids are 'spent', you see!

Each round, a weather card is revealed to adjust the weather chart: from dangerously-stormy to beautiful and bright, which can - at the extremes - affect the movement of ships. In addition, each card has an Event that can hamper or benefit the ships on their journey including an iceberg and a school of whales that forces all players to sail around it in a loop!

The first player to make it to The Statue of Liberty is the winner!

name: Gormiti Versus
description:
In Gormiti Versus, each player chooses a Gormiti Warrior and picks a fight with other Invincible Lords of Nature on the island of Gorm.

Each character has its one set of battle tiles. Each turn, two of these tiles are chosen to perform two actions. You can attack, defend, move or even regenerate.

Each successful attack means that 2 or 3 hit points are lost. A warrior whose hit points reach 0 is eliminated. The last warrior standing is victorious.
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Square Grid

name: Ať žijí rytíři!
description:
Based on the comedy film, Ať žijí rytíři! ("Long live the knights!") is a tower defense game with 2 levels of difficulty - one for children age 7-12 and the other, more advance version, for gamers age 12 and up.

Each round has 6 phases that are repeated until the end of the game is triggered.
Phase 1: Taking action card. Every player takes 6 action cards in the first round, in other rounds takes 3.
Phase 2: Evil knights are coming. The number of evil knights depends on the number of players. In the first round number of evil knights is the same as the number of players + two extra more, in other rounds without two extra more.
Phase 3: Playing action cards. Players use their cards to fight the evil knights. On their turn, players can play as many cards as they can. Players place their cards under evil knights, face down, and put a token in their color on top of it.
Phase 4: Action card payment. Action cards are turned face up (tokens must remain on the cards) and players pay the sum of their face up cards. If they can't pay, all of their face up cards are discarded. If they pay more than necessary, they don't get any money back.
Phase 5: Fighting knights. Evaluate every knight separately. If the sum of the action cards under a knight is greater than the power of the knight, a knight is defeated and the player gets a point. If the sum of the action cards is lower, knight survives (card is not discarded), action cards are discarded and tokens are returned to the player.
Phase 6: Knights attacking. Every knight that survived is going to attack the castle. Every knight attack after another. A knight can destroy a castle card only if his crest color matches the color of the castle card. This card is then discarded.

After 7 rounds, if all the castle cards are destroyed, all players lose. If all the knight cards are used and the castle is still standing, you successfully defended the castle. All players are considered heroes, but only the player with the most points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Rotor
description:
Each player starts with a pawn at space A and one on space B. Movement is determined by a die. If a pawn gets on an occupied space, the pawn which was standing there is thron out and has to begin anew at the nearest starting space.

The pawns win points by getting on spaces while meeting certain conditions (color and number of the space, result of the die roll and the position of the second pawn) shown at the table at the bottom of the game board. If a pawn scores points on a space, while throwing out another pawn, the player of that pawn loses the same amount of points.

If a pawn gets on the space with the designation "Wunschfeld" the player gets to chose the color and number of this space for scoring points. The "Wunschfeld" must be abandoned the next turn. No pawn may be thrown out while standing on this space.

The first player to get 200 points wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the magazine "Neue Berliner Illustrierte" Nr. 28/75.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spillin' Beans: Grandpa-Approved Expansion Pack
description: This expansion contains 40 Grandpa-Approved cards in a tuck box. Swap out your dirty cards for these hilarious sanitized cards to play with family and prude friends!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Junfa: Struggle for China
description:
Junfa: Struggle for China​ takes players to the Chinese Warlord Era of the 1910s and 1920s where they will command different warlord factions as they compete to be the dominant faction in China by collecting the most victory points by the end of the game. Players will do this by increasing their political power to pass favorable legislation, using military forces to conquer and control provinces, and maintaining a steady cash flow, all while balancing support from foreign powers and the Chinese people. Players also engage with one another through bribery, diplomacy, and betrayal as only one will win to rule and shape China’s future.

In a game round players take turns performing special political, economic, and military actions such as moving armies in addition to playing cards and bribing other players. Players score points based on stats and controlling certain areas. At the end of 5 rounds, the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Bribery, Catch the Leader, King of the Hill, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Zum Gipfel der Jungfrau
description:
6-part board game with 4 travel cards. The players start at Basel (by bicycle), Genf (by train), Chur (by Stagecoach) and Lugano (hiking). The players roll the die and move. Each player gets a travel card, wich shows his route and spaces where events hinder or benefit the player.

When the players reach the center image of the board, they have to climb the mountain, so only even rolls count and are divided by 2, only allowing moves of 1, 2, 3 or none at all.

The first player to get to the summit of the "Jungfrau" wins and ends the game.

The game seems to have been published around 1900. No automobiles are pictured or mentioned.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Right Cruel and Fell: Wargame Rules for field battles of the Hundred Years War
description:
Right Cruel and Fell is a wargame for field battles in the Hundred Years War (1337-1453).
It covers closely-related conflicts, such as the War of Breton Succession, the Castilian Civil War, or the Anglo-Scottish wars of the same time.
The system is specific to time and place, although supplements expand the scope to include the War of the Roses, Italy (1300-1492) and the Teutonic Knights (1200-1410).
The mechanisms particularly reflect these conflicts and the interaction of troops in them, with historical accuracy and even zeitgeist.

A battlefield in RC&F is divided into a grid of 3” squares called acres, each of which represents approximately 70 yards in each direction.
“Troops” of 400 infantry or 200 mounted men are the basic units; each troop on one base with a recommended size of 2”x1” although the gaming standard of 40mm frontages (or 60mm with 4” acres) will work as well.
There is likely no need to rebase miniatures.
Each type of historical soldier and unit is accurately represented.
The status-based attrition system (step loss) accounts for both physical and psychological deterioration.
The game uses both six-sided and ten-sided dice, sometimes as singular rolls, sometimes in opposition to the enemy.
RC&F accounts for command and control, or lack thereof, as well as the character of leaders and their influence on troops’ behavior.
The mechanics are straight forward, leaving players to concentrate on historical tactics, rather than worry more about rules.
A large number of orders of battle and battlefield maps is included.

RC&F players should be ready for a challenge that accurately simulates battles in the Hundred Years War in a playable and enjoyable game.
The author is a professional historian with decades of wargaming experience, who has extensively playtested these rules with both experienced and novice players.

—description from the publisher

name: Right Cruel and Fell: Condottiero – Italian supplement, 1300-1492
description:
Condottiero is a supplement to Right Cruel and Fell which adds troop types, new actions, and special rules to extend the timeframe and geographic location of the basic rules.

This supplement covers wars in Italy from 1300-1492ce - the great age of the mercenary soldier during the Italian Renaissance.
Like RC&F, Condottiero contains historical orders of battle.

The basic rules set of RC&F is necessary to play this supplement.

–Description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Right Cruel and Fell: Help, Defend, Heal – Supplement for the Teutonic Knights 1225-1410
description:
Help, Defend Heal is a supplement to Right Cruel and Fell which adds troop types, new actions, and special rules to extend the timeframe and geographic location of the basic rules.

This supplement covers the Teutonic Knights and other military-religious orders and their eastern opponents, such as the Balts, Russians, Lithuanians and Poles (but not the Mongols).
Like RC&F, HDH contains orders of battle, both historical and hypothetical.
In addition to the topical terrain generation rules, there is an accurate map of the large Grunwald battlefield.

The basic rules set of RC&F is necessary to play this supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Right Cruel and Fell: Livery and Maintenance – War of the Roses supplement
description:
Livery and Maintenance is a supplement to Right Cruel and Fell which adds troop types, new actions, and special rules to extend the timeframe and geographic location of the basic rules.

This supplement covers the War of the Roses.

Like RC&F, L&M contains orders of battle, both historical and hypothetical.

The basic rules set of RC&F is necessary to play this supplement.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Gung-Ho: Marine Raiders on Makin Island, 1942
description:
The US Marine Raiders make their debut with a surprise raid on the Japanese-held atoll of Makin Island.
Will these daring "gung-ho" Americans carry the day or be driven back into the sea by the dogged Japanese defenders?

This campaign is designed to be used with Too Fat Lardies Chain of Command and can also be readily adapted to your preferred WWII miniature ruleset.

Contained in this book you will find:

Complete campaign setup, duration, and special rules to add variation to play
Platoon layouts for both US and Japanese forces, as well as campaign-specific Support Lists
Four scenarios based on period maps and satellite imagery
Pre-generated character names, custom Patrol Markers, and National Characteristics


–description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Musketry Like Thunder 2: More Great Civil War Battles Never Fought
description:
Musketry Like Thunder 2 provides twelve fictional Civil War miniature gaming scenarios, from small introductory games to corps level actions.

Each provides a unique tactical problem often encountered by the armies fighting the war.
These range from command and control issues, surmounting difficult terrain, to combating the weather as well as each other.
In addition, each scenario has great replay potential.
Federals and Confederates can switch deployment areas, and you can modify the order of battle to represent different years during the war.
In fact, you can use the maps and deploy entirely different forces on the table!

Try something new, where your opponent doesn't know everything about your army's deployment, strengths, and leadership before the game even starts!

These scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental or brigade level set of rules. Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand. Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn.
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.
This book does not contain rules for playing miniature wargames.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Cold War 3! Gulf States: Gulf Wars – Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, UAE, Jordan & Oman
description:
GULF STATES: Saudi Arabia, bahrain, UAE, Jordan and Oman covers the smaller Gulf States for the Gulf War (Op. Desert Storm/Op. Granby) in 1991 and beyond.
The contents of this book can be used to recreate the 1st and 2nd Saudi Brigades and the Gulf Coalition Forces.
ALL equipment and personnel used by all of the Gulf States is included.
Omani Challenger I's, Bahraini M60a3's, Saudi M1a1's, UAE AMX-30's, the ubiquitous M109a1, Rapier Air defence missiles, Scorpion and Scimitar reccee vehicles, Croatale SAM's and the M16/M4, M60a2, SAW and MILAN ATGM's equipping your ground forces.

Also included are three fun scenarios, including an assault by Saudi Forces across the causeway to Bahrain in a "what if" scenario; Gulf Co-Alition forces on Highway-40 to Kuwait City Vs. Iraqi forces and a rescue the hostages scenario against insurgents in yemen by Oamani forces.

Air power is included with F5/Tiger II's, the ubiquitous F-16, Jaguar and Mirage 2000 fighter jets providing much needed air support.

Invade Kuwait! Push back the Iraqis (available soon as a seperate book: GULF WARS: Wars In The Gulf 1990-2020); liberate Kuwait, push onwards into Iraq -or engage in any number of "what If" scenarios.

Operating a small Gulf States force is fun and brings an added element to your COLD WAR3! games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Stingbad!: Mass Skirmish Fantasy Wargame Rules
description:
Stingbad is a set of Fantasy wargame rules developed as part of a new series covering different periods.
They were developed from the pedigree of our popular Sacre Bleu massed skirmish rules, using a variable sequence of play which means even underdogs stand a chance of winning.

The rules stand alone, no other sets in the series are required, but all those in the Streamlined Play Rules Series share a core set of rules, so if you learn one picking up another one of the rules in the series is easy. Each set is, of course, heavily tweaked for the period they cover and are streamlined for fast play. We want our games to be straightforward, so we can concentrate on trying to defeat our tabletop enemy insted of spending our time 'fighting' the rules to get them to work! That is central to the design philosophy of these wargame rules.

In the case of Stingbad, included are three ways of choosing armies, and the features include amongst other things flexible unit sizes, different types of battle, weather rules, commander ratings, fluke hits, heroes and speeches, collapsing buildings, smoke and - as you'd expect - magic rules. Magic can be powerful, it can cause hills to rise up or collapse, and trees to animate and become walking creatures and water to rage for instance, all assuming you can get the magic to work!

The rules have taken years to develop, during which keeping them simple and not complicating things was a major challenge. They can be used with as many or as few figures as you want (individually based, that is!).

We hope you decide to give them a go, and enjoy leading your hordes to ultimate victory, or even to glorious defeat... ?!

–Description from the publisher

name: SagaBorn Battles
description:
SagaBorn Battles is a card based miniature game of player vs player skirmishing.

Join in a skirmish game that explores the world of the Dark Return as you compete to find ancient artifacts.
Battles can use any 28-32mm miniatures you already own, so all you need is the cards and some d8’s to begin!

The lands of Atheles have long been in a dark age, though now magic has begun to return. Adventurers, tomb raiders, and grave robbers search the lands for ancient relics of magic.

SagaBorn Battles uses miniatures you already own. Terrain can be 2d or 3d printed and is based on 1 inch.

Why play SagaBorn Battles?

Its fast. Set up and play takes around 30-45 minutes.
Its easy. You can learn the basics of the rules in 10 minutes.
A simple and fun dice system. One die to rule them all, combat outcome is determined in quick opposing rolls.
The lands of the Dark Return are full of peril and life, a world ready for adventure.


—description from the publisher

name: L'infanterie attaque !: Un jeu d'escarmouche durant la seconde guerre mondiale
description:
L'infanterie attaque ! is a skirmish game for 2 to 6 players.
It invites you to relive the confrontations of the Second World War on a smaller scale than usual.
Far from the great mass battles, small clashes between small groups of men played a role that was sometimes crucial and not recounted in the history books.
In this game the individual soldier is honored and you will focus on following his progress as the battle progresses and sometimes accompany him until his death. We invite you to create the story of these anonymous people who have forged the world we live in at the cost of their lives.
The game includes a scenario generator with 288 possible combinations, 29 skills and 6 nations represented.
The campaign possibilities are therefore very numerous and not one part will be the same.
The figures can be of any brand.
The rules are written for 28mm but by dividing all the distances by 2 you can play in 15mm or even 1/72.
The playing surface can simply be your living room table, you can use a play mat.
For the terrain, leave room to your imagination. For more interesting games, the playing area should have a minimum of obstruction items to provide shelter and strategic stakes.

– Description (translated) from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Les Voltigeurs: Le jeu d'escarmouche
description:
Les Voltigeurs is a skirmish game for 2 to 6 players.
It invites you to relive the confrontations under the Napoleonic era on a smaller scale than usual.
Far from the great mass battles, small clashes between small groups of men played a role that was sometimes crucial and not recounted in the history books.
In this game the individual soldier is honored and you will focus on following his progress as the battle progresses and sometimes accompany him until his death.
We invite you to create the story of these anonymous people who have forged the world we live in at the cost of their lives.
The game includes a scenario generator with 288 possible combinations, 29 skills and 6 nations represented. The campaign possibilities are therefore very numerous and not one part will be the same.
The figures can be of any brand.
The rules are written for 28mm but by dividing all the distances by 2 you can play in 15mm or even 1/72.
The playing surface can simply be your living room table or you can use a play mat.
For the terrain, leave room to your imagination. For more interesting games, the playing area should have a minimum of obstruction items to provide shelter and strategic stakes.

– Description (Translated) from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Blood & A Black Flag: Swashbuckling Skirmish Wargaming
description:
Grab a brace of pistols and strap on your cutlass, as you head for the desperate and blighted isles of the Triangle in pursuit of untold wealth and power!

Decide who your hero is by equipping them with feats and influence, then recruit a ragged team of unsavoury ne'er-do-wells and do your best to bash them into something resembling an organized ccrew. Then take to the streets of Devil's Spit in a new skirmish wargame from the author of Horizon Wars and Horizon Wars: Zero Dark.

With a stripped-down style focused on tactical gameplay and decisive action, Blood & A Black Flag is a miniatures-agnostic skirmish game you can turn as easily to sci-fi space opera or sword and sorcery as you can to the golden age of piracy.

–description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Fighting Pits of Baad Tibera
description:
The Fighting Pits Are Open!

Now, with Fighting Pits of Baad Tibera, you can take your favourite fantasy miniatures and pit them against each other in games of fast-paced, strategic arena combat! With rules for dynamic melee combat, ranged weapons, magic, packs of wild animals, traps, towers and more, the only limit is your imagination!

Inside this 120 page, fully illustrated rulebook you will find:

Low restriction rules for placing your favourite miniatures straight into the game - there are no set stat-lines, or skills lists; a simple, points based Fighter creation system applies RPG flexibility to a tabletop skirmish game! Create the Fighters YOU want and play them YOUR way!
A visceral and dynamic combat system that keeps your Fighters on the move, and allows you to deal out long-term, game changing injuries to your opponents!
Over 40 special Signature moves with which to customize your Fighters and impress the crowds!
A modular magic system with over 30 spell effects and optional rules for creating your own!
Full rules for placing in-game wagers on the outcomes of your Bouts - even the spectators can join in!
A full campaign system - watch your Fighters grow with experience or succumb to their lasting injuries as you follow the fortunes of your Fighter House!
In-depth background for the city of Baad Tibera and the world beyond, and the variety of magical peoples that inhabit it, to really bring your Fighters, and your games to life!
Eight sample Fighters!
And more!


Included alongside the rulebook in the download, you'll find a printable playmat, tokens, Fighter sheets, Rosters and more, and a tower and walls that you can build yourself - basically everything you need to get started!

So what are you waiting for? Grab your sword and strap on your shield - the Fighting Pits await!

Limited solitaire play

–description from the publisher
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Hexes Napoleonics: Batalla de Molins de Rei 1808
description:
St. Cyr, blocked in Barcelona, ​​decides to make an exit to eliminate the threat of the Spanish settled on the other side of the Llobregat river, who interrupted his communications with the rest of the peninsula.

With this intention, he leaves the city at the head of his 7th Army Corps with more than 20,000 men, 1,500 horses and some artillery.

The Spanish block the crossing of the Llobregat river at the Carlos III bridge in the town of Molins de Rei with about 15,000 men and good and abundant artillery, thinking that it will be through that place where the French will try to cross the river.

In reality the Imperials have crossed much further south and surprise the Spanish on the other side of the river.

The disproportion of forces makes Spanish victory unfeasible, and therefore in this scenario we will only try to determine how long the Spanish will be able to maintain the pressure and prevent the imperialists from taking them out of their positions.

If at the end of the day the French have not managed to get the enemy off the map, we can consider that they have lost the battle and that victory will be for the Spanish arms.

And since the relationship of forces is very favorable to the French, we introduced a reinforcement that did not exist in reality, although it could have perfectly happened, and that allows the battle to be balanced and give the Spaniards more possibilities.

name: Talkative
description:
Have you ever experienced a time-warp? You get lost in conversation and think, where did the time go? What if you earned points based on your ability to keep track of time? Built around two-minute conversations, Talkative explores that weird time-warp that can happen in your brain, while you’re just talking. Perfect for groups of eight or less, Talkative is sure to get everyone talking, but will that conversation blur the passage of time?

Roll the dice, pick a subject card, start the timer and talk for exactly two-minutes to earn the most chat-bucks. Others can help you fill the time, but be careful, you can't see the timer and their job is to get you to talk too long. Get lost in conversation and you will lose track of time and your chat-bucks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Resume Lies
description:
How to play: To start, one player is designated the "Employer" for a single round. The Employer draws a green job card from the deck after shuffling. Everybody else is dealt 7 blue skill cards. The green job card displays the name of a job or occupation of some kind. The remaining players are "Candidates", and they must choose from their hand of blue skill cards which card they wish to hand face-down to the Employer. After everybody hands their blue skill cards face-down to the Employer, the Employer will decide based on the skill cards, which Candidate was the best and most appropriate match for the job. Whoever wins the round becomes the Employer for the next round, the cards are re-shuffled and the game restarts. The first player to win ten green job cards wins the entire game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Donjara Doraemon
description:
Donjara Doraemon is a series of games released since 1980. Every edition contains Donjara game, which is a family friendly mahjong version with characters taken out directly from Doraemon anime, and a variable number of other mini games utilising the included components.

Donjara Doraemon is a fast and exciting game than can be played by up to 4 players and appeals to all ages.

Donjara set comes with one game board, 84 tiles with Doraemon characters, 2 dice, circa 80 point tokens and few other sub-game boards.

The aim of Donjara is to gather a hand consisting of three sets, 3 tiles each. There are many different hands worth different points, like in mahjong.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Match It!: Picture Word Bingo
description:
Be the first to fill your board with matching picture cards in this beginning reader game.

Shuffle the picture cards and set them in a pile. As they are revealed the player with the matching item claims it to place on their board.
