Continue until someone folks their board and yells, "Bingo!" Difficulty can be adjusted by using three sides of the board or cards with pictures and words or with only words.

name: Charge! Eagles Rising: Battle of Loubino (Valutina-Gora) – August 19 1812
description:
Russian General Barclay de Tolly on the evening of August 18, 1812 decided to pullout of the battle of Smolensk and continue the retreat to Moscow.
The Russian army got lost, and did not get far before the French advance guard found the rear guard of the Russian Army near the villages of Valutino, and Valutina-Gora.

This is a scenario booklet for Charge! Eagles Rising as this rearguard battle neared Loubino and the main line of retreat for the Russian army the morning of August 19, 1812.
This scenario has about 50,000 men per side and is at the battalion level.

This scenario can be adapted to any Napoleonic rules set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Trip to Cadbury's Game
description:
A Trip to Cadbury's Game is an promotional advertising game produced by Cadbury's Chocolate in Australia during the 1960s.

The object of the game is to be the first player to arrive at the Cadbury's Chocolate factory in Tasmania, Australia.

Players roll a dice and move their colored token the number of spaces along roads around the Cadbury factory. Certain spaces link these concentric roads to smaller inner roads that is repeated until the final innermost road leads to the factory. Hazards encountered along the way can send players back to the start or miss a turn.

name: イロトリトリ (Irotoritori)
description:
In Irotoritori, players compete to be the quickest in finding bird cards that match both a condition card and a bird card which specify the color of parts composing a bird's body.

The player to find the most matching bird cards wins the round and gets to score points.

At the end of 5 rounds, the player with the most points wins.

name: Disobey
description:
Disobey is a semi-cooperative communication game inspired by John Carpenter's They Live.

During all phases of the game, it is strongly recommended to discuss, argue, try to convince your playing partners ... or manipulate them to achieve your goals. Anything goes! The only rule is that you cannot reveal your cards. You have to let the doubt hang out.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Variable Set-up

name: Action Force Strategy Game
description:
Action Force Game is an exciting board game for 2 players based on the constant struggle for supremacy, between Action Force and Cobra Command, demanding military planning and tactical skills. It is played on the printed board (inside of the box), and involves combat on land, air and sea.

The object is to seize the enemies [sic] H.Q. using all the resources at your command. Each side has a different mix of vehicles and terrain, ensuring that every game presents new challenges...

description from the publisher

name: Habt 8
description:
The task cards show color combinations, and your objective is to recreate these by placing wooden blocks in these colors on the gameboard. The white joker is very helpful for that. On each turn, you may either blindly draw a block out of the bag or relocate a block that is already on the board.

Playing this game fosters spatial vision in combination with concentration – and with fun.
The first player to fulfill the 8 task cards wins.

It seems to be a lightwEIGHT game – but both players need to stay alert, since a good chance of completing a task can be blocked quickly.

name: The Trip!: The Infamous Game
description:
"Are you ready for a psychedelic journey? Fill up on alcohol and drugs and set off on the most infamous rat race in history."

The Trip! is a cruel fight based on recklessness, drugs and a lot of infamy.

To win you must be the first to reach the 250km that separates you from the finish. You will be able to move on the course thanks to the VEHICLE cards and the BOOSTER cards.

Get special abilities by carrying PASSENGER cards and increased speed by accumulating bonuses from DOPING cards, but beware! overdosing will make you lose everything.

If your opponent is running too fast, tip the law enforcement and throw them a ROADBLOCK or use ACTION cards to punish that poor bastard!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Munus
description:
As a concept, gladiatorial combat is one of the more horrible ideas that humans have come up with. However, it certainly has a morbid and primal appeal. Even the Saintly Augustine of Hippo observed how quickly one could become drunk on the sights, sounds, and bloodshed of the Roman Games.

Munus is a set of rules designed to stage a miniature recreation of gladiatorial combat.
The core rules are intended to be streamlined so that two players, with a sound understanding of the rules, can string several half-hour games together in a single game session.

—description from the publisher

name: Chromatics
description:
Business is booming for local artisans and as assistants at the local paint shop, you and your opponent must race to meet their urgent requests! Carefully manage your inventory of colors, invest at the right time to obtain useful bonuses and abilities, and assemble sets to fulfill the requirements for rare and valuable color swatches.

Chromatics is a tight, two-player strategy game about colors. In a fresh twist on established game mechanics, each player's resources - red, blue, and yellow "primary color cubes" - also function as the "workers" used to secure positions around a contested 4x4 grid of cards. Each round, players place cubes from their inventory on various border cards, before deciding to take one of two actions:


investing cubes, allowing players to build up their supply of colors, or
spending cubes, obtaining a wide variety of action cards featuring inventive abilities and lucrative scoring bonuses


When each round ends, players are also provided an opportunity to purchase vibrant paint swatches, further adding to their score - but depleting their inventory of resources at the same time. At the end of the game, players tally their scores. Most points is the winner!

Featuring an approachable art style, a creative blend of mechanics familiar to veteran players, and a variety of cards to ensure no two games are alike, Chromatics is an exciting entry into the genre of two-player strategy games. Who knew colors could be so competitive?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Pieces as Map, Square Grid, Worker Placement

name: Fragmentz
description:
Fragmentz is recreation of fast-paced Korean poker/card game called Go-Stop. With the Fragmentz deck players can play two types of games which are Go-Stop and Gree.

Go-Stop, The goal of Go-Stop is to capture cards from a central layout by playing a card of the same realm(landscape). The aim is to collect scoring combinations among the cards captured. When a player's captures have a sufficient value, the player can 'stop' the game and claim payment, or can continue the game ('go') taking the risk with hope of winning more.

Gree, is a new interpretation of Korean version of Texas Hold'em called 'Seotda', playing with 20 cards from the deck and each players dealt 2 cards(or 3 card variation). Goal is to have the highest scoring hand according to the preset combinations called pedigree.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Pop for Word Families
description:
How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Pop for Blends
description:
How to Play:

Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Instant Mafia
description:
Instant Mafia is a quick card game where players manage their mafia to earn the most money. Whenever a player's front is discovered and their Boss eliminated, the game ends.

Instand Mafia takes place over two phases: #1. Establishing your Mafia, and #2. Ruling the Streets.

In Phase 1, players bid on characters and actions to add to their crime syndicate, using their starting resources. This is a group bidding time with a limited duration.

In Phase 2, players play repeated timed live rounds until the game ends (a Boss is defeated). Players may purchase more characters and actions to add to their Mafia, earn money from various crimes, or encounter other enemy Mafia members on the community streets. All players must manage their members and act at the same time, giving them orders and sending them around to do various tasks in under 30 seconds. After the time for orders is up, all players fulfill their character's actions and the game continues...unless a Boss has been outed!

Once one Mafia's Boss is defeated, the game ends and the player who has accumulated the most wealth at the end wins!
mechanics: Action Timer, Auction/Bidding, Real-Time, Secret Unit Deployment, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: The Pirate Republic: Africa Gambit
description:
Return to 1713, the dawn of the Golden Age of Piracy. After a decade of war, a rare peace comes to the Spanish Main. With thousands of demobilized sailors, pirating explodes in the West Indies and across the Atlantic.

One crew of pirates, calling themselves the Flying Gang, seek fame, fortune, and self-governance by building their own Republic free from the constraints of kings, queens, and imperialism. Will you work together to build the Pirate Republic? Or will you betray your brethren in pursuit of greater riches? The sea is your territory; anyone on or near it, your prey.

The Pirate Republic: Africa Gambit is a second edition to the original The Pirate Republic. It is a thematic deck building, sandbox adventure game for 1-5 players which also adds West Africa riches, new Pirates, the Portuguese, and a campaign mode into the mix. Set in the early 18th-century, each player is an infamous pirate captain weaving their own tale by performing daring feats and plundering on the high seas.

It's a time of conquest and the lure of riches, indomitable spirit and fat treasure galleons, pirate utopias and watery graves!

Are you ready to get your Pirate on?

How does it play?

You start with a deck of 12 cards, 2 of which are unique to your Pirate while 10 are shared. As you acquire cards and build your deck, your decisions will shape your Pirates’ personality.

Using your cards you will sail across the map, strike fear on enemies, recruit crew, attack, defend, form a pirate haven, sack forts, complete global missions, or build infamy (which lets you gain even stronger cards). Each turn you will draw a hand of cards and take actions with them. Once you are out of cards, play goes to the next Pirate, and this continues until everyone has exhausted their decks.

Individually you are amassing Swagger as quickly as you can while collectively completing the global missions. The game ends when the global mission (chosen by the players before the game begins) is completed Alternatively, whoever reaches 120 Swagger first is the winner.

.....
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Does It Matter
description:
Does It Matter is a dark-humored party game that takes place in the outer reaches of space. Players must race through 42 spaces to reach the black hole at the center of the galaxy using their wits, creativity, and strategy.

There are three decks of cards players must draw from in order to move along the board. These decks are:

DIM: A variety of dark, absurd, and twisted trivia.
SAD: Player must use Sound, Act, Draw, or a combination of these.
LEMON: Space-themed action cards that move players forward or backward on the board. They can be used on any player and have the potential to become lemon-scented sabotage.


The game ends as soon as a player reaches the black hole and shouts, "Does It Matter" as their piece lands on the final space. If another player says "Does It Matter" first, the win is rejected and the player must move back to their original position.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Science Fiction, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Chaotic Toongeon
description:
The non-greatest heroes of the kingdom will face the evil villain in the fifth level of the chaotic dungeon. They will explore and find better, powerful (or useless) weapons, objects and equipment inside the five levels of the dungeon. However, the path to the darkness is full of danger, so they must collaborate with other adventurers knowing that, in the end, only one of them will rise with glory (and countless fortune).

Each turn, a player draw as many cards of the Heroic Action Dack as his hero can pick. Then, he can use as many of this cards in order to do any action (attack, explore, defend, move, etc.)

The game ends when the villain in the fifth level is killed.

The player with the most heroic points at the end of the game wins. A player can get heroic points by killing monsters, completing secondary missions or overcoming traps.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval

name: Bridge-A-Word
description: A word card game where words are made from letter cards held in a special stand for them.

name: Declare
description: A word game, played from cards that have one letter each on them.

name: Unravel Words
description:
A word card game.

First make words from the letter cards dealt to you. Make any number of any length. Longer words score more but are easier to guess. You get points for each letter used, and bonus points for each letter over 3 in a word, for your longest word being longer than other’s longest words, and for using all your letters in words.

Next guess words. The more precise the guess, the more points you make. You get 1 point for a successful general guess like “Do you have any Ls?”, and 5 points for successful specific guesses like “Is this card an L?” There are bonus points for guessing a player’s last hidden letter and knocking them out of play, and for your letters still hidden when a player is knocked out. When there is only one player left, the one with the highest score wins.

Feel the excitement as you try to work out everyone else's words before your words are all guessed out.

[Adapted from the back of the game box.]
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Spelling

name: How to Train Your Dragon: Terror of the Sea
description:
Bring your family together for this easy to learn board game set in the magical world of burly Vikings and wild Dragons. Be the First Viking to climb the volcano to WIN!

Each Viking Teen travels along the game path by rolling the die, and advances the number of spaces. The space you land on will direct you to either twist the base of your pawn either 1 or 2 "clicks" or to spin the pawn. Each pawn has 2 sides: the Viking Teen indicates the front and their Dragon is the back. Whichever direction the Teen is facing when the spinning is done is the direction the player will move next turn (forward, backward, or along the main path). First player to land on the Winner space by an exact roll "flies" their dragon up to the Volcano's cloud to final victory and WINS!

Contents:
1 Game board with magical spaces & 3D Volcano Walls
4 Viking Teen Pawns and Spinning Bases (Teen on front, Dragon on back)
1 Die
Full Instructions

name: Flights, England to Australia by air
description:
Flights, England to Australia by air is a roll and move race game where players travel a path across the globe from Croydon in England to Darwin in Australia. Along the numbered path players encounter favourable or detrimental problems such as "take an extra turn" or "Return to Croydon for a new plane". The winner is the first to arrive in Darwin, Australia.

Published in Victoria, Australia, the playing map and aircraft path patriotically highlight the influence of British colonial rule during the late 20's and early 30's. Further to this it lists the pioneering aviators who made the journey during the early 20th century up to Amy Johnson in 1930.

name: Damn the Torpedoes!: Action Off Charleston
description:
On January 29th, 1863 the British blockade runner Princess Royal was pursued by USS Unadilla and run aground while trying to enter the harbor at Charleston, SC.
Her cargo included arms and ammunition as well as an unrecorded number of large rifled naval guns and two powerful steam engines slated to be installed in Southern ironclads then under construction.
These imports were of such great potential value to the South that they have been called "the war's most important single cargo of contraband."

In thick, predawn haze on January 31, 1863, CSS Chicora and CSS Palmetto State raided the Federal blockading force of unarmored ships lying just outside the entrance to Charleston Harbor.
Their goal was to drive the blockading vessels away from the Princess Royal and recover her cargo.

–Description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Gi-Go
description:
The players each take turns placing one of the 49 game pieces on a 7x7 playing field. The player who places a tile on the last square of a vertical, horizontal or diagonal row receives the victory points for this row according to its length (vertical and horizontal 7 each, diagonal 2 to 7). As soon as the last tile has been placed, the player with the most points wins.

The game has appeared in a series of games with educational intentions.

name: Non Speed Race
description:
A cooperative game, a noon speed race between the turtles and the snails. The turtles look at each other or to the next turtle on the board to move on to the next step. If the players cannot find the turtle who looks at the previous turtle or the next one, the snail moves to the next step.The players win if they filled the board with turtles, before the snails moved to the last step.

—description from the designer

name: Ejército Popular
description:
The players have the role of a republican agent during the Spanish civil war. Their objective is to buy arms in the black market or in the USSR to form new Battalions for the Popular Army. The behaviour of the battalions in combat and the achievement of our agent give us Victory Points. The game is divided in Battles and each battle has several turns.
There are 'Help' cards that are useful to manage your objectives or interfere with the other players activity.
Each player receives several Action Points, Negotiation Points, Money and Two help cards at the start of each Battle.
The battle can be 4 or 5 turns long so during that turns the players have to move their agent through the board spending their Points and money in the different boxes of the board in order to get arms, conscripts and uniforms for assembling a battalion or to send weapons to the High Command (demanded in the Battle card). Doing this gives Victory Points. At the end of the last Battle Card the player with more Victory Points win the game.
---
Los jugadores tienen el rol de un agente republicano durante la Guerra Civil Española. Su objetivo es conseguir armas en el Mercado Negro o en la URSS con los recursos limitados que se tiene y con estas armas formar batallones que demanda la carta de batalla que está en juego. El comportamiento de estos batallones en combate y los logros de los agentes proporcionan Puntos de Victoria. El juego se divide en 'Batallas' y cada batalla tiene varios turnos. Hay cartas de 'Ayuda' que facilitan tus acciones y tambien molestan a los otros jugadores.
Cada jugador recibe varios Puntos de Acción, Puntos de Negociación, dinero y dos cartas de ayuda al comienzo de cada batalla.
La batalla puede durar 4 o 5 turnos, por lo que durante esos turnos los jugadores deben mover a su agente por el tablero gastando sus Puntos y dinero en las diferentes casillas del tablero para obtener armas, reclutas y uniformes para armar un batallón o para enviar armas al Alto Mando (exigido en la carta de Batalla). Hacer esto da Puntos de Victoria. Al final de la última carta de batalla, el jugador con más puntos de victoria gana el juego.
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, World War II

name: VYSHiBALY: Ramstein AFB
description:
Op VISHiBALY: The Capture of Ramstein AFB

5th June, 04:00hrs, 24hrs before CASE RED, CASE BLUE and CASE BLACK, the Invasion of West Germany, 1984 and Ramstein is assaulted by a battalion force of VDV with the intention of disrupting the REFORGER effort to re-supply and re-inforce Germany as WWIII errupts.
At the same time VDV are assaulting Grafenrheinfeld Nuclear Power Station to tie up the 3rd Infantry Division,
Op. Vishibaly is designed to disrupt REFORGER as well as tie up elements of the 8th Infantry Division denying them supporting 3rd Armoured and CASE RED's thrust.

Elements of the VDV are to seize and deny ramstein, take it out of action and then form up to head in formation to Frankfurt Un Der Main AFB and eliminate that... if there any survivors of Vishibaly!

The scenario set is designed with full (generic) force lists for the VDV as well as the 8th Infantry Division;
four linked scenarios ranging from the initial assault on Ramstein, to ambushing the relief column of the 8th iD and a 1:1 type scenario where a Spetznatz team infiltrates the control tower and seizes it versus a force of USAF Security Personnel.

These scenarios are designed to be generic -so can be used with ANY rule set!
Ideally suited for COLD WAR3! and BERLIN '84 these scenarios can be used with Team Yankee or even Command decision or Bolt Action!

–Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Fruit Salad
description:
In this very simple and fun game, the players take turns trying to get all the ingredients to make a nice fruit salad: grapes, blueberries, strawberries, kiwis, tangerines and bananas. The first one to complete the set wins.

In terms of gameplay, initially there's a pile with fruit and "veggie" tokens. Each player on their turn rolls two custom dice, one with the 6 fruits on its faces and one blank, except for one face, that shows a broccoli ("veggie"). Depending on the roll, they either pick up a corresponding fruit token or a veggie token from the pile. If they already have the fruit, they have the option of picking up a second one (only up to two per fruit are allowed) or return their fruit token back to the pile.

Veggie tokens are "jokers", in that they can stand in the place of any fruit token. However if you roll for veggie and already have one, you have to give it back; you can have at most one veggie at any given time.

Winning condition is having exactly 6 different tokens (6 fruit or 5 fruit and a veggie) with no duplicates.

name: The Lion and the Hunter
description:
The Lion and the Hunter is a game where one player is the lion and the other is the hunter. Players follow a route to the lions den. Along the way they must follow instructions as the come to them along the path.
The winner is the one who reaches the lions den first. Alternatively if the hunter lands on the space occupied by the lion after space 60 he has captured the lion and the hunter wins the game. Prior to space 60 if either player lands on the other player then the player landed on goes back to the start.
mechanics: Action/Event, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Telepatio
description:
Telepatio is a fun and engaging board game for believers of Telepathy and skeptics alike. With the help of colourful renditions of the original Zener cards as well as your very own minds, you and your friends can perform the same scientific experiment to disover which one of you has the greatest capacity for telepathic communication - or simply is the luckiest. Who knows? See for yourself!

Telepatio is turn-based and played over 24 rounds, or until the first player reaches 17 or -11 ESP points. You score ESP points by successfully sending or receiving the correct telepathic signals.

Every round a player assumes the role of a 'Sender'. The Sender rolls the Zener dice with the dice cup and views the result in secrecy. The Sender then flips over the hourglass, and must try to telepathically communicate the right Zener symbol to the other players. No words or visual cues of any kind are allowed, you must rely on the power of your mind.

By the time the hourglass runs out all other players, known as 'Recipients', must have chosen a Zener card with the symbol they believe is being telepathically sent to them. The Sender then reveals their dice roll and Recipients reveal their cards. Was the Sender successful in communicating the Zener symbol? Did the Recipients read Sender's mind, or did they score by simple guesswork?

If a Recipient chooses the wrong card, the Recipient moves one step back. The Sender moves as many steps forward as the number of correct matches from the Recipients, plus two extra steps. If the Sender does not match up with any of the Recipients, the Sender stays put.

The player with the most ESP points after 24 rounds is the most telepathic of the players, or does it all come down to luck?
mechanics: Action Timer, Simultaneous Action Selection, Track Movement

name: Smokey Game
description:
The Smokey Game is an Australian community service board game for the prevention of forest fires. Players move by roll of a dice along a 60 space course that enters a Picnic ground and Koala sanctuary before continuing on to return to home on space 60.

Along the way certain green spaces promote good fire prevention practices and in turn help the player (i.e take a short cut). Red squares on the path highlight dangerous fire behaviour and this incurs a penalty to the player (i.e. Playing with matches go back to 26).

First player to complete the course is the winner.

name: Cross Clues: Steamy Deck & Winners Tokens
description:
Expansion created by Datebox Club which includes 20 additional word cards and 9 winner tokens.

—user summary

name: Mojee
description:
Players receive nine cards of one color in their hand. They must place their cards in the same order as the story board cards. However, they can only place their cards on other players stacks.

Once all players have their cards, play begins simultaneously as each player tries to play their cards in the correct order and stacks. Once a player is out of cards, play stops and the stacks are checked.

Players win if the cards were played without mistakes and you have the least number of cards.

Players can also make up their own master stories or play the game without referring to the master set to make the game harder.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Real-time

name: Loki
description:
Loki is the first Play-to-Role game ever created. Play through three different card games with your friends (push-your-luck, bluffing and memory) and dive into a mystical Norse atmosphere.

While you play, your actions and results will determine your fate as a character, and you will be able to start the fourth module, an immersive Role Playing adventure! The card games are designed to create a vibrant, thrilling and engaging atmosphere between players. Each participant will compete against the others or in team, depending on the card game.

Asgard is a bluffing game where players must act as a Norse deity while bluffing to stay undercoven. The last one remaining alive wins the match.
Omen is a push-your-luck & memory game where players place bets to guess the number of cards on the board. Omen cards act as a jolly and can turn luck and memory against everybody.
Valhalla is a combat game where players compete against each other and against monsters to remain the last man standing in the arena.

Once the games are complete, the results and the points obtained by the players, together, form the traits of their characers in Mask of Loki, the Role-playing game that acts as a forth module. The game comes with a handy game manual explaining the rules: Mask of Loki, in fact, is a very simple game (it takes half an hour to be mastered) that rewards cooperative play and awards poor luck in the previous character creation session.

Hours of funny, thrilling and amazing adventures in the Norse society are waiting for you. Dive into Loki and show everybody what you are made of!
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Spell & Learn
description:
Points based spelling game for children where a throw of the dice determines word type (noun, verb, etc) and word length (3-7 letters) for all players. All players begin with 100 points and draw letter tiles from the same shared pile (letters are hidden) until one player completes a qualifying word. That player rings the bell and all action stops. The bell ringing player gets 2 points per letter of their qualifying word. Other players get one point per letter in their words and they lose one point for every unused letter. the player with the most points at the end of 10 rounds wins. There are provisions included for challenges and for making the game easier for younger children.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Score-and-Reset Game, Tile Placement

name: Panic Attack! Scooby-Doo!
description:
Scooby-Doo is trying to solve mysteries. A scary ghost gets in the way and does not let him move freely. Help Scooby evade the flaming ghost with the help of the scooby gang to be the winner.

In your turn you flip a location token to decide the location that the ghost appears, you then roll the die to move Scooby-Doo and if you land near a space with a hidden token you open it. If you land again near it, you take it. If it is a member of the scooby gang or a Scooby snack you use various abilities to win the game. If it is a monster, it gives you negative points depending of the color. Whoever has the most victory points when all the tokens are taken wins.

name: Conquista
description:
Conquista is a dice game in which the players conquer countries with the help of the right combination of dice. It is also possible to take over territories that have already been occupied, although this is more difficult. The winner is the player who takes over the most valuable lands overall.

—description from the publisher

name: Zookeeper: an independent-play game for pre-schoolers
description: A game with no reading or counting, let pre-schoolers play together. Draw a card and put it face up in front of you. On your next turn, draw a new card or bank those face-up cards. Draw an open cage card and return any un-banked cards to the discard pile. Play until you are out of cards. The person with the largest pile of banked cards wins.

name: Hide & Seek
description:
One player takes on the role of the cat, the other of the mice. The cat tries to capture the mice before the mice escape. The game uses hidden movement and bluffing mechanisms.

—user summary

name: 大正吉凶なし (No Luck in Taisho)
description:
Players each receive a rad. In each round, players play a card face down and choose either to challenge or clear it. Once every player has chosen, challengers turn their card face up and score UNLESS 1 child card is shown, in which case the child scores points.

Cards are then discarded and new cards dealt until the deck is finished. The player with the most points wins.

大吉は大当たり、中吉はうれしい、小吉は救われる。
それより最も重要なのは、末吉の命運！
運勢を小僧に奪われないよう、タイミングを見計らって、おみくじを引け！
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Move Through Deck, Score-and-Reset Game

name: ZombieZone (Postcard edition)
description:
The year 2020. It's been 5 years since the zombie uprising that we now refer to as "Zombie Summer". You could say that we've since adapted to living with the undead… All you need to do is stay indoors, keep your weapons close, and don't trust anyone or anything. But as humans, we are a greedy species, and we found a way to make money off of the zombies. And that is where the ZombieZone comes in.

ZombieZone (Postcard edition) is a battle arena where 4 humans and 4 zombies will fight to the death… on live television. From the safety of our homes, we watch the destruction unfold, placing bets on or against mankind. And some of us will even risk our own lives for a chance at fame and fortune. Will the money hungry-humans, armed with a shotgun and a brain make it out alive? Or will the flesh-hungry Zombies multiply and take them over?


ZombieZone (Postcard edition) is a head to head strategic battle for survival of humans vs. zombies. 2 players each use coins and dice to maneuver around a gridded parking lot game board. Humans are armed with a shotgun for ultimate zombie destruction, and zombies spread quickly by taking over the humans (flipping the coin over to become a zombie). The last one standing wins.

If you are looking for the full edition, see here. The full game has a larger board, more units, bombs, a second win condition, and a lot more space to do what you need to do.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: ZombieZone (BGotMC edition)
description:
This is the card reimplementation of the 2012 board game ZombieZone, for the Board Game of the Month Club.


ZombieZone is a battle arena where 10 humans and 10 zombies will fight to the death… on live television. From the safety of our homes, we watch the destruction unfold, placing bets on or against mankind. And some of us will even risk our own lives for a chance at fame and fortune. Will the money hungry-humans, armed with a shotgun and a brain make it out alive? Or will the flesh-hungry Zombies multiply and take them over?


ZombieZone is a head to head strategic battle for survival of humans vs. zombies. 2 players each use double-sided disc tokens, cards, and dice to maneuver around a gridded parking lot game board. Humans are armed with a shotgun for ultimate zombie destruction, and zombies spread quickly by taking over the humans (flipping the token over to reveal a zombie on the other side). The last one standing wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Reise durch den Harz
description:
The players start at space 1 (Goslar) and the first to reach space 109 (Halberstadt) wins the game. On their turn, players roll a die and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published about 1920.

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Dice Poker
description:
Playing poker with the dice. The players take turns rolling the dice and try to get results like in poker. Points are awarded depending on the result.

—description from the publisher

name: Dracula Dice
description:
The players act as vampires who want to collect as much blood as possible.

Players can only collect points by rolling blood drops, but it is also possible to snatch blood from the others. The game ends as soon as a player has reached 50 points.

—description from the publisher

name: En Garde
description:
Life is unfair - so is this game...

Each player is 3x attacker (red dice) and 3x defender (blue dice). On the dice there are sword symbols for attack and shield symbols for defence. Blue has more dice than red - yes, unfair...

—description from the publisher

name: Kreuzworte ABC
description:
Form words and the best letter concatenations.

The players roll letters and try to turn these letters into words. Points are awarded according to length and complexity. However, the players must also find a word each round with which they can form a sentence after 5 rounds - because this is the only way to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Lang lebe der König
description:
A new king is appointed. But who will it be? Am I backing the right one? The winner is the player who bets on the right aspirant.

The players roll the dice and according to the result either put the aspirants forward towards the throne or increase their support - you can't do both and since you can only win with a lot of support for the aspirant who will also become king, you have to be a bit tactical...

—description from the publisher

name: Pieks
description:
Fend off the mosquitoes...

The players roll the dice. Whoever has mosquitoes is bitten, whoever has a swat can ward off mosquitoes. You can still modify your result. The game ends as soon as a player has received 10 mosquito bites.

—description from the publisher

name: Piratengold
description:
As pirates, the players try to prevent losing all their gold, because everyone wants to get their hands on the shiny metal.

The dice are rolled to see whether gold has been rolled or whether the skulls predominate. Without gold it becomes dangerous...

—description from the publisher

name: Schatzkammer
description:
Be the first player to find four identical gems.

The players roll the dice and advance in the treasure chamber. But you can only score points if you find the right gems. The game ends as soon as a player has rolled (i.e. marked) a gemstone type four times.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Waldbären
description:
The players try to find as many bears as possible in their forest.

The dice are rolled and depending on the symbols achieved, you can either find bears or only encounter useless trees. But if you are lucky, you can also push them onto the other players' eyes or even steal bears from them. In the end, you need many bears and should have them in the right places.

—description from the publisher

name: Inspector Penguin
description:
Inspector Penguin is a bluffing card game for 2-4 players. The goal of the game is to craft jewelry with normal and magical pebbles. Magical pebbles are forbidden and risky to use, but give you a bonus action. Beware of the Inspector Penguin who can block you from crafting jewelry if they uncover a magical pebble. Use your action cards strategically to help you dodge the inspector, or help you sniff out magical pebbles.

Test your luck and bluffing skills in this fast-paced, highly interactive (cute) card game.

—description from the designer

name: Tabletop Archaeology 101
description: Tabletop Archaeology 101 is a simple roll table dice game where each player takes on the role of a Hollywood archaeologist. Your rolls will determine what you find, whether you trigger traps, and if you encounter raiders. Welcome to the dig site.

name: Nano Battle: Epic Mini Figure Combat
description:
A tabletop combat game system using 1.75 inch little rubber keshi figures called Nanoids. Take control of Nanoids as an Operator, your task is to close the power hungry rifts opening all over the world.

Use your 6 Command cards to simultaneously activate your Nanoids in Nano Battle! Each card has a number indicating how many seconds it takes for your Nanoid to act in battle, a Dodge is almost instant while a Super move might take some time. Deplete each others Life Sparks while avoiding peril on the Nano Fields stabilizing the rifts.

Be careful, once your last Command card in hand is activated each round the rift consumes its data, never to be used in this match again. 21 total choices before you run out of commands and your Nanoid goes rogue. Can you defeat your opponent while your Nanoid is choosing its own commands?

An expandable game system of Rumble and Nanoid Packs. Rumble Packs provide everything for 2 players to Nano Battle and can be combined or used stand-alone. Nanoid Packs add more colorful Nanoids to your arsenal of little warriors. More pack types to come such as Story and Megoids.
mechanics: Area Movement, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Necromunda: House of Shadow
description:
Discover the mysterious origins and agendas of House Delaque, from their plots and schemes against the other Houses to the truth behind their steady spread across the Hive world.

Inside you will find:

1) Updated rules for creating and running House Delaque gangs including new rules for Psy-Gheists or the preternatural assassins and saboteurs known as the Nacht-Ghuls.

2) New rules for adding Hired guns as well as Delaque specific Dramatis Personae such as Yageloth the Whisperer and the terrifying Servant of the Silent Ones.

3) New sub-plots, a unique Delaque skill set, terrain and House features

4) New Scenario's specific for the House of Shadow
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Pentecostés
description:
We cannot keep silent about what we have seen and heard.

Pentecostés is a game for both young people and adults where the book of the acts of the apostles covers by theme and narrative, in which each player must represent an apostle witness to the resurrection and assumption of Jesus Christ who will have to announce and testify to the message of the good news and to be forming their Christian communities encompassing the people of the different social classes of all the people of Israel in that historical period.

The player who has been the emissary with the highest score at the end of the game, adding the points of the cards of each community, plus the additional scores, will become the winner.

The objective of the game is to have accumulated the highest score at the end of the game. Where not only will win the one who accumulated the highest score in the community cards, but also the additional scores of the teaching of Jesus Christ and life goal that each of the players will have will be credited.

In each round, each player has their turn to perform two actions that allow him to:

Obtain Speech tokens: Do conversion actions with God to obtain tokens, to be used soon to obtain community cards.

Proclaim a card: Once you have the corresponding amount of tokens to exchange for one of the available cards, pay the corresponding cost for it to obtain the card you want.

Baptize a card: Once a community card is obtained, it goes on to add points. Now you can baptize it by paying the amount of corresponding baptismal tokens; and thus enhance your game for later.

The game ends once the community deck cards are used up, so there are no cards left to replace on the table. Each player starting with the starting player will have a last turn, where this time he will have the opportunity to do 3 actions to end his game and move on to the summation of points.

name: 3DMILL
description:
3DMILL is a three-dimensional strategy game for two players. Built on an ingenious board frame structure, 3DMILL breaks the limitation of two dimensions and integrates spatial concept into the game, thus stimulates spatial perception, cognitive skills and interactions between players.

Inspired by the classic game "Nine Men’s Morris", 3DMILL applies simple rules but has great strategic depth with more dimensions. Players need to achieve a plurality of forms in which three pieces are in one straight line in a three-dimensional space. It is fun to play for young and old!

Moreover, 3DMILL’s board construction is convenient to be dissembled and stored. Handy tweezers assist players in manual dexterity exercises when placing the game pieces. With a unique crystal-clear looking, the board is not only for playing games, but also an exquisite eye-catcher for distinctive art decoration.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Ziqqurat
description:
Two card are turned face up. Each card shows two letters. The first player to find a word containing all letters gains a level for his ziqqurat. Then he changes one card. The first to complete his ziqqurat wins.

—description from the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #11.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Ancient, Educational, Word Game

name: Guardians of Fire: Holy Order
description:
The Knights Templar lead by Grandmaster Michael face a new foe: unusual Demons. Grandmaster Michael has found these foes are more cunning and have an array of cruel weapons. Alongside his Brothers in Arms, he will vanquish this threat.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: Catena vitae
description:
Catena Vitae means in Latin: The Chain of Life

The aim of the game is to create the chain of life with tangent chessmen of the same colour

9x8 chessboard from the Octonovem series
Each player has ten pieces. They are arranged in alternating rows for five pieces on each row with empty square between each other. White has pieces on 2ed and 5th row, Black has pieces on 4th and 7th row.

General rules of the game:
The pawns move three free spaces vertically and horizontally, turning only one time (but you can't jump over any pawns)
If any pawn (own or the opponent’s one) is placed on the last square, you can take its place by moving it one free space in the direction of the last move.
When the moving pawn, own or foreign, has no free square to move in the same direction, then it is removed from the board
After the initiating movement, whether any of the pawns has been moved or taken off the board, the opponent has to move.

The end of the game:
The player who created the chain of life wins ... what means that all his pawns are connected in one continuous chain, not necessarily closed (connecting vertically or / and horizontally, or / and diagonally).
Independently from creating the chain of life the player looses the game when all of his/her pawns are placed on one colour of the field.

name: Honolulu
description: Honolulu is a fast and lightweight engine builder that plays in about 60 minutes for ages 10 and up. The game takes place on a market. Try to suit the needs of your customers and fulfill their demands.

name: Narrato
description:
Narrato is a therapeutic boardgame where we invite players to enter the space between fiction and reality, between game and therapy.

Narrato takes players on an exploration hike through the many meaningful maps (domains) in their lives. It is a semi-cooperative game that you can play solo, with your partner, with (a) friend(s), with your family, with co-workers. The explorers (players) have total control on how to engage in the gameworld ('agency'). Under the supervision of a 'narrator', players explore a diversity of domains of meaning in close cooperation with each other. There are several domains of meaning in the game that can be chosen and are puzzled in a game board: neighbourhood, relationship, freetime, family, household, work, friends and school. In each domain you will face questions, exercises and challenges depending on the chosen mission. You gain 'join' points by doing missions and by engaging in the missions of other explorers.

The game ends after a fixed amount of gathered missions (depending on how long you want to play: between 1 hour and 3 hours) and the explorer with the most 'join' points (victory points), wins.

In a search for new ways to 'do psychotherapy', we offer in this board game an unseen constellation of play and therapy, where we let go of the necessary presence of a therapist in the therapeutic process. Narrato is a board game that has it's inspiration from concepts within the narrative psychotherapy and systemic psychotherapy. In an atmosphere of fun and connection, players remember not only rich stories but they also write new ones with the playing of Narrato. Players can get connected in surprising ways and through the specific design of the game. We expect new kinds of experiences for themselves, their partner, their family, friends and other meaningful persons in life. Increasing each other's sense of influence is rewarded ('relational agency’) through 'join' points.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Hidden Roles, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Literatio
description:
A new game for people who like word games, crosswords and other educational, challenging family friendly games.

Literatio is a game of word creation where 2 to 5 players build words from cards drawn with cards used from preceding players’ words to ultimately achieve the highest score. A player’s word is scored by the numeric value of each letter plus the total number of cards used. Each word played after the first must contain at least one card from the previous word and at least one card from their hand. A fast, portable word making game that's also fun as a solitaire game.

Literatio comes in a cloth draw-string bag containing 100 small laminated letter cards, instructions, pencil, and score sheets.

Player One builds as high a scoring word as he can. For example, 8 points for the total of the numerical values of the letters
plus 6 points for the number of cards used.

Player Two discards one card from Player One's word into a used letter pool and rearranges the remaining letters while adding at least one of his own to make a new word. Play continues until all cards have been drawn and one of the players has used all of his cards or until all possible words are played. The value of the
unused cards that players are unable to play are subtracted from their scores.

The player with the highest score wins! Players may use a timer if desired.

name: Toast
description:
Toast is a handmade scrambled word game where players race to form words of 4 or more letters and collect the most tiles by the end of the game. Seven tiles are face-up on the table, and the first player to see a word of 4+ letters among them calls it out, collects those letters, and replaces them from the draw pile. After all tiles are flipped and no more words can be made, the player with the most tiles wins.

Toast includes a drawstring fabric bag containing 131 individually word burned tiles and game directions. The tiles are approximately 1"x 1", consisting of:
- 125 letter tiles.
- 3 buttered toast tiles, which can count as any letter.
- 3 burnt toast tiles, which give the players who draw them -4 points each.

name: Build Word Challenge
description:
The Build Word Challenge deck is a game system with which many word games can be played. The deck has 2 copies of each consonant, 4 copies of each vowel, and 2 star (wild) cards. The letter cards are also numbered 1-26 in alphabetical order, and the star card is 27. The letters and star are printed in 4 colors (red, blue, green, black), 2 on each card. The numbers and colors can be used for different games, change a game’s difficulty, and resolve ties.

The main Build Word Challenge game deals 7 cards to each player, and they each write down all the words they can find among them; then they pass their hand to the left and do the same with the new hand. This is repeated until each player has examined each hand, and then everyone scores all the words they found; highest score wins.

The rules booklet includes rules for word games based on many other popular games:

BWC Canasta
BWC Concentration
BWC Cribbage
BWC Gin Rummy
BWC Go Fish
BWC Pass the Deck
BWC Poker
BWC Rack-O
BWC Scrabble
BWC Seven
BWC Solitaire (5 different games)
BWC Spoons
BWC Trash
BWC UNO
BWC War
BWC 2Plus
BWC 56 Sticks
BWC 900 Rummy

name: HINT Promo
description:
HINT is about hinting to your team-mates what YOU know. You can hint by talking, drawing, miming or humming. The better you are at hinting, the faster you can advance. But be careful about wild guesses, because there are things you are NOT allowed to guess. Get ready to play the #1 party game in Scandinavia.

—description from the publisher

WHAT IS THE GAME ABOUT? HINT is about hinting to your team-mates what YOU know. You can hint by talking, drawing, miming or humming.

The better you are at hinting, the faster you can advance. But be careful about wild guesses, because there are things you are NOT allowed to guess! Teams take turns and the one with the highest score when all 20 cards have been played wins!

Promotional game has 20 cards.
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Singing, Team-Based Game

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Irregulars
description:
Fall of 3134. After decades of peace and prosperity, interstellar communications broke down two years ago, and conflict is sweeping through the Republic of the Sphere.

As ancient hatreds and rivalries rear their ugly heads, people who have only known war through history books are suddenly thrust into the dark maelstrom of combat. Splinter factions have arisen, aligning themselves with fealties long thought forgotten, and stalking each other on Republic worlds like jackals. Often lacking military-grade equipment, these groups and defending militias deploy SecurityMechs, Support Vehicles, or even modified civilian machinery in their desperate struggle to prevail.

Technical Readout: Irregulars unveils the weapons deployed during the chaos after Gray Monday when paramilitaries warred in the Republic’s outer Prefectures. Technical Readout: Irregulars debuts the production and custom machines used by splinter factions in 3132 and afterward. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 25 new IndustrialMech MODs, Security- and MilitiaMechs, support vehicles, and their variants ready for play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Schinderhannes 1803
description:
Soonwald 1802 - Schinderhannes the robber is on the run.

The players try to find out where Schinderhannes committed which crime. To do this, follow the various instructions on the info cards. Reference markers are placed on the possible locations and help with research.

Using the exclusion principle, indicator markers can gradually be removed again until a crime has been precisely identified for a location.

The players are rewarded the more information they provide.

The game ends when there is a crime disc on each town and thus all offenses and their locations have been determined.

The player with the most points wins.

name: Nightmare at the Rockport Caverns
description:
Nightmare at the Rockport is a roll and write game where you and a friend are spelunkers exploring the caverns. While in the caverns, an earthquake hits the area and catastrophic geologic nightmare ensues. Rock slides block pathways and the water begins to rise from the lowest point of the caverns. To make matters worse, in all the confusion, your friend gets injured and separated from you in the caverns. Your goal is to find your injured friend and escape out of the caverns before the water overtakes you. If you run out of Life points, unable to escape the caverns, or you are overtaken by the rising waters, you lose!

Each turn you will roll for two rock slides. Next, you will raise the water level in the caverns. You will then take two actions to either move, climb, dig. After completing your actions, you will roll for an event. Two of these can be beneficial ... but don't get your hopes up! The event die can really thwart your effort to get out of the caverns.

Once you get to close enough, you will call out to your friend and the location of your friend will be revealed. You will then trudge your way through the caverns to reconnect and escape out of the caverns.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Il dono del Nilo
description:
Two players take turns in covering the Nile valley with silt.

The chessboard has 7 x 7 squares. On their turn, the player places a tile that covers two adjacent squares on the board. Tiles cannot be placed on top one another.

If the player is unable to lay down a tile, the game ends and he loses the game.

This board game is a themed version of a traditional paper & pencil games called Playing Last.

—description by the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #7.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Book, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: 2 gegen 20
description:
One player gets 2 red pieces, the other 20 yellow ones. The red player has to defend his 9 red places that the yellow player wants to occupy. The red player must jump over yellow pieces and remove them, otherwise he loses a piece. The yellow player may only move his pieces forward or sideways. The yellow player wins if he can occupy all 9 red squares, or the red player has no piece left. The red player wins when he has reduced the yellow player to 8 pieces.

—user summary

name: Durch die Wildnis
description:
The game is a safari trip to Africa. Graphics and logo style indicate pre-1934 Germany.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. On some spaces, events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Action/Event, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Quak quak
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 70 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the frogs.

Published in Auerbachs Deutscher Kinderkalender 1926 edition.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Ozean-Fliegerspiel
description:
A game recreating the Trans-Atlantic flights of Lindbergh (1927) and Köhl (1928). There are four different ways to play this game.

Line game (2-4 players): The players start in Germany or the USA. Each player has his own track. The players take turns to roll with 3 dice and move. Only rolls over 12 count. If a 13 or 14 are rolled, the player may move 1 space, at the roll of 15 or 16 he may move 2 spaces and so on. The first player to reach his destination wins the game.

Double game (2-6 players): The players form two teams. One team starts from Germany, the other from the USA. Movement is like in the line game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first Team to finish the journey wins the game.

Line or double game with the Novuma-die: The players use only the special die, which determines a movement of 1 or 2 spaces or 4 different events that hinder or benefit the pilots.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Combo cards
description:
Combo Cards - the Only Combined Playing and Word-building Cards. [From a 1934 Australian newspaper advert.]

The Combo deck is a traditional card deck with a letter in its center and below the suit symbol in the corners. Back in 1934, it might well have been the only such deck available.

The deck comes with rules for 3 games:

Lexical: A rummy game. Each player starts with 10 cards, and during their turn may either: discard a card to draw the top card of the draw or discard pile; lay a word down on the table form their hand; exchange a letter from the hand for one on the table (as long as it makes a valid word; or add one or more cards from the hand to an existing word to make a new word.

When one player empties their hand, each other player adds the points of the cards in their hand to their score. Face cards are 10 points, number cards have points equal to the number of spots, and the Joker (wild card) is 15 points. When someone reaches 100+ points the player with the lowest score wins.

Kittylex: The same as Lexical, except it scores by each player placing a chip in the kitty at the start of the round, and the winner claiming the kitty.

Combolex: The same as Lexical, except you may also lay down a flush or run of 5+ cards. You may not lay off cards on opponents' flushes or runs.

name: Guardians of Fire: Temple of Destiny
description:
The Temple of Yazd was sealed by the Priests of the Order. Hormozan and his brothers in faith ventured inside and were ambushed by the two mighty Arch Daevas: Akvan the first chosen of the Ahriman, God of darkness, and his bodyguard Savul.
Facing certain disaster, the only hope for the Hormozan was to call upon two goddesses: Mithra, the Divine Justice, and Anahita, Divine Protector.

The fate of this battle depends on you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: Word Gin
description:
Gin Rummy with letters and words. Players have 10-card hands, and on their turn they draw and discard until they can use all their cards to form words of 3+ letters. The one who does this earns the points of all the cards in their hands, plus the points of all cards in opponents' hands that they cannot use to make their own words. The game continues until a determined total, e.g. 250 or 500 points.

—user summary

name: Dirty Plates
description:
Dirty Plates is an "adult" party game/card game. There are dry erase cards for the answers and license plate cards for the prompts.

A dealer displays the plate card and the rest of the players have to write down what they think the acronym on the plate card stand for. The dealer picks their favorite and that player collects the card and the points for that round. The dealer role is passed to the next person and the process repeats until the players decide it's over, at which point they tally up their points and the player with the most points wins.
categories: Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Het Zeeuwsch-Vlaams Familiespel
description:
It is one of a series of Monopoly style board game developed for funraising in the Netherlands for a local Kiwanis group. The games in the series are essentially the same, but as in the different versions of Monopoly, the board and the businesses are specifically themed to the town or city represented in the title - in this case a geographic region in the Netherlands around the city Axel.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company (there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. Since shares can be owned by two different players both may demand payment from a visitor.

Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The “New Share Quotations” square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies. This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:
- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.
- When all but one player has gone bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Aladdin: The Mystical Boardgame
description:
Players start on any start space and roll the die to move. They can move in any direction except through the walls! They may not land on a space occupied by another player.

When landing on lamp spaces, they collect a lamp. When landing on instruction spaces, they must follow the instructions. Some are good, some are bad!

The object of the game is to move around the board collecting six lamp tokens, and then be the first to deliver the lamps at the centre of the board where the treasure is!

In the longer game rules, players must collect four lamp tokens with different numbers on them.

name: Roll Out! Dice Game
description:
Players take turn rolling two dice to either 'bear off' their checkers by rolling the corresponding numbers (or combination of numbers) or flip their opponent's checkers to make it harder for their opponent to bear off his/hers (essentially adding an extra step for each checker flipped).

Players can continue rolling dice until they win or roll out (dice combination cannot be satisfied by checkers).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Skärgårdsflottan!
description:
This short pack is a supplement for LFG’s popular Cannon, Cross and Crescent Renaissance naval rules, covering the Russian and Swedish coastal fleets of the 1700s and 1800s.

The Skärgårdsflottan from which the rules derive their name was the remarkable Swedish Archipelago Fleet, a fleet comprised of many unique ship and barge designs developed by the naval architect Fredrik af Chapman.
These ships comprised everything from front line warships to troop and horse carriers, floating barracks, hospital ships and workshops and supported not only naval operations but operations on land. To capture this characteristic of combined operations warfare in the Baltic a new section of rules has been included to cater for actions on land.
Also included are comprehensive stats for the Russian and Swedish coastal warships of the era.

–Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Global Warming: Point of No Return
description:
World is in turmoil! Global warming changed world's shape and you take the role of United Nation (UN) secretary or ruler of one of six continents and try to find a way out of this mess, before it's too late.

Global Warming: point of no return is a game for 1-6 players, where you manage world resources, react to disasters and try to develop better technology to survive difficult time.

Game is played in turns and each player has to draw a card from event deck and apply the event ( usually bad ), but each card has also option to buy it and add to player zone as new possible action in future turns!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Environmental, Science Fiction

name: Gut Pile Card Game
description:
Gut Pile is a set collection card game with an Alaskan Hunting theme. Players play cards to acquire gut piles from their hunting trip. The first player with 3 gut piles ends the round of play. The player with the highest score wins the game.

Players can play various types of cards including type of game, terrain, equipment to increase their score. Players can also place action cards to present a challenge to another player decreasing his score or blocking a pile altogether. The rules state 2-8 players with games lasting up to 2 hours.

name: Word Builder
description:
An onset-and-rimes spelling card game with Crazy Eights mechanics.

The deck has:
- 41 Building block word cards, each with an onset [1-2 consonant word start] at the top of the card and a rime [word ending of a vowel and following consonants] at the bottom.
- 8 Star option cards, each with 6 different onsets, one of which is starred.
- 7 You Lose! cards.

During their turn a player plays a card with an onset that can go with a rime of the card on top of the discard pile to make a valid word. If they cannot play any card they draw a card and end their turn.

The You Lose! card makes the next player draw two cards and otherwise skip their turn. To win the hand, a player must play a You Lose! card as their final card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching

name: Cheese Royale
description:
In Cheese Royale you will become a little mouse in the middle of the field, where you will fight against hunger, traps and the rest of mice, to be able to get hold of the central cheese.

The game map consists of 37 tiles: All the tiles, except the starter and the central cheese, are placed face down on the map so that they cannot be seen. Each mouse at the beginning of the game has a starting life and food and its corresponding attack and defense values. Each mouse has also a different ability.

The main objective of the game is to be the last surviving mouse. The game is divided into rounds, in which each player has 2 actions to perform in his turn. At the beginning of each round an event card is revealed and it can affect the whole round, such as reduction of the map at the end of the round. In this case, the last layer of tiles is removed from the map making it smaller.

Actions that can be performed in your turn:

Sniff: View the content of a tile without executing its content.
Move: Move to adjacent tile, if it is face down, the tile is turned over and its content is executed.
Attacking: When attacking, the attacker's values and the defender's values are compared, that is, base characteristics of mouse, its equipment and the fight cards used in combat. If the attacker wins, he gets a fight card reward and the opponent loses a life. In case if the defender wins, he gets a reward from fighting cards and has the possibility to counterattack.
Rest: if you have excess actions you can rest to get fight cards or food.


After taking your 2 actions, your turn ends and you consume 1 food from your supply. If you don't have food, you lose one life.
If a mouse reaches 0 life, it's eliminated from the game.
mechanics: Action/Event, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: ASL Comp: Breakout from Borisov 1
description:
Many Russian divisions, which were not caught in the encirclement of Minsk, were soon racing back to the safety of the Berezina River. There they hoped to establish a new defense line.
Aware of the dangers of headlong advance, 'Fash Heinz' Guderian ordered the 17th Panzer Division out of the line behind Minsk to reach the Berezina first to cut off the enemy retreat. The German general would need the bridges there to continue his advance, and there were few left standing as of 1 July 1941. The few bridges that were left were mostly small wooden types, unsuitable for German armor, but strong enough for Russian infantry, to cross on foot as they headed away from the onrushing Wehrmacht.

This is Breakout from Borisov 1, and it's the summer of 1941 all over again.
Barbarossa is in full flight and you will join the action with a set of 8 scenarios and 4 large semi-geo maps that create an overall play area of about 24" × 36".
If you have a hankering for early war Russian campaign, you need to get to the Berezina before the enemy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ASL Comp: Breakout from Borisov 2
description:
The 17th Panzer Division had captured Borisov and the railroad bridge across the Berezina. But Corps insisted on a larger bridgehead and ordered the 18th Panzer Division to follow the 17th to the Borisov area and establish more crossing points. Lead elements of the 18th came in behind the 17th and moved south of Borisov to facilitate their commander’s orders to capture another bridge over the Berizena. The rain covered their work, as well as the weak patrolling on the part of the 100th Division commander, focused on the loss of the railroad bridge at Novy Borisov. A patrol of Russians, making their way to counter-attack Novy Borisov, rounded the bend and spotted the Germans building the bridge, and laid in the attack.

This is Breakout from Borisov 2, and it's the summer of 1941 all over again.
Barbarossa is in full flight and you will join the action with a set of 8 scenarios and 4 large semi-geo maps that create an overall play area of about 24" × 36".
If you have a hankering for early war Russian campaign, you need to get to the Berezina before the enemy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Legends of Vietnam
description:
Won 3 awards at the 54-Cards Game Design Contest Viet Nam 2019

Imagine yourself as a farm boy named Đinh Tiên Hoàng, who started off as a boy playing with tree sticks, later to become a general-turned-king. Relive the time when empress Ỷ Lan adeptly led the entire nation through endless turbulent dynasties.

Play four different card games as sixty unique heroes and heroines as you explore historic events of Việt Nam.

1. Land & People — Like Uno and Crazy Eights but more chaotic. For 2-8 people.
2 Sword & Pen - Race to assemble a dynasty (Four-of-a-Kind). For 2 people.
3. Match a pair - Create your own memory game. Playable by both adults and kids. For one or more players.
4. Dynasties - Test your knowledge of Vietnamese history. For 2-4 players.

Bilingual • No Vietnamese knowledge required.

name: アダマスの守り手 (Guardians of the Adamasu)
description:
Somewhere in this world one can find the remains of a king of great power slumbering untouched. Only the Guardians of the Adamasu — soldiers of departed spirits gifted with the meaning of “indomitability” — can find the road leading to where the king’s remains are hidden.
 
You are an observer who has been entrusted with the mission of finding the king’s remains before any other observers.

In the first stage of play, players puzzle together Mana cards to form rhombuses of different colors. After a one minute period where players can adjust the orientation of the Mana cards in their hand (but NOT the order), players then race to place cards from their hand to create the right rhombus(es) for the unit card they wish to acquire.

Using the acquired unit cards (with assigned power points based on Mana main and sub colors), the first player to inflict 8 damage points upon the other wins the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: MindMonsters
description:
MindMonsters is a fun, story-based adventure card game for people living with anxiety and stress. The goal of the game is for your Hero to get calm and stay calm when facing monsters on an epic journey. Players learn to Think Like a Hero — to focus their power to see a situation for what it is, consider options, and make the best of it.

The game is cooperative and is for 1-3 players. A player will start by choosing a Hero card, deciding what Play Style (class) they want, and a fill-in story card. Each fill-in story card has fill-in the blank lines that you will choose a word for based off of what cards you draw each turn. The games lasts for 6 chapters (rounds).

Depending on their Play Style, the player will draw different cards. They then decide if they want to trade cards, and if they have any cards they can match to be able to unlock the letter for that chapter's story. If they don't unlock a letter, they can spend a mimo (action point) at the end of their turn to buy one. You get 4 mimos each turn, and if you don't use any or all of them, they carry over to the next chapter.

Then, every player draws a monster card, Magicians will try to befriend the monster, Collectors will try to collect them and Warriors will try to fight them.

You win by succeeding in as many monster encounters as possible, the monsters add to your Hero's overall strength. Whatever mimos you have left over by the 6th chapter also add to your Hero's strength. The 6th chapter card is a Boss Monster, you defeat it with your accumulated strength.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Matching, Storytelling

name: Rooby's ABC
description:
Come fly with Rooby Roo as you learn your ABCs. Rooby's banners show each letter in both uppercase and lowercase, and the order they follow in the alphabet.

In Rooby’s ABC, players take turns drawing one of the 26 letter tokens from the bag, they then place them on one of the five public alphabet boards with the matching letter (each board contains 4 to 6 unique letters of the alphabet). When a player completes a board, they collect a Rooby token, and the player with the most Rooby tokens when all the letters have been played wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Trick‘n Trouble: Kette mit roten Heringen promo card
description:
Chair with red legs promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 12/0/0

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

name: Trick‘n Trouble: Hansons Cadillac promo card
description:
Hansons Cadillac promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 0/12/0

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

name: Trick‘n Trouble: Chucks Tagebuch promo card
description:
Chuck's Diary promo card from Spiel 2018.

Promo task 0/0/12

Simply add this card to the other cards in Trick ‘n Trouble. It just expands the number of available tasks.

name: Wyverns
description:
This is an adventure deckbuilding game where you start your journey in the kingdom of dacya passing through the magic ships that keep the kingdom safe from wyverns destruction.
Walk through dacya islands, buy gate medallions of the matching element to enter in different Wyvern Islands.
Fight them and steal their eggs then return to the magic ships so the magic barrier can sustained the power of destruction.
It's all about speed and skill, gather as much points as you can during your journey and return at least one egg so you can survive the fall of dacya and the mighty Wyverns and be victourious against the other players.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Set-up

name: Monsters Messed Up My Room
description:
In this 2-4 player game that lasts 30-60 minutes, you take on the role of a child who must clean up their room. While it may be a chore to clean your room, you have monster friends that you can use to cause mischief and hinder your opponents!

The first player to clean their room ends the game, but the player with the cleanest room wins!

Each turn you have to make the most of your three actions as you place cleanup Tokens and Play Chore cards. While keeping your opponents in check with Monster cards.

The game ends when there are no Mischief cards left to draw or if a player removes their last Messy Room token. If you have the most Cleanup Tokens you win!
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Duel sur l'Écume
description:
The two players play Surcouf, the Corsair, or Blackbeard, the Pirate. The two crews face each other with cannon shots symbolized by the rolls of the dice.
