The object of the game is to decimate the crew of the opposing ship and then to sink it. Dice roll combinations will hit either the opposing crew or the opposing ship.

A new feature is the box serves as a dice track with bonus and penalty areas. Landing dice throws in these areas will take skill.



L'un des 4 jeux du coffret Jeux Pirates et Corsaires Légendaires. Au contraire des 3 autres jeux du coffret, celui-ci est une création originale.Les deux joueurs incarnent soit Surcouf, le Corsaire, soit Barbe Noire, le Pirate. Les deux équipages s'affrontent à coup de canon symbolisés par les jets de dés.

Le but du jeu est de décimer l'équipage du navire adverse puis de couler celui-ci.

L'originalité de ce jeu réside dans le fait que la boîte elle-même sert de piste de dés ayant des zones de bonus et de malus. Donc il est nécessaire de faire preuve d'adresse lors des lancers de dés.

Les combinaisons de chiffres des dés atteindront soit l'équipage, soit le navire adverses.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Nautical, Pirates

name: Willie Weeties football game
description:
Willie Weeties Football was an Australian promotional game found on the back of Weeties Cereal boxes during the 1950's. Produced by the National Biscuit Company, now known in Australia as Nabisco, the game is an adaptation of Australian Rules Football.

Two players are on opposing sides, either red or yellow teams. Players spin a numbered spinner and take turns in moving their playing piece towards their goal along a numbered path set on a football ground. Along the way certain numbered spaces assist or slow progress towards goal. When a player's piece nears goal they have a chance to spin and shoot for goal. The player with the most goals after a designated time is deemed the winner.

name: Creationary: Travel Edition
description:
Welcome to the world of fast LEGO building where you try to correctly guess who built what!

Players select a card from the stack and all players race to build the image out of Lego. The player who builds best, wins the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the games wins.

Contains:
100 Creation cards
30 Two-point cards
20 One-point cards
1 Sixty-second sand timer

You will need to provide your own LEGO bricks.

This game was made available through the LEGO VIP program.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Truth or Drink: On The Rocks
description:
Expands the original Truth or Drink: On The Rocks deck into a Standalone version. 432 all-new questions guaranteed to shake things up. The set uses the rules from the from the Second Edition of the base game.

Are you prepared to dive deep below the surface of your friendships?

Chill questions for mixed company—with just enough of a bite to help you loosen up together.

name: Taifun
description:
The players set their meeples in the center space and take turns rolling the die. Only at the roll of 1, the player has to move his meeple to the red dot of the inner circle. from this point on, he has to move clockwise after every roll. If he gets on a space connected to next ring, he has to change to that ring on his next turn. On the third ring there is a space which allows movement back to the first ring (connected with an arrow). On the fourth ring, there are spaces that cause the meeples to fall from the wheel and be taken out of the game.

The last player to remain on the board wins the game.

The boards where published without a box and without meeples and dice. Title and rules where glued to the back of the board.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Run Shark Run
description:
Run Shark Run is a cooperative board game for kids aged between 5 and 13, where all players play together as a team against the Shark.

Players choose a card from the deck and play a card from their hand to move on the board.

Choose and play your cards wisely to go around the board and collect the treasure before the Shark gets to your boat to win the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Lockout Monster
description:
Lockout Monster is a cooperative board game for kids aged between 5 and 13, where all players play together as a team against the Monster.

Roll the dice and decide where to move the two knights. Collect the right combination of locks and keys and lock all the castle gates one by one before the Monster gets in to win the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Matching, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Tensor: A Game of Equilibrium
description:
In this game players are managers of teams that are designing artificial intelligences. You are all working for the same research university, which will only give precious computer processing time to the teams whose AIs are doing the best. The game takes its inspiration from real-world “deep learning” techniques used when designing and building real AIs.

Unlike many games, Tensor is game of equilibrium, not efficiency, and you do not win by VPs. You will balance a board of 5 “weights” across many rounds through careful tile selection and placement, as well as special cards that let you change your tiles in unique ways.

On their turn the player takes one action, often placing a hexagonal tile on their board. The game ends when the draw pile of hexagonal tiles is exhausted.

At the end of the game, the player whose lowest weight is the highest wins! Be careful, as other players can hack your board!
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Income, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Cosmos: Infinity
description:
Cosmos: Infinity is an online and physical trading card game. You start with all the cards unlocked in the online game, and as you play, unlock card codes you can redeem for real physical copies of your cards.

The game itself if fairly unique, but a few of the mechanics utilised are as follows:

Custom starting hand: You start the game with 5 cards of your own choosing in your hand.
Board position matters: As you play cards, you grow your "tree" which allows you to play stronger cards. Your cards power up the card at the top of your "tree" allowing it to attack, and getting the cards lower in your tree to the top is not always easy.

name: Mürkantun
description:
Mürkantun is the first published game in Mapuzugun (Mapuche language). It is a card game that wants to collaborate with the task of revitalizing Mapuzugun, a language spoken by the Mapuche people, a people pre-existing to the national states of Argentina and Chile. Languages are one of the most beautiful and wonderful human creations. More than 7000 languages are spoken in the world and, in Argentina, in addition to Spanish, there are more than 20 languages of different indigenous peoples. But many are at a disadvantage compared to Spanish and are at risk of disappearing.

It has 2 game modes:

Mürkantun
Objective: find the pair.
On their turns, players turn over two cards trying to find the corresponding pair (Ex: Mara- Rügkün). If they do not match, you must leave them in the same place. Whoever finds the most pairs wins.

Konew
Objective: each participant has to guess which card was played from the clues provided by the other players.

On their turn, a player draws a card from the deck without looking at it. The other players, in turn, must provide a clue in Mapuzugun about the appearance of the image of the card that the player has to guess (Ex: it does not fly, it has feathers). If they guess, they keep that card. If they don't guess, the card returns to the bottom of the deck. The one who collected the most cards wins.

The guessing game (Konew) is an ancient Mapuche game. Older people say that in the winters when families were gathered in their homes they used to play to tell riddles, thus the cold weather passed.
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Memorace: Elképesztő találmányok
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

You only have 10 seconds to observe every little detail and information on the card! With the help of the Amazing Inventions, a child can learn about the greatest achievements of mankind and their inventors. Who built the first airplane? When the ballpoint pen was invented? The answer lies in the cards. Will the player be able to memorize everything until the time runs out?

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1. Draw a card and place it in front of you.
2. Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Roll the dice!
4. If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5. If you did not roll a 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

If you answered correctly, you keep the card and earn a point.
The player with the most points, wins.

Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Math, Memory

name: Championship Golf
description:
Another replay game from Lambourne games including 80 individual player cards - solo or multi-player

Championship Golf lays no claim to being an elegant reconstruction of the subtleties and skills of real golf. It doesi provides a system for running large-scale tournaments over the full 72-holes, producing the quick and accurate results, and enabling an entire season of big tournaments to be run in the course of a few evenings in the true replay tradition.

80 individual Player cards are provided for the top golfers of one particular season, each golfer being rated separately for his skill at driving, long iron, short iron, and putting. Course Profile Cards are provided together with details of twenty major courses to enable you to reconstruct each course accurately within the framework of the game.

Two games, a Short Game and a Long Game, provide alternative methods of play but both use the same Player Cards and it is perfectly feasible to run the early stages of a tournament using the Short Game, switching to the more detailed Long Game for the final round.

In the Long Game. the Morale Rules can reproduce the brillance of a "hot streak" or the frustrations of temporarily lost form, and in both games Optional rules provide for "steady", "normal" or "taking a gamble" styles of play.

name: Mysterious Kingdom
description:
Mystery Kingdom is a deduction game based on perceptiveness and fact matching. Players take the role of mages working on the chronicles of the fantasy land. Looking through the jumble of events they try to put them in order and solve puzzles about which events influenced the future of the kingdom.
During the game players have 9 maps at their disposal which represent a fragment of the fantasy land. These maps are filled with various scenes in which inhabitants and magical creatures take part.
Players learn a mission which consists in finding a particular event on the map on the basis of its description, the coordinates of this place are a password to open a PDF with the next task (for this purpose we use a computer or a phone - to read tasks from PDF files). In this way the players go through the story scenarios during which they also draw on the map and color its elements. The game is cooperative and players win when they manage to solve all puzzles and learn all passwords in a given scenario. All scenarios make up one big campaign

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bravery
description:
Solo card survival game in which we try to survive in the huge forest. While wandering we have to take care of food, water, shelter.

We create a map of random cards on which are marked subsequent locations, in each of them we can perform different actions.

In his turn, the player chooses a place to go on the map made of cards, then draws an 'action' card that specifies what he can do at that location. Each action can be done by a dice roll action based on the 'push your luck' mechanic or by spending 'fatigue' points (which he will also lose if he fails, but more). When he runs out of 'fatigue' points he has to pay with health points, their end means losing the game.

In some locations, we will be able to get raw materials (5 types), which will be used for crafting items that will help to significantly increase the chances of testing for certain actions (e.g. bow increases the chances of hunting).

The game takes place in different scenarios with specific victory conditions.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Set-up

name: Family Plot: Loser Family Booster Pack
description: The last family in the core game was voted on by the Backers and they were awesome, but there were some runners up that deserved a little love too! So, by popular demand and a lot of whining, we decided to create the Backer-Created-Runner-Up Family Booster Pack! So, this is basically a pack of ten losers you can bring into your Family Plot Graveyard!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Family Plot: Fantasy Expansion Deck
description:
The Fantasy Expansion Pack is a Fantasy-Themed Expansion pack with all-new FANTASY family, Action, Modifier, Reaper, Angel and Family Tree cards! Don't miss out on all the Fantasy goodness!!!

This pack contains 20 All-New cards which can be folded directly into your core deck and also allow you to add another player to your game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Family Plot: Monsters Expansion Deck
description:
The Monsters Expansion Pack is a Monster-Themed Expansion pack with all-new Monster family, Action, Modifier, Reaper, Angel and Family Tree cards! Don't miss out on all the monster goodness!!!

This pack contains 20 all-new cards which can be folded directly into your core deck and also allow you to add another player to your game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Placement
description:
This is a tennis simulation. The game is played between two players. They draw cards and the one with the highest number wins first serve and the player figure is put on space 45 or 44. Serve and return of service are resolved by drawing cards and following the drawn numbers. Then the players must draw a retrieve to reach the ball (move the playing figure) and to shoot the ball into the opponents court.

Scoring is the same as in actual tennis. The player winning six games first with a two-game margin, wins the set.

It is also possible to play Doubles.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: 戦国ブリッジ「群雄割拠」 (Sengoku Bridge: Gun'yū Kakkyo)
description: The expansion 戦国ブリッジ「群雄割拠」 (Sengoku Bridge: Gun'yū Kakkyo) adds more special player powers to the base game.

name: At The Height of Battle: The Battle of Fukuda Bay, October 1565
description:
The Battle of Fukuda Bay is a scenario for At The Height of Battle in which a Japanese fleet engages a small Portuguese squadron over a matter of honour, in the first naval engagement between Japanese and European warships.

–Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Richelieu
description:
A French-language crossword card game published in Quebec.

Each player starts with 10 cards (or 7 if six people play), each with a letter on it. On your turn you play cards forming a word onto the table; after the first turn the word must fit with the others in a crossword fashion similar to Scrabble. Instead of playing a word, you may discard a card and draw from the deck or discard pile.

When someone plays all the cards from their hand, the other players add up the points remaining in their hand (5 points per consonant, 10 per vowel, 15 for the wild Richelieu card), and add it to their total. When someone reaches an agreed-on total (e.g. 100 points), the player with the fewest points wins.

name: La Traversée
description:
Your long and perilous journey home is almost over. Only one last obstacle stands between you and your destination: that wobbly suspension bridge, unstable and treacherous, especially when winter is approaching and the wind is blowing in icy, unpredictable gusts. One false step, one shift, and you could lose part of your precious cargo. Hunger and cold will also sap your strength. And the night which is inevitably approaching will be your doom if it catches up with you before you have found refuge on dry land, on the other side of the bridge. Despite all these dangers, you set off and begin the crossing.

Each turn, players will program a few actions from their board (with action tokens) and resolve them. This will often involve moving forward along the bridge, revealing and resolving bridge cards and potentially weather cards. The game ends when the bridge is crossed or the night has caught up to the character or too much cargo has been lost along the way.

name: The Portable Colonial Wargame
description:
The rules have been designed to be used with a gridded tabletop made up of squares or hexes.
This book has fourteen chapters, two sets of rules, two exemplar battle reports, two appendices, a list of sources of inspiration, and over one hundred and ten illustrations.

—description from the publisher

name: Chorizo
description:
In many societies of the world there is corruption with its different popular sayings "bite, bribery, CHORIZO, etc."
The Chorizo ​​game is designed to show some forms of corruption that exist in the world.

The purpose of the game is to understand what corruption is, how to avoid it and teach players to avoid this evil. Say no to corruption, say yes to Chorizo ​​game!

The game its similar to monopoly or petrodollars, with few differences where you have to go through elections to became president You roll a dice, move around the board and instead of buying properties, you buy corrupt politicians (judges, deputies, transit police, etc) The idea is that you try to be president as many times as possible to accumulate money buying, selling or exchanging properties

The game ends when with one of the following situations:
1) when all the players became elected president at least one time, then finish the last round until next elections
2) setting up a time limit at the beginning of the game

The player who collects the most money wins

The goal is for each player to be president as many times as possible and accumulate the most money.


En muchas sociedades del mundo existe la corrupción con sus diferentes dichos populares "mordida, soborno, CHORIZO, etc."
El juego chorizo esta diseñado para mostrar unas formas de corrupción que hay en el mundo.
la finalidad del juego es el entender que es la corrupción, como evitarla y enseñar a los jugadores a evitar este mal. !Di no a la corrupción, di si al juego chorizo!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Point to Point Movement, Trading

name: Save Bruno Maciel
description:
Based on a real story taken place in Viana Con 2021, "Save Bruno Maciel" is a semi-cooperative push your luck game where players need to save Bruno Maciel from choking but... they get points from stealing his beef! It's a run against time.

In each round, players roll dice and choose between raising the bar of Bruno's life or getting a piece of his steak. When a player chooses to collect a piece of steak, the life bar of Bruno is decreased and the consequences are unpredictable.

Players can also choose to assist Bruno raising his life bar, getting special abilities for that.

The game is over when the dice clock expires.
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Biblemoji
description:
Biblemoji is a fun and easy Christian game to play, connect, laugh, and talk about some main characters of the Bible, illustrated in emojis.

This game has more or less the same concept as the classic game of 7 Families, but with a few twists.
There are 8 characters, so 8 families of 5 cards. Each family is a collection of 5 clues to guess the character of the Bible.

Gather 5 cards of the same family to complete a character of the Bible; gather the most families and you win the game! Ask strategically the cards you need. Observe the moves of other players to sabotage their game. Trick others (or yourself!) with the tricky-cards that may (or may not!) be in your favor!

This game is ideal for families and groups interested in the Christian faith, to have a fun time as well as learning opportunities about the Bible.

—description from the designer

name: Auksinis protas: Didysis stalo žaidimas
description:
"Golden mind. The Great Board Game" is a team intelligence game. His goal is to advance three playoff rounds and face the strongest opponent in the final. The first two rounds are in teams, the third and final are for personal mind battles. The game has as many as 1300 questions from wildlife, history, inventions, culture, astronomy and so on. Joker cards give the game excitement, surprise and fun, from which the TV game hosts - Arūnas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - give the tasks to the players after reading the QR codes with your phone.

"Golden mind. The Great Board Game" can be supplemented with cards from the games "Golden Mind. Start No. 1" and "Golden Mind. Start No. 2".


„Auksinis protas. Didysis stalo žaidimas“ – komandinis intelektinis žaidimas. Jo tikslas – pereiti tris atkrentamuosius turus ir finale susikauti su stipriausiu varžovu. Pirmieji du turai – komandiniai, trečiasis ir finalas skirti asmeninėms proto kovoms. Žaidime net 1300 klausimų iš gyvosios gamtos, istorijos, išradimų, kultūros, astronomijos ir pan. sričių. Azarto, netikėtumo ir smagaus juoko žaidimui suteikia džokerio kortelės, nuo kurių nuskaičius QR kodus užduotis žaidėjams pateikia patys TV žaidimo vedėjai – Arūnas Valinskas ir Andrius Tapinas.

„Auksinis protas. Didysis stalo žaidimas“ galima papildyti kortelėmis iš žaidimų „Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 1“ ir „Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 2“.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Action Timer, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Strandgut
description:
A tile placing game.

To win in competition mode, you've got to place a tile adjacent to the tile where the wanderer stands, then decide to move the wanderer to one of the new tiles or let him stay. This way you can choose to move it where the next player can't take a turn.

To win cooparative, you got to lay down all tile in game (move the wandere to where the next player can place a tile).

The rules are pretty simple but nice with children so they learn to plan forward (or learn playing at all).

name: Hatsumode
description:
The purpose of the game is to travel to the seven Jinja locations spaced out along the map of Japan, and meet the requirements for each location to receive the Takaramono treasures. Each player starts the game at the Toyama Bay location on the west coast, and they start each turn by drawing enough cards to have a four Goshintai-card hand. The collecting of Takaramono - and the amount each player possesses - will affect this total later in the game.

In order to move around the board, the player must use the movement choices listed on the Goshintai cards to travel in the direction of the choice. The action that the player takes after moving is determined by the color of the space they land on.

When you encounter a Yokai, they will either fight you, curse you, or help you, depending on the symbol in the upper-left corner: combat-oriented Yokai feature a black symbol, and effect-oriented Yokai feature a red symbol. When you reach a Jinja, you have the option of trading in the combat-oriented Yokai that you defeated for the Takaramono at that temple.

Once you have collected all seven Takaramono, you must return to the initial starting location at Toyama Bay. The first player to reach Toyama Bay with all seven Takaramono is the winner.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Set Collection

name: Dating Queen
description: Go to the movies with Andreas or to a candlelight dinner with Tobias? Who can collect the most dates? Each playing girl must try to find the most suitable date with her date cards and thus snag the boy. But whether the date takes place at all or unexpected problems arise is decided by the dice. Whoever has collected the most plus points in dating wins the game.

name: Deamon Dice: Blood Booster Pack
description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Blood daemon (red plastic/black ink): A blood daemon doesn't just enjoy seeing arterial spray; they sustain themselves by drinking it! Each attack/ability that causes a body part to be wounded recovers a stunned body part after all the victims’ damage has been suffered. Note: This is in addition to anything recovered via a Mouth.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Deamon Dice: Death Booster Pack
description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Death Daemon (Black plastic/yellow ink):Death claims all things in the end, one just needs eternal patience to be victorious! During each turn, a death daemon generates an automatic targeted minus. During your foe’s next turn, apply this minus to your choice of the foe's dice prior to the non-targeted minuses!

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher

Fester daemon (yellow plastic/red ink): Fester daemons are covered in blisters so swollen with vile pus that they burst when wounded! Each attack/ability that causes a body part to be wounded inflicts a stun damage against the attacker which is taken immediately after all the fester daemon’s damage has been suffered.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

Fire daemon (red plastic/yellow ink): When fighting against fire, a slight graze can burn and scorch your flesh! Each turn, one stun damage from an undefended attack from a fire daemon's body part becomes a wound instead.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Stench daemon (yellow plastic/black ink): The foul odor of a stench daemon is so strong it can stun by itself! This is treated as a stun attack that cannot be defended or modified, and is suffered as normal during Suffer Stuns & Wounds.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). —description from the publisher

name: Deamon Dice: Wraith Booster Pack
description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Wraith daemon (blue plastic/red ink): It is hard to get an advantageous position against a foe that can fade out of existence! At the beginning of each turn, a wraith daemon ignores the minusing effects of one die of its choice, even a Lung or a Wing!

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: 紅裸々(Kurara)
description:
The game 紅裸々(Kurara) comes with a single tile. The rules present three ways to play, each of them involve the players using a single finger, dragged across the top of the tile, in an attempt to stand it up. In each of the variations, the player who can most efficiently and repeatedly stand the tile will win.

The game's title is word-play that references a famous scene of the popular anime show Heidi, Girl of the Alps (アルプスの少女ハイジ), in which one of the characters, a young girl called Clara Sesemann (クララ・ゼーゼマン, pronounced as Kurara Zēzeman in Japanese), stands up from her wheelchair.

name: UNO Stacko Travel Size Bonus Pak
description: A bundled set of the UNO Stacko dexterity game and the UNO card game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Stacking and Balancing, Take That

name: Pocket Escape: Der Schneediamant
description:
Ready to use anytime, anywhere: The Escape Game puzzle booklet!

There is no question that Miyu Moto, it girl and undercover specialist from the Dyscover detective agency, has to be seen at the penthouse party in the Holden Tower. It's the high society event of the year. But the guests are behaving strangely every minute. Is the new party drug snow diamond to blame? And who distributes the drug among the celebrants? Then Miyu discovers someone in the crowd that she would never have expected at this party ...

28 pages full of puzzles and difficult decisions are waiting for you. Pocket Escape: The snow diamond fits in every pocket - the ideal case for at home or your luggage!

name: Auksinis protas: Startas Nr. 2
description:
The game consists of 100 cards with 200 questions, an answer book and 10 joker cards, of which the TV game hosts - Arūnas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - will give the players fun QR tasks. You can compete one on one or form teams and embark on a real intelligence fight.
The game begins with the first round of cards (101 to 150 cards and with 5 joker cards) to be shuffled and folded on the table. Cards are drawn in turn, questions are read aloud. If the game is a team based, team members can consult with each other. Answers are checked by the opponent or the opposing team. After playing the first round, the second is played on the same principle (from 151 to 200 cards and with 5 joker cards).
1 point is awarded for the correct answer. For proper performance of the joker's task - 3 points. For transferring a joker card to another player (or team) without reading the QR code - 0 points. After scanning the QR code of a missed task, 1 point is deducted. The participant or team with the most points wins.

The cards can be used as a stand-alone game or as an expansion for "Golden Mind: a great board game". Also, this game can be expanded with "Golden Mind. Start No. 1" cards.


Žaidimą sudaro 100 kortelių su 200 klausimų, atsakymų knygelė ir 10 džokerio kortelių, nuo kurių nuskaičius QR smagias užduotis žaidėjams pateiks patys TV žaidėjų vedėjai - Arūnas Valinskas ir Andrius Tapinas. Galite rungtis vienas prieš vieną arba sudaryti komandas ir leistis į tikriausią intelekto kovą.
Žaidimas pradedamas pirmojo turo kortelėmis (nuo 101 iki 150 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis), kurias reikia sumaišyti ir užverstas padėti ant stalo. Kortelės traukiamos paeiliui, klausimai skaitomi garsiai. Jei žaidimas komandinis, komandos nariai gali tartis tarpusavyje. Atsakymus tikrina priešininkas arba priešininkų komanda. Sužaidus pirmąjį turą, tokiu pat principu žaidžiamas antrasis (nuo 151 iki 200 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis).
Už teisingą atsakymą skiriamas 1 taškas. Už tinkamą džokerio užduoties atlikimą – 3 taškai. Už džokerio kortelės perleidimą kitam žaidėjui (ar komandai) nenuskaičius QR kodo – 0 taškų. Už neatliktą užduotį nuskaičius QR kodą atimamas 1 taškas. Laimi daugiausia taškų surinkęs dalyvis arba komanda.

Kortelės gali būti naudojamos kaip atskiras žaidimas arba papildyti žaidimą „Auksinis protas: Didysis stalo žaidimas". Taip pat, šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 1" kortomis.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Kriminalkuvert: Todesspiel
description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

It should have been a happy and conciliatory card game: Six people meet on an island in the tranquil Bad Leckersmoor to spend a sociable evening together. But in the end one of them is dead.

Those present are all valued members of the community: some work on the local council, some are important industrialists.

The law firm entrusted with the estate of the deceased senses inconsistencies and asks you for help.

name: Japanese: The Game – Fantasy Expansion
description:
This 36-card Fantasy Expansion Deck brings you vocabulary appropriate to the fantasy realm. Words like “Dragon,” “Magic,” “Treasure,” “Fight,” “Steal,” and “Cast a Spell” are included along with a mix of particles and other words that allow these cards to integrate into a Core Deck without any loss of play balance.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.

name: Japanese: The Game – Slang Expansion
description:
This 36-card Slang Expansion Deck brings you vocabulary that is used in a less formal setting. Words like “Cool,” “Hey,” “Gross,” “Lame,” and “Iffy” are included along with a mix of particles and other words and phrases that allow these cards to integrate into a Core Deck without any loss of play balance.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Japanese: The Game – Blank Expansion
description:
This 36-card Blank Expansion Deck brings you blank cards that will allow you to create your cards to integrate with the Core decks. The cards a colored by word type such as “Noun,” “Verb,” “Adjective,” "Adverb," and “Participle” as well as plenty of space to write the Kanji character, description, and example sentence in Japanese. Once all the blank fields have been completed, the cards can be integrated into a Core Deck. There are also 2 cards outlining the Godan Conjugation Table for reference.

This expansion to Japanese: The Game gives you the opportunity to customize your learning experience by adding new vocabulary words that are more specific to your personal needs.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: 1821: Journey to Freedom
description:
1821: Journey to Freedom is a fast-paced game in which each player takes on the role of a companion of Kolokotronis, the legendary old man of Morias, on a journey through time, starting with the creation of the Filiki Etereia and ending with the birth of the New Greek state!

The game takes place during the Revolution.
All the players go through cities and villages, participating in the important historical events that played a key role in the struggle for Freedom.

In the Greece of 1821, based on the memoirs of the Old Man of Moria, we pass through cities, castles and villages, fields of critical battles and political decisions, captures of fighters and places of self-sacrifice and martyrdom, on a journey where memory becomes destination, and destination is experience.

The game takes place in the Peloponnese, the central theater of the Revolution. Each player chooses one of four characters from that period. The choice of character also determines the way the player moves in the game. The Member of the Filiki Eteria, the Philhellene, the Woman of the Revolution and the Revolutionary Fighter of 1821 move inside the board, in order to overcome the obstacles in front of them, to gather supplies and finally to lead to the creation of the Greek Nation.

–Description from the publisher

name: NASA Home & City Tech Connect Card Game
description:
The Tech Connect Card Game is an educational game to teach the concepts of the NASA Home and City website (homeandcity.nasa.gov), namely that there are many technologies that NASA developed that help in many parts of society. It was distributed for free at various events hosted by NASA.

The game is a deck of cards in shrinkwrap and with a cardboard stiffener. Besides the cover and rules cards, there are 12 Target Cards for aspects of life in Home and City (Bedroom, Bathroom, Living Room, Kitchen, Outside; Air Travel, Automotive, Coastal, Grocery, Manufacturing, Medical, Sports), and 48 Tech Cards about various technologies derived from NASA R&D (e.g. UV-blocking glasses, freeze-dried technology, digital cameras, countertop gardens, self-driving farm vehicles), each with a couple of paragraphs of description.

Players take turns being the judge. The judge reveals the top of the Target Card deck. Each other player chooses one of the six Tech Cards in their hand which they think best impacts the revealed target area. The judge chooses which is the best fit; players can try to persuade the judge why their choice is best. The player whose Tech Card the judge chooses keeps the Target Card, players draw to replace the Tech Cards played, and the next player is the judge for the next round. The player with the most Target Cards after they are all distributed is the winner.

name: MathemaChickens
description:
Acting as an omnivorous chicken that eats almost anything, gobble up the most food points to win.

MathemaChickens is a simple math game where kids use their equation-making skills to eat their way around the farmyard while avoiding the coyote.

How many answers can be formed from two die numbers? 20: 1-10,12,15,16,18,20,24,25,30,36.

Game play is simultaneous, with each player taking turns to roll the dice then making a move.
On each turn …
1. The current player rolls the dice.
2. Moves the coyote.
3. Players examine the numbers rolled and think of two or more equations using those numbers. (Add, substract, multiply, divide)
4. The rolling player makes the first move, following by the remaining player(s) clockwise.
mechanics: Area Movement, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: I.Q. 2000 Trans Canada Trivia
description:
This Canadian spin-off of the I.Q. 2000 game, published some time in the mid-1980s, has you navigate across Canada rather than the solar system. It comes with 800 cards (200 per category - History/Geography, Famous People, General Knowledge for Adults, and General Knowledge for Children), each with 5 questions on it, for a total of 4000 trivia questions about Canada and Canadians. It also includes a gameboard with the Canadian map, 6 player pieces (which are stackable if two players land on the same space), 1 die, a plastic storage tray, and instructions.

The object of the game is to be the first player to correctly answer a trivia question after reaching the last circle on the gameboard (in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada). Players take turns rolling the die to move. The color of the space they land on determines which category of question should be asked to them by the player to their right. When children are playing, they can be asked questions only from the easier children's category regardless of which color of space they land on. As long as a player continues answering questions correctly, they get to keep taking more turns. When they get a question wrong, then the player to their left gets a turn. When someone reaches the final space in Victoria, they must answer a final question correctly to win; otherwise, they must move 4 spaces backwards and wait for another turn to try again.

The publisher considers certain topics "integral to the educational aspects of the game", so there is some overlap between the adults' and children's questions, just with different phrasing.

name: The Dentist
description:
Do you want to become a dentist and run your own dental clinic? Then, this is your very special game, whether you’re a student or actually a… real dentist. Equip the clinic, hire the best team you can have and let the fun begin.

The Dentist Game, an ideal way to spend your free time and socialize with your friends while you learn new things about dentistry in a more easy and enjoying way. At the very beginning of the game, you have to choose the level of the location interior and waiting room as well as your team of technicians, assistants, students and the starting tools, consumables. After you have put in place all those aspects, you start to upgrade your estates, until you reach the maximum level of 3 for each part of them.

Your managing and economical skills are used to a full extension in this “venue”, so you have all the tools in order to not worry that you have lost your time by the time you get to $10000 (For Your Information: You start with $2000 in your bankroll and the winner is decided by that one person who manages to get to the $10k mark). Time management is also a key factor in this game, so you have to be careful with your game plan, because times means money, right?

Minimum number of required players for the game to be played in a proper way: 2.

Durability of a game that involves at least 4 players: 30 minutes to 1 hour of play-time.
mechanics: Auction: Dutch, Open Drafting, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Doctor Who: Alien Attax
description:
The Doctor Who TV show reached its 50th anniversary in 2013. The European division of Topps released a collectible trading card game in honor of this, with both a first edition earlier in the year and a 50th Anniversary edition later in the year. It was primarily sold in the UK.

Alien Attax is a simple card game for two players. Each player lays 9 cards face-down. Decide who goes first by flipping a coin. The first player picks their first card and decides whether to attack or defend with it, while it is still face-down. The second player chooses which of their cards to respond with, again while it is still face-down. Then both cards are revealed, and their attack/defence numbers are compared to determine who wins that round. For the next round, the opposite player gets to make the first choice. After all 9 rounds have been played, the person who won the most rounds wins the game.

The first-edition Alien Attax series had 240+ different cards available, and the 50th Anniversary series had an additional 160+ different cards. The 50th Anniversary cards have a grey Tardis '50' symbol in the top right corner of the fronts of the cards. Starter packs were available that included a "Collector Binder", "Collector Guide" with checklist and how to play, and a two-sided paper play mat, in addition to cards. A Collector Tin was also offered with a bundle of cards.

Note: Although 2012 copyright dates are stated on some items, this game was first sold in March 2013.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: GWR: Race to the Ocean Coast
description:
The Great Western Railway company served southwest England. This game is played on a board showing the lines and towns that could be reached by the company. Players refer to a chart to see where your journey would take you. Movement is by a die. You do not need an exact roll to reach your destinations. The first player to reach Penzanca, Birkenhead, or Fishguard wins the game.

This game is from the 1920s or 1930s.

name: Tatort: Das Quiz
description:
The investigators go on a manhunt. And with them, millions of fans in front of their screens. For over four decades. For over 900 episodes.
High time for a crime scene quiz! Here, die-hard fans can show how well they know their crime scene and put their knowledge to the test.
This quiz box provides 150 entertaining and informative questions and answers about the cult TV thriller.

name: Mia and me: Gemeinsam für Centopia
description: The floating island Funtopia and ringmaster Rixel disturb the peace in Centopia, the players must protect unicorns and circus animals from him. 16 squares are laid out according to backs, around them circle tiles with Centopia monives of the squares. You roll the dice; for a color result you uncover one movement square and one motif square and move the figure accordingly. If the move ends on the same motif as on as the uncovered motif square, you may turn over the circle tile you have reached. Rixel as the result of the dice steals one of the eight movement squares with arrow markings on the back. If all the circle tiles are turned over before Rixel has stolen all the arrow tiles, everyone wins together.

name: Angriff der Drachen: Playmobil Super 4
description: Dragons of the Black Baron are approaching Knight's Land, the four heroes Ruby, Twinkle, Alex and Gene together with the chameleon collect the equipment. Chips are laid out, around them the Super 4 trays. You roll the dice - for an item you have to hit it with the flicked chameleon, you use a hit alien as a joker; if the chameleon touches a dragon you have to put a dragon chip on a Super 4 tray; if you win an item, you put it on the matching tray; if there is a dragon, it is removed. If there is a dragon on all the trays, the Black Baron has won.

name: Pentiko
description: Out of six icosahedrons (20-sided dice), one shows only vowels, one only consonants and the others vowels, consonants and * for jokers. You can roll the dice up to three times and then you have to form a word of the German language with at least three and at most five letters, words with four or five letters may contain one or two jokers. For a five-letter word that also contains a four- and a three-letter word in sequence, you get additional points - e.g. Seite - Seit - Sei. You score points in relation to the number of letters and jokers used. You win with 100 points or after an agreed number of rounds with the most points. A new edition of the game rules allows words with six letters, winning sum 500 points.

name: Ten To One
description:
The French colony of Saint-Domingue produced more wealth than the rest of France's colonies combined. France chose to meet the demand for these labor-intensive crops by way of an explosive increase in slavery with nearly half a million enslaved West Africans working the Saint-Domingue plantations. The brutality and greed of the plantation owners and overseers, coupled with the extreme disregard for the enslaved Africans' humanity, set the stage for revolt. After months of hidden preparation, the signal was given following a secret Vodou ceremony. On the 21st of August, 1791, the fuse to the powder keg that was Saint-Domingue ignited with the flame of liberation.

In the cooperative deck-building and strategic war game Liberation - Haiti. the players each control a geographical faction of enslaved Africans or those who escaped enslavement living in the French colony of Saint-Domingue during the early period of the Haitian Revolution, 1791 to 1793. These factions seek both the abolition of their slavery and social equality.

Before rebelling and fighting for your liberty, you need to recruit people to your cause, gather information, develop maneuvers, and stockpile supplies, all while the game is opposing your actions. You have to face well-armed colonial militia and foreign armies, navigate fragile or fleeting alliances, and overcome both political and environmental challenges to win freedom for your people.

The game is played in two stages: the Planning Stage and the Revolution Stage. In the Planning Stage, you use a deck of cards specific to your faction to acquire planning cards that represent intelligence, people, and materiel. Cards added to your pool will in turn help accumulate more and stronger cards of these types. In the Revolution Stage, you use your acquired card pool to overthrow the colonial slave system by deploying units to raid plantations, defeat enemy forces, seize control of strategic locations, increase the morale of your people, and meet political challenges.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Memorace: Gyerekjáték a matematika
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Immerse yourself in the cards and discover the ingenious connections of math! Sphere, right angle, parallel, symmetrical ... If you don't already speak the language of math, these words may sound scary. But you won’t even notice, and with the help of the cards, every concept will fall into place!

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

name: Memorace: Fedezzük fel Európát!
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Wander through the wonderful landscapes of the old continent and get to know the culture of the countries!

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

name: Memorace: Varázslatos mesék
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

One of the great parts of the Memorace board game series is Magic Tales. The child can cross the threshold of the fairytale world, meet their favorite fairytale heroes and learn about new ones. Was the princess blonde or brown haired? What color was the ladybug? How many wolves stood with their backs to the picture?

The point is that not the smallest detail escapes our attention and success is not left behind.
You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

name: Memorace: Ismerkedjünk a matekkal!
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

The child can take the first steps in the wonderful world of math and playfully learn the realm of numbers.

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

name: The Fall of Kings
description:
The Fall of Kings is an asymmetric worker placement game that focuses on 4 different organizations that are determined to perform their duties better than the others.

You take control of one of four unique factions; the Town Guard, the Doctor's Consortium, Paladin's Order and Tax Collectors and you must perform each faction's unique actions on the surrounding towns of the kingdom in order to progress the fame of your organization.

Through your actions, you may be able to impact other factions such as poisoning the village that is about to get visited by the Tax Collector or curing a town of their diseases as the Paladin Order, before the corrupt Consortium has a chance to cash in on their own doing.

The King can influential the performance of the factions in multiple ways; through the alteration of income for each faction or through the fame bonuses given to them. But most organizations have the ability to contract assassins to remove the King, hoping the next one in succession will benefit them and their faction.
mechanics: Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Sternenspiel
description:
Players begin on the red outer lane. Each players rolls dice and moves along the outer lane. If you end your turn on a black star, you can switch to the yellow inner lane on the next turn. If your token meets an occupied space there, you must switch back to the red outside lane. Pieces on yellow stars may not be captured, but can be on black stars.

The first player to move all of his stones to the central star wins the game.

A variant of "Mensch ärgere dich nicht".


Variante von "Mensch ärgere dich nicht".
Gewürfelt wird reihum. Wer seinen Zug auf einem schwarzen Stern beendet darf im nächsten Zug auf die gelbe Innenbahn wechseln. Wenn sein Spielstein dort auf ein besetztes Feld trifft, muss er wieder auf die rote Außenbahn wechseln. Spielsteine auf gelben Feldern dürfen nicht geschlagen werden, auf schwarzen Feldern ist dies aber möglich.
Wer zuerst alle seine Steine auf den zentralen Stern befördert hat gewinnt das Spiel.

name: Blood in the Valley: Campaign Supplement
description:
This is a supplement for the main rulebook “Blood in the Valley”.

You will be able to conduct campaigns with your armies and fight multiple battles! This Campaign Supplement is D6 based.

You will feel like an American Civil War General commanding your armies and leading them to battlefield glory!

This Supplement is available at WargameVault as a pdf download!
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Drug Czars
description:
The game of international drug interdiction by the U.S.

U.S. player attempts to prevent the Drug Czar player(s) from importing their contraband without turning America into a police state, while the Drug Czars attempt to get rich while avoiding arrest and their fellows.

name: Tchotchke Wars
description:
Tchotchke Wars uses ordinary items laying around the house, in your book bag, or picked up from your favorite con to power your character in their war. It is a 2 player game that takes 10-30 minutes to play for ages 10 and up. The goal of the game is to reduce your opponent's health to zero.

How To Play
Players flip a coin, roll a die, or sign an international peace accord to determine who goes first. Players then attack, defend, gain health, etc.
all activating that tchotchke's attributes.

Attacking
The first player picks a tchotchke from the shared pile, declares what aspect they are using, then resolve that aspect based on the result on the character card.

Defending
After the attacking player chooses the tchotchke attribute they are attacking with, the defending player can defend themselves by invoking an attribute that allows them to block only from that same tchotchke.

name: America The New Game
description:
America The New Game is a word game whose deck celebrates the United States of America, probably in conjunction with the 1993 Chicago World's Fair -- it being published in Chicago that year.

Its deck includes letters cards to cover the alphabet twice, in red and in black, and each letter has a different painting by the designer about an aspect of American history and heritage. About half the cards cover history, including Leif Ericsson, Columbus, the Mayflower, Declaration of Independence, first railroads, etc. The rest of the cards cover the geographic range of America: the cities Washington D. C., Chicago and New York; the Statue of Liberty, steamboats, Niagara Falls, cotton plantations, wheat fields, orange groves, farms, cattle ranches, etc. It also includes an American Flag wild card, and a rules card. The cards are bridge size, measuring 88mm x 57mm.

It has rules for two games. "America" plays like Gin Rummy, with players drawing and discarding until someone goes out by playing a 7-letter word. At that point, everyone scores a word from their hand with bonus points for longer words, and for names of American cities or states. The largest point total is awarded if the 7-letter word is "America". "Alphabet Rhummy" plays like normal rummy, letting you play words to the table once you have them, as well as add letters to existing words to make new words. The first player out of cards gets one point per card in everyone else's hands.

name: Birdy
description:
Birdy can be played in two very different ways. Whether it involves matching colours and collecting birds or putting down bird cards on ones that have already been set out – both game variants promise loads of fun and develop children’s matching abilities.

Game 1: Feeding the birds
At the moment the birds can’t find anything to eat around them and need help from humans. Attract the birds with food so that they don’t have to go hungry. The 25 bird cards are shuffled and then spread out on the table face down. Three arbitrary cards are left face up so they are visible to all players, and the dice are
placed nearby.
The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. He then chooses one of the 3 face-up cards and tries to attract the selected bird by rolling the matching colours. The player has a total of 3 attempts, and can set aside any matching dice with each attempt – and continue to roll the dice/die the remaining times. The picture of a birdhouse functions as a joker and can stand for any colour. The X on the die is a „Lame Duck“, and can’t be placed anywhere. If the player manages to cover all colours after rolling the dice (a maximum of) three times, he can keep the card – otherwise, he has to put the card back. It is then the next player’s turn. If the previous player was able to collect a bird, then a new card is turned face up, so that there are 3 cards face up again. The object of the game is to attract 3 of the same kind of bird.
The game ends when one player has attracted 3 of the same birds. That player wins the round. If none of the players succeeds, the one who has collected the most birds wins.

Game 2: Bird dominoes

Can you link all of the birds onto the long chain of birds? Try to be the first player to attach all of your birds to the long row of birds. The 25 bird cards are shuffled thoroughly and spread out face down on the table – one card in the middle is turned face up, and one die is placed nearby. Then each player is given 4 bird cards to start with.

The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. The first player to roll a birdhouse starts. He rolls with one die, and there are the following possibilities:

Rolls a colour: The colour that is rolled matches a “free colour point” on the card in the middle and one of the bird cards that the active player has shows the same colour – very good, the bird card can be placed
Rolls a colour: The colour that is rolled is not a “free colour point” or the active player doesn’t have a bird card that shows the colour – too bad, it’s the next player’s turn
Rolls a “Lame Duck”: The active player draws a “penalty card”
Rolls a joker: The active player can place an arbitrary card on a free and matching colour point


The player who is first to place all of his bird cards wins the game.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Memory

name: Erstes Englisch
description: For the first steps in the English language, you can play lotto or memory or bingo with the 36 picture cards, check the pronunciation if you want, and otherwise just play the usual classics and become familiar with the basic vocabulary. Accompaniment by an adult who speaks English is an advantage. The illustrations are child-friendly and interesting, the game principles familiar enough that one is not distracted.

name: Erstes Schreibspiel
description:
A letter of the alphabet serves as a travel route for the ABC-mobile, in addition, there is a timetable on the letter card, which indicates in which order the stations must be completed. The letters have in principle no stations in the rounds, with the O the two stations are placed at the top, so that one accommodates them at all. On this basis, there are several game variants for one or more children, you can also lay and travel whole words. Whoever reaches the end of his timetable first and has been to all the stations on his letter card wins.

—user summary

name: Quick Quiz: Querdenker
description:
100 game cards with 250 questions.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Subjects: past times, world travel, animals up close, stars and starlets, would you have known?
Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

—user summary

name: So werden Sie Weltmeister im Batterien-Verkaufen
description:
This soccer game is played on a small field with 11 Nails on each side (representing soccer players) but which actually act as obstacles, a small steel ball and two plastic ice cream spoons to kick the steel ball. The players take turns trying to put the ball in the opponent's goal.
The player to score the most goals in an agreed time, wins the game.

—user summary

name: Cacti
description:
In Cacti, you are a bristly gardener seeking to create succulent arrangements in a community garden. Uproot cacti, and supplant pots to achieve the best botanical beauties. But your prickly neighbors have their own sorted assemblage in mind and will try to spoil your toils with their barbed ideas. Plot your preferred assortments in five passive aggressive rounds to gardening contentment.

On your turn, you will swap the position of two cards in the garden, then flip one of them to lock it in place (but losing its flower). End your turn by placing one of your four score cards face down to claim a row or column of cactus arrangements.

After five rounds, count your scores from all of your score cards and flowers in your claimed rows/columns. The player with the highest score wins the game!

Misdirect other players with your score cards, sabotage their arrangements, and hoard pots and cacti.

—description from the publisher

name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Alpine/Lunar Hexless Battlemap
description: This map is 34” x 22", The map is high-resolution with great color quality, making it one of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes an Alpine battlefield and the secondary side includes a Lunar battlefield.

name: Family Affairs
description:
There are many secrets hidden in this big old city. But the main one is vampires. A hundred years ago there were so many of them here, and they behaved so openly and brazenly that people declared a hunt for them. The angry crowd caught all the bloodsuckers and buried them with aspen stakes in their chests. And this was forgotten for many years. But a small group of vampires managed to escape. For a hundred years they wandered around the world, and it's time to return to their hometown to resurrect their deceased relatives.

In the game Family Affairs, players will take on the role of the heads of vampire families. Their task is to resurrect as many of their blood-sucking relatives as possible in six nights. To do this, you need to find as many tombstones as possible. Then dig up the bodies and give the poor fellows fresh blood to drink.
Capturing cemeteries will help your family complete the mission faster, but you should be wary of fanatical Vampire Hunters.

Family Affairs is a roll and write game. In it, you will take on the role of vampire families who are looking for their long-dead relatives. There are eight vampire families to choose from in the game, each of which gives you a unique gaming experience. The main task of the game is to paint over as many graves with vampires as possible, resurrecting them. To do this, you will need to find the tombstones first.

Gameplay: throw dice and try to throw "6" on them - i.e. resurrect a vampire and not throw "1" - i.e. stumble upon a Vampire Hunter.

Each turn you will capture a new cemetery. Each captured cemetery will give you new opportunities for the rest of the game. For example, to throw more dice or resurrect vampires not only by "6", but also by "5". The head of the vampire family must skillfully decide which cemetery to capture first and which to leave for later. The opportunity to make Sorties brings more excitement. You can double all the resurrected vampires, but at the same time reduce the number of Vampire Hunters from whom your family can hide.

You have only six moves to assemble a well-functioning game engine and win.

—description from the publisher

Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dreams of Empire
description:
Dreams of Empire is a competitive Deck-Building Area-Control game with Hidden Actions. Play as one of 6 Trusted Advisors to the Emperor as you try to sway the imperial council in your favor. However, the Empire is old and weak with new rumor's of revolt brought before the council each day. Without swift action the Empire will shatter. Prove to be the most Influential Advisor and the council will crown you the next Emperor! Can you make your Dreams of Empire come true?

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Economic, Political, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hidden Victory Points, Move Through Deck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Eagle Chase
description:
In Eagle Chase, players move around the board with their die roll and with the actions on their cards visiting locations throughout the United States. Interesting geographical and historical facts are read out loud as players visit the destinations on their cards and when they catch up with the Eagle players earn a Star Token. Cards are worth one point and Star Tokens are worth two points. Be the player with the most points at the end of the game to win!

Learn interesting geographical and historical facts about some of the most well-known (and not so well-known) locations in the United States. Players travel the country, visiting as many locations as they can by playing their cards and rolling the dice, while also trying to catch up with the Eagle to earn extra points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Euro-Game
description:
White box with title and description "Across Europe by Game" in four languages.

The game wants to help open access to the future of Europe in a playful way. It wants to stimulate conversation and discussion, arouse curiosity, and the desire to deal more intensively with the EC member states. If the game succeeds in providing a little general education and understanding for the other EC member states and their inhabitants, then it has fulfilled its main purpose. As a supplement and to loosen up, some information about the global importance of B-Braun Melsungen AG is offered.

Contents: Game board, spinning top, dice, four game figures, 28 question cards with 254 questions and answers.

name: Movie Empire: Fly Hard Promo Card
description: A single promo card for Movie Empire titled "Fly hard" with 7 victory points.

name: Gesellschafts-Kugelspiel
description:
Each player receives a ball, which he places to his launching field. All players shoot their ball at the same time if possible. The balls roll into holes that score different points (between 5 and 50). The player who has scored the most points after 4 rounds wins the game.

—user summary

description:

categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Nobody's Cards
description:
Play the game by drawing a card and improve the quality of your relationships with your family or friends. Most of our cards offer a different game for various areas of life - e.g., habits, love, exercise or comfort zone.

Minimum of two players
At the beginning of the game, each person writes down 5 bad habits of his/her opponent. Players attempt to eliminate as many of their bad habits as possible in 7 days. On the last day, they summarize their results together, discussing each bad habit in turn. The winner is the player who eliminated the most bad habits.

description:

name: Mixology
description:
Mixology is an approachable, cocktail-themed game, featuring a Modern artistic theme and focused on hand management.

On a turn a player can do one of three actions. 1) A Player can pick up a new recipe to add to the drinks they can play. 2) They can pick up ingredients or equipment needed to make the drinks. 3) Play a drink to earn points with the opportunity to earn bonus points based on customer preferences.

First player to 21 points wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Shekarestan: Bazaar
description:
Based on the famous Iranian Animated TV series, Shekarestan Bazaar is a worker placement and pick up and delivery board game set in the crowded bazaar of Shekarestan Land.

Players move from one spot to another, trying to buy goods with minimum price and sell in one of the grand bazaars with the highest possible price to win the King's favor for the best merchant of the town.
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Shekarestan: Bazazi
description:
Based on the famous Iranian Animated TV series, Shekarestan Bazazi is a game set in a bazazi (tailoring) shop in Shekarestan Land.
Players try to claim the customers and find a suitable fabric to gain coins and be the best tailor in town.

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 16
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 16 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Locust LCT-1Vb/3D/3M/3S/5S/7S/7V/7V2/C
• Locust IIC/IIC 2/IIC 3/IIC 10
• Stormwolf Prime/A/B/C/D
• Ebon Jaguar (Cauldron-Born) T/E/F/G/X
• Turkina T/E/M/X
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Stone's Trackers
description:
Backstabbers. Assassins. Cowards. Dezgra.

To the elite headhunters of Stone’s Trackers, these labels mean nothing. The only true measure of a warrior is success, and the Trackers will go to any length to ensure that Devlin Stone’s vision does not falter.

Forged in the flames of the Jihad from a secret Clan Nova Cat unit and comprised of Inner Sphere and Clan veterans alike, the Trackers take on the missions too dirty for regular commands to touch. Masters of infiltration, ambush, and marksmanship, they are the ghosts at the edge of the firelight, the wraiths that even MechWarriors have learned to fear.

From the battlefields of Operation SCOUR to glory of the Capellan Crusades, Stone’s Trackers hold to a code of honor of their own making, one that demands victory at any cost.

Spotlight On: Stone’s Trackers includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Holt's Hilltoppers
description:
Born in the fires of Operation: GUERRERO, Holt’s Hilltoppers took on missions from the Periphery to the Chaos March, displaying grit and tenacity to rival any famed mercenary command. Action against Periphery pirates earned the Hilltoppers a reputation as savage defenders, but disaster during the St. Ives War nearly ended the command’s existence. Steadfast courage and resilience kept them together, aided by an alliance with Periphery renegades. Glory and infamy awaited in the FedCom Civil War, along with respect and eternal enmity in equal measure. Tiring of the vagabond life, the Hilltoppers found a new home outside the boundaries of the Inner Sphere. The Fronc Reaches offer constancy, but safety is always in short supply.

Spotlight On: Holt’s Hilltoppers includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Nakayama's Blood
description:
When Federated Suns forces stormed into the Draconis Combine during the FedCom Civil War, proud samurai Chu-sa Harold Nakayama and the Forty-Sixth Dieron Regulars deployed to Ashio to repel the invaders. Disaster struck when an all-but-unknown mercenary command slaughtered Nakayama’s troops, humiliating him. Nakayama swore an oath to exterminate mercenaries wherever they tainted Combine soil, and gathered around him an independent company whose BattleMechs were anointed by the blood of their MechWarriors in an oath to seek out and destroy mercenary scum. The Jihad provided Nakayama’s Blood with rich hunting grounds and the opportunity to strike fear into the hearts of mercenaries operating anywhere near Combine territory.

Spotlight On: Nakayama’s Blood includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Unending Faith
description:
Nearly every faith in human history has had its militant, stalwart protectors of the light ready to cast down those who would question the true path. The vision of Blessed Blake is no different. The creation of the Republic and its disbanding of the Com Guard cast a deep shadow, but true faith endures.
