Now, amid a Dark Age, the light of Blake is needed more than ever and the Blessed Order stands ready to share it with the Inner Sphere. For the warriors of Unending Faith, the end of the Com Guard was only the beginning.

Spotlight On: Unending Faith includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On First Marik Protectors
description:
In the fires of the Jihad, a handful of brave souls placed honor before duty, service before survival, and the people of their shattered nation before all others.

Considered traitors by some but heroes by those they watch over, the First Marik Protectors rose from the ashes of the Free Worlds League to protect worlds at the far-flung edge of their fallen nation. An elite cadre of warriors, the Protectors’ dedication to safeguarding the lives of their countrymen is nearly unmatched in the Inner Sphere.

The Marik Protectors exist to offer a single hope to the citizens of these outcast worlds: that when darkness closes in, there will be a light shining for them, a hammer and anvil to smite any who would disrupt their peace, a shield against all the ills the Periphery holds. Protectors, behind whom they may rest.

Spotlight On: First Marik Protectors includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Thermo Police
description:
Beyond the edge of acknowledged civilization lie the Outworlds Wastes. Planets abandoned by the Star League centuries ago. Governments shattered by apathy, obscurity, and the march of time struggle to provide even the most basic needs of their people. From these meager surroundings one small but zealously dedicated unit stands to serve and protect the remnants of their realm. The Thermo Police may be enrolled as mercenaries but in truth they patrol these lawless stars seeking to bring the order they once knew. Specializing in non-lethal tactics, and trained beyond the typical pirates and bandits prowling the Wastes, their next encounter could be from past the distant stars they call home. But will it be a threat or an opportunity?

Spotlight On: Thermo Police includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On The Crazy Eights
description:
There is no company more fitting as heralds of the Davion sword and sunburst than the Crazy Eights, and even fewer regiments in the AFFS with as storied and lengthy history as the Eighth Company of the Twentieth Avalon Hussars. Disbanded and lost during the Word of Blake’s Jihad, the Crazy Eights were reformed when the call to war once again compelled the Federated Suns to raise new regiments for the protection of the realm. Now, as House Davion’s ancient enemy bears down on New Avalon in this new Dark Age, the Crazy Eights are one of the few to stand in the Dragon’s path.

Spotlight On: The Crazy Eights includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Schmidt's Petraries
description:
Captain-Marshal Rudolf Schmidt took command of the Hanseatic Defense Force at a critical juncture. The nearby Scorpion Empire posed an existential threat to the Hanseatic League. While reorganizing the HDF, he recognized a crucial need for an elite company to inspire the troops. Thus was born Schmidt’s Petraries, the HDF’s overall command company and home to the best of the best. Intense training with their comrades was far different from the trial by fire that the Petraries faced when the Scorpion Empire finally invaded. The Petraries rose to the occasion, defying the fearsome invaders and inspiring a nation with their deeds.

Spotlight On: Schmidt’s Petraries includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Master Strikes
description:
Master Strikes is a high skill-cap 15th century German longsword card game where players honor-duel to the first cut. The game utilizing authentic fighting stances, swing types from each stance, and counter moves which force players to change stances in order to react.

Master Strikes relies on deduction and memory, as well as chess-like strategy to outwit your foe. The game is easy to learn and hard to master, with several balanced methods to find an advantage.

name: BookWorms
description:
BookWorms is a simple word search game where players, acting as worms, find letters in adjacent books to form words.

PLAY IN ROUNDS

Play at least two rounds. Each round consists of setup and game play until the draw piles are depleted.

GAME PLAY

On each turn, the current player …

Examines letters adjacent to and in a path of letters from their location.
Calls out a word using any nearby letters and optionally one letter from a draw pile.
Moves their bookworm to the location of the last letter used.
Collects all the book tiles used.
Places the tiles collected upside down in front of them.
Takes a random tile from the draw pile and places it face up on any empty board space.
Moves the mole.


The mole is used to steal a random book from an adjacent bookworm.

Making a Move

Move your bookworm onto a location where the first letter will be used to form your word. The location must be adjacent to, or within a continuous “tunnel” of five empty spaces from your worm’s current position. However, you cannot move next to, or pass next to the mole.
The word will be a combination of adjacent letters in sequential order and optionally a letter or bigram from any draw pile.
Call out the word for others to verify.
Pick up the tiles used and them place in front of you upside down.
Move the worm to the location of the last letter used.


TIP: Try to use letters with the highest values.

Moving the Mole
The current player moles the mole at the end of their turn. The mole is moved onto a book tile whose letter matches the first letter of the word just made.
If the mole is moved next to a worm, that player loses one of their collected letter tiles at random. The current player selects one of the that player’s tiles and places it face up on a random board location.

ENDING THE ROUND
When all players agree that no more words can be formed, the game is over.
Each player tallies their collected books’ points and records them on a score sheet. Repeat the setup and play at least one more round.
Repeat the setup and play at least two rounds.

ENDING THE GAME
At the end of the last round, the winner will have the most points. In case of a tie, the youngest player wins.

—description from the publisher

name: High Noon: Grizzly Greenwood
description:
From the deep woods of Timber Heights comes the silent big game hunter, Henry "Grizzly" Greenwood. With his sturdy long rifle, near limitless supply of bear traps and a loyal pack of wolfhounds by his side, Henry has collected many trophies in his career and has now set his iron sights on more challenging prey.

The Grizzly Greenwood posse is one of corral and control. Greenwood's bear traps make his targets think twice about taking their next step, while his wolves can pounce and maul their prey, keeping them in one vulnerable location for Henry to pick off at a safe distance with his rifle.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Lone Star
description:
Cold, desolate, long-abandoned and looted of any treasures centuries ago, Lone Star was once a crown jewel of the Terran Hegemony and bold achievement of terraforming. In Touring the Stars: Lone Star, players learn about Volgadon and the Pond Cities and their disparate and fabulous architectures, discover why Lone Star was a major agriculture and manufacturing center for the Terran Hegemony...and read how the horrors of the Amaris Civil War and the First Succession War set this once-great world onto the path towards oblivion.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Benet III
description:
The mineral-rich planet Benet III served as a place of industry, a base for military forces and as a home to a hearty, stubborn populace--a people who survived the Succession Wars, the FedCom Civil War and the Jihad, only to all but wiped out by the fickle planet itself. In Touring the Stars: Benet III, players learn about the planet's constant volcanic and seismic activity, as well as the infamous "Death Mists" that eventually led to the disastrous end of Benet III.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Bone Norman
description:
A stark world on the fringes of the Inner Sphere, Bone Norman's desolate, haunting geography can spook even the most experienced warrior. A sleepy backwater planet for most of its history, Bone Norman vaunted to the front lines of the Clan Invasion and Jihad. In Touring the Stars: Bone-Norman, players learn about the planet's interesting flora and fauna, as well as the mysterious Föhnkrankheit, or "wind sickness"? brought on by the planet's unique geography.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Bibi & Tina: Mädchen gegen Jungs
description:
The players collect clues on clue squares to exchange them for 4 star cards. In addition, the 3 girls' pieces must be moved to the target square before the boys' piece. The figures are moved by a dice roll.
The collected clues are immediately deposited in a cloth bag. When a player thinks they can acquire one of the 4 face-up star cards, clue cards are drawn from the cloth bag. Clue cards that do not match are lost.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Manassas
description:
The victim of a devastating cosmic impact and war, Manassas is still one of the Inner Sphere's safest planets, except for the so-called "Dead Zones"? dotting the world. In Touring the Stars: Manassas, players will learn about the famed Manassas Run, an annual world-spanning treasure hunt for valuable LosTech where anything goes and the prize of becoming Run Champion is all that matters.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Level Chess
description:
Game of chess for 4 with levels.
Level Chess is a chess variant where it's harder to move Up than Down. Then you go Up, you can go just on first reachable box of higher level. Going Down no any restrictions.

—description from the designer

name: Código Secreto: Expansión promocional Américas
description:
10 cards with 20 typical words from Latin America.
This promo pack was produced by Devir and it was given as a promo for those who participate of acompetition proposing latinamerican words.

10 cartas con 20 palabras típicas de Amercia Latina.
Este pack promocional fue producido por Devir y entrgado a aquellos que participaron de un concurso proponiendo palabras.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Brownsville
description:
Now a lifeless, dead planet, Brownsville was once a vibrant and discreet supplier of atmospheric processors and inexpensive water filters before the Amaris Coup. But political and diplomatic mistakes would turn the unassuming planet into another casualty of the Star League Civil War and early Succession Wars. Brownsville's demise sealed the fate of dozens of other worlds.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Bob
description:
It is a shadow world of dark woods and darker rivers, and so was it named--Dunklewälderdunkleflüsseschattenwelt. Alien predators roam the land, seas and air, named for creatures of folklore, while survivors of the once proud settlements eke out an meager existence. Dunklewälderdunkleflüsseschattenwelt suffered during the Succession Wars as many planets of the Inner Sphere did, but as detailed in Touring the Stars: Bob, the beginning of the end was unwittingly initiated by a vote to change the planet's name...

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Promised Land
description:
Promised Land was not exactly as the colonization brochures described, but was settled nevertheless. A chance encounter during the early Star League saved the planet from abandonment, and the struggling colony remained. Long a border waystation between the Lyran Commonwealth and the Free Worlds League, Promised Land's history is the story of overcoming the challenges of this strange world and thriving in its unique environment.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Inglesmond
description:
A curious, albeit devastated, survivor of the First Succession War, Inglesmond was once a shining jewel of the Terran Hegemony. Though Inglesmond is now a planetary nature preserve in the Republic of the Sphere, it could easily be reinhabited and once again rejoin the Inner Sphere. Learn about the planet's unique climate and equatorial-spanning ice belt, tribal survivor communities and salvage operations gone awry.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – McEvedy's Folly
description:
McEvedy's Folly--a world where mad science ran rampant. In the grip of an ice age in the final years of the Star League, the planet once known as "Project SAGITARIUS UMBRELLA" was of little interest to anyone, save for brilliant xenobiologist Alpheus McEvedy. Under the aegis of terraforming, McEvedy played god with the primitive fauna, using them as vehicles to recreate long extinct species from across the Inner Sphere--as well as other rumored abominations. McEvedy and his team were eventually abandoned as the Star League fell, and the planet was lost for centuries--while only the legend of McEvedy's Folly remained.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Butte Hold
description:
Butte Hold is a harsh and unforgiving world home to criminals and rogues that has long been a haven for outlaws. Drawn by rumors of hidden Throline Desert caves caches filled with looted valuables, the world became infamous for being the home of Redjack Ryan and his dreaded capital of Raider's Roost.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Ionus
description:
An introverted, self-contained world of modest technology, Ionus was originally a poor candidate for human colonization. However, recovery of the Helm Memory Core brought new importance to Ionus as the Free Worlds League's premier WarShip producer. A lucky survivor of the Word's Jihad, today Ionus's advanced shipyards remain a tempting target for any world-be conqueror.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Tyrfing
description:
Once an exotic and beautiful planet known for its large, naturally-occurring crystalline formations, Tyrfing was a provincial capital for the defunct Terran Hegemony. Savaged by the Star League Civil War, Tyrfing was damaged beyond repair by a five-way battle between all of the Great Houses during the early Succession Wars. Descending into a dangerous, mutated, feral wasteland, Tyrfing fell off the map. Left to rot, the world is still home to primitive human cultures struggling to survive their deadly world.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Noisiel
description:
You are cordially invited to visit the greatest festival world in all of Lyran space: Noisiel! Come for the pastoral atmosphere, share the local flavor, and test your skills in the galactically renowned Noisiel Summer Games! Experience the sportsmanship, the finesse, and the wonder as military technology meets friendly competition! Thrill to the spectacle of baseball, football, hockey, rugby, and even chess on the scale of titans!

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Dumb Luck: The Lottery Game
description:
Players are given chips and a lottery ticket on which they mark 6 numbers (out of 44). From the starting field, they travel through the American states and are allowed to move one step at a time when one of their 6 numbers is drawn. Events (chip win, chip loss) are triggered on some of the spaces reached. If all 6 numbers were drawn by a player, that player is allowed to go 6 more steps. Then all players have to buy a new lottery ticket and the procedure starts again. The first player to reach the target field with at least 20 chips wins the game.

—user summary

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Jardine
description:
Once a world of vibrant forests and exotic wildlife, Jardine’s loss in the early Succession Wars nearly erased it entirely from the annals of history. Rediscovered on the eve of the Word of Blake Jihad, its centuries-long isolation revealed one of the greatest secrets in ComStar’s dark past: the Hidden Worlds! Scoured by its own Guardians, the birthworld of the Manei Domini now lies under the shroud of endless smoke, its ruins a mute testament to the legacy of its fallen masters.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Iron Land
description:
Billed as a lost world paradise for thrill seekers and wannabe explorers, Iron Land has a dark history seldom spoken of, as those who know of it either never live to tell the tale, or live to profit from it. The dark history of this tortured world both resonates with, and haunts those drawn to it from across the stars. Iron Land is a planet where you can check out any time you like, but never leave.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Spiel und sprich mit Bello
description: Bello the little dog immediately takes every child to his heart. The wooden dog figure is great for free play. The six finger games with rhymes around Bello motivate to imitate and speak and thus promote language development. The twelve domino cards also make a picture story that encourages storytelling.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Wynn's Roost
description:
While the Outworlds Alliance shrunk on ComStar’s maps for two hundred years, not all of disappearing worlds died. The “Outworlds Wastes” also included secessionists, would-be pocket imperial capitals, abandoned worlds, pirate havens, pirates’ victims, and imagined sanctuaries from the bloody Succession Wars. Wynn’s Roost was one such world, alternately seceding from the defenseless Outworlds, attempting to build an interstellar nation, being abandoned by collapsing civilization, and suffering pirates’ depredations. The sulfurous world has outlasted its pirate tormentors, rebuilt its industrial base, and hosts a growing population that is now reaching out to the stars. It is a glimpse of the potential of the modern Periphery.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Old Kentucky
description:
When the first waves of explorers and settlers departed Terra for the great black ocean, not all looked to the future—some longed for the traditional values of the past. One such group made their new home on Old Kentucky, a world near the heart of humanity which has persevered through centuries of abandonment, conflict and conquest.
Touring the Stars: Old Kentucky details this hot, rugged world, its proud history, and its native "sasquatch" primates.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Mizar
description:
The two thousand worlds of human space often claim to have some incredible beauty spot that is unrivaled by any other world. Some worlds claim to be the most beautiful entire world known to humanity. Statistically, one has to be correct, and that world is Mizar. This freakish accident of planetology has thrilled tourists, earned a title as champion party planet, and avoided most wars for centuries until the Word of Blake arrived.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Oktoberfest
description:
The players move along a route by rolling the dice and have to solve tasks on event fields and mostly drink a beer. The first player to reach field 30 alive is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Memorace: Meghökkentő rekordok
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Learn about the Earth’s most prominent natural phenomena and man-made records in the Memorace Astonishing Records.

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.

Draw a card and put it in front of you!
Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
Throw the dice!
If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!


There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

name: Memorace: Ismerkedjünk a betűkkel
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Take the initial steps towards learning the ABCs. Your child can learn the letters by playing and his vocabulary also expands.

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.

Draw a card and put it in front of you!
Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
Throw the dice!
If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!


There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

name: World Series Computerized Baseball
description:
Batter up! Bases are loaded - there are two outs and full count on the batter - can he outwit the pitcher and drive in the winning run?
Two players or two opposing teams plan their pitching and batting strategy and feed their plays into the Analog Computer. The Computer "Read Out" gives the resulting plays instantly. The Computerized Play Chart guides the next action play - all in accordance with Official Baseball rules.
All of the Challenge-Strategy-Suspense of live Baseball-from base hits to homeruns! Planned Strategy keeps the game moving for 9 or more action-packed innings.

name: Sounds of Fun: Disney's Beauty and the Beast
description:
Actual character voices and realistic sound effects bring Beauty and the Beast to life as you make your move in the 3-D palace ballroom and courtyard.

An enchantress has turned the Prince into a Beast, and all his servants into Enchanted Objects. Use your memory to help bell break the spell-and make them all human again. The player that reveals the Prince wins the game.

Players press the center button on the Sound Randomizer board, following the instructions given. The aim of the game is to collect 5 Enchanted Objects chips. which are needed to turn the Beast Human. Players have 5 chances to turn the beast human. The player who turns over the correct magic rose square, wins the game.

name: Silent Ships
description:
A naval-themed card game for 2 players. It is a card battler that borrows mechanics from war games by making units move around the board. Instead of a mana system, players can play ships for free but need to discard cards to move them around the board. Islands can be captured to increase one's draw power, but these are out of the way and come at the cost of tempo. Additionally, as ships begin to sink, the deck gradually thins, and eventually draw power becomes irrelevant in the end game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Nautical, Wargame

name: Memorace: Descoperă România
description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game entertainingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Wander through the wonderful landscapes of Romania and get to know the culture!

You can play Memorace alone, or with more people.

Draw a card and put it in front of you!
Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips - it’s about 10 seconds.
Throw the dice!
If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!


There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 20
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 20 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

Hellion T/D/E/F/P
Shadow Hawk IIC/IIC 2/IIC 10/IIC 11
Longbow LGB-0H/0W2/8C/10C/10K/14Q/14V
Warhawk (Masakari) T/F/G/I/L
Mastodon Prime/A/B/C/D
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Regis Roost
description:
Ringers and Roosters. Two separate cultures living very different lives, one in the rings of the verdant planet of Regis Roost, the other at the bottom of that world’s gravity well. Two separate governing philosophies, one as an extended family with corporate laws, and the other a pseudo-democracy subverted for decades by external interests. Two very different civilizations living on one world in the Taurian Concordat—what could possibly go wrong?

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: Bitcoinopoly
description:
Bitcoinopoly is a highly strategic crypto-powered version of the Wall Street trading floor. Players take turns drawing and playing cards until someone collects three colour coded sets of crypto currencies and lays them out on the table.

Players pick up cards and attempt to collect 3 matching sets. The first play to do so wins. However, event cards can stop your efforts!

The game becomes increasingly intense as each player builds their crypto portfolio, as each player's crypto trading strategy becomes apparent. This is when you'll have to use all your strategic might. GOOD LUCK!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Events, Hand Management, Race, Set Collection

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Tortuga Prime
description:
On the pirate haven of Tortuga Prime, alliances can shift and power can exchange hands at a moment’s notice. An interstellar kleptocracy, Tortuga Prime’s only rule is simple: take what you need, and try to keep it. Will you further the centuries-old cycle of needless death and destruction—or put a stop to it once and for all?

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Sherwood
description:
Founded with ecological sustainability in mind, the colonization of Sherwood seemed like a failure as soon as it began. But thanks to the strict control of a strong central government and a well-educated population, Sherwood pushed through the privations of the Star League era and became the “Green Gem” of the Outback.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Herotitus
description:
From oppressive occupation by pirates to religious domination by various sects, Herotitus knows what it means to suffer. New hope for the future is growing, thanks to the stability and protection from the resource-rich world’s deadly, unique native wildlife offered by the narrowed eye of the Fronc Reaches and their Colonial Marshals. But criminal elements remain in hiding, desperate to return to power, threatening the precarious peace.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Stotzing
description:
The Star League’s terraforming technology brought life to worlds struggling to survive, and wrought miracles on landscapes thought uninhabitable. But Stotzing is proof that even miracles can be undone by human hands, and not all those who seek to repair them are angels.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Rigil Kentarus
description:
Terra’s closest if not first colony, the binary planets of Rigil Kentarus and Riken Minor are just 4.3 light-years from Terra. Rigil Kentarus was settled by a mélange of Terran Alliance member-nations, some of which still leave their mark on the world (“Little America”), while others were wiped out by the Succession Wars, Jihad, and reconstruction. The twin worlds only recovered in the Republic of the Sphere, but generations-old refugee camps nurse hatred for the current government.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Kaumberg
description:
Nestled in the wide frontiers of Lyran space, Kaumberg is a pastoral world known mostly for its woodlands and little else. But just below the mundane surface lies a world of political intrigue, its fortunes and falls tied inextricably to those of the Commonwealth to whom its rulers serve. Collective masters of one of the region’s strongest independent defense forces, the barons of Kaumberg stand ever-ready to protect their world and its neighbors from any Periphery threat that comes their way—but only as long as their own internal intrigues don’t get in the way.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Braunschweig
description:
Braunschweig is one of the jewels of the Hanseatic League. Combining pristine nature with highly developed cities, from orbit the world appears to be a paradise. On the ground, however, the luster tarnishes significantly. The natural abundance is rife with deadly native life, and civilization is stratified between the ultra-wealthy and the serfs who labor under their lash. Braunschweig is in fact a world of contrasts, where natural beauty meets industrial sterility, and luxurious comfort clashes with penurious servitude.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Granada
description:
Granada: called “The Pumpkin” by everyone but its inhabitants, this oblate planet is probably the fastest-spinning world settled by humanity. Like other worlds of the Nueva Castilian cluster, it is water-rich and very compatible with terrestrial life, allowing humans to thrive.

Granada has seen key events in Castilian history: the collapse of its original central government, the invasion of refugees from the Clan worlds, and the birth of the Umayyads. The Seekers of Clan Goliath Scorpion have delved into this history, answering burning questions of the Umayyads’ mysterious origins.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Gulf Breeze
description:
From pirates to profiteers, and corrupt Mining Consortiums in between, Gulf Breeze has a thousand different ways to kill even veteran spacers. But with great danger comes great opportunity and Gulf Breeze has it by the metric ton. If you can survive the resource-rich world’s deadly and unique planetary challenges or avoid being spaced from a Wheeler station, a fortune awaits.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.

name: Thaumaturge
description:
Thaumaturge is a two player card game where instead of drawing cards at random, you can take whichever one you want. During your play, you can take three actions, which include adding cards to your hand, playing cards, and using actions on certain cards you've already played.

You win if your opponent has no cards remaining in their crux, and their discard pile, and no effect is in the process of resolving.

name: Smart Assistant Interrogator
description:
A reverse-trivia game for adults that uses a smart assistant (Google, Alexa, Siri, etc). Pick a card from 4 categories in play and get the smart assistant to say the word or name on the card while following a set of rules of things you can not do. The base game comes with 10 categories with 36 game cards in each as well as a 36 card cheat deck.

4 categories are chosen at random. 6 Game cards from each chosen category are stacked below each matching category card. Play starts in the clockwise rotation. The player chooses a category and then selects the top card from its deck. They must now get the SA to say the word or name on the card, without saying it and by following other rules such as - no spelling, no present or past tense versions of the word etc.

When the 24 game cards are gone, the game is over, and the person with the most wins. Easy right?

name: Three
description:
In this game, players battle each other by showing one number card out of three open cards in their hands.

The higher the number card is, the higher points you will get, but it becomes easier for your opponent to read your card, and harder for you to win.

The lower the number card is, the easier you will win, but the lower points you will get.

It is important to judge when to attack and when to defend.

This is a psychological game, where the decisive factors are reading, bargaining, and intuition.

—description from the designer

name: Mosquito!
description:
Each player/team has their own deck of 25 cards. The entire alphabet is comprised by 22 of them. Four cards show two letters, either of which can be used. The remaining 3 cards are special cards.

On a turn all players flip over their top card and thinks of a word that begins with that letter and is equal to the number of letters on the first square of their flight path on the game board. Play continues in real time until a player has reached Madswatter (finish space).

The winner receives 10 points. Penalties includes spaces left by the longest path and errors (-5 pts each).

Three matches are played and the winner is the player with the most points.

name: Ora io Vado
description:
It is a children game based on memory.
The player has to collect seven objects to win. To collect object players have to take a card from a 4x4 grid.
Important is the fact the have to collect objects in a proper order.
There are also some special cards that permits to stole objects or to lose an object. It is also possible pass a turn.
The game is based on the novel of Matthieu Maudet

name: Jet Set Billionaire
description:
A traditional roll and move game, featuring up to six players in a race to become a billionaire first.

The aim is to collect wealth, either in cash or via expensive assets like stocks or possessions. Clever setbacks along the way like striking a bad deal or meeting the tax man.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Meigas
description:
In the dark forests of Galicia, with each change of the moon, the most famous witches of the place meet. There, among the mists of the groves, the world championship of witches takes place. In this championship the witches will make spells, tricks and execute different types of magic to achieve the most desired magical objects of the place.
Maybe it's a girls' tale, I don't believe in witches, but you know.

Meigas is a dice game where players become witches and must compete with each other to increase their reputation. During an indefinite number of rounds the witches will acquire ingredients and perform spells to acquire magical equipment. The witch who gets the most reputation with her equipment or if any gets the legendary equipment will win; then she will go down in history as the best witch in the world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Last Resort: Very Important Meeples
description:
Very Important Meeples is a bumper expansion for Last Resort, introducing two game-changing new modules – The VIPs and Specialists (which can be introduced individually, or all at once!) with 6 new tiles, 52 meeples, and 16 cards!

In The VIPs, you’re challenged to invite and entertain as many shiny new VIP guests as possible – the player with the most will receive a cash bonus! But it’s harder than it sounds – not only will you need to stay on top of current Trends to attract them to your station, you’ll also need to avoid checking them out too early, and try not to attract the attention of the Kidnappers – a new malfunction that preys on vulnerable-important-people!

In The Specialists, a whole new array of Improvements are added to the game, each of which with their own special meeples that grant powerful effects when they’re drawn from the bag – from inquisitioning Inspectors who fend off Malfunctions, to elite Dignitaries whose private security will vet incoming guests!

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: BattleTech: Operational Turning Points – Falcon Incursion
description:
Into the Alliance!

Reeling from their war with Clan Wolf, the Crusaders of Clan Jade Falcon were spoiling for action against a worthy foe. Khan Marthe Pryde seized the opportunity to test both her fledgling warriors and the strength of the newly formed Lyran Alliance. The Falcon march to Coventry would bear a fruit that no one could have anticipated, ultimately setting the stage for the end of the Clan invasion itself.

Operational Turning Points: Falcon Incursion details the events of the Jade Falcon strike into the Lyran Alliance, opening up the battle for players to join in the fight using the successful Turning Points PDF-exclusive format. Return to the campaign that sparked the rebirth of the long-held dream of the Star League.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual Missions and Touchpoints, following a campaign arc, and inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF exclusive includes detailed information on the worlds involved, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, an overview of the historical campaign, and several tools and tracks that players can use to run historical characters and battles from this time period. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Historical Turning Points – Mallory's World
description:
In the waning years of the Third Succession War, Takashi Kurita moved to take Mallory's World from House Davion's Federated Suns. Taking advantage of Davion's preparations elsewhere, the Coordinator dispatched several regiments only to be thwarted by First Prince Ian Davion. Though the First Prince met his death at the hands of Yorinaga Kurita, the DCMS ultimately failed the Coordinator.

Three years later, House Kurita tried again. In one of the most legendary battles in BattleTech history, Yorinaga Kurita faced mercenary commander Morgan Kell. When it was over, a deadly rivalry had been born that would shape the destinies of men and nations.

Historical Turning Points: Mallory's World takes events from the Third Succession War and expands them using the phenomenally successful Turning Points PDF exclusive format. Return to an earlier time in BattleTech history, when centuries of Succession Wars have honed an animosity to a razor's edge between the Great Houses of Davion and Kurita!

This campaign series uses the _Chaos Campaig_n rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios. This PDF exclusive includes a detailed map of the planet of Mallory's World, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Dark Age Turning Points – Vega
description:
For the planet Vega, the collapse of the hyperpulse generator network signaled the beginning of four years of chaos. Beset by terrorists, foreign invaders and the shattering of the planetary militia in a devastating civil war, the world descended into a seemingly endless spiral of death and destruction. Ruthless warlords divided the land and fought amongst themselves to claim what little remained of the old Vega. With the Republic suffering its own troubles, there was scant hope of relief from any outside force.
And then the Bears came.

Enacting contingency plans created decades earlier, the Rasalhague Dominion sends its forces to stabilize several worlds of the Republic. But their reception is anything but warm and the Clanners will have to face local resistance and malicious outside influences to save Vega from itself. Isis Bekker and her Raging Bears are up for the task, but will they have the strength and the time to see it through?

Dark Age Turning Points: Vega uses Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even creating their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a “Vega flavor.” The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Vega, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Historical Turning Points – Antallos
description:
Rendered mostly barren through centuries of warfare, the world of Antallos is dotted with death zones, long-lost treasure troves of Star League technology, and city-states that once vied for rulership. The rise of Vance Rezak and his Band of the Damned stabilized the ancient pirate haven, creating a power base of terror along the Combine and Alliance borders.

Then came Clan Snow Raven. Their arrival sparked a war that pitted the recently-arrived Clan against dug-in pirates and their new Word of Blake allies. Short and brutal, the conflict forever altered the balance of power in the Periphery.

Historical Turning Points: Antallos looks at the pivotal conflict that removed an ancient pirate haven and ushered the Ravens to the Inner Sphere. Return to BattleTech's recent past, where pirates and Blakists fought together to keep a Clan from perching along the Inner Sphere's quietest border.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, or inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF exclusive includes a detailed map of the planet of Antallos, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to recreate the entire violent conflict on Antallos. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Historical Turning Points – New Dallas
description:
A lifeless planet with a bloody past, New Dallas was a mere footnote in history until the Devil's Brigade mercenaries rediscovered an ancient artifact in the early days of the Jihad. Their discovery revealed a secret history, long buried and believed lost.

Home to the vast Hegemony Central Intelligence Directorate, New Dallas has been a lostech prospector's dream. The system was a shining jewel during the heyday of the Star League, lost after the fall of the Amaris Empire, and rediscovered during the opening shots of the Jihad. The secrets that lay among its ruins would change the course of technology in the Inner Sphere forever...

Historical Turning Points: New Dallas details three era events that occurred on the planet. Containing three mini-campaigns using the Chaos Campaign rules, this campaign supplement gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns, and even creating their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a "New Dallas flavor." This PDF-exclusive book includes a detailed map of New Dallas, a comprehensive list of the forces involved on New Dallas across three eras, and several Tracks for players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles or stage a complete world-wide invasion. The only limit is the players' imagination.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Dark Age Turning Points – Irian
description:
Devlin Stone's Military Material Redemption Program transformed the Inner Sphere, retooling BattleMech production lines for civilian output and boosting state economies. Companies that had made their names building machines of destruction now found themselves turning more towards peaceful IndustrialMech manufacture. Downsized and heavily regulated by Stone's policies, Irian Technologies was an exemplary model of the Republic's new paradigm.

But IrTech has kept a secret through the long decades of peace: a fully functional Marauder II production line hidden away from the Republic's auditors and enforcers. In late 3133, however, that secret got out. With the Republic already torn by factional strife, the revelation of IrTech's deception has everyone scrambling to win the prize. Who will emerge victorious from this all-out faction war?

Dark Age Turning Points: Irian uses Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even creating their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games an Irian flavor. The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Irian, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Turning Points – Arcturus
description:
Before Devlin Stone, before the Republic, there was Kurita
As the Jihad unfolded, Chandrasekhar Kurita fought a one-man war against the Blakists when others would not. From the cradle of the Lyran Commonwealth, Kurita built a coalition of mercenaries to expose one of the Word's darkest--and turn the Inner Sphere against their real enemy.
But the Word of Blake had other plans. To protect their secrets, they launched an invasion of Arcturus to punish Kurita and his mercenary cohorts. Led by a vicious Shadow Division and one of their best operatives, the battle for Arcturus became more than just survival as the very fate of the Inner Sphere hung in the balance.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, or inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF exclusive includes a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict and several tracks that players can use to recreate the entire violent conflict on Arcturus. The only limits are the players' imaginations.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Turning Points – Orbisonia
description:
The Chancellor of the Capellan Confederation ached to reclaim the long-lost worlds of the Chesterton Confederation for her nation, and the outbreak of the Second Succession War gave her the opportunity for invasion. Chancellor Ilsa Liao targeted worlds along a wide front, and personally led one of the most feared formations in Capellan history against Orbisonia. Five bloody days in June 2828 turned the tide of the invasion and changed the Confederation forever.

Turning Points: Orbisonia uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, or inserting Chancellor Ilsa Liao’s campaign for Orbisonia into their own campaigns. Included are a detailed map of the world of Orbisonia, full details of the forces involved in the invasion, and scenario tracks that players can use to recreate the battles on Orbisonia. The only limits are the players’ imagination!

name: BattleTech: Turning Points – War of 3039: Vega
description:
The wait is over as the Federated Commonwealth hammer falls upon the Draconis Combine. The War of 3039’s Commonwealth Thrust focuses on Vega, a world of burning sands, blazing sun, and the ruins of ancient Star League technology. A combined force of Steiner, Davion, and mercenary units showcases the massive alliance and technology of the Federated Commonwealth. The Combine defense, led by the Legions of Vega, is determined to justify the reforms and faith of the Coordinator. They will not surrender their homeworld easily.

Turning Points: Vega (3039) uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, or inserting the heated battle for Vega into their own campaigns. Included are a detailed map of the world of Vega, full details of the forces involved in the conflict, and scenario tracks recreating the battles on Vega. The only limits are the players’ imaginations!

name: BattleTech: Turning Points – Tyrfing
description:
Rumors of valuable Star League hardware left over from the war against Stefan the Usurper bring treasure hunters to the Free Worlds League world of Tyrfing in the midst of the First Succession War. These trespassers hailed from the Capellan Confederation and Lyran Commonwealth. The Free Worlders sent reinforcements, only for the rumors to spread to the other Successor States. Soon, forces from the Federated Suns and Draconis Combine joined those already on Tyrfing. The Five-Way War for the fabled treasure of Tyrfing had begun!

Turning Points: Tyrfing uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles or following a campaign arc, and even includes special rules for randomizing allies and enemies and battling within the unique terrain of the Great Crystal Valley. Included are a detailed map of the world of Tyrfing, full details of the forces involved in the Trial, and scenario tracks recreating the battles on Tyrfing. The only limits are the players’ imaginations!

name: Young Wizards Smart Savings
description:
In an affluent society, it is more important than ever to instill good financial habits in our children. Why not start with Young Wizards Smart Savings, a collaborative game designed by AXA Hong Kong and the social enterprise People on Board? We encourage parents to join children in the game and help them grasp basic wealth management concepts like saving and spending wisely in a fun interactive setting, while inculcating positive values like civic consciousness and the importance of sharing.

On their turn, each player draws three cards from the draw pile. After resolving any charity or vice cards, the player then chooses whether to save or spend. If a player chooses "save", they put any coin cards in their wallet for use on a future turn. If they save three coins in one turn, they get to advance one space as a bonus. If a player chooses "spend", they pay the price and move the number of spaces indicated on the item card. Some item cards also have ongoing special effects.

After each player has taken a turn, the spinner is spun and all players must take the action indicated by the spinner.

The first player to reach the goal at the end of the board is the winner. That player has mastered the importance of saving and spending wisely.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: We, The Faceless
description:
We, the Faceless is a fast playing asymmetrical 4x game.

The Faceless Lords, demigods of torment, march their forces into populations centers, reaping skulls and spreading destruction. Clashing with each other, they devastate the landscape, but the dark magic of the faceless lords seal the gods out of the realm, but also seal in the souls of the slain. Some of these souls come back as the Grieved to fight the Faceless beyond death.

Players select control a Faceless Lord, possessing a dark host of unique powers and minions. They choose a Realm to war over, and set up hex tiles according to a Realm map.

Each round, players draft commands from a shared deck, then reveal cards simultaneously; the card's initiative decides the order of actions. Actions include: Marching minions into settlements, reaping skulls & causing destruction, empowering your minions, and casting spells.

As you devastate the realm you gain Hate, until a player triggers their unique End Times, signaling the last round. At the end of the final round the player with the most Hate wins the game, and overtaking the realm.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Sudden Death Ending

name: Planes Battle Buildings
description:
On a planet of lava and ocean, steam shrouds the terrain as mighty mechanical constructs battle each other for sovereignty. Anachronistic aesthetics and wicked machine designs bring the game to life.

Planes Battle Buildings is a 2 to 4 player miniature strategic game. Each player controls a faction of miniature planes or walking buildings.

Players then draw terrain hex cards to reveal and traverse the unknown landscape. The aim is for each player to gain area control, retain enough resources to maintain and expand their collection of planes or buildings. Conflict arises when players battle over terrain or attempt to pilfer the other player's resources.

Game play is either skirmish mode (where one players wins all) or adventure mode where a scenario is chosen with its own unique set of rules for the players to follow.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Experior Proelium
description:
2 to 6 Players
Dice Management - Combat - Competitive - Dungeon Crawler

A group of heroes are hired to venture into a labyrinthine and narrow cave near the kingdom, lair of beasts creatures to complete the mission at the risk of being trapped. One player will handle the creatures, the rest will be the heroes.

The players, including the "boss" player, each turn must throw their dice, with them they will be able to pay for the actions during it.

The cave of the route will be revealed in a random way with the movement of the heroes, with a continuity of terrain cards, but the "boss" can lengthen his path.

There are three possible contracts that the heroes must fulfill, when doing so the heroes will win, otherwise the "boss" player will win.

—description from the designer


2 a 6 Jugadores
Gestión de Dados - Combate - Competitivo - Dungeon Crawler

Un grupo de héroes son contratados para aventurarse en una laberíntica y estrecha cueva cercana al reino, guarida de bestiales criaturas para completar la misión a riesgo de quedar atrapados. Un Jugador manejara las criaturas, el resto serán los héroes.

los jugadores, incluido el jugador "jefe", cada turno deberán arrojar sus dados, con ellos podrán pagar las acciones durante el mismo.

La cueva del recorrido se ira revelando de forma azarosa con el movimiento de los héroes, con una continuidad de cartas de terreno, pero el "jefe", puede ir alargando su camino.

Hay tres contratos posibles que los heroes deberan cumplir, al realizarlo los heroes ganaran, de lo contrario ganara el jugador "jefe".

—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Charlottesville
description:
This board game, simply named Charlottesville, is similar to Monopoly; players accumulate properties and try to bankrupt the other players. It was created as a business class project by local high school students, in approximately 1987-1988.

The square board is filled with local Charlottesville, Virginia businesses which purchased the spaces. The box is decorated with the same artwork as part of the board. It comes with four pawns; two dice; round plastic chips to use like houses/hotels; play money sponsored by a local bank (Jefferson National Bank); property cards; two sets of 'Chance'-like cards, sponsored by Hallmark stores and the local Seminole Square shopping center; and a rulebook with a brief description of Charlottesville's history and location.

Note that this game is very different from "All About Charlottesville - Albemarle County, VA" which uses a board made from large puzzle pieces and focuses on visiting businesses to complete a shopping list.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cadbury's Wacky Races Game
description:
Cadbury's Wacky Races Game is a promotional Australian board game from the chocolate maker Cadbury. The game was most likely included in Cadbury Showbags (sample bags) purchased during Australia's annual Royal Shows (Fairs)

A simple roll and move game where players must complete 3 laps of a course. There are some detours and instructions that delay the players progress but the first player to complete the 3 laps is the winner

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Alea Iacta Est
description:
This is a game in the fortified Roman camp of Haltern. The players are legionaries doing their rounds in the camp. They have different buildings to reach and have to end their round in the principia.
It is a roll, move and remove with with action spaces and individual obstacles.
First to reach the goal wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pitsch-Patsch
description:
A mini, action game. Try to grab the chips of the rolled colour with your suction rod.

—user summary

name: Stix
description:
Stix (a pun on the Danish "stik", meaning trick) is a Rummy-derivative with missions; players draw cards and discard cards trying to assemble a hand that fulfils their mission, and then close the round before the other players also fulfil their missions.

—user summary

name: BattleTech: Third League Turning Points – Free Taiw...St. Ives
description:
Taiw...St. Ives Free

In 3226, revolutionaries have freed Taiw...St. Ives from the oppression of the Third League. But are the people of Taiw...St. Ives really free? Or are they just trading on oppressor for another? With the Third League unlikely to stand for treason, Taiw...St. Ives will be the center of the universe for a brief period.

Turning Points: Taiw...St. Ives fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Third League Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of forces fighting for control--and survival--of this instrumental world.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a ˆ_Ñ??Taiw...St. Ives flavor.ˆ? The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Taiw...St. Ives, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Dropships and Small Craft Cards
description: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Cards – DropShips & Small Craft provides players with unit cards to bring these units to your Alpha Strike or BattleForce games. Featuring dropships & small craft from across the range of technical readouts and other sourcebooks, this product contains nearly 200 dropships & small craft. Note that DropShips & Small Craft are playable in standard Alpha Strike games based on ground and atmospheric combat, Alpha Strike space combat requires the Alpha Strike Companion.

name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Warships and Jumpships Cards
description: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Cards – WarShips & JumpShips provides players with unit cards to bring these units to your Alpha Strike or BattleForce games. Featuring WarShips & JumpShips from across the range of Technical Readouts and other sourcebooks, this product contains over 140 WarShips & JumpShips. Note that Alpha Strike space combat requires the Alpha Strike Companion in addition to the Alpha Strike: Commander’s Edition rulebook.

name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Caveat Emptor
description:
After Gray Monday, the Republic has descended into a new Dark Age, ploughshares are being turned back into swords, and the jackals are feeding on the confusion. The desperate need for weapons of new militaries arising everywhere sees mundane machines strapped with outlandish weapons, flamboyant arena ’Mechs returning to the battlefield, and renowned manufacturers engaging in uncharacteristic experimental gambles. It is a seller’s market; anything goes and no price is too high. Caveat emptor—the dust will settle quicker on your new acquisition’s battlefield debut than on the transaction that got you there. You won’t have time for buyer’s remorse.

Experimental Technical Readout: Caveat Emptor samples production and prototype machines that have earnt infamy after Gray Monday as inefficient monstrosities sold to the highest bidder. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in Tactical Operations (or quirks found in the BattleMech Manual)—now employed on battlefields of brush wars on former Republic worlds. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

name: Renaissance Wars: Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goal Cards
description:
A set of 11 cards that were made available as exclusives to Kickstarter backers. They are mixed in for use with the standard cards in the set:

Contents:
- 1 Money in the Bank card
- 2 Populace cards
- 2 Immediate Intrusion cards
- 2 Immediate Event cards
- 4 Personal Action cards
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Buado: The Card Game
description:
Carefully utilize the every-player-shared main deck cards and take down the other Kings with your own King and Equipment!

Have your Bear attack an opponent’s King once you’ve broken all of that King’s shields to win!
There are 3 Win conditions:

Hit an opponent's King once with a Bear when the opponent does not control any Shields or Bears of their own.
Drawing the last card.
Control the all Muse-a-Bears: John, Dhruv, and Matt.



During their turn, players play Bear, King, Shield, and equipment cards take down the other kings.
mechanics: Command Cards, Negotiation, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Experior Portales
description:
1 to 3 Players
Deckbuilding - Dice Management - Strategy - Solitary - Cooperative - Competitive

This game incorporates into the world of Experior, not only the Dark Epic Fantasy, already present in other games of the line, but also includes Science Fiction from different evolutionary paradigms, telekinetic developments, steampunk technology, Cyberpunk, worlds of almighty beings, anomalies, mutations and aberrations.

Starting from an asymmetric deck of 10 basic cards, each player will throw basic dice, exchange the cards in their hand for more dice, use their abilities or enhance other abilities already triggered. The combinations of use are infinite and these will depend on what the dice dictate, being able to also get new cards, buy improvements or travel through the portals, taking them to uncertain destinations. There you can fight or find objects or more fissures that will allow you to continue traveling.

In solo mode, the player must close a number of portals, while the automa will take time away from the game. The player has an initial life, if the automa consumes the time or the player's life reaches zero, the player loses.
In competitive mode, it will be a race between players to see who manages to close the portals first.

—description from the designer


1 a 3 Jugadores
Deckbuilding - Gestión de Dados - Estrategia - Solitario - Cooperativo - Competitivo

Los manipuladores de energía pueden cerrar las fisuras, entrada de los Mitos a nuestro mundo. Para esto deben viajar a través de ellas como portales, llevándolos a destinos desconocidos entre los distintos planos de realidad y sus diferentes líneas temporales.

Este juego incorpora al mundo de Experior, no solo la Fantasía Épica Oscura, ya presente en otros juegos de la linea, sino que incluye la Ciencia Ficción desde distintos paradigmas evolutivos, desarrollos telequinéticos, tecnología steampunk, Ciberpunk, mundos de seres todopoderosos, anomalías, mutaciones y aberraciones.

Partiendo de un mazo asimétrico de 10 cartas básicas, cada jugador arrojara dados básicos, podrá usar las cartas en su mano para canjear por mas dados o usar sus habilidades si puede pagarlas o potenciar otras habilidades ya disparadas. Las combinaciones de uso son infinitas y estas dependerán de lo que los dados dicten, pudiendo aparte conseguir nuevas cartas, comprando mejoras o viajar por los portales, llevándolo a destinos inciertos. Ahí podrá pelear o encontrar objetos o mas fisuras que le permitirán seguir viajando.

En modo solitario, el jugador debe cerrar una cantidad de portales, mientras el automa ira restando tiempo de juego. El jugador tiene una vida inicial, si el automa consume el tiempo o la vida del jugador llega a cero, el jugador pierde.
En modo competitivo, será una carrera entre los jugadores por ver quien logra cerrar primero los portales.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Window Pains
description:
Window Pains is a light 2-4 player strategy game where you are a craftsmen building a stained glass window, and your opponents are lowly interns messing it up.

Players add cards, partially overlapping the cards already on the table, and score points for the colors connected to rosettes as the play area slowly grows. At the end of the game, score bonus points for your secret objective and tally points to find the winner!
mechanics: Deduction, End Game Bonuses, Map Addition, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Das Grosse Autospiel
description:
An eventful journey through the 4 seasons. Almost 150 events can influence this trip. Who will manage to get the most points despite all the hurdles?

Players roll dice to move around the board and pick a card from the stack color coded to match the spot they have stopped in. Each card presents a hurdle and assigns points.

The first person to land on the last square by an exact roll of the dice wins.
mechanics: Action/Event, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: 零に誠 (Zero Ni Makoto)
description:
This game is called Murder Mystery. The player becomes one of the characters in the story and searches for the culprit of the incident that occurs in the story. Since the criminal is also one of the players, the purpose is that the player who became the criminal does not know that he is the criminal.
Each player has his or her own purpose other than searching for the criminal or not knowing it, and each player aims to achieve multiple goals and win the points obtained by achieving them.
